description:
The 1-star rating is for the service. Food is a 3-star. 

Beware. Saturdays can be extremely busy. If you're taking food to go, I recommend calling in your order. 

I walked into the restaurant and the line to order snaked around inside, thru the dining area. There was one cashier and three order takers. Clearly seeing the long line, the order takers continued to move at a normal, slow pace--without any hint of urgency. After 10 minutes, the line began moving a little faster. I noticed the manager (I presume the owner; who returned from somewhere) had stepped-in, began taking orders, and really taking charge. Suddenly, the order takers started working more quickly. 

My point in this post, the workers began working faster ONLY when the manager appeared. None of them demonstrated initiative to speed-up the pace, even after seeing the long line grow. 

If the manager hadn't showed-up, I probably would have waited 20-25 minutes for two burritos. Ridiculous. 

REVIEW UPDATED 

My experience has been good since they started accepting online orders.
author: Charlie A.

description:
The line at La Corneta Taqueria is always insanely long, which is so weird to me because I don't think it's that special. After walking by a few times and not bothering to wait in line, I finally found the time to wait in line on a Saturday afternoon around 2pm. The line moves relatively briskly, which is great, but it's still kinda a pain. 

I chose to get the salmon burrito here, since I don't feel like I see fish options at many burrito places. The salmon for my burrito was freshly cooked, which is a plus for sure. However, it does mean that you wait a bit longer for it. If you want to just get in and get out, probably don't get a fish burrito. The burrito itself was just fine. The flavor was good, but it was wrapped a bit poorly. You get chips and salsa, but the salsa isn't anything special at all, unfortunately. I got the hot salsa and it wasn't even hot. :(

I think La Corneta would be a solid 4 if they weren't cash only. But without, they're just an overpriced, overhyped yet average in flavor taqueria. I'm sure it helps that they're the only taqueria in all of the Glen Park "downtown" area, but I probably don't really recommend it. If you're out here, you're basically across the street from Glen Park BART, so you should just take the Glen Park BART to 24th Street/Mission and get El Farolito or something.
author: Brian W.

description:
I think this place can be good when it's slow but when it's busy (which is most of the time) the servers can be really pushy and a little rude. 

The consistency is also non existent. When I order a chicken mole burrito sometimes it's saturated in sauce and no meat or vice verse a hunk of thigh meat and no sauce. 

I can't complain too much though because these guys have saved me several times on busy workdays and right before meetings. 

They could do a little more for the customer I think like once in awhile have a taco Tuesday or raffles or something to help people feel like they're not just being herded on an assembly line to the cash register.
author: Justin P.

description: The food is mainly prepared in front of you, and the service is fast. Priority is given to make sure your food is hot when you get it or at least a warm enough for you to enjoy it. The tacos are generous as are all other meals that are prepared. I would have rated it higher but when I have brought tamales home to have later that day or the next, on three occasions the tamales have spoiled.
author: A. L.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE. FOUND A DEAD LADYBUG IN MY CILANTRO.

See picture attached. When I first confronted them about it, they dismissed me rather rudely. Then I literally took the plate and showed them exactly what you see in the picture. I was told "sorry" a lot. That's it. I didn't even want my money back, I just wanted them to check their ingredients before serving other customers. But they kept on taking orders.

Super, super gross.
author: Kevin P.

description:
Cheap and fast food, but the workers aren't the most pleasant. They barely give you a second glance when taking your order and it's all about moving you down the line and getting you out of there.

I ordered the chicken quesadilla which wasn't spectacular, but wasn't too bad. Chicken was seasoned nicely. However, there was so much oil dripping from the quesadilla that I had to literally hold it up and drain it before I could eat. The oil made the quesadilla soggy really quickly.
author: Mallory L.

description: La Corneta consistently delivers! High quality ingredients and quick service. La Corneta has been around for years! Personally, you can't go wrong with a burrito  A shrimp super burrito or carne asada Taco is a hearty meal. The torta I ordered recently was amazing! Hit the spot! Only thing to remember is - its cash only! Bring cash and be ready to enjoy some quality Mexican food.
author: J M.

description: Not worth what I paid for. Being a Latina from the mission district, this was a total waste of time and money. Never have I gotten a soggy and messy quesadilla. Definitely won't ever be going here again. Not to mention from the moment I stepped foot there the employees looked at me and my husband as if we didn't belong although we were courteous and spoke Spanish fluently. Sad and disrespectful place
author: KayGee S.

description: Average Mexican restaurant located in the Glen Park district of SF. This is my grab-and-go default place if I'm craving some burritos. Their burritos are okay -- they have the standard selection of meats and toppings, and they generously fill up the burrito so the portion size is well worth the price, but the quality of the ingredients I feel is quite average. I usually frequent their carne asada burrito quite often as the flavor of the beef is quite good.
author: Alvin W.

description: Over the years, this restaurant has become very inconsistent. I've continuously found my food dry, cold, and/or somewhat flavorless. I say, keep it simple with a burrito if you do eat here. I do love their fresa agua fresca. Also, come at an off time if possible, the food seems to be better and you will get a table more easily.
author: Adriana G.

description:
CROSS CONTAMINATION!!

I've been to this location several times over the last 5-6years. It's been a mixed bag but overall usually good. At this point (April 2018) the cross contamination issue has gotten worse than all previous times. 

The guacamole used to just have a few sprinkles of cheese & sour cream but today they were SWIMMING in it. Since I love guacamole but I am lactose intolerant it's a frustrating situation. When I tried to explain this to my burrito-maker she seemed to think I was more concerned about being charged for unwanted cheese/sour cream rather than actually ingesting those animal products. Furthermore, when she showed signs of understanding my concern of cross contamination (she scooped the dairy off to the side of the guac bin) she proceeded to leave said dairy spoon resting on the guac. Only a few seconds later and another burrito-maker grabbed that spoon and scooped someone else a heap of dairy guac, unbeknownst to all but me and another customer that witnessed this and shared glances.

It's sad. The food is good and has so much going for it but I can't bring certain people here because of the ongoing cross contamination issue. Please, business owner, do yourself and your pocketbook a favor and go grad a burrito at Chipotle or Gordos and watch how the pros avoid cross contamination. They both have one burrito-maker per STATION and NOT PER CUSTOMER which helps move the line faster and keep things orderly. Also watch how clean, and well separated the bins are. How well trained the employees are on cross contamination. You can do better and this review is my attempt to raise your awareness to this issue as trying with your employees is futile.

I will gladly change my review if you change your behavior here. It's all a result of management (or lack thereof).
author: Josh P.

description:
Unfortunately I don't see what the hype is all about. I came here about a week ago on a weekday for dinner and was disappointed. My man lives in the area and we saw the long lines so I assumed it HAD to be good. OR maybe it was bad judgment and this was the only fast restaurant near Bart. 

CONS 
1. I didn't expect the service to be top notch with the long lines but I also didn't think communication would be that bad. I couldn't even complete my order because the lady assumed I was finished so my boyfriend and I ended up having to order separate and I was basically being pushed towards the cashier. 
2. They ran out of all the tamales except for chicken. The chicken one was over cooked and HELLA dry I honestly had to throw it away. I should have asked for a refund but I took it to go. (we live within walking distance) 
3. The enchilada plate was just as bad. I should have asked for shredded chicken but I didn't think they would put dry chunks of chicken meat. The re-fried beans were HELLA salty! However, everything else was so bland including the watered down salsa! 

I don't see any reason to come back here. I can't agree with the "authentic" reviews. But, see for yourself MAYBE they just had a bad day but I would rather eat chipotle lol!
author: Roxanne A.

description:
Let me start by saying this is my favorite Mexican spot that isn't in the mission (even though they do have a location on mission st). I've lived in glen park my whole life and have been coming here since the place opened. That being said, the prices have gotten just too damn expensive. I remember when the super quesadilla was $8.70 after tax. I came in today to find they have raised their prices for the 2nd time in a year and now the super quesadilla is $11.18 after tax when just last week it was $9.98. 

I could understand raising prices if they were doing anything different but it's literally the same exact food, same ingredients; the only difference is the lines just keep getting longer.

This spot has been blown up by all the yuppies and techies coming in from out of town on Bart. If they continue to raise their prices like this they will eventually push out all the locals and long time customers. 

I'd love to continue supporting my local Mexican food establishment but these prices are getting too high.
author: Aidan M.

description:
They were out of al pastor so I got a carnitas burrito. It was fulling, and very large, but nothing to write home about in terms of flavor.

The seating area was quite dirty despite it not being too crowded. Many tables were piled high with the left over/trash of previous patrons. There is no trash can so I guess the tables are bussed but it seems like they had not been cleaned in a while.

Maybe next time it'll be better?
author: Byron L.

description:
This is my favorite place to get a burrito in the city. I probably come here like 2-3 times a week. 

What I love about them is they're always open, 7 days a week I believe, and they also have two locations. They're meats AND beans are flavorful, which isn't always the case. 

They also have BABY burritos, which is soooo nice. I personally can't and don't want to eat an entire super burrito so having a baby option is the best.

Hands down one of the best places to get a burrito in the city. This is coming from a local who eats burritos all the time lol.
author: Jewel S.

description:
I've come here a couple times and I have to say that while I might not be a convert from Farolito, it definitely is the place for me when I'm just in a pinch and need a quick bite and don't have the time to wait in line. I just order online and pick-up my order almost immediately. 

My go-to here is now the Super Baby Burrito, which even for a big eater like me is the perfect amount of food. It has all the toppings I want without being so filling that I have to nap afterwards. Also, it's always a wonder to me that they give me the chips and salsa for free.

This is my favorite quick Mexican spot in the neighborhood, especially thanks to my ability to order online. Corneta will continue to see a lot of me in the future!
author: Jenny D.

description:
Service is good and the staff is nice. FYI- cash only, which is unusual for a taqueria.

Environment: quite dirty because they don't clear the tables right away so there is always trash and food lingering around on the tables.

Chicken quesadilla: they put lettuce in it which I've never seen before in a quesadilla, and overall was very messy and not very good.

Burritos: average.

Chips and salsa: they only serve the vegetable salsa (spicy and non spicy versions), not the dipping type.

The following taquerias are all better than La Corneta:
El Farolito, Taqueria Guadalajara, Mexico Tipico
author: Tom P.

description: Definitely a go to if you're in the area looking for latin good, it's cash only I believe so be ready. You order before you pay as soon as you walk in, and they have the traditional taqueria menu, burritos, tortas, etc. I love burritos and tacos, and they come out really good. I do recommend
author: Santiago E.

description: A nice local eatery, with long lines and an extensive menu.  Came here on Sunday at 2 pm and the line was still long.  Food looked  delicious.  Today I tried the super fish taco, which was soooo good. Fresh veg, fish was hot and smothered with sour cream, black beans and topped with a slice of tomato.  I would definitely be back to try other food items on the menu.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Great food, but customer service can be improved. I called to place an order and asked the lady to repeat what she was saying. After repeating it in an angry tone, she literally hung up on me.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: One of the most crackin spots here in FRISCO! Depending on the time of day or chance, the lines can go out the door. Great Mexican food imo. The plates are always a hit as well as the burritos like steak and shrimp. I got the taco salad this time and was very happy with my order.
author: Mark H.

description: Fast Mexican food.  Tasty.  Several selections  Reasonably priced.  If you get there around lunch or dinner the lines can be long... but you can usually get through in 15-20"
author: Anna E.

description:
I've moved to Dallas. One of the things I miss most about San Francisco is La Corneta. I'd recommend specifics, but honestly, everything I've eaten here has been so, so, so good. Their salsa verde is amazing. Their chicken is moist and full of delicious spicy flavor. You get a TON of bang for your buck. 

I miss you, La Corneta! Texas burritos don't even come close!
author: Ilya N.

description:
A couple a years ago, I went to a party/lunch my wife's work was having. The food was catered Mexican. Everything was so good, I asked where they got it from. La Corneta was the answer. I made a mental note, but since I don't go to Glen Park often...I nearly forgot about it.

Fast forward to current times. I wanted to have a post-season awards banquet for the high school wrestling team I coach...and I wanted it catered. I tend to gravitate towards Mexican food...so "La Corneta" flashed in my mind. I called them up a week out to get a handle on things. They were very helpful and friendly. So far; so good.

Even though it was pouring rain, and I know they were busy last Friday evening... they delivered everything on time.  The food did not disappoint. The first thing I always taste at a Mexican place is the rice and beans. Those should be good enough to be a meal by themselves. If they aren't nailed...anything else the place has probably won't be either. Their rice was spot on: perfect texture and flavoring. The beans were just as yummy. OK, so now we're in business.

I ordered buffet food for 35. Carne aside and carnitas for the meats; refried and pinto beans for the beans; vegetables; and a rice, Everything was great. The carne asada and carnitas were tasty and cooked properly. As I said, they had me at the rice. It was as good as mi suegra's....which is not easy to do.

I know very well La Corneta is no secret to the folk living in Glen Park...but most out in my neck of the woods (Outer Sunset, where the Mexican food is awful) have not heard of it. I'm glad I did.

Highly recommended!
author: Michael W.

description:
I normally love la Corneta especially one on mission and Burlingame but this one I would never go especially ladies who is helping at the pay out doesn't listen 
I don't like being rushed and my burrito being rushed 
I know they were busy but please take a pride in what you do 
I have them second chance but second time was only worst 
I could put up with service but when the food is also bad I give no stars or go back 
Please owner of the establishment go check this location instead staying 24/7 in Burlingame location
author: ercan b.

description:
Delicious food and lots of it! 
Friendly fast service. 
Super affordable prices for the quality and quantity of food. 
Salsas are fantastic. 
Loved this place. 
Ate too much.
author: Nilu r.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped by La Cornetas while heading out of the city yesterday and I kinda actually wish we didn't. The place wasn't busy and the food came out quickly - but that's about it. We ordered a couple tacos since we weren't that hungry and they tasted mediocre at most. Neither the green or red sauce had any spice to them & the meat was pretty bland. What bothered me the most was cleanliness. The table was sticky and the chairs made me oddly itchy. I did not feel comfortable at all. At one point I gave up on sitting and decided to just stand up. Definitely not worth a second visit.
author: Lynn A.

description:
Nearly 1000 reviews, & 4 stars?  Not to mention, I read "best Mexican food outside of the mission," & "better than La Taqueria."  

That certainly raised an eyebrow.  So I came in looking forward to my mind being blown.  

That didn't happen.  

First...
Where's the flavor?  

Chips & salsa?  Bland.
Carne asada super burrito?  Bland.
Carnitas tacos?  Bland.

Second...
What happened to decent customer service?
Notice I didn't say good, I said decent.  I'm keeping my expectations real.

The gal that made my order was a complete fail.  Not only did she get my order wrong by giving me soft tacos instead of crispy; but she couldn't have asked me "what kind of beans?" w more apathy if I had paid her.  She wasn't the only unenthusiastic employee, either.  The gal that gave me a to-go box was equally apathetic.

I can forgive bad service if the food is great.  Or at least good.  But, every aspect of this meal was subpar.  I was left disappointed.

I let the soft tacos mistake go after she plated them & had added the beans because I usually order them soft anyway.  Crispy tacos are a departure for me, so I didn't really care.  

Pick your battles.  

But there were no redeeming qualities in the carnitas, or the carne asada.  Tender?  Flavorful?  No & no.

Nopalito & La Taqueria still have carnitas locked in, w Nopalito holding the title, especially for quality.  Hands down.

If your mantra is "bigger is better," then you might be happy here.  The super burrito (that everyone raves about) is positively gargantuan.  Flavorless, but indeed huge.

On an up note, the menu is refreshingly versatile & expansive.  The salmon dish that I saw plated immediately gave me dish envy.  And the desserts...cream filled churros, chocolate cake topped w flan, & sugar dusted sandwich cookies, all looked fabulous.  I didn't try them, but they get props just for offering them.

If I come back, it will be for dessert.

This one was a letdown, folks.

2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Been coming to this spot for over 10 years. Still a fan. They are good and close to my house. I prefer El Farolito to them, but it's still great food. Prices are a little steeper than most because of the location, but it's a slightly cleaner atmosphere as well.
author: Eva C.

description:
First and only burrito I tried on my last day in SF during my month here and I couldn't have been happier. Ordered a carne asada and prawns burrito and it literally melted in my mouth! 
They only take cash and thankfully I had cash on me. The prawns were not the same temperature as the meat and rice so that was a sight downside (they only barely heated up the prawns on the grill). Otherwise couldn't be happier about my choice to eat my last meal in town at La Corneta. Highly recommend !
author: Vanessa D.

description:
What a spread! So many great choices. Loaded burritos, great salsas, long line but moves quick. Cash only.
Carnitas great, Al Pastor soupy not grilled
author: Heather L.

description: Stopped by after visiting San Francisco and ordered the asada tacos. The tacos came out quickly. Ordering style is like that of chipotle or Panda Express. The meat wasn't too fresh and tasted plain. The sauce provided didn't add much flavor.
author: Justin V.

description:
I eat Mexican all the time. And without a doubt, this place has the worst staff ever. They don't speak English OR SPANISH well. "Hi can I please have one bean, rice, and cheese burrito with refried beans?"
"what kind of beans?"
"refried"
"What?"
"REFRIED"
"Ok what else"
"One regular chicken burrito"
"What kind of salsa?"
"Mild"
"What kind of beans?"
"Refried"
"On which burrito?"
"The regular chicken burrito"
"You want chicken on your bean burrito?"
"No!"

You get the idea.
My fiancé is fluent in Spanish and the lady couldn't understand that either. Food is meh
author: Reed M.

description:
SF taquerias like this and others inspired Chipotle, but they'll never attain the authenticity of these little neighborhood joints. (And I am not anti-Chipotle either, as it fills an important niche).

This is a sentimental favorite because Hubs and I used to eat here since the kids were little. A visit to my sister and her family in the neighborhood always required a meal or two at La Corneta.

Cash only!

Park in the empty lot two doors over.

Two blocks from BART station.

Casual, kid friendly, good efficient service.

SF Style order at counter after perusing the steam trays of various proteins (tofu, green chile chicken, carnitas, prawns, etc) and additions such as beans, rice, veg. 

I had an XL $9 "super burrito" of 1/2 steak, 1/2 grilled chicken, refried, rice, cheese, guacamole, lettuce, sour cream, and salsa. Comes with free chips. 

Green avocado/tomatillo salsa and a boring red are in squirt bottles at each table. There's a spicier red and a mild or spicy pico de gallo behind the counter that staff will pack in little cups for you.
author: Trish W.

description:
Great place to go with the family! The Burritos are awesome, and they have vegetarian options too! Heres a great video on what the inside looks like!

La Corneta inside tour: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7JEesF0vw70
author: Anoah W.

description:
"Ode to Super Baby Fish Burrito"

Your 10 minutes
of existence were short
please know
I loved you

I almost breathed in this whole burrito, it was that good. 

Highlights:
- Salmon, do they add lime juice? Amazing
- Black beans,  superior to all beans
- Green salsa, on point and the best of all of them

Salmon + lime + green salsa combo made this experience impeccable. If you love those three things then please try this burrito. Super baby burrito is also regular burrito sized in my opinion. I ate the whole thing and feel uncomfortably full, but omg it was perfect.

If anyone knows a place that has a better fish burrito, pm me. I need to know. This review is strictly for the fish burrito.
author: Lupita D.

description:
I got a burrito. It wasn't anything special but it wasn't bad. They build your burrito right in front of you and you have the choice of what goes in it (much like chipotle, they charge extra for guacamole). 

Interestingly, you have chose between mild or spicy pico de gallo. The chips are made in house, or at least I assume the chips are made in house because a bunch of them were stuck together. 

As burritos go, they're pretty standard. Beans, rice, and meat. I had a little trouble ordering, because it's a little loud and I'm short so my voice doesn't carry over the sneeze guard like it should.
author: Brianne N.

description:
Not sure why Corneta gets such good reviews. I live around the corner and I commute out of glen park station everyday but I've still only gone to Corneta maybe 3 times in the last 5 years, and only out if desperation.  This is the poster child for gringo Mexican food. 

The beans and rice both have this really distinct greasy flavor, the lettuce is always drenched in water so it soaks your food, makes it sloppy and depletes the flavor.  The carne asada is dry, tough and mostly flavorless - I never order it anymore because it's always a disappointment. The grilled chicken always tastes burnt and bitter. The saucy meats have dry meat and watery sauce so it's the worst of both worlds. The carnitas is dry, flavorless and really fatty (that sounds oxymoronic, I know, but it's true). The meat that they refer to as "barbecued pork" (it might be Pibil) is the most pleasant meat option.  

The chile rellenos are pretty good.  The grilled shrimp are pretty good too when they cook them properly (99% of the time they're raw or overlooked). The nachos are pretty good except that the meat options suck so I recommend just getting the vegetarian ones. 

The worst offense is the salsa, which used to be good until they started either watering them down or using unripe ingredients because the last couple times I've gone there they've been totally flavorless and watery. The pico de gallo tastes like unripe tomatoes and water. Seriously, the main ingredient in any dish here is water.
author: Emma H.

description:
I'm from Texas and am picky as hell when it comes to Mexican food. La Corneta does not disappoint!! I come here a lot. I've had everything on the menu and have found few things I didn't love.

TIP: Don't be intimidated by the long line. It moves fast. And if you can't deal with the cash-only policy then go somewhere else and GET A LIFE instead of helping Visa, MasterCard and the other credit card companies get rich by screwing over small businesses!!!

My Favorites: Al Pastor tacos (tender and tantalizing); shrimp burritos (same Mission style concept only better than most places in the Mission; Carne asada nachos (thin and crisp chips made in house smothered in cheese and fixing!); Salsa verde = heaven!!
author: Jay E.

description: I love this place, and the food is always delicious, but I am no longer going to get burritos from here. I have had several poorly wrapped burritos from there as of late, and they are very messy. My burrito I got there yesterday had a 2 inch gash in it, and fingernail gashes in it, exposing the beans and rice. Eventually the insides fell out. I could tell when I was watching it being wrapped that it was done improperly, because it was HUGE--not tight at all!
author: M'famous O.

description:
My local burrito shop. The burritos are pretty good, nothing mind blowing but good enough to come back too. My go to is the Al Pastor, I used to get plain chicken but I kept getting disappointed. My wife enjoys the grilled salmon tacos, if you "super" that it isn't really a taco anymore but a big pile of food with a soft taco bottom. The chips are good, salsa okay.

Always super busy around lunch with a line wrapping around inside. Ordering is always an interesting experience, you order at one end of the counter and work your way up the counter as they build your meal. It gets awkward when you order multiple items as you will be going back and forth re-starting for each item. Plus you will skip over other people who are still doing their order dance. Finally your meal itself gets in line waiting for people to pay, make sure to keep a good eye on it!

They have a fair bit of seating but it you can still miss out.

It is also cash only.
author: Tristan L.

description:
This taqueria is pretty dependable if you go in with the right expectations. Expect to be rushed and to repeat your order several times. Most of the time, they get it right in the end. Expect mediocre food and long lines during dinner time.

One thing to watch out for: when you order a regular burrito/taco, they will charge you for a "super" ($1 or $2 more) if you add on lettuce (should be $.20 more), even though you didn't get sour cream or guacamole.

If you order anything with shrimp, make sure they cook it all the way through. 

3 stars for being open on holidays and for being the only taqueria in glen park.
author: Sheila G.

description: I popped in for a Friday afternoon snack and was quiet pleased!  My quesadilla was fresh and tasty, the ordering and food preparation process was quick, and the setting was spacious and inviting.  I appreciated the fact they provided complimentary chips, as well as the tasty bottles of green and red salsa they had at each table!  Solid spot.
author: Barnali D.

description:
They higher their price I think.
But.. it's all good! Their burrito is really good! I don't even lie!!!!
Oh, try their carne asada!!! I bought my uncle a burrito and he likes it so much.
What happened the next day?
He bought it again for his lunch..for himself! hahaha
author: Candice L.

description: Best burrito in SF. Why wait in the long Mission district lines, when you can go to simple Glen Park? There's normally a little line, but it moves fast. Be sure to bring cash.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
La Corneta has been one of the most, if not the most, consistently returned to taqueria in San Francisco since I moved here in 2009. Initially I think this was due to relative proximity to where I lived, even though there were 10 other taquerias between my front door and La Corneta, and then it was its proximity to the glen park Bart station, but now, when all is said and done, it's their perfect grilled chicken.  

La Corneta utilizes the assembly line style of Mexican food prep, invented in the mission district in the 1970's and popularized by Chipotle, which is also gaining steam with the rising trend of Poke shops. This is an awesome way to get a burrito or taco made so you can specify or see exactly what goes in it, and choose from different beans, rices, etc. While I love the ability to customize in the flesh, my favorite thing to order here involves little to no dictation - the quesadilla suiza with chicken. 

Perfectly charred and seasoned chicken collides with a generous amount of melty white (jack?) cheese and a freshly crisped tortilla that is simply divine. Typically it comes with your choice of hot or mild pico but I always get that on the side with my chips because I feel it makes the experience too et and soggy. I have yet to have a better quesadilla anywhere in the Bay Area that balances flavor, juiceyness, and freshness without being insanely greasy. It's hard to use such a big amount of cheese without giving the customer an oil slick in their mouth and somehow La Corneta achieves this feat. Also worth noting is the insanely delicious quality of their shrimp. Although pricey, if you have never had a shrimp burrito this is the place to get it. All the shrimp is cooked to order until just barely translucent and served to tender perfection. 

Pro tip: they offer "baby burritos" which come in a slightly smaller tortilla with smaller portions for a couple dollars less, which is awesome because it's still almost too much food to handle in one sitting.
author: Sean S.

description: Food is on point. You can get a great meal for about 13. A burrito and chille relleno. The carne asada is never dry and always has flavor. The staff is very friendly. I recommend bringing cash.
author: Erick L.

description: My #1 Taqueria in San Francisco over all the rest. Reason being they're generous with the way they prepare your order. The flavor is unmatched and the location is very good and convenient.
author: Billy G.

description: I am not a fan of soft tacos but this place turned me around on that.  Their beef tacos were not only flavorful but everything they put on their was so generous and delicious!  The price was dirt cheap for these humongous tacos.  Only one cook and one at the register so a little slow but they were friendly and nice and the food is worth the wait.  Lots of to go orders.
author: Donna N.

description: This is a great spot to either grab and go, or dine-in.  The lines do get long after 6:30pm, but the prices and variety of food keep me coming back for more.  Order to your heart's content, and you will get a free side of chips and salsa!  I usually go for the chicken burrito, but if you are feeling fancy, their shrimp and mushroom burrito is very tasty!
author: M Z.

description: Awesome little taqueria. I recommend getting a super baby. Still really large but definitely enough so that you won't be hungry for a while.
author: Steve M.

description:
Had a burrito craving but didn't want Chipotle so I came to La Corneta after a short drive. I would have much preferred something else but this had to do for now.

It's not so much that La Corneta isn't good...it's that its quality is so hit and miss that it's just hard to choose it time and time again. Case in point, I opted to have a super baby burrito with carnitas, black beans, and all the fixings. As she filled my burrito, she would hit the spoon on the wrapper...which meant that later, as I was unwrapping my burrito, it had all kinds of little tears along the way which meant juices everywhere! Usually a good thing, but not so much if you have to continue to be human the rest of the day. After a few hand washes, my hands still emitted a fruity flavor with a Mexican flavor undertone. 

The burrito did fill me up though. And they also provide complementary chips, which weren't stale this time! But my salsa was super flavorless...so sad. The pico had zero flavor.

Still a meal under $8 though.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Actively disappointing burritos. Totally perplexed why it was packed when I went there on Sunday afternoon.
author: Sergio P.

description:
Sadly after going to this place since it opened and i was a teenager and many great years, I've about had it with the rapidly diminishing and now pathetic portion sizes at Coroneta.

The first time i got a $9+ burrito with a scant half spoonful of chicken i chalked it up to new staff (some of these wonderful women have been here for a decade-plus). But fool me twice and I'm done.

I'm also not to happy that they had Belly (app/ipad) for ages and i wracked up hundreds of points before the iPad broke. They said it would be up soon. Then after a few months it disappeared. And of course, they won't honor the points. Given that we've probably spent thousands of dollars here over the years, really disappointing.
author: Mike V.

description:
La Corneta is not too bad. I've always enjoyed their burritos and tacos. 

I ordered a Super Steak and Prawn burrito with chips and salsa on the side. $14. CASH ONLY. I don't remember when this place stop accepting cards but it seems like a lot of people weren't up on game as patron after patron had to order then leave to get cash from one of the conveniently placed ATMS right outside. 

Burrito was good. Carne Asada was nicely flavored and warm. Prawns we're cooked to order, but as the lady wrapped my burrito she dropped two pieces and didn't replace them. :( oh and they have peas in their rice. Weird. Decent burrito
author: John M.

description: Iv been going to this taqueria since I was 5. In love with their super vegetarian burritos with a spinach tortilla. Their prices have gone up slowly over the years and portions decreased but I understand because they get more abs more popular and have to earn their money !
author: Lara C.

description: Loved it. They make the food in front of u and u choose what u want , kinda like a subway athentic Mexican food spot . Loved
author: April F.

description:
3.5

This is a tale of a married couple and their friend. My good buddy and his wife told me about this taqueria. He is a fan. She... not so much. I am somewhere in the middle. This 3.5 rating reflects all of our experiences.

He thinks it's worth 4 stars because of the size of the burritos. They're pretty massive. They're not the cheapest I've ever come across but when in San Francisco, expect to pay over market for burritos -- even at neighborhood taquerias. The employees are very friendly and everyone was engaged with our visit -- despite the place being packed. LCT employs the Chipotle/Subway conveyor belt method of putting together your food. Keep an eye on it or it just might magically appear at the cash register, ready for your eating. Chips & salsa come with each burrito and are complimentary.

She thinks it's worth 3 stars because the taste is somewhat bland. Mexican food is known for a spice profile and, unless you drown your burrito with their hot salsa, you might just receive a big tube of edible - but not exciting - food. It's cash only so be mindful of your order. I saw some patrons take advantage of the ATM across the street. I tried to be a hero and pay for all three burritos. I almost had to take to street walking to afford the cash transaction.

I think it's worth 3.5 stars because both of them have valid points. My super chicken burrito (so named for the beans, rice, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and guac that comes with) was decent but not extraordinary. The rice was that slightly crunchy type that you'd never want to eat on its own but gives texture and added depth to burritos. I asked for no sour cream (part of the 'super' designation) and received mouthfuls of the white nastiness as I neared the end of my burrito. My mild salsa paired nicely with my meal but the chips were a touch stale. LCT won't be the best Mexican you'll ever have, but it's more than passable. 3.5 is a fair number on which we can all agree. Check it out if in the neighborhood and hungry but don't go out of your way.
author: Johnny T.

description:
every time I'm in the mission, I know that La Corneta is a reliable place to get delicious tacos or a satisfying burrito. La corneta is relatively spacious, so you can usually find a spot no
matter the time of day.
author: Haley D.

description: Very mediocre taqueria.  Only burrito I've ever had that was too salty to finish.  I would only go here if I was in the area and was very hungry.  Otherwise take a quick trip to the mission.
author: Avery N.

description: Un pastor super burrito con agua para dinner... Respectable portions, courteous service, good vibe. :)
author: Jeff K.

description: I regularly order the steak and shrimp burrito that tastes very fresh. The chips are great and the  salsa wasn't too bad but not spicy at all.  The pico behind the counter was really spicy!  Cash only but there is a Wells Fargo across the street.
author: Celina A.

description: Amazing!! Delicious and fast!!! As a college student who doesn't have a lot of money this is definitely worth the very low price!
author: Mykel D.

description: The burritos are good but can get pricey. Great ratio of meat to beans/rice, and the prawns they used tasted fresh as well. This one cashier in particular was extremely nice to me when I didn't have any cash on me by letting me, burritos on hand and everything, run outside to grab cash from the ATM outside and then run back in. Not many businesses would put that much trust on their customers to walk out with a $50 order and trust that they would come back so big ups on that lady for letting me do that.
author: Zhi L.

description: My go to taqueria in the city.  The carne asada is the best.  I've been coming to this place for years and never disappointed.
author: Anthony T.

description:
I love this place. Been their customer for years now, and they never fail to disappoint me each time. I usually get a carnitas super burrito, but I decided to get 3 chicken tacos the last time I came by. 

They don't skimp on their meat, you'd be very surprised at how much meat is in one taco and how big the portion is! It was a bit bland in my opinion, but it might've been because it was chicken. 

There's always a long line so if you can, just call in and pick it up. It'll save you lots of time
author: Elaine C.

description: Love this place.their food is bomb and affordable. Staff is also very nice and love coming in here. My fave is the burritos from this place.Most def recommend.
author: Juliana M.

description: Now that La Taqueria is closed on Mondays, we need an alternative place to grab our pre-band practice dinner. La Corneta to the rescue. The staff here do a great job of serving up fresh, quality food with a smile. My usual go to is the fish taco with black beans and a chicken taco (either mole, tomato, or verde) with pinto beans and onion/cilantro. No need to smoother the tacos in dairy with the "super" order of cheese, sour cream, etc. Instead just opt for the cheaper "regular" order and let the flavors and spices of the meat and beans vouch for themself. Each order comes with chips and an assortment of salsa, with the non-spiced pico de gallo being my personal favorite at the moment. And there's even a small beer with draft beers and liquor if the Mexican-mixology bug craves. My only complaint is if you pay for extra avocado, they give you smidgen. I complained once and the owner asked me if I knew how much avocados cost? I was a little disappointed with his question to my question, and in my research I saw that avos sold for a mere 99 cents a few doors down-- so I was getting about 15 cents worth of avo for my $1.50 extra payment. Kinda lame considering how much better the food tastes with that. All good otherwise, and I consider myself a repeat customer.
author: Brian J.

description: Shrimp burritos FTW!! These can be kinda gross or bland at other taquerias. Not here- the shrimp is always tender and well seasoned. I made the mistake once of getting a salmon burrito- don't bother.
author: Jean L.

description: Great Mexican joint. But it always smells like soap. Nachos are really good, but try to get them to put the onions on before they put it under the broiler to melt the cheese.
author: Cliff H.

description: I've been going to La corneta for over a decade now. Amazing food, explosive flavors...just true authenticity. Hands down one of the best taquerias in SF.
author: Sonia R.

description: Super delicious and probably one of my favorite taquerias in San Francisco. I usually always order a chicken quesadilla and im always satisfied. One of my favorite things to also order is a chicken Cesar salad they are quite tasty
author: Liset O.

description:
Line moves quickly and we were able to snag a table for 5 during lunch hour on a Wednesday, but I imagine it's much busier on weekends.

Tacos are huge and toppings are piled high, so you really get your money's worth. We all ended up getting seafood items and the portions are generous and the fish/shrimp very well cooked. I got the prawn quesadilla (regular) and it was just the perfect ratio of cheese and prawns (big and juicy ones, too!). It was so simple, but so good and really hit the spot. My table also ordered tacos and burritos, and everything looked amazing and we all polished off our plates. Complimentary chips with each order, too.

Great place for a quick bite, either dining in or taking it to go.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I've been going to this place for over 6 years. the reason for the 2 star is because of the food quality isn't good unless you go in lunch time, the price keeps going up and the rudeness of the new staff. All they do is talk to each other and don't pay any attention to what you want. Like if you say no sour cream they still put it on and when you see them do it they just scooped off the sour cream and still have some on it. 
Or if you want the cheese on the burrito before the meat, so the cheese melt they roll their eyes and give you attitude. 
The biggest problem is that the food tasted like perfume a few times  and it was a waste of money for a hard, long  and hungry day. 
So watch out for these things. This place use to be my first spot for food but after awhile of them keep fuckin up I just stop going.
author: Alexander M.

description: This is one of our favorite Mexican restaurants because the food and service are excellent. We often call this place when we need catering. We also love the image of Our Lady of Guadalupe inside the restaurant. It's so beautiful!
author: Steph L.

description: Fuck this place. The workers are rude and racists. I walked in a worker looked me in my face didn't greet me, say hi welcome nothing. I was standing there for a minute still didn't attend to me. I walk to the register to see if that's where I get my order taken. Two workers  see me but don't speak they're just chilling it up bdtween them selves. Then I see another woman taking the order of the lady beside me. I said hold on I was here before. All 3 of those bitches started speaking Spanish tryna say I wasn't in line. Bitch I was trying to ask y'all a question and they straight up just ignored me. Fuck this place. Never will get my money. And it look nasty anyways. Go on mission st.
author: Kaimi B.

description: Sit down for this one, or just enjoy the read it's the real deal as I lived it. First, what annoyed me the most is that my favorite place down the block was closed so I resorted to this place. I've been here before, nothing stands out much since it is your typical "gentrified" type of Mexican food that you just settle for. Why? Because nothing around is authentic enough to be called good Mexican cuisine! On this night though a party of four walked in their doors and I was at the forefront of the squad. When I walked in a Caucasian man and his daughter got up and cut in front to order. I let them by, no reason to get worked up and I start to look at their menu. I wasn't done reading when I could hear the "angry" lady screaming NEXT!..... NEXT.... NEXT!!!!!!!!!!!  Oh man I thought, so let me just start ordering before this lady throws herself on the floor and starts convulsing. I start to talk and she interrupts me. She gets mad and starts to say what else, okay but what else, ok but what else....????? Jesus, she wasn't letting me talk and I was trying so hard to just be clear and concise with the hood rat chick! To top it off she threw the food around like she was slamming it on the counter, she cross contaminated the food (accidentally adding meat or beans to the wrong order). She ended up making an extra burrito because of course she wasn't listening! I said four!!!! Four burritos please.... And what the ghetto child in me wanted to say, was 4 f****** burritos bi***!!! Because by then the women boundary crossed and quite frankly -----broken. How dare you be so disrespectful like that especially in front of my offspring I thought. But the part of me who has gone through a whole load of schooling just remained calm. I let the man I was with deal with her. She softened her tone after he pointed out that she had made an extra burrito. He  I said to her, you know you made an extra burrito right? I mean I think that is what she (me) was trying to tell you but you aren't listening he told her. She finished making the food and I paid and handed the cashier my business card. I told her to have her boss call me. He never did and I didn't drop that there. I called for almost two weeks and they  I just kept saying he wasn't around.And do I emailed Joe who said this isn't typical of them (his workers). Well Joe, you also promised me lunch for four on you and I am still waiting so what's new? Lead by example and follow through. Finally let me say, tjat for the most part everyone is nice. She looks ignorant is all and I feel bad because she hates her job and it shows. If I could start a gofund me account for her I totally would. She needs a career change.
author: Pamela A.

description:
This is the place where I said "oh hell yeah, Mexican food is SO GOOD AND I LOVE IT NOW". I know it's silly but it was the first time i ate good Mexican food. Place is sanitary from what I see,  the employees are helpful and nice, and I never once got food poisoning. I expected it to like chipotle and have stomachaches afterwards but holy crud, this is the best place I've eaten at so far. No food poisoning, food is good, salsa isn't all heat and you can actually taste the ingredients, CHIPS, good service and all. I would go to great lengths to eat here again.

I don't know how people say it's bland, I eat bland food almost everyday due to my budget and this doesn't come close to that.
author: Aaaaaaaaaa A.

description:
Was coming home from the 101 and was craving burrito. Quickly yelped and found this place. Got here and usually an issue I have with Mexican food is that the burritos are usually just too much. I can always eat a good amount of it, but by the time I finish that much there is only a small portion left (not worth saving) and then I just end up eating all of it, which then ends up to much. You might be asking, why am I rambling on about burrito sizes, well the reason for that is because this place has baby burritos! Just the perfect size! Not overly full and still satisfied. Smaller burritos are great. Another reason why I like this place is that you automatically get chips with your order too. Line is quick as well. 

Downside: Cash only, which is not the biggest deal since there are ATMs around, but I would prefer to pay with my credit card.
author: Julie L.

description:
like really this place.nice and clean. 
when my friends shows me this place i was worried because i was not like the Mexican food , but after i eat at La Corneta Taqueria i change my mind and now always go to this place .
author: Max F.

description: Highly disappointed by their nachos. The tortilla chips are thin and they place them at the very bottom. The chips soon ends up as one large, congealed, soggy mass after the moisture from all the toppings have gotten to the chips (see picture). A massive fail for me.
author: Esther A.

description: Make sure to order something like a burrito, the chicken mole is good, just stay away from the salads. Just ordered the spring mixed salad with steak, I know-what am I thinking, but on a low carb diet so... Anyway, lady handling food puts raw steak on the grill with her bare hands and then proceeds to next grab lettuce and rest of raw veggies to put on plate, all without washing hands in between. Now I'm thinking... do I eat this and risk getting sick? I know much worse may happen that I don't see, but if handling food in front of customers please wash your hands! And if handling raw meat always wash your hands!
author: Julie O.

description:
I've watched this place double their size and quadruple their business. Unfortunately I've also witnessed the manageress become steadily more unfriendly over the years. Maybe she's had her fill of clueless or rude customers, or is weary from being constantly busy. 

I haven't been driven away by her, but I have found myself getting frustrated when my attempts to smile and say something kind have been met with coldness. On my last visit, I accidentally counted out 5¢ under the amount I intended. The manageress thrust her hand toward me and demanded "five cents!" in an accusatory tone. Typical of her style. No thank you. No smile. Just "next!"
author: tout le monde a.

description:
Oh, this place, this place is bad for my diet.  Toddler-sized burritos stuffed with meat and cheese.  Yeah, you're not going to find more delicious food for your buck than one of those.

There's always a line, and I think I've only ever eaten in once.  Get it to go, head home, draw the blinds, and let no one see your shame as you finish the whole thing.
author: Foodbag B.

description: Holy Moses the portions are enormous. Each regular taco had practically as much meat as an entire Chipotle burrito. The asada was great, the al pastor was outstanding, and the chicken in salsa roja was tender af. Free chips and salsa when you dine in.
author: Alec N.

description: Beware: This place has shortchanged me *multiple times* and every time I've brought it up with the cashier, she is unapologetic and in fact, STILL gives me the wrong change and goes on to the next customer. The third time this happened I became convinced that they must do this deliberately to cheat their customers of their money (if they can rip off $3-$5 from each customer, then it can really add up). It's always very busy and they only accept cash here so I suspect it is very easy for them to cheat people without customers even noticing. I am a big fan of cheap, good Mexican food, but I will not support unethical businesses (plus their food is not even that good), so I will never go back here again.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Ordered steak nachos and they gave very little meat in it. I showed them my nachos and asked if they can find the steak in the nachos and said that the steak melted with the cheese when it was microwave!  Really now. It's not my first time ordering nachos here so I don't know what magic trick they're trying to pull right now.
author: Lyn B.

description:
After failing to get a free burrito from the Chipotle Cultivate Festival because of the long lines, my friend and I stopped by La Corneta for some real Mexican burritos! Even at 3pm, there was still a line of people grabbing food here. They have a nice variety of items on the menu, so get picking!

You go down the line like Chipotle and pick what ingredients you want (tortilla, beans, meat, and sauce). The steak was so juicy, and I really liked the rice they used in the burrito. You also get a basket of chips, and the salsa is delicious! 

Can't use your plastic here, so save your cash for tasty Mexican food!
author: Christine S.

description:
I was too lazy tonight to make enchiladas so went looking for red one specifically and with traditional red mole. When I arrived they only had the green spicy sauce. I said yes to those and ordered one with grilled chicken and the other with chicken in sauce (same that would go on top of them); It came with beans and rice. 
Wow, i'm impressed they are super good. I got chips and salsa too but I didn't really want them. Portions are big. I would definitely ask them to put less chicken in them next time ... LOL I know funny right? But I like my enchiladas thinner ;) 
I also saw that they had a Flan / this was Chocho flan...so I order that too! piggy... But I swear I'm going to eat it in three days lapse!
author: Tere C.

description: This is probably one of the best burrito places I've been to. My favorite is the wet style burrito with steak and I have them grill it before they pour the sauce, cheese, salsa and cilantro over the burrito. It's so moist and flavorful. There's always a line out the door and make sure you bring cash.
author: Rina K.

description: I'm upping this by a whole star because I finally tried their al pastor meat. Sewwwww good! Juicy and flavorful and delicious.
author: AJ P.

description:
The super burritos are 5 stars. Filled with fresh ingredients and meat that give it a full hearty taste. The super tacos on the other hand are around three stars for me. I've had tacos from many local Mexican restaurants, but never have I ever been served a taco I couldn't pick up; let alone hold. 

I'm sure some people love all of the ingredients, but they're so enormous that it completely defeats the purpose of the taco, as you won't be able to eat it without a fork and spoon. If you're craving normal small street tacos, probably not the best place as single tacos are pretty expensive here. Nonetheless, still good tasting and fresh. 4 star Mexican place!
author: Dominic E.

description: Very nice ample place. Had a quesadilla that was a bit too big for me but for the price it was worth it. Down side 1) they limit the chips and salsa they give you only 1 cup of either hot or mild sauce with a small side of chips. 2) it says CASH ONLY but I saw someone pay with a card. (the worker took it out from the side where it was hiding). Not sure why they would do that it sure limited us since we didn't have much cash on us and we wanted to visit the bar. Even when I asked if I could pay with a debit card, she said cash only.  So if anyone reads my review next time try paying with a credit card they may actually take it if you insist. maybe?
author: Ruby A.

description: I swear they removed my previous review. Anyways, the quality and portions are consistent with other locations. They give lots of salsa for the dip when you pay. The line moves fast but they do get busy around dinner time. Cash only and there's no signage to state this so be aware as I fell victim to this the first time. BofA ATM is right outside if you need it. Parking sucks.
author: Julie L.

description:
What can I say about this place that is bad? Not a thing. I've had to stop from ordering there more than 3 times a week. Everything I've had off the menu is good. Favorites include carnitas and steak burrito, steak and shrimp super tostada. Salmon tacos are great too.
My goto is the super baby burrito, and a large strawberry Juice.
author: Cheyenne B.

description:
Ordered 40 tacos for a birthday party plus chips and salsa. Everything was great and they had everything ready in about an hour (I called ahead). Only downside was that they are CASH ONLY! Their yelp page says credit cards are accepted and I ended up having to go to an ATM to get $150--luckily there is a BofA ATM a few doors down. I wish they would accept credit cards for larger orders.

They gave us a generous amount of meat (carne, pollo, carnitas, green chicken), beans, tortilla, chips and salsa. I was actually pleasantly surprised at how much food there was! Great for parties!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I'm sure this place is actually good but last night I ordered their prawn tacos and literally they give sooo little prawns.... I ordered prawn tacos and they made super prawn tacos so charged me $5.50 for each tacos and I can barely eat it cuz they put sooo much stuff on top.

All I remember was eatin soggy tacos with mostly veggies and beans and once in awhile theres tiny prawns in there.

Not sooo happy with my order, my bf said to order their meats cuz they give you alot for that.
author: Debbie D.

description:
A bit disappointed after seeing the reviews here and visiting. On the entrance you'll notice the Trip Advisor, Michelin, Yelp window stickers. I opted for my staple... the chicken burrito. How would my life be without this amazing invention wrapped in a convenient edible wrap? Too bad my experience wasn't the best. The taste wasn't anything special, but what really irked me was how soggy the burrito was and the amount of rice. I love rice, I'm Asian! But it's all about a good balance. And how about draining some of that juice so I don't have to worry about trying to eat a soggy-ritto? 

I'll have to give it another try. I always give places a second chance if they've had a history of quality service and food.
author: David K.

description:
Like a bad relationship, I continue to come back each time. This taqueria is conveniently located and not as healthy. Time and time again, even with the long lines, not so friendly service, and cash only option, my palate and stomach are lured in by their burritos. 

I have to admit, this is so far one of the best places for a burrito since I moved to SF over a year ago. And in my past year of trying various burritos throughout the city, none get to me as La Corneta Taqueria. I usually get the carne asada regular burrito with refried beans and rice on a spinach tortilla. The rice is consistently moist, and I love the beans. The meat is tender and has great flavor. I can't speak for their other items on their menu, but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Nova P.

description: I was in San Francisco for a couple of days and this was my go to spot for some great food!
author: Oscar I.

description: This is one of my favorite Taqueria's, but the customer service is horrible. Almost every time I go there the women that ask for your order don't pay any attention to what you say. I went about an hr ago and I had to tell her to remake the entire burrito because she was too busy gossiping and talking about her kids than paying attention to what I was actually ordering. The worse customer service!
author: Marissa A.

description:
Been going here for at least several years.  This place is a lot cleaner than other taqueria's I've been to.  

The ingredients are fresh and quite filling.  I usually order a the carne asada or regular chicken burrito w/salsa.  The chips are also nicely warm and crispy when you bite into them.

The place gets crowded during peak hours so be prepared to wait or go during a off time.  The parking could be a bit sketchy as it's mostly parking meters or that horrible rocky community parking lot.  If you're in a lowered or sporty car best to park in the first tier closest to the street because the 2nd tier has big hidden potholes that can scratch up the bottom of your car especially exiting that huge drop off from the curb.
author: Eric T.

description: Love this place. Burritos are great and carne asada dinner is also outstanding. Lines can get long but it moves okay quickly. Don't forget the agua fresca - I never leave that place without one.
author: Anthony W.

description:
As a glen park native i really dont feel good having to write a bad review about this place.
if it was 5 years ago i would have given this place 5 stars, however recent events have left me no choice but to give it a one star rating.

lets start with the time my husband and i walked in to get a couple burritos. Normally i dont care if the workers are having a conversation while they are making the food, but if your conversation gets in the way of you hearing me say that i want black beans and leads you to drop a generous amount of refried beans and still not hear me tell you that i didnt want it until youre done making the burrito, then we have a problem.
i seriously repeated myself about 6x while the women were chatting away not paying attention to what we were saying. we ended up leaving out of frustration.

another time we ordered one of their combinations. when we got home to enjoy our food my husband pointed out that his steak tasted like it was covered in perfume. when i tasted it to see what he was talking about, i was hit with the overwhelming taste of chemicals and floral scent that masked any taste of the food itself. we pretty much steered clear of that place for months until today....

exhausted after a long day of work, picking our son up from school and baseball practice we decided to make it easy on ourselves and call in a pick-up order on our way home from the park.
when i called i placed an order of chicken and prawns quesadilla  (for my son and i to share) and a super steak burrito for my husband. we get our order and get home and as soon as i open the quesadilla box i see a steak quesadilla covered in hot salsa..my son is 6 so hot salsa isnt something he can tolerate. my husbands burrito was fine but this was our final straw. 

there have been many other instances of wrong orders and cold food with this taqueria but because i grew up in the neighborhood and have fond memories of what this place used to be i have gone back too many times hoping that maybe 'next time' will be better. It isnt, and sadly i will not ever be returning here. this place really needs to get their shit together
author: holly w.

description:
This is one of my close friend's go to spot in Glen Park for burritos. I finally had an opportunity to check it out and it was a pleasant delight. 

It's a quaint establishment with some tables for dining. The line fluctuates as I'm pretty sure the locals frequent often. It looks long, but goes in waves. Thank goodness we came in around 8:30pm ish and it wasn't bad, but a little after another line started to form. Nonetheless, they have a solid rhythm to get the line moving. 

I got the Carne Asada Baby Super Burrito. Even though it's called "baby," it's still a good hearty portion if you're not hoping to overstuff yourself. What I liked about the burrito is that it had lettuce (get them veggies in!), as well as the typical rice, beans, meat, salsa, guac, and cheese. 

Overall, it tasted very balanced and not too heavy. Thumbs up for complimentary chips with the order!
author: Vincent L.

description: Don't understand the hype for this place. Food is alright but what really needs to improve is the attitude of the employees. The girl that took my order was unfriendly and made rude remarks when ordering. The lady at the register is rude as well and everything seems chaotic.
author: Laura R.

description: I love their mushroom quesadilla! Lots of plump sauteed mushrooms and smokey cheese. Perfect with their cantaloupe agua fresca. This location, unlike the Burlingame one, doesn't have a self service salsa bar, so you have to ask them at the register for salsa. Friendly service and clean.
author: Ellen H.

description:
Meh.
It wasn't anything special. It filled my stomach but my taste buds yearned for more. I had the #5 special: prawns, spicy chicken, and your choice enchilada. I got carne asada in my enchilada and it was fine. Probably the best part of the meal, in my opinion, and I would probably order it again if I was forced to eat here. You can choose any meat for the enchilada which is nice. The spicy chicken was not spicy and kinda dry. The prawns were good I guess, but there were a ton of mushrooms with them which is good if you like mushrooms but I didn't care for them. The meal also came with a miniscule amount of rice and beans, and a "salad" that was pretty much shredded lettuce. 
Sauces at the table were not spicy.
Honestly, there are so many more satisfying places in the city.
author: Audrey D.

description:
I've been going here for years. 
From enchiladas to super burritos food is great!
Everyone know about it & the line can be very long & slow. 
Try the carnitas, the chicken or the shrimp all fabulous. 
Chips & salsa
author: Jonathan P.

description:
The food is hit or miss. We LOVED our Especial Burrito with Cochinita Pibil, but our Super Burrito with Carnitas was bland. The Strawberry Agua Fresca was tasty, but their horchata was just okay. They give you free chips and pico de gallo, but they're both terrible and bland. The free chips at Tacolicious are much better than those at La Corneta.

Worst of all, THEY DON'T ACCEPT CREDIT/DEBIT CARDS! It's 2016, La Corneta -- that's how people pay!
author: Cameron N.

description: This review is strictly based off their BASIC ASS TACOS. I paid three dollars for a taco with meat and beans and some pico de gallo. The tacos had no flavor at all, i soaked it in their green sauce and still couldn't taste anything. How this place has such high ratings i have no idea. Maybe the tacos just suck and everything else is good. I wouldnt come back to find out though...
author: Robert L.

description:
So disappointed! I live near by so I come here often. But on my last visit I swung in to grab a quick vegetarian tostada. I have no problem paying extra for the "super veggie" even though I don't eat cheese or sour cream. As a substitute i asked for additional guac. Seems fair right?? 
Well no, the lady was very RUDE and insisted i pay extra for the additional table spoon of guac she gave me. Fortunately, the cashier understood the situation and removed the "extra" charge. Still I cant bring myself to come back here. I walked by the other day on my way to bart, I was starved but decided to hold off until I made it downtown to get Chipotle.
author: V I P.

description:
We came here on  Sunday evening after exiting the Glen Park BART station with major burrito cravings. There was a line, which gave us time to peruse the rather large menu. We are vegetarian and ended up ordering the super burrito with tofu, the chile relleno burrito, and a mushroom quesadilla.

Overall, we thought the tofu burrito was good, and liked the rice in the burrito, but prefer the tofu offering at Papalote (which is grilled and has a better texture and flavor). The chile relleno had some phenomenal cheesy bites with a mild chile flavor, but it was rather uneven through the burrito. The mushroom quesadilla was appropriately cheesy, but dripped with oil and mushroom juice, as they fry the mushrooms right then and there (and not for enough time to allow the mushrooms to lose all their liquid). One of us loved the thin crispy tortilla chips they gave with the order but both of us agree that the salsa offerings were not particularly exciting.

Would we be back? Maybe, if similar cravings were to strike again while in the neighborhood. But, Papalote remains our favorite burrito place in the city.
author: T K.

description: I would rate them higher but they are on the stupid taco bandwagon. Serving tacos so large you have to eat them with a fork. Whats the point? They don't even provide taco paper. Have these people ver been to Mexico? So annoying.
author: H K.

description: Wow, I just ordered a fish burrito at La Corneta. They told me ten minutes. I got there in ten minutes and there was no salmon on the grill and only a few people in restaurant The woman at the counter said, "It will be a few minutes". So, I took a stroll back along the line to see if they were just putting the salmon on at that moment. Then a woman behind the counter, right in front of me, pulls out a to go container with an old fish taco in it (obviously a mistake from earlier in the day. It was 5pm and no telling when that mistake taco was made). Then she dumps that cold piece of taco fish along with the beans into my empty burrito tortilla shell. No heating it up, no adding anything. Totally lame. I won't be going back.
author: K R.

description:
Hands down the best tacos I've had in San Francisco. The super prawn tacos are TO. DIE. FOR - giant fresh prawns covered with generous portions of guacamole and cheese. I can't recommend these enough. Notice something about all the less than 5 star ratings on yelp? They all didn't have the super prawn tacos! I've never had an issue with a line but these babies are definitely worth waiting for.

Note: Cash only but there is a bank of america ATM right next door so that's usually not an issue.
author: Cameron C.

description:
Best Taqueria in the City. ( A family favorite as well) There is always a line when I go, so I'd assume that there are many individuals in the area that feel the same way. 

There are a lot of meat options, and even the vegetarian burrito sounds good. My go to is the Super Baby Burrito w/ everything as I get full from just a few bits. The portion sizes are huge here and you won't be disappointed.

Even with the long lines, the service is always prompt and cordial. La Corneta Tacaueria comes highly recommended!!

Side note: $ cash only
author: Tammia H.

description: A solid 4 stars! I got the super burrito ($9), which comes with meat, beans, guac, sour cream and salsa. Definitely a couple steps above the Chipotle quality that I'm used to and had a certain authenticity. Worth checking out!
author: Tashnuva E.

description:
La Corneta is a great Mexican restaurant that services the local neighborhoods of Glen Park, Diamond Heights and Sunnyside, which having lived in the area for years since the 1970's, has never seen such an excellent place to eat Mexican food as this.

The burritos are of good quality and quantity, and for $7 you have a single good meal for one or a nice snack meal to split for 2, for a regular meat burrito.

I compare this to Pancho Villa Taqueria on 16th Street (Mission District), but the location is better and if it's more convenient for folks to go to, if given the choice between the two, I'd say they're identical in almost every single aspect of food taste, pricing, selection and quality.  I'd almost speculate they're the same restaurant or owned by the same owner.

The parking in the area is not impossible, given it's located near the Glen Park Bart Station and is a somewhat emerging neighborhood area with lots of reasons to be there to support and shop locally.  If you're willing to search and walk, parking is available, especially limited parking by meters or 2 hr zones.
author: Rick S.

description: One of my favorite taquerias I work by glean park so I eat there once a week. Love the taste but some times they don't put enough meat.
author: Gabriela C.

description:
I have this ongoing love / hate relationship with La Corneta
that sways wildly 
depending on a number of things different factors
which, I will admit,
can be somewhat unreasonable at times.

My last review
bordered closer to the hate side of things
but may have also been a wee bit
crazy irrational.

I could have been suffering from a combination of
price anchoring and 
embodying the spirit of a grumpy old man at the time,
so you'll have to forgive me.

My recent visits,
and discovery of possibly the best rice and bean burrito in town
(check out my tips if interested on how I order it),
have swayed me back again
to the love side of spectrum.

The freshness and quality of their food
and the quick friendly service
makes me wonder how I could ever be
mad at these folks.

Then again,
I could get grumpy
and to paraphrase the Hulk:
you wouldn't like me when I grumpy.
author: Dan B.

description:
It's hard to understand why so many reviews praise what is a very typical taqueria. Perhaps it's a local favorite because there aren't many other taquerias in Glen Park. 

If you are visiting from out of town, you'll have a better experience in Mission at El Metate, Cancun, Farolito, or Papalote.

Like others, I experienced a long line, average ingredients, impatient servers slapping the wrong things on my burrito, and a cash-only kiss goodbye. 

I can smile and say, "No rice, please." I can smile again and say a little louder over the blaring music, "No arroz, por favor." I guess I'm having the rice, thanks.
author: Jeff V.

description:
*CASH ONLY* (There is a BofA ATM down a couple buildings)

Consistent and delicious! 

I stumbled upon this place back when I was still in high school and took public transportation. Even after all these years, this taqueria still makes good food. 

They have a lot of items and options. I like their super baby burrito because it has everything and it's not too filling that I'll get food coma and KO at work. Their super nachos are delicious and such a huge portion too! They also offer churros but I haven't had any yet. NEXT TIME FOR SURE! The one thing that is different about this place is that their rice includes little bits of carrots and peas.

Also, this is one the cleaner taquerias I've been to. Doesn't feel greasy and sticky.
author: Rebecca T.

description: This restaurant has a great atmosphere and space. Their vanilla custard churros are unique in this neighborhood. Also their portions are generous.
author: Yuri M.

description:
Truly a $ sign place. Food was so incredible. We had leftovers galore. Thought that 6 tacos and guacamole might not be enough for the two of us since we were so hungry... But we didn't realize that the portion sizes are larger than average.
Only caveat is cash only. Luckily we had just about enough.... 
Also it was really fresh.. It kept till the next day.. Which is when we inhaled the rest of it
author: Louisa D.

description: Good place.  Disappointed that they will gladly take a credit card for catering, but not for regular orders.  Makes me wonder what exactly are they hiding.
author: LM F.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting from Chicago and were heading back from the coast up to Muir Woods and were super hungry so I googled taquerias and this place popped up. We chose this restaurant based on the reviews and definitely weren't disappointed. Got the super burrito with steak and was very impressed. Probably the best burrito I have ever had. The salsa was very tasty although I could tell they either didn't roast the tomatillos or used under ripe ones. The reason I am giving four stars is because the tostadas they serve as an appetizer were stale. Otherwise, I definitely would return if ever in the area again.
author: Patty G.

description: This place is awesome...the shrimp and steak burrito is amazing...it's a little pricy but we'll worth your hard earned scratch...it gets very busy but the staff does a great job at keeping the line moving while maintaining great quality and flavor.
author: Daniel G.

description: I love everything on their menu. Always fast, always fresh, always delicious. Every time I travel here, I have to grab some grub. ^_^
author: Brianne K.

description: It's really hard for me to pay for Mexican food anywhere outside my house. I know most everyone that  is Mexican say's their mother and grandmother are amazing cooks! And I don't doubt it! However, my Mother is just something else so it really makes it hard on me to like any other place when I can just have my mom make it! Overall, this place is really good, nice and fresh. The smell of the food being cooked is delightful! Great first time experience!!!
author: Cesar S.

description:
I'm a big fan of todos of the La Cornetas--the one in the Mission, the one in Burlingame and now, the one in Glen Park.  

This past Saturday, I was driving home from Twin Peaks around 2:00 p.m. when I had sudden and uncontrollable need for a burrito--I could not continue the day without one.  I knew La Corneta was on the way to the 280, so I decided to stop and indulge my whim.

Let's talk about parking in Glen Park.  First of all, sweet Jesus.  Second of all, even on the weekend, the BART parking lot is CHOCK FULL.  I circled the block so many times I ended up with a mild case of vertigo.  Finally, I was able to secure parking by noticing a parking space whose parking meter was partially blocked by shrubbery on Bosworth.  I paid something like $2.00 in quarters for a half an hour, which I (mistakenly) figured would be sufficient.  

I walked up the hill a block and entered LC.  I was surprised to find an incredibly long line winding all the way around the back of the restaurant.  Normally, in this situation, I would just peace out and call it a day--I'm not the biggest fan of waiting--but I had just went through a great deal of trouble to procure parking, so I was committed.  When it was finally my turn, which was definitely 15+ minutes post-entry, I asked for a Super Shrimp Burrito, no beans, no lettuce, with guacamole on the side.  So, I know this is not the best order--but the heart wants what the heart wants.  I don't like lettuce in the middle of hot food, and sometimes beans make a burrito too heavy, or I'm simply just not in the mood.  I asked for guacamole on the side because I typically cannot eat a whole burrito in one sitting, and I don't like reheating a burrito with guacamole inside of it.  It turns brown and gross.  

When I went to pay for my burrito, I liked that the cashier called me mejita, because I was in the mood to be called mejita.  I became very confused about my salsa options, and please correct me if I'm mistaken, but there is no DIY salsa bar at this location.  Finally, I just started asking for ones that I thought looked good.  The cashier obliged.  

When I left and returned to my car, the 30 minute time limit had long expired.  I didn't get a ticket, but this should illustrate that the process of getting a burrito at LC in Glen Park was a lengthy one.
