I won't bore you with the details of how I proceeded to get on the wrong freeway right afterwards, which also took about a frakking month to rectify, but I forgot that I wasn't going to work--force of habit.  

I was sad that when I got home the guacamole was missing.  I was looking forward to dipping the chips in it.  That's okay though, because I don't really *need the chips.  The burrito was pretty tasty, although the distribution of the burrito ingredients could use some work--I didn't like that the lion's share of the sour cream was at the bottom of the burrito.  The salsa was delicious, and the generous amount of shrimp in the burrito were cooked nicely--flavorful and juicy.  

Like I said, I love LC.  The food is solid, the service is friendly and the portions are huge.  Just look out for the parking, mejita.
author: Sunny S.

description: Would've given a three star for serving average burrito, but this location takes only cash, so a downgrade to a two star. Their Burlingame location takes cards, makes no sense.
author: R R.

description:
Food is OK, but overall fairly bland. I don't really understand the great reviews, it's very average compared to the other Mexican food available in SF. Will you be disappointed? Probably not. Will you love it? Probably not.

Spicy salsa wasn't really spicy. Shrimp in my burrito was cooked to order, but I don't think it was seasoned at all. Sure didn't taste like it. Guacamole was runny and bland.

Big time "meh".
author: Steve P.

description: This place is great. I do love how fresh their tortillas are and their meat is the best. Their tacos are huge, which large portions of meat and salsa. There is typically a line and the people working there don't get your order right all the time. I wish that they'd give you more chips and salsa, but I'll take what I can get since you have to pay for it at other places.
author: Drew R.

description:
I was staying at an airbnb a few blocks away and my host suggested this place for a late dinner. I arrived at nearly 8pm and the line was wrapped around to the back of the restaurant-- daunting to a hungry traveler, but a good sign that it's so popular, right? YES. The line moved quickly, and I had just enough time to think over the many, many menu options.

My host advised me to stick with a "baby" (smaller, but by no means SMALL) burrito, which was right on. I got the super baby prawn burrito, and it was the perfect size AND the prawns were freshly cooked and tender. Cheap, quick, and good people-watching. I hope to visit again.
author: Marissa F.

description:
Random taqueria in Glen Park with a gigantic menu. They have all your typical taqueria stuff, complimentary chips and salsa, and a weird combination menu. I ordered the "super shrimp" burrito, super has lettuce, beans, rice, sour cream, and guac. It didn't taste that great, and they put in wayyyyy too much filling and not enough shrimp/meat. 

They are cash only and if you want to go in the bathroom put on your hockey gear cause its a mess in there!
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
Look, nothing is ever gonna get you to tell me that El Farlito isn't the best taqueria in The City.  HOWEVER, let me state that the Glen Park La Corneta comes a very close second. Verrrrry close.  Line can be super long during busy hours, but that just goes to show you how great their burritos are.  I'm a Super Burrito guy, occasionally mixing it up by getting a tostada instead.  Portions are a god size and the food is super tasty.  

Pro-Tip:  you can call ahead and get stuff to pick up if you don't feel like waiting in a long line.
author: Randy R.

description:
I love the food here (mostly burritos but I like their ceviche tostada and horchata too)! I would say it's comparable to El Farolitos burritos in size and flavor and all-around goodness.

A super baby is good enough to fill me. I once accidentally ordered a super vegetarian burrito and was in a situation where I had to finish it by myself. Muy no bueno. I could barely move because I was so full for the next 5 hours!

Tips: 
- The prawn baby burrito is the bomb!
- They grill their delicious meat fresh all day
- They look clean!
- Lines move pretty fast although they get busy at rush hours
- Cash only like most places in SF but ATM's all around
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Reservations and Reservations

I had my doubts about La Corneta especially since I'm not a huge fan of the restaurant that shares its name in the Mission. I'm from LA, which means I grew up eating, nay, inhaling tacos. Yes, that's right, tacos breathed me into life. Tacos in LA, anywhere in LA, are made the exact same way. You have two corn tortillas with meat, topped with cilantro and onion; lime and salsa on the side from the salsa bar. 

So naturally when I was asked to customize my tacos I was shaking my head in worry. I asked for the beans on the side and refused to put any cheese. C'mon, beans and cheese are for burritos, not tacos. I ordered one shrimp taco and one al pastor taco. The shrimp was amazing! Plump and juicy, the shrimp was cooked to perfection. I did not care for the al pastor. It was too sweet and made my taco soggy. 

On my previous trips I've had the salmon salad and the beef taco. Both very delicious! I highly recommend both the salmon/shrimp salad and the shrimp taco or burrito. 

Good price and good food will have me coming back for more.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Bland and consistently lacking basic customer service.  It's the only Taqueria in GP so it does well but, If one had time there are better options on Mission.  They seem to prioritize phone orders vs. people waiting in line for 15 min. 

a new Taqueria in this neighborhood, with better customer service and accepted credit cards would make $$.
author: Elaine B.

description:
Best Mexican restaurant in SF. I eat here multiple times per week!! Very friendly service, reasonable prices and amazing food. I love that they have a bunch of salsas too. I almost always get the super baby vegetarian burrito--their baby burritos are huge, I can barely finish one and I'm a big eater.

They are cash only, but there is a BofA atm two doors down. Don't be scared of the long line at lunch, it moves quickly!!
author: Natalia K.

description:
solid, yummy mexican food. no frills, just get in line, order, and pay. won't cost you a thousand dollars like everything else in SF.

only downpart is that 1 of the 2 times I was there a homeless man came in and squirted some salsa on his foot and then he hid in the restroom... But that has nothing to do with the taqueria itself.
author: Angela E.

description:
Became nothing special and burritos now have weird veggies in them like it's a fajita or something.
Used to be really good and consistent.
author: Artur T.

description:
Note: Sorry for the long review again. I ended up rambling about my disappointment for a place which I was very excited to try. 

I love Mexican food, so it really pains me when I have to give this place a bad review. La Corneta Taqueria came highly rated by one of my most picky friends. I will continue to use five categories to review this restaurant. Location, Service, Presentation, Taste, Price and then give my final verdict. 

Location: This restaurant is located in Glen Park right by the Bart station. A few friends and I went to La Corneta Taqueria on a Saturday for lunch. The area seemed very vibrant. There were a lot of people walking around, which should be the case for a Saturday. Parking was easily assessable and though the taqueria is cash only, there is a Bank of America right next to it. Overall, no complaints on the location. If you don't like driving up to the city, you can catch Bart and walk a block and a half. 

Service: As soon as we walked into the tacqueria, you could see a cook grilling meat and it smelled delicious. I was very excited for the food as soon as we walked in. The ladies making the food as you ordered seemed nice too, but I would have preferred if they gave me an extra few seconds to take a look at that extensive menu. The menu board had lots of choices and for someone who loves Mexican food... I wanted it all. This is a sit down place where someone comes by to clean up the tables. My one complaint is that the bus boy who was cleaning the tables did not wait for us to completely finish our food. The place was not even busy with people who were sitting down. He should not have rushed us like that. He also touched my drink, which I had only drank half way. I do not think that was polite.  

Presentation: I ordered an al pastor burrito and the choice came back to haunt me. A back story to this, I originally ordered a carne asada burrito, but my friend got the carne asada nachos and asked me to share, so I figured I could try my two favorite two kinds of Mexican cuisine meats by getting the pastor, but... after I ordered my burrito, my friend changed the nachos to carnitas nachos, which was also a bad idea. The burrito was made well by the woman. She loaded the burrito with pastor, rice, black beans, guacamole, sour cream, lettuce, and pico de gallo. The burrito was wrapped in two layers of tin foil and nothing spilled out as I ate it. Overall, well made burrito. No complaints on the preparation. 

Taste: Here is where most of the stars are taken away from the tacqueria. I was very disappointed in the taste of the food. The pastor had no taste to it. It seemed like carnitas which were chopped. I had to drench my burrito in their delicious green (tomatillo) salsa, which I must say was probably the best tasting thing I had there. I did not enjoy my burrito at all and finished it because I was very hungry and it was the first meal of the day for me. I don't even have many more words for the taste of the food other than it was bad. I really wish I had ordered the carne asada to judge because it seemed good when we walked in. If you take anything from this review, just don't make the mistake of ordering the pastor or carnitas. Get the carne asada. Overall, not very tasty burrito. Meat was not flavorful. I was disappointed and now I feel sad because I had to think about the burrito. 

Price: Pastor Super burrito was about nine dollars. In total, we ordered a carne asada super burrito (which I should have asked to take a bite of), a pastor super burrito, carnitas super nachos, and two large horchatas (which was just decent, nothing special). The total was $31.49, which is not bad for three people. 

Final verdict: With so much anticipation and hope for this place which was described as amazing, I left very disappointed. I was full, but the food I ate did not satisfy my craving and love for Mexican food. I am sad to say that I will not be going back, even to try their carne asada. This is because there are an abundance of tacquerias which serve amazing Mexican food and the food at this tacqueria did not taste great. Why go out of the way to Glen Park for Mexican food?
author: Victor T.

description: Cash only delicious mexican food. The burritos are big enough to make even the hungriest cop unbutton his pants. The super baby burrito is the best buy and satisfies without requiring elastic pants.
author: Ameer B.

description:
Dear Tech Hipsters that are new to Glen Park and the city in general: 

Ask where the end of the line is - don't cut in line. Also, don't order before me if I am in line in front of you and haven't been helped. Also, don't tell me I should speak up. Also, go back to Iowa.

There is a long line that moves fairly quickly. They have super fresh salsa. The carne asada was only so-so and i wouldn't order it again. The tacos are massive. I asked three times for one bean and rice taco and one carnitas taco and they still got my order wrong. The chips are super thin and crispy. 

YAY:
Carnitas tacos were on point.

NAY:
CASH ONLY.
Carne asada.

PRO TIP: You can get a chili relleno put inside your burrito!!! It's off menu. Shhhh!
author: Tara H.

description:
We picked up dinner on a Friday evening.
I had the chile relleno plate with came with rice and beans and a small salad.  It was pretty good although my relleno was soggy by the time we got home.
My partner again got the shrimp tosada which he loves and he ate everything.
Our friend got the beef tacos with rice and beans but ate only the tacos.  So I had enough for a light lunch.
I continue to be surprised at this wonderful Mexican restaurant.
author: Philip C.

description: The burrito here is solid.  It is on point with other places that I have been to in Nor Cal, meaning it contains rice and beans.  I grew up and lived in So Cal for a majority of my life, LA and SD, where rice and beans were not typical burrito affair.  But since moving up to the bay I have gotten used to it.
author: Richard L.

description: My wife and I stopped in here for lunch the other day. It was pretty good! While we haven't partaken of much of San Francisco's famed burrito culture, we've had a couple here and there, and these stacked up well. I got carnitas - pretty good, the meat was strong but was well-balanced with the other ingredients. My wife got chicken mole, an old favorite of hers, one that we haven't seen a great deal out here. Everything was tasty and while the price was a little higher than some of the other places we've been, it wasn't prohibitive.
author: Dan K.

description:
I've been eating here for about 15 years, and back then I would've given them a 4. Not the best burrito, but solid. But about 5 years ago something happened that made me not eat there again.

It was close to closing, and mine was one of the last quesadillas on the griddle. A guy started cleaning up before my food was cooked, which meant wiping down the interior of the hood with a wet cloth, hopefully not with chemicals on it. This is a HUGE health code violation. Even if it had been just water, he wiped down the inside of the hood and made it so wet that a large ball of brown greasiness formed and *dripped right into my quesadilla* on top of the cheese. I was appalled, and the chef completely missed it, so I turned around and left disgusted. What else goes on there if that hideousness is in plain view?

Skip forward 5 years to just now, when I decided to grab a burrito there. The guy in front of me ordered 5 burritos, and a different girl came to service me. He got his 5 burritos before I got my one. In fact I didn't get my one, because *the same girl* who took my order looked blank when I asked her where my burrito was, and she said, "Did you already order one?"

"Yeah, from YOU!" the guy next to me said, and thank you sir for stepping in and saving me from terminal dumbfoundedness.

Add this to the overall stinginess of the dole -- I often get prawn burritos and they count each one, and there's always too few -- these are prawns people, not gold doubloons -- and the tightwad salsa -- it's all over the tables for free, as much as you want, but if you want a bit more than the tiny Solo cups they give you to go the cashier looks at you like she's some kind of Leprechaun and you're trying to steal her Lucky Charms.

So I left, again, and this time I won't ever bother going back.
author: Rob C.

description: This is the best burrito joint in all of san francisco. Get the prawn super burrito with steak. It is a game changer.
author: Jeff L.

description: The food here was decent, though less seasoned than I normally like out of my Mexican food. The carne asada and shrimp in my dinner combo had a good char flavor. Nachos were a hodgepodge of meat and toppings. I couldn't really taste the al pastor. Even though the line was ridiculously long, they were able to churn through everyone's orders quickly.
author: Huey N.

description: I dont really make reviews but somewhat may help others. Come here if u want to get a saggy salsa burrito.  I highly recommend u try El farrolito in the mission by 24th & mission. Better service and real authetic mexican food.
author: Dune C.

description:
This once was a really really small hole in the wall years ago. Once they expanded. Popularity followed, the lines and prices got longer and higher. Service went down and eventually you have the remains of that once good local spot.

I still try and give this place a shot every so often.

CASH ONLY which in my opinion is ludicrous for a place like that to ask.

Multiple times they skip and flat out ignore the line order. I had my friend get skipped three times before we barked why are we getting skipped?

Couple times the quality of burrito left an unsatisfied feeling. Just like you get when you arrive to a concert only to find out the artist you came for is being replaced last minute. 

Consistency is all over the place. 

Salsa is still pretty solid though.
author: Nathan A.

description: The most consistently excellent San Francisco style burrito restaurant in the city.  Lots of toppings, reasonably priced, and superior service.  Not too greasy.  Simply the best.
author: Lancelot C.

description: Great burrito/taco takeout servicing the neighborhood though they take only cash. Food is fresh and tasty and of course cooked in front of you. Parking can be a challenge in the heart of GlenPark/Sunnyside.  My only pet peeve is when you're left waiting while they're busy handling large phone orders.
author: Smjoe F.

description: Went here during the December holidays when our other picks were closed for the holiday break. What a great find though! The menu offers a ton of choices and everything was very tasty. I got the combo plate with grilled veggies, rice and beans. Whatever they do to grill those veggies - they were delicious.
author: Anne T.

description:
This joint is well known in the city of San Francisco.

I only have good things to say about this place.

I highly recommend the super carne asada & shrimp burrito.

The burrito was very juicy and tasty - every bite felt like heaven (not cliche at all).

Quick service and I left very full and happy - what more can I ask for?
author: Sam K.

description: Really solid.  Like lots of taquerias, they have a big menu and everything is pretty good.  But the special item here is the shrimp!  Get a shrimp super burrito spicy (it's not crazy hot) with everything (including the sour cream - it's a winning combo.  Oh, and sugary drinks from Mexico.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Long wait, messed up order, food is below average.  We were having a get together so we used online ordering to get 6 burritos, a quesadilla, and a tostada, guac, and drinks.  They only got 1 of the items correct.  When I went to pick up the order, it was flat out missing 2 burritos.   They also gave us a 1/2 pint instead of a full pint, and was missing a drink.  So I waited for them to be made and swap the guac, etc. The line was long (at least 15 people at 7pm) so I chalked it up to them being busy.  When we started eating we realized the remaining burritos they all had basic issues e.g. the wrong meat, didn't get a "super" version even though it was paid for, etc. There isn't really a way to check the correctness of a burrito without opening it up so I didn't know until we started eating.  So even though I added a hefty tip on the online order, they still messed everything up.  They'll probably do better with smaller orders but chances are if you customize things they'll still get it wrong.

Ironically even though they do online ordering that's the only part that's high tech.  What they do it look up your order on an ipad Mini then write it on a napkin (literally a napkin) then make your order off that.  Since we had a big order I assumed they didn't bother writing down the details e.g. type of meat, etc.  They didn't even bother checking off what they did which is probably why they flat out missed 2 burritos and a drink.  Oh, and although you can use credit cards when buying online it's cash only at the store.

As for the taste it was very bland.  Perhaps it was because I was expecting al pastor and only got carnitas.  It was also very mushy.  So even if everything else went perfectly above the food was still not good.  With all the other burrito options in the area, the only reason to go here is if you are in the area, must have a burrito, and aren't willing go to one of the far superior burrito places that are nearby.
author: John K.

description: Glen Park is not exactly a mecca for Mexican food but La Corneta holds up well in comparison with the best Mission tacquerias. We got carnitas tacos loaded with glistening slow cooked pork (their carnitas makes bacon look like lean food) and I had a chile relleno burito that just barely fit into its foil sleeve. A great post hike lunch spot after a jaunt through Glen Canyon park!
author: Chris K.

description:
Absolutely wonderful food and service. Love the prawn dishes and burritos the most. Generous helpings of everything so try the baby burrito or ask for smaller portions if you're not a big eater. Friendly ladies. It can be busy at times, but I don't mind the wait at all. It can be hectic at times, but you're in for a treat. 

Oh, cash only. No cards accepted.

Buen provecho.
author: S. A.

description:
Home of the super rice burrito.

Al pastor is chewy and tough, and not flavorful as it is supposed to be.

The super burrito, according to the menu, doesn't have rice. Had I known that it would in fact be 75% rice, I'd have asked for no rice.

What should I expect from Dear Leader Ed Lee's favorite taqueria, after all. Dude is bland as heck.

Should have gone to the Excelsior.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
My absolute favorite taqueria period.

My personal favorite is the spicy prawn burrito.  The baby size is big enough for nearly anyone.
author: William N.

description: Forget Mission. This is the best Mexican food I have ever had. Their special Garlic Shrimps, Grilled Fish is delicious. Imagine yourself sipping a glass of margarita thinking your in Cancun, no your in San Francisco. Fresh food
author: Taryn M.

description:
Te amo, La Corneta.  

Back in 1995 when La Corneta opened their doors I was still living down the street.  I never forget how friendly the owner was.  He would even pass me a free beer with my burrito. 

How cool is that? I'll tell you right now.  Give me a free drink and serve good food and you are going to have a customer for life.  I always appreciate kindness shown to me.

Along with the kindness, La Corneta has stayed consistent.  The salsa at the tables is great.  Chunky salsa that comes with the chips is refreshing.  The food is always fresh and like Anchorman Ron Burgundy said: "This burrito is delicious but filling."  It's not to be compared with other Taquerias.  Who has the best burrito is a useless debate, like asking who has the best burger.  How about they are both good, just different.

The one and only spot for Mexican food in Glen Park.
I love La Corneta. Good people. Good Food. Life is Good.

As Rihanna sang:

 "te amo La Corneta, wish somebody'd tell me.

Don't it mean "I love you"?
Think it means "I love you"
Don't it mean "I love you"?

Y, Gracias por mi cerveza..
author: Michael L.

description:
Mmmm Tacos in a flash. 

My dad and the owner used to do business together so I have been going to this place for a very long time. The ladies are always fast and the food is always good. I am gluten intolerant so the only thing I can really eat here are tacos but the good thing is I LOVE TACOS. They make some of the best tacos in town and the best part is I only live a mile away. A lot of places are really chintzy when it comes to their toppings but this place is the exact opposite of that. All I can say is I always leave happy and satisfied.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
This place gets a solid 4 stars.  We stopped because we were starving and had gone to Glen Park to try Gialitas Pizza for lunch.  It was closed until 5 and we saw the line out the door at La Corneta...figured it must be good.  It was!

We all ordered the burritos and they were huge and delicious.  The lengua (tongue) was very moist and tender, as was the the carnitas the carne asada.  Chips came with the burritos, they were just ok.  I love chips and I didn't finish them.  Prices were very reasonable (between $5-8).  

This place isn't very big, Crowded seating, takes debit & credit. Would def go back.
author: Deb P.

description: I still remember when this place first opened and I was excited because I didn't have to travel all the way into the Mission for great tasting Mexican food. I eat here a few times a year, usually when I'm in the Glen Park neighborhood. They are located in a great neighborhood. The meats are juicy and well seasoned. I always have the super carnitas quesadilla, and  I always forget that this restaurant puts a lot of lettuce in the dishes. I am not fond of that. Salsa I love, just no lettuce for me please. I find that it deadens the rich flavor of the meats. Until the day I can remember to tell them to not put lettuce in my order, I will have to give them a rating of 4 and not the 5 that it could be.
author: Dirty S.

description:
Been coming here for years and there's always a line, most take it to go so there' are still plenty of seats. Large portion, great deal and lots of options. Great burritos and tacos, my favorite is their ceviche for $3. 

Not much service, but get your food, in and out, just the way affordable restaurants are supposed to be. The fast food chain burrito "Chipxxxx" should learn how to work as fast as they do.
author: Pauline H.

description: Bought a bomb ass chicken burrito, it was so good. The line went all the way to the back of the restaurant but it was worth it. Also got horchata and also bomb. Overall such a great place to eat. For a chicken burrito and horchata it came out to be a little under $12 but we also got free chips and salsa so it was by far worth it!
author: Ashmi S.

description: Never thought I'd like a shrimp burrito. Until now! Delicious and convenient.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
We came here on a Saturday night for dinner.  I don't think the line ever got shorter than 15 or so people, and there aren't a ton of tables, so many wisely get carry-out.  Like Alice R said, the workers were rushed and hasty.  Not complaining about their hustle, but it does add a bit of stress. 

We shared the Spicy Prawns plate, which included black beans and salad, and chicken nachos, which I got with everything (including lettuce, which I thought was kind of unusual).   The prawns were small, but very tasty.  They were also very saucy and still in their shell, which made them a big mess to eat.   The nachos were fine.   

I have no doubt there are some great item on the menu here, but for us it was only okay.  

If I lived in the neighborhood and could figure out a time when it wasn't packed, I'm sure I'd be back.
author: Tom J.

description:
La Corneta Taqueria is one of the best restaurants for Mexican food here in San Francisco. I came in here today and ordered the Quesadilla Suiza with beef and cheese (no salsa) and a bottle of Jarritos Strawberry Soda plus tortilla chips. The quesadilla suiza was absolutely delicious and I enjoyed it. Overall, I enjoyed my experiences here so I'll definitely come in here again for some Mexican Food if I happen to be in the Glen Park area.

Parking:
Street parking only

Be prepared to have spare coins on you as some of the spots maybe equipped with a parking meter.

Public Transit Options:
-23 Monterey
-36 Teresita
-44 O'Shaughnessy
-52 Excelsior
-Glen Park BART Station
author: Bennett W.

description: This might be closer to a 3.5 star rating. While the prices are relatively high for tacos, they are mostly made up for by the portions. The food is done assembly line style and can therefore move a bit slowly. I thought the cochinita pibil was just average, but the carne asada had nice flavor and deserves your attention. The salsa was pretty bland too and the tacos fell apart. This would be convenient if I lived in the area, but it's pretty generic Mexican food and is not really worth going out of your way for.
author: Teddy E.

description: I really like the Yelp eats really convenient. Ordered the super burrito and super prawn with meat burrito. They were both good! One of the best burritos I ate. Only thing that was weird that there were peas in something i think the guac but other than it was delicious. My bf loved that super pawn and meat burrito.
author: Ruby T.

description:
Just landed back stateside and what else would I have for my first meal than Mexican? How about authentic Mexican on the Cheap?! Yes please... I mean seriously, 4 people for 40$?! What more can you ask for...dare I say, Chipotle will still cost you roughly the same at 10$ a person for a main, chips and a small drink.  Yes, yes, this is your standard hole in the wall, cash only operation, but don't you know that's where you find some of the best eats? 

 At La C I stuffed myself with 2 huge fish tacos overflowing with fillet sized salmon, cabbage, lettuce, pico de gallo, rice and beans, plus a cheesy chicken tamale so ooey gooey with goodness while Mom had a crispy tostada salad, Dad, a lingua (cow tongue) burrito, and my sister a taco plate with rice and beans. Oh you're saying, that's it?! Of course not, what like of Mexican fiesta would this be without chips and salsa and delicious custard filled churros?

These piping fresh churros are some of the best I've had, the custard filling really brings it to a whole new level. This was the perfect welcome home to America meal. My stomach and taste buds thank you. 

Dear Sydney, AU, 
I love you and when I return I promise to visit, but when it comes to Mexican, G y G just doesn't compete.

My apologies,
Audrey
author: Audrey L.

description:
The carnitas baby super burrito was exactly what I needed in life. Great portion for a solid price - $6.74 after tax. 

La Corneta, you are now my go-to taquería when I don't feel like traversing to the Mish.
author: Eduardo R.

description: I ordered a spinach super baby burrito. Service is really fast. The super baby burrito I ordered had steak, black beans, lettuce, sour cream, guacamole, shredded cheese, and mild salsa. I didn't order rice inside my burrito therefore it was a bit watery. Overall, the super baby burrito tasted really good.
author: J T.

description:
Pros: Prices, Amazing Selection, Nice Workers

I thought the food was good but I wish I would have tried something other than a salad. Tons of selection I was really impressed with all of the options. Too bad I was so overwhelmed I got a salad :(
author: Travis C.

description:
I grew up on these burritos. My dad used to work in this area, and this was the only burrito place I knew. Over the years I've been to many many different burrito joints, but none have ever hit the spot. 

After years of not coming here I walked in again and everything is as I remember even the burritos. Let me tell you, you have not had an awesome burrito until you've come here. The burritos have just the right amount of everything, and have a fresh taste. The meat is really well made too not dry or too oily. Everything is perfect.
author: Kaitlin V.

description:
What a clean Mexican restaurant! I was a little skeptical of the authenticity of this place when I stopped by for a late dinner, but after the meal... Mmm.

A great addition to the Glen Park area, and a pretty affordable meal for this kind of convenience. The regular burritos aren't necessarily cheap, but the Super Baby Burrito ($5.50) with a free side of chips was actually really filling. They're a little skimpy on meat and guacamole, but I'm not complaining.  

Service was a little spotty when I was there. The girl who helped my friend looked lost (maybe a new hire?) and the woman that assembled my burrito rolled her eyes before I even ordered. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt...or will just pretend that they don't exist. 

Cash only!
author: Colleen M.

description: Wow! Can't believe my disappointment. It's now officially time to leave the city for good, substantial, economical eats. This place has been turned into your neighborhood chipotle. But before I explain further, please allow me to first reminisce. Back in the day, there was a taqueria on mission st, run by an ambitious young entrepreneur, serving good, tasty, authentic Mexican food, to a mostly local mission district clientele. Understandably, the place  became popular. The keyword was fresh. Authentic, flavorful, but fresh. No lardy type aftertaste. So, she opened another one in the Glen Park area. Now here is where some history comes into the picture. Glen Park at that time, way before the word "hipster" was even invented, much less there being actual hipsters around, was a middle/working class area, so obviously the same formula as the one on mission street, also worked there, and that place also became popular, serving great, authentic, burritos to a mixed hispanic and other clientele. Now here's where it becomes personal, because after eating there countless times, and also bringing food home, (my late mom's fav burritos,  and that senora knew her burritos!,) And years later, picking up food with Winnie for our then yung uns, I eventually ckecked out for a couple of years, (never mind why, long story, worked late nights at the club, schedule changed....) So you can imagine my surprise when I finally dropped in last week after all these years. What changed? Omg, everything. "super burrito's" much thinner, smaller, and more expensive, (probably the result of countless noe valley hippie moms remarking "oh, I can't eat all that! This much food is obscene!") the great flavorful substantial taste of old is virtually non existent now, replaced with a thin watery, no taste, "fresh vegetabley" flavored water. (Don't get me wrong, I love dem veggies, and yes in a burrito, but if the burrito tastes like a salad, I know  immediately that it's a concession to the chipotle crowd, and no longer a "real," traditional burrito, like at Los Metates or Taqueria San Bruno.) Also, I ordered a "chicken"  burrito, but a la chipotle, there was absolutely no chicken in my burrito. Except for three tiny pieces, it was all beans, rice and thin light red water. No guacamole, and barely discernible sour cream.  Was there any cheese in it? I don't know! I never tasted any. But certainly not the melted onto the tortilla kind (step 1) of old. I also requested "salsa picante" and they gave me a salsa that looked like a mini tomato, parsley and bell pepper salad that had absolutely no hotness whatsoever. And finally, the clientele. Gone are the occasional (infrequent even in the past,) Hispanic house painters, UPS drivers and other laborers, replaced by Glen Park hipsters, and "alternative lifestyle" Noe Valley Anglo (and occasional Japanese) ladies with their same type, deferential husbands, and "liberally raised" kids, (you know the types, no meat, vegan, soy protein candy bars, you know, being raised with a life devoid of any guilty, real childhood pleasure, types.) So I felt crappily lonely seeing a childhood memory place disintegrate in front of me. Geesh! Aren't there enough chipotles around here already? (Rhetorical.) I left feeling empty, (and hungry) as the realization suddenly overcame me about how far we are getting from the real authentic, and varied traditional cuisine of Mexico and its wonderful people.
author: George F.

description:
called in to order a regular burrito with hot salsa and when i got there they had a super burrito for me. so i told the lady that i ordered a regular burrito but the lady kept on insisting that i ordered a super because she
wrote it down and showed me the piece of paper..well i know what o ordered and it was not a super burrito. they re did my burrito and asked if i wanted salsa i said yes and she gave me "some chips" when i say "some chips" it was literally 4 or 5 chips! lol oh man..i don't know if she got upset at me because i told her she made a mistake when i placed my order and this is why she gave me only 5 chips so i told her she can keep the chips since it was just 5 chips lol ..i was hungry so i ate the burrito but the salsa was NOT hot the meat had no taste to it the beans were alright. This place charges you and arm and a leg for their food and it's probably because of the location.. ( mostly white people) they don't know any better and have no idea what is real good Mexican food lol and if you go down mission you can still get a GOOD burrito for less then $7.00!
author: Sol H.

description:
I have no idea why i took so long to replace this place. Personally i prefer greasy fried oily goodness over in the mission. 

La corneta is a nice spot in glen park area. Clean, friendly staff. The line is usually 10 minutes long. 

They food reminds of chpotle' fresh, with more traditional flavors and mexican love. 

The carnitas, carne asada, is lovely. Great flavor tortillas, and awesome guac. 

Last night we ordered a combination plate, side of refried beans, and super quesadilla. 

Free chips are very tasty and fresh. The food is great, and they have decent salsas. But i love to use my fresh made home stuff, or la vics orange sauce i stash at home.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Every single person working there glared at me and acted like they didn't want to help me...until I got to the register, at which point three people swarmed up to tell me that it's cash only and where the nearest ATM can be found. 

Also, I said I don't want chips three times, yet I was still given chips. Mostly just confused about the whole experience.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Hearty, serves the taqueria style mexican food you expect. staff is friendly, you can go half half on the meat if you want.

Contrary to all the reviews, however, I would only say this place is average in terms of mexican food.  Especially being so close to the mission, I would take a quick bart ride through the city and get the mexican food there.  I feel like any restaurant there could beat out la corneta is terms of taste.

that being said though, la corneta is  a great place for a quick bite on your way home.

try the super tostada.
author: Patricia K.

description:
This is a delayed review, I think I went here about a year or two ago.  Never came back well you'll see my review why.  

This place is crackin' when we came for dinner.  I don't remember what I got except I know it was a burrito.  it's a clean place, but the meat needed more flavor.  It lacked fat flavor.  It had a lot of options for people who are trying to be healthy but eh not my cup of tea.  Food is more flavorful when there's some fat.
author: Claire J.

description:
I don't get the hype of this place. It's not that tasty.

Pros: Portion size, beer selection, and glen park is always a cute neighborhood to have lunch in.

Cons: Taste of the salsa, meat, and even beans. Menu selection is kind of weird and overwhelming.

I love the mission district for mexican food (la taqueria) and maybe this place is catered to the Glen Park location. I'm a but surprised of the reviews.

I'd honestly prefer Chipotle. 

Overall, was not horrible (thus the 3 stars) and I did finish everything. I just would like a punch of flavor in my mouth when eating Mexican food.
author: Carina M.

description: Four golden stars because this taqueria has churros and alfajores. For the first time in many years I can go to a taqueria and have a full dinner, including desserts.
author: Benito C.

description:
My go to place for fast Mexican food to go. Cash only! If you're hungry and you want an amazing burrito - get the Steak And Prawn Super Burrito. You will not regret it. If you're a vegetarian - you can never go wrong with the vegetarian tostada or veggie nachos. These are the best I've ever had and you can have them out less bean and rice based on your palate - don't be shy to ask them to make it the way you like - just tip them well ;) These ladies are awesome. Oh yes, and you can ask for the spinach Tortilla at no extra cost- are you hungry yet? 

Have a nice meal!! :)
author: Rayne W.

description:
I'm gonna be honest with you, I don't usually eat tacos, burritos, nachos, salsa, etc...it just isn'y my cuisine of choice. BUT...

This joint is the SH*T. Despite the long line and horrible parking options, this is a place worth trying! It was so good that I even regretted I didn't have any left overs to eat it again the next day! 

I ordered the Super baby prawn burrito (w/less beans). MY FREAKIN GOODNESS it was amazing! Ate it so fast I gave myself shock! The burrito was excellently made...plump and juicy prawns, crunch here, softness there, but most importantly, the sour cream was all over! Every bite was with a good amount of sour cream. I hate it when some joints make burritos and you wonder "Where the hell is my guac and sour cream in here? I paid extra for this!" Well, you won't have that problem here! Another thing, their green salsa is BOMB! Add that to your burrito and it's 10x better. 

I AM A FAN!
author: Michelle S.

description:
This used to be my go to burrito spot. Their their prices have definitely increased and I was willing to pay up, but I've noticed they're getting skimpy w the meat! Almost to the point where my burrito lacks in flavor.  
Consistently over 3 different visits, I felt like I had a vegetarian burrito. Totally not worth it anymore. So sad.... I miss u old La Cornetta
author: Jennifer P.

description: I'm from San Diego and I FINALLY found a Mexican food place that I love. I'm typically all about tacos and burritos but prefer getting a plate here (especially one with shrimp). The ingredients are fresh and non-greasy.  The food here is just as good as SD Mexican, just different. Only downside is that it is cash only.
author: Jordan H.

description:
1 Star rating for customer service and operations

5 star rating for food

I understand that things can get hectic when there are a lot of customers but I've been to this place with few customers and their service was still extremely slow and disorganized.

Food is delicious though.
author: Ilija G.

description: This is the best Mexican in SF! I love the Spicy Chicken Burrito. The Flautas are also delicious. I just love Glen Park. I wish that they had a La Corneta in LA! But, it gives me something to look forward on my visits to San Francisco!
author: William H.

description:
Just like Pancho Villa, you will need to come with plenty of patience as the lines are long just to order your meal. On the flip side, they know how to grill their meats and their shrimps as well. I ordered their shrimp tacos- regular added sour cream, which were great. Their salsa was decent, but their guacamole left much to be desired. My husband's veggie burrito wasn't that great either. The beans nor the salsa stood out. Also, we tried one churro and one alfajor. The alfajor was extremely dry and lacking any dulce de leche in the center and the churro was mushy. 

All in all, I would go back for the shrimps and or if my friends/family ordered meat. The aguas frescas were pretty decent too.
author: Carolina S.

description:
The paragon of the SF burrito. The line is long but worth it.

Had the asada, going for the prawn next.
author: Misha T.

description:
If I could give it a negative -0 stars 
I would!!! I was called STUPID BY the Mexican lady who made my order who was one of the the managers that wears a green apron!!! Just bc I'm also Latino does NOT give her the right to insult me in Spanish!! The NERVE of HER!!! I've been a loyal customer for over 20 years in the neighborhood and supported this local business. I use to love this place until I got a nasty burritos and tacos and a even nastier, unbelievable customer service!!! 
I called to give my input on how unpleasant the food tasted, on my
large order of $80 worth of food I bought for my family reunion birthday party. And I called and left a message for the manager to give me a call back and she said that she would replace my entire meals and so I said great I'll be in to pick it up later next week. 
I came in on and the owner was there and she took her word back and refused to honor what the manager said and then, she said that she would only cover 'ONE' burrito which was worth only $10 I did the $80 order. I said that is unbelievable I can't believe you guys took my information and went back on your word so anyways to make a long story short I am I was like that's unprofessional and unethical, but fine I'll just come in for my 'ONE' burrito whatever. As I put in my order one of their employee's (one who was the manager of who cooks the food) told me & insulted me in Spanish for complaining about the food she made and called ME STUPID!!!! I called and left a message with the owner 3x's and NEVER CALLED ME BACK! REALLY? This is how you treat your loyal customers? You take their $$$$ with no problem, but Once there is an 'Issue' with your food and you are asked for a well deserved customer you are selfish, rude and disrespectful. I'm very disappointed in you and your service.
author: Jeannette V.

description:
If you looking for fake Mexican restaurant, you find one.
Never ever have similar experience in San Francisco for simple quesadilla.
Especially if you tried once it in El Farolito taqueria on Mission street.
Surprisingly fast preparation for steak and prawn quesadilla.
30 second: served cold, just mix of sour cream,guacamole, some greens, cold shredded cheese ,cold meet not even looks like steak, some prawns , $11.50 , no condiments no chips.
author: Michael F.

description:
* Clean
* Large portions for a great price
* IMO the BEST burrito in San Francisco - authentic
* Fresh, hot tortilla chips
* GREAT horchata
* Efficient employees that move the line along
* Gotta bring cash, but it's totally worth it

I only wish there was one in the Presidio or Pac Heights!
author: Maria C.

description: I always get the Super Nachos with chicken, extra sour cream and light lettuce! Food is good but the employees need to speak and understand English better!
author: Jane S.

description:
Upon stumbling on this little gem, I was left wondering how on earth I could eat the wonderful food I just had, at a Mexican food place outside of the Mission? I was a little apprehensive as this is the only Mexican restaurant among all these little Shops and restaurants, but that long-ass line convinced me!
The super baby burrito is my go-to, it's pretty consistent-always good and well made. They stuff it so much, they're barely able to wrap it.
I've had enchiladas, tacos, torta, and flautas there-all awesome. Sometimes they have chocoflan for desert-do yourself a favor and buy it.
author: Lupe V.

description: just had a SUPER BABY BURRITO with some steak and prawns! it's good! There was line when I first got in but it went by fast.
author: Jon R.

description:
Packed in.

Small way to live: http://www.sfgate.com/business/article/Micro-apartment-developments-on-rise-in-S-F-4951775.php

Large way to eat: $4.50 baby burritos the size of regular burritos and $7.50 tortas big enough for two lunches. So much packed into each one.

Former had an excellent seasoned grilled chicken in a wheat tortilla, latter a delicious shredded chicken in a slightly spicy red sauce. Cheese and avocado too if you desire.

There are about 15 other meats you can select. Walking in and seeing row upon row of chicken lined up on the grill was the perfect visual and aromatic greeting.

City continues to face a housing crisis. City also continues to face a challengedetermining which burrito is best. La Corneta is the latest contender for the crown.
author: Jason B.

description:
My 2nd favorite burrito in the city. I drop in about once a week or every other week...burrito especial with either carne asada and refried beans or pollo rojo with whole pinto beans. 

Consistent flavor, service, staff. CASH ONLY.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
My absolutely favorite taqueria in San Francisco. This location is super underrated. The grilled chicken is so delicious and their green sauce?! Heaven! If you're looking to get something aside from a taco/burrito, get either the carne asada dinner or ceviche tostada. Oh and OMG get the strawberry jugo next to the horchata. My trip here will almost always include one of those. My mouth is watering as I write this.

As a heads up this place is cash only but there are like three ATMs in the immediate area.
author: Victoria K.

description:
Food = delicious.  I had their carne asada plate, and the melon agua fresca.  
Hot salsa = hot stuff.

Chips = great, and fresh!

Service = friendly, but it's all at the counter!

I'll be back...nomnom.
author: Fannie S.

description: I crave their salmon and shrimp burritos!! Their rice is almost like friend rice it has veggies in it! So good I haven't had one of their burritos for about 3 years and I came back today and the taste, flavor, and quality are all still the same. Just like I had remembered it!! Still the best!
author: Ali L.

description:
I know pickings are slim in Glen Park for Mexican food, but La Corneta had a line snaking around the length of the restaurant. Not sure if the place is just that popular or the entire neighborhood just had a wicked burrito craving, but suddenly it was the hottest joint in town. 

I believe La Corneta gets points solely for the location. Right in the heart of Glen Park just steps off the BART station, I didn't see many other options for Mexican food. It's an above-average indie fresh-Mex place. The burrito was thick, though I've had longer. (That's what she...never mind.) 

Chips were a bit stale and tasted like they were fresh out of the bag. I was a little disappointed not to see a soda fountain or salsa bar anywhere, but I wanted a warm burrito and I got one. If you have the fever when you're stuck in Glen Park (and who hasn't), try out La Corneta. Saturday around dinnertime may not be the best time to go.
author: Kevin B.

description:
This place has a great variety and offers lengua, which is always a plus. So soft and tender!

The tacos are hardly small, little tacos. They're piled high, so you can't even fold them in half! You just eat them like a salad off the tortilla, and then you get to eat the soggy tortilla that has all the remnants. Really good system.

They also serve Orangina and a good selection of bottled beers.
author: Sam D.

description:
Their food is consistently good, but I want to give a shout-out for their catering service, in particular.
At my party today, I had several different guests ask me who catered because they thought the food was delicious. 
In working with their catering service,
I started with email contact about one week prior to my event. The initial response laid out a typical buffet with a variety of easy-to-understand options. 
When I had a final headcount two days before my event, there was no problem with placing the order. They'll take an order over the phone, but since I hadn't used them before and I have limited knowledge of Mexican food, I went in person to place my order. The order taker was very friendly, patient and helpful with bouncing around ideas and customizing my order for me.
The night before my event, the delivery driver for called me to make sure he understood where to deliver since he wasn't familiar with McLaren Park. Then he also called in the morning to confirm delivery time (noon). When he called I asked if he understood where to go and he said "Yes, I drove to the location last night so I know where to meet you."
People--how awesome is that, right?
When the driver delivered my order, he was friendly, patient and helpful. (Notice a pattern here?)
He helped me with arranging the trays and as many people vied for my attention, he graciously and attentively waited so I could answer questions while also trying to receive the food and pay my bill. He helped me identify which trays to keep on ice (guacamole, sour cream, cheese).
He helped things go very smoothly.
I gave the delivery guy a big tip because I felt so grateful. I hope that the tip reflected that message.
The food was delicious and the service was fabulous.
author: Amelia K.

description:
I've been to more than my fair share of taquerias, in and out of SF, and this one really does it for me.

Just last night, I got their beans & rice burrito ($4) on a whole wheat tortilla with both black and pinto beans, avocado (50 cents more, I think), salsa verde (instead of the salsa fresca, of which they have spicy and mild), and their special and spicy pickled red onions. Delicious, super stuffed, and very filling.

We also had their yummy cantaloupe agua fresca, which tasted fruity and fresh, not too watered down like some other places. They also had watermelon and orchata.

I also really likes their chips and salsa. The service is always friendly and efficient.

That's why they typically have a (fast moving) line and why it's my go-to place for burritos.
author: Veg V.

description: Wow the burritos were huge! It's delish! They are not stingy with the ingredients! The line to order is the downfall! They have a system going where you order with the available server then it moves along as the burrito or whatever you order is built, then you pay & leave. Despite their ordering system the food is so good! The people are really nice!
author: Angel G.

description:
Good burrito with nice staff. We don't have a lot of time to cook so we often order from restaurants in our neighborhood. I would eat there more often if my metabolism was better:)
Try the super nachos or the steak and prawn quesadilla. Also the place itself is very clean and the girls working are always very polite.
author: Rositsa K.

description: Besides the long lines and small dinning area , the prawns and steak Super burrito with avocado ( not Guacamole) is in my top ten burritos list of all time.
author: Juan V.

description:
I can't believe I missed out to try this place since I go to glen park bart station literally every weekday. I was brought here by a friend working in real estate a guy who truly knows SF :D 

I got a prawn baby burrito which is enough food for me, loved it. Also got that nachos which is obviously too much and caused me to over eat :D The Mexican tradition drink was delicious as well.
author: Cheng C.

description:
The best Mexican food ever!! The staff is super friendly! 
I love this place, I always feel like at home. My fav is the prawn burrito and the carnitas yummy.
author: Laura C.

description: Solid traditional taqueria in the heart of Glen Park.  Everything is made fresh, with great ingredients, including fire-roasted salsas on every table.  What's really special about La Corneta is their unique selection of proteins, including seafood as well as sauces like mole, chile verde and cochinita pibil.  Fresh prawns, cooked to-order a la plancha, are a particularly pleasing addition to a burrito or quesadilla.  Unfortunately, soupy and bland carnitas is a (correctable) disappointment, but there are plenty of interesting menu options besides it (including lengua!).  Two things to note before heading to La Corneta: 1) as one of few take-out places in Glen Park, lines can be long around dinner time, particularly just after large commuter bus drop offs, and 2) this is a cash-only establishment.
author: Ronald C.

description: I've been coming here for years and it's by far one of the best taquerias in SF. The food is excellent and always tastes fresh. The staff are super friendly and helpful. 5 stars and well deserved !
author: Adriana C.

description: Best prawn burrito hands down with an unlimited bottle of tomatillo  sauce to pour over
author: Gwen K.

description: I'm downgrading my review from 5 to 3 because the flavors have not been as good as I remembered. They use to be one of the best places for carne asada but lately it's been tasting underseasoned. Shrimp has also felt underseasoned and overcooked. Right now my favorite menu item is the ceviche tostada.
author: Elsie M.

description: the food is very taquerish!  not very mexicana but that's what us americans want.   The service is efficient but very unfriendly - even when you make an effort to be friendly they look at you like your an alien.  a smile would not  break your face people!!!
author: Tiffany S.

description: I'm not sure why this place gets such a good review but I've gotten a burrito here once and a quesadilla here once. The meat is not fresh tasting and there isn't much given to you. A lot of times I just feel like they just add a bunch of lettuce to it. The lettuce just tastes off to it.This is probably one of the worst burrito/ quesadilla I have ever had. The nice convenience about this place is that it's close to the Bart. But since it's close to Bart, I'd recommend hopping over to the mission and just getting a burrito there. I'd recommend going to panchos on 16th and mission - that place is great.
author: Derrick C.

description: I got a  steak and prawn burrito. Very blah and bland. Nice customer service and quick with the line. I don't understand why the reviews are so high, very misleading.
author: Neil R.

description: I would normally steer clear of Salmon in Mexican food but, here, it is delicious!  Each taco was loaded up with tasty marinated salmon (or chicken since we ordered that too).  They are quick, affordable, and the food is so dang delicious. I have also had their taco bar catering for a birthday party and LOVED that too.
author: Jessica J.

description: My daughter's grilled chicken burrito contained a woody bit of something or other that she was able to remove from her mouth after chewing on it.  After examing it closely I concluded that it was either a trim from a toenail or fingernail, but I told my daughter that it was a wooden splinter, so she wouldn't be sickened.  My selection was a ceasar salad with chicken.  I bit down on some fatty gristle attached to the chicken and spit it out.  Perhaps it was just a really bad day at La Corneta, but it seems that quality control has slipped.  Most days the  staff seem to be rushing orders along as quickly as possible to keep the long line moving. The pace is frantic.  Things aren't how they used to be.
author: Marvin N.

description: Cash Only! Good thing there's a Wells Fargo atm right in front. Fast lines (they attend multiple people at a time) and friendly staff. Prices are decent.
author: Mauricio B.

description:
Their burritos are great, and can easily compare with the best in the mission. My favorites are the Al Pastor and Pollo Verde regular burritos. Their spicy salsa is nice and tasty as well. Portions are massive, as expected.

Cons: the chips aren't very good, and service is really slow. The line can take 20-30 minutes around lunch and dinner time. Try to arrive a little bit earlier to beat the line.
author: Mason G.

description:
They don't appear to serve breakfast burritos, but neither La Corneta nor I was upset about the massive, al pastor super burrito that I ate at 10 am. 

Believe me, this log of deliciousness will kill your whole day, but you'll love every second of it. Although, I highly recommend sharing with your girlfriend, otherwise she will bitch at you all day long for making her get her own food, when she and three of her friends could've just shared yours and you'd all be satiated.

I love the creamy salsa verde on the tables, as well as all their house salsas (get the grilled one!).

I wish there was some pineapple in the al pastor (is that not standard everywhere?), but the pork was tasty enough. Whenever I'm out in Glen Park, I'd never say no.
author: Peter D.

description:
Yum, Yum, Yum.

I am a loyal fan of the shrimp burrito here. Very kid friendly and great portions.   A neighborhood staple.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Solid Mexican food. Definitely a local favorite- a mix of actually having good food and being one of the only casual eateries in Glen Park Village. 

I personally don't love their carne asada, but their carnitas, chile verde, grilled chicken, and salmon are all great options for your tacos, burritos, and tostadas. 

My pro tip?  Get a tostada, but ask for romaine lettuce as your base instead of rice... And you'll actually end up with a healthy salad!

Also, don't be dismayed if the line is out the door because they are very fast.
author: Karla R.

description: You know the food is good when there is a line that wraps around the restaurant and everyone knows the routine.  If youre new: wait, it's worth it.  Delicious food, friendly staff, and reasonably priced. It's cash only but there's an Wells Fargo ATM across the street and a Bank of America ATM doen the street. . Also, only a few minutes walk from Bart.
author: H R.

description:
My experience is normally exceptional. This time not so much. I stop here often after work so I can grab dinner to take home. They recently installs the Belly points system of which I've never redeemed. Tonight I go to swipe my card and they say it's not working. No problem. I simply ask how I get my points. And she says "I don't know,sorry". 

Hmmm. That's really bad customer service when I spent about $50 per week in this place. I guess from this point forward I'll take the 29 and stop at El Farolito on Mission.
author: Mark S.

description:
My favorite local Mexican place for a nice burrito.  I almost always go for their baby prawn burrito (which is amazing) and sometimes mix it in with chorizo (which is spicy!).  The combo is pretty awesome.  Along with the burrito, each time I look forward to crunching on those corn chips and their delicious and spicy green sauce (I could seriously drown the whole bottle in one go!).  The staff here is fast and respectful and the decor is nice (nothing fancy). 

I did order tacos once but I wasn't impressed.  The sauces from the taco made the taco skins all wet and I had to use forks and knives to not get my hands wet from the juices.  I didn't try it again.

Overall, this is an awesome place for a solid burrito on the cheaper side!
author: Jyotshna K.

description:
I love that this place has the Baby Burrito option. I'm a pretty petite girl and I don't always have the appetite or will power to finish a regular sized burrito, so this option is perfect. 

I usually get the Carne Asada Super Baby Burrito -- Carne Asada, Beans, Rice, Meat, Cheese, Guacamole, Sour Cream, Lettuce, Tomato & Salsa. The Tortilla Chips are pretty good too. 

I also have to mention that the owner's idea of putting salsa in squeezable bottles is legen-dary.
author: Elaine N.

description: Best chicken burrito I've had in a long time! I ordered the regular burrito and it seemed plenty large enough. Also came with free chips and was fairly cheap compared to other Americanized taquerias with less flavorful ingredients. Will definitely be back to try other options on the menu.
author: John L.

description:
We love coming here and usually order the Carne Asada with Shrimp plate.  The portions are big and the food is always good.  I've ordered other dishes and have never been disappointed.  If you want to avoid long lines you can order ahead. 

Just be aware that parking can sometimes be a hassle but that's usually the case in San Francisco.
author: Mirna V.

description:
So disappointed. With all the hype this place has been getting, and my constant search for a good mexican restaurant, this place did not satisfy my needs at all. It was such a huge let down, especially with all the great ratings here on yelp. 

There was nothing exciting about this place. I've tried tgis place 3 times (burrito, taco, nachos) I was expec5ing every item to be jam packed with flavor, but it was extremely bland! Definitely not worth the price!

However, the service was okay. It went by quickly considering how many workers they had.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Taquerias in San Francisco are a dime a dozen and everyone has their favorite.  Most neighborhoods have a couple... some neighborhoods there are 3 on the same block.  For my money, La Corneta is my clear favorite.

THE TOPPINGS
This is what makes the the burrito, taco, nachos, etc

Chorizo - 5 out of 5 - This is the first place I ever had chorizo and it kind of ruined me.  Every other time I had it I could never understand why it was never as good as here.  The chorizo is fresh and home made.  It is also one of the few toppings that are cooked to order.  Admittedly its a little greesy... but DAMN it's good!

Carne Asada - 5 out of 5 - Juicy, tender and flavorful.  You can't go wrong.  It isn't cooked to order but if you told me it was I would believe you.

Shrimp - 4 out of 5 - Fresh and cooked to order.  The shrimp themselves are very good but in most dishes I've had they tend to get a little drowned out by all the other ingredients.  You can also order half shrimp and half Carne Asada (my preference)

THE FOOD

Super Burrito (or Baby Super Burrito) - 5 out of 5 - If you're a fan of mission style burritos then it doesn't get much better than this.  Each one comes with your choice of meat and beans, rice, lettuce, cheese, salsa, sour cream and guacamole.  The price for a Super Burrito is a little higher here than a lot of other taquerias at around $7 but it is worth it.  The burritos are huge and super tasty.  If you want a smaller burrito at a cheaper price go with the Baby Super around $5. Its still a large meal and for me, just the right size

Super Nachos - 4 out of 5 - All the awesomeness of the super burrito but over chips.  The super nachos here are pretty good, one thing I'm not a fan of is that they put the beans, rice and cheese on first then microwave the package so the cheese melts.  I often ask them to skip this step as it tends to make a lot of the chips soggy.  Other than that, the serving is huge and very good.

LOCATION

The restaurant is a block away from the Glen Park Bart station and packing can be a little tough (thought not north beach tough).  The restaurant is a good size but be prepared to wait in line.  During peak meal hours the line can be out the door and seating can be a little tough as well so be prepared to take it to go.

OVERALL

Despite a few small hiccups, I have yet to find another mexican restaurant where I crave something as much as I do their Chorizo Super Burritto.  Hope you give this place a try!
author: Rob P.

description:
Probably the best CaliMex food anywhere. And I'm from L.A. so I HATE to admit this of a San Francisco restaurant. Great carne asada with tender quality beef unlike most other taqueria's in the area (that taste more like jerky)

It's very telling that there's almost always a line that wraps around the inside of this place. And I remember back when they opened and the restaurant was half its size and the line took up almost all of the store. Don't be turned off. The line moves pretty fast. And it's worth it. The bigger issue is parking because you'll spend more time looking for a parking spot in Glen Park than in line inside the taqueria.

Love their horchata and flan for desert but not so much their churro's.
author: Tom D.

description: Fresh ingredients and always a good burrito. Just kind of on the pricey side for a Taqueria.
author: Joshua C.

description: First time coming here after seeing the good reviews on yelp and it was definitely worth waiting the long line. I got a steak burrito and taco with cheese and it was soo good beat burrito I ever had, the green sauce was good too. I'm definitely gonna go back here whenever I'm craving  a burrito.
author: Tommy L.

description:
came in here after a friend recommended their burritos. i'd have to say, moving to san francisco from the suburbs was the best idea ever. new city, new people, new food. 

unfortunately, la corneta wasnt all that great in comparison to some other taquerias ive had in sf. i had a carnitas super burrito and because of the huge crowd i had high hopes. the meat was dry and lacking in flavor and the rice was something that youd find at panda express. peas and carrots? 

the salsa was amazing. whatever they had in their squeeze bottles on each table was delicious! def coming back for that and maybe i'll try carne next time. the employees were so so so nice and the place was really clean.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Some things are really good and some things not as much.

I have only tried a few items and some are consistently good such as Baby Prawn burrito.  Not so good, enchiladas (don't like th sauce) and the nachos.

Almost always long lines.
author: Mark M.

description:
My favorite place, hands down in the Bay Area.  Every time I come up from San Diego, I go here and get a super burrito.  What more can I say that's more powerful than that?  

The meat selection is awesome and even the tofu is good (if you can believe that).  They also have real, home made Horchata.  Not that garbage that comes out of a soda machine.  Home made!!   I'm actually planning a trip next month specifically to eat here.
author: Elan H.

description: Today , I went to order 2 burritos & 1 torta for my family.The total cost was $30+ tip , as I got home me and my family realized that the carne asada was not carne asada it was more like boiled meat cut up into the smallest pieces like it was tuna , it seems as if it was scraped of the bottom on the pan. It was truly disappointing , this was me and my family's favorite place to eat out at , but our minds have changed and we will take our business else where , A place with real Carne Asada.
author: Hugo G.

description:
Yummy food, friendly service, and fresh ingredients! The staff is wonderful and keep the place spotless. 

It does get crowded around lunchtime so make sure to get there early if you want to have a delicious lunch. 

I love that you can see your food being made, it really drives home the idea that the food you're getting is of great quality.
author: Dania H.

description:
It's still yummy and affordable, but this busy place has become La Bacteria. You can watch food handlers wipe counters, floors, refrigerator cases, and their bare hands -- all with the same rag -- before making your burrito. Vats of salsa, meats, and lettice get tossed into barely clean steamer trays with those same hands.
This place is an epidemiological disaster in the making. The successful owner can afford to invest in disposable gloves and some basic food handling training. 
Meanwhile, I won't eat there.
author: Lotion M.

description:
This place is freaking bomb. I've heard about it being good for years, but finally went myself. I ended up getting the carne asada taco - you can hardly call it a taco. 

2 corn tortillas are buried under a massive pile of beans, juicy meat, lettuce, guacamole, and more. I had to eat at least 3/4 of the filling before I could even attempt to eat the thing as a normal taco.

SO good, and all for under $4. I am definitely coming back.
author: Claire S.

description:
Best tostada (referred to as a taco salad bowl at some restaurants...?)
The shell of the tostada is fluffy, crispy greatness.
Excellent selection of meat and seafood.

The empanada was not very good. especially since it cost close to a baby burrito.
author: Kent T.

description:
parking is difficult and the traffic has increased like crazy.

the food is VERY GOOD!  It's back to respectable and very tasty.  Why not 4 stars?  For some reason, they started giving half scoops of refried beans.  If its a super, its a quarter scoop of guacamole.  They give you a pinch of lettuce.  If you ask for more guacamole, lettuce, sour cream...you name it.  They charge you an extra dollar.  

Whomever is managing or owning has decided to just charge and not explain that it will cost extra.  I wouldn't have a problem but its lettuce.  Maybe at least a regular scoop of guacamole and i wouldn't ask for extra.  Then to be charged an extra dollar for it to be the size of scoop it should be.

This place was rated THE BEST BURRITO in San Francisco over some very TOUGH GOOD competition.  

Please bring back the normal scoops, and a handful of lettuce.  At the same price it should be.  I may have to look for another go to place.
author: Bing D.

description:
You don't have to go to the Mission for good Mexican food. Though my usual is a burrito. I've enjoyed eveything I've ever gotten here.

This place is great. I feel lucky that it's my neighborhood spot.
author: Linnea J.

description:
This place is popular! There was a line when I stopped by to pick up dinner, and the other people in line where saying it was a slow day. Their burritos are big enough to be a meal by themselves, and they have a wide selection of menu items. 
I got a burrito, my wife got a chili relleno, and we got some guacamole and chips.
My burrito was pretty good, but my wife's relleno was soggy, and not so good. I was really disappointed in the guacamole which was a little watery and flavorless. My aunt Highly recommended them, so I'll try it again next time we are in the area. 
They have a few tables set up, but is mostly a take out place. 
Be aware that they are cash only!
author: Chris D.

description: We were in Glen Park for a walking tour, and afterwards, we were quite hungry.We stumbled around looking for someting that was open and that was decently good.  La Corneta Taqueria it is!  So glad we found it because I had a wonderful chicken burrito with lots of beans, rice, tomatoes, cilantro, and there was a nice bottle of green sauce on the table that I added to it - lots of fresh ingredients make their food so yum!  They give you some chips and yummy tomato salsa too.  I had a strawberry agua fresca (refreshing, cold, yum) and a churro (it was a ltitle hard, cold, ok).  I really enjoyed my meal and this place is bustling with lots of hungry people, and they all seem to leave full and happy.  I certainly was happy with a bit of a food coma that sent me into a nice little nap when I got home.  I will be back!
author: Maile N.

description:
The worst service ever.  Wait 10-15 minutes to order, then they whip out your food in record time with huge dollops of cream and guacamole, and then you get to the rubberneck, the front, where your burritto sits for another 15 minutes and gets soggy and cold while the woman at the register runs around doing everything but ringing you up.  
Finding a new Taqueria ASAP.
author: Danielle M.

description: Our favorite fast family Mexican eatery in San Francisco. We come here almost every weekend! The line looks really long but they move it really fast. We usually enjoy the shrimp and chicken quesadillas and a baby tofu burrito. They accommodate special requests like "light cheese", etc, in their stride. Though you have to watch to make sure the quesadilla guy is following through on the special request.
author: Vik C.

description:
This place always has a line but it super worth it. They make a great burrito,  usually get the Baby Burrito, if I'm REALLY hungry I'll get the Super Baby. No idea how anyone eats more than this.
Free chips and salsa
author: Kajal G.

description:
Off the Bart, stumbling home after happy hour went a little later than expected? You've come to the right place! All walks of life are easily drawn to the lights of this Taqueria. But we're not just dumb insects attracted to bright things. The selection and variety is what truly makes this a place to stop by.
On this evening, I went Lengua Super Burrito, because I was super hungry and super...well, I needed something to sit in my stomach. The lengua is cooked a little different, stewed in a tomato sauce. Different but the flavor definitely packs a punch behind it. A little on the spicier side. I also opted for the Spinach tortilla. I also wanted to do low carb (you know, because I was already disgusted with myself at this point) and asked for no rice. The lady didn't quite hear me so when I did correct her, she was more than happy to make another one for me. I'm not wasteful though so I still went with it.
Salsa appears to only be available if eating in. I do miss my salsa bar, but I'm okay with it since I get some tortilla chips thrown in the bag. If you're by the Bart, need a bite, and don't mind the snaking line, you're in for a treat.
author: Eric L.

description: I am sure there are better places in the City for Mexican but a short walk in Glen Park and carry-out fit the bill.  Prices are very reasonable.  Grilled salmon taco was good - a little bland but the salsa hit the spot.  Carnitas taco was excellent and love the black beans as a choice instead of refrieds!  Only major drawback is cash only if you are getting a large order.
author: Mark O.

description: Yes yes yes! Favorite neighborhood burrito spot hands down. Love the super carne asada burrito with black beans. There is always a line out the door because the locals love it! Great place to get some clean, fresh, Mexican cuisine!
author: Ryan G.

description:
Place is very clean, food is fresh, they serve wine n beer, bring cash no cc accepted!!!! 
They have baby burritos which I get and its a pretty good size. Their super tacos r bomb, one of those and a side of chips is more than enough.
Me and my daughter love it here!
author: Vee N.

description: Tasty food and inexpensive. Few table to sit at so better for one to take away. Few parking spaces on street with meters. Close to Glen Park BART station if you really wanted Mexican but then one could have went to 24th Mission BART or 16th Mission BART. Extra crowded during dinner time 6pm onward. Tacos, burritos, quesadillas with beef, pork, chicken or vegetarian it all tasted good. This reminds me of the Mexican fast food taquerias that I ate at as a student.
author: Clifford W.

description: VERY good food and really fast service! I am a sucker for Mexican food so this is a go! BEWARE: The Hot Salsa is soooooooooo VERY hot! Oh my goodness we couldn't even eat it! Don't let that discourage you though! Go get a meal ASAP! We went Sunday around 1:30pm and it was crowded but the line moved quick!
author: Chrys D.

description:
Hands down the BEST shrimp/prawn super quesadilla I've ever had!!!!!! Fresh flour tortilla, lots and lots of tasty plump prawns, delicious salsa, guacamole, and sour cream, cilantro and cheese.  I would recommend coming here if you want authentic Mexican food.  Order as you walk in or call ahead to order and walk straight to the cash register!

Don't forget they are cash only.  But a legitimate bank ATM 3 doors down.
author: Karin E.

description:
I lived in Glen Park for all of about two weeks when I first moved to SF (long story...) and during that hellacious period that was the Worst. Rental Experience. Ever. this lovely place was my only solace. I drowned my sorrows in delicious, coma-inducing burritos. Even though there are often long lines the staff is a well-oiled machine and they move fast.

I could ding them for not having a salsa bar, but that would mean less seating, and I already feel claustrophobic in many SF locations, so I applaud their choice here.
author: Jared S.

description:
This is my favorite Mexican joint in the city. I was first introduced to this place as a mere teenager. My co-worker dragged me there to hold his aqua frescas. He told me to hold on them really tight because the last intern he took failed at this simple task, in which the intern did $1000 worth of damage to the leather in his sports car. Whoopsies?

I love love love the super soft tacos, which resembles a taco bowl. They are packed with grilled meats of my heart's desire, chopped tomatos, lettuce, beans, guac, and sour cream. All ingredients are fresh and the way they are supposed to be. The meats are done just right, flavorful and not tough.
