Also, the way the juices from the ingredients soak into the tortillas make the tortillas soft and a whole other delectable experience. 

The cantaloupe frescas and horchata drinks are good too. Even though I normally do not consume sugary drinks with my meals, I always order them at La Corneta. It's a must here for me, and that is most definitely a rare thing.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Attorney at work wanted to take me out to lunch, I told him I was craving chips and salsa and quesadilla cheesy goodness.  He said let's go to Glen Park.

I had a hard time choosing between the super shrimp burrito, and the super shrimp quessadilla.  I chose the quesadilla and was not disappointed.  The thickness came in about 3/4 of an inch, and the puddle of grease from the mountain of cheese glimmered in the sun on the bottom of my plate.  The shrimp was tasty, the cheese was melty, and the tortilla was crispy.  PERFECT.

If it weren't for the heart attack that would result, I would eat it everyday.  Next time I'll try out the burrito.
author: Brice H.

description: I love this place! I wouldn't call it "healthy" but to describe how good it is... It's basically the healthy version of el farolitos! So this is my other go to spot. I always get the steak & shrimp super burrito or the super steak & shrimp nachos! Hella BOMB! Mm MMM MM
author: Jazzmin A.

description: The entire menu is on point, but heres a hidden gem: if you dont want something so heavy like beans and rice, go for the mixed greens salad with your choice of protein. I get balsamic but mostly dress it with the bomb salsa verde on the tables. Perfect lo-carb but filling and yummy meal! They use mixed greens (not lettuce) as a base with jicamas and carrots, its fantastic!
author: Joon B.

description: This is the only place my family will eat Mexican food. Everything we have had is delish. My hands down favorite is their strawberry fresca. I'd drive a million miles for it. I usually get either a torta or vegi burrito. My husband usually get a grilled chicken burrito. I accidentally got some horchata and although I'm not usually a fan, my mind was changed that day. I don't think the city has a better Mexican food place (maybe one of the other three or four of their locations can match them) they have two or three locations in sf, one in San Carlos and one in Burlingame. The two down the peninsula serve sangria and that's also a must get!! Just writing this review makes me want to drive on over and order some goodies.
author: Najah S.

description: Solid burrito for all of your burrito needs when you can't make it to the Mission! The line gets really long at peak hours, so I try to go a bit earlier if I can.
author: Avni B.

description:
My favorite burrito place in the city! 

Super delicious burritos and quesadillas. They have all your favorite meat choices and a wide selection of fresh toppings. I love the shrimp and steak burrito- probably the best combination ever invented. 

Super burritos (w/ choice of meat, cheese, rice, beans, guac, salsa, sour cream) range from $6-$9 depending on your meat/fish/shrimp choice. It comes with a side of chips and there's a self-serve salsa bar on the side. Yeah- it's probably not the cheapest burrito joint around but I think the extra dollar pays for the cleanliness of this place. They make everything right behind the serving area so you can tell it's a pretty clean establishment. 

Lines can get super long so be prepared to wait. There are a few tables inside but not enough tables/space for big groups (I'd say the max is 6/grp). Most of the customers get their food to-go as well. i've heard that you can also phone in your orders since the line can get pretty long but there's a greater chance that they'll mess up the order- I'd recommend going in to order if you're picky about your food. 

Parking in the area is a hit or miss as well but try driving a few blocks in and closer to the residential area.
author: Patricia K.

description: the carne was delicious, and they definitely do not skimp on the meat...tons on meat, the agua fresco strawberry was good, tasted like there was real fruit at the bottom
author: Long C.

description: Great burritos they give you a good portion of stuff on them too. Got my food Mase pretty fast although it was busy.  This my friends favorite spot
author: Shawn B.

description:
Love my neighborhood taqueria!! Go with the super baby burrito (which, despite his name, will fill you up at least once over for only $6). The chicken's good and I've heard great things about the al pastor. They're really nice about customization (50/50 meat, different salsas, pickled onions, jalapenos...) though YOU HAVE TO ASK as they won't prompt you for this stuff.

Once in a while, spring for the prawns ($2-3 more) and your stomach will thank you.

Last, note that the lines can be quite long in the post-work rush (I'd estimate 5:30pm-7:30pm). A decent percentage of the mass of humanity coming up the Glen Park BART escalators (well, more likely taking the stairs because the damn thing is broken again) will stop by La Corneta.
author: Rohan N.

description:
One of my favorite burrito places in the area. I always order the surf and turf burrito with shrimp and carne asada. The best part about this burrito is it's pretty healthy compared to your normal burritos. It's still "authentic" to me even though it's not super deep fried and oily. The burrito is packed with so much flavor it will make you crave bite after bite. It also comes with very fragile but crispy chips.

The other menu items like their quesadillas and nachos were alright. I would eat these at guadalajara's or el farolito in the mission. If you plan to eat there, remember to bring cash... otherwise you can use the BOA around the corner. Go try their juicy steak burrito now!
author: Gordon Z.

description:
Sorry, definitely not understanding the hype. I'm not from the Bay Area so I had no idea it was a chain until I was driving around Mission and saw another one. We thought it was a local gem (since the line was out the door!) and decided to give it a try.

I ordered the super baby burrito ($5.50) with carne asada. Maybe I should have ordered chicken or shrimp because I fail to see anything special about it. If anything, it was just rice and beans with salsa. I could get this anywhere! Not to mention the salsa by the table was seriously watered down. Why is it in a squeeze bottle?!

Sorry, I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.
author: Allison S.

description:
Portions here = massive.

Two or three people could easily share one nacho plate and leave very satisfied.

The very first time I came here, about two years ago, I tried this place and didn't like it. I guess I'm picky about my burritos. But the last time I came I ordered a mushroom quesadilla and it was quite taste, although huge. My friend ordered a veggie nacho plate and it was insanely massive. Something we will remember for next time. Too bad something like nachos doesn't really work for leftovers.
author: Jennifer P.

description: La Corneta is awesome ! Customer service is fast, efficient, and friendly. The location is very nice. Get your order "for here" and relax. Also, very reasonably priced. Most importantly , the burritos are delicious. Lots of options, I even noticed that they had chili verde Tofu for vegetarians. Make sure to have cash, because they are cash only. But, there is also a Wells Fargo ATM right across the street , so no big deal if you need to get cash. Thanks La Corneta! I stop by here every time I crave a burrito.
author: Nate W.

description:
I now have a thesis that Glen Park is part of the Outer Boroughs of SF. My meal in La Corneta informs me that people here can wait, but not for long. A line of 10-15 people during the evening rush hour means you will leave you there about as many minutes, and quite possibly less.

Commuters from the Glen Park station, parents with small children, people of all stripes, know what they want from La Corneta's giant menu. 

There's a counter-table facing the street - Diamond - where you can watch joggers, Jagermeister women, panhandlers, young families and school kids come and go. This isn't a meat market. This is Glen Park, home of people's lives...not those who are trying to "do something" that night or looking to be with someone else. 

I ordered two Super burritos, pollo and carne asada. Neither comes with a ton of spice, even with the hot salsa. And yet each was very tasty, almost too moist overall. I very rarely encounter that in a burrito.
author: Mike H.

description:
Between marriages, JDate and Match provided some interesting dating experiences, and all of them positive or at least a welcome learning opportunity. Gayle will tell you that I wasn't ready and had no business doing this, and she was right. Gayle is also a bit of a data hound and walking past La Corneta Taqueria last Sunday precipitated a relaxed conversation about personal growth and Facebook pages.

La Corneta Taqueria was the site of one such pre-Gayel date, and I still favourably remember the woman and the quesadilla. And neither required sour cream to make our short dinner a success.
author: Eric B.

description: Fresh ingredients and a decent price. The lines can get really long, and also it's cash only. My favorite is the steak and prawn quesadilla.
author: Eugene H.

description:
The background: Taqueria that quickly won my heart over located near the Bart station. Definitely met my need for good Mexican in SF. 

The details:
Best dinner ever for only $10 including a canteloupe agua fresca. Ordered a taco dinner which came with 1 taco (two large scoops of meat), beans, orange rice and salad. All really delicious: carne asada was not overcooked and flavorful, orange rice just is frankly amazeballs! The dinner was huge, I split it into two meals basically. And you get a free bag of chips! 

The verdict: Great value, delicious, somewhat crowded, but completely worth it.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Christine B.

description: Solid Mexican spot with lots of options. The free chips and salsa is a nice touch, but the chips are just ok. The super tacos are giant but you have to eat them more like a tostada than a taco. The salmon and carnitas were tasty. The burritos are also giant and you get your choice of beans and fillings. I didn't love the rice, but I will definitely be back.
author: Kenzie T.

description:
Currently my favorite burrito place. Fresh, generous portions at excellent prices. I like the touch of green peas in the rice. I usually get the especial burrito with black beans and double chicken in red sauce, which is really two meals. Delicious! And only $10.

It is crowded and noisy -- I only go there for take-out. It is busy at meal times, but the line moves quickly. I've never seen a place which gets such a range of customers and friendly at that. I've had some decent conversations waiting in line.

I suggest making eye contact with the woman taking your order and watch as it is prepared to be sure you get what you want. They're good people, working hard. Be sure to leave a tip.
author: Jack T.

description:
I had eaten at the La Coroneta in the mission, hated my cold burrito, and subsequently gave it 1 star on yelp. I should have known that the Glen Park location would suck too, but I thought I'd give it a chance since it's gotten a 4 star average on yelp. I was mistaken.

I got a carne taco this time. What's with the cold food at both La Coroneta locations?? COLD TACO?? Seriously? Cheese in mexican food needs to be melted and beans must be warm. No shit. Yeah, it's cheap, but definitely not worth the disappointment of cold mexican food. Pass!
author: Kristen F.

description: Just like what everyone have mentioned already..STEAK and PRAWN burritto is the shiatsu here! Spinach toritilla, no rice, and refried beans with lots of spicy onions..all for the protein gain. Friends of mine took me here after a long workout at the gym and it's been my favorite Mexican restaurant ever since. I can't believe I've been missing out.  The flavor from the grilled prawn is what got me in my opinion. The minus 1 star is for the lady that rushed my order she missed one ingredient and totally ignored me when I tried to aske for it.  I'd understand if there was a long line but there were only two people waiting.  Overall, I love their burrito and salsa and that's all that matters!
author: Lloyd M.

description:
For some reason, I didn't find this place too praise-worthy. I got the prawn taco with everything on it. The prawn was way too salty, so that already ruined it for me. The prawn's supposed to be the hero here. Other than that, there was too much sour cream (I asked for it without too late). The mild salsa wasn't that fresh, and the gauc lacked seasoning. All that stuff piled on with the lettuce and beans was just too loaded for these tortillas. One thing I really pay attention to is the freshness of the tortilla here. Can it hold everything so your tortilla isn't ripping all over the place and just getting soggy?

In short, I wasn't impressed by the tortilla or, in general, the tacos at all. I doubt the burritos could have been that big a step up. Probably wouldn't come here again if it were up to me!
author: Antoinette S.

description: Food is three stars but the seating area is dirty as hell
author: David G.

description: Love this taqueria. Their carnitas and carne asada is very delicious. I've had their beef tongue too, and despite most people's ick factors, it's pretty tender and amazing. Super tacos are pretty sizable. So are their burritos. It's all delicious. I've had friends who come into town from the East Bay just to go here. Yes it's cash only. Yes their portions are big, their food is delicious, and the times I've gone I've gotten free chips. Yes there is a long line that forms a U-shape but it moves quickly. Worth it.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
Good, fresh food. 

The food here isn't as heavy as other taquerias in the city, which my stomach appreciates. 

I get the super baby burrito and, with the chips, it's plenty of food.

My go to is the carnitas. If you get that, you have to make sure they throw it on the grill while they make the rest of your burrito, otherwise the meat isn't hot enough. Some of  the employees do it without me asking but a couple of them don't. It makes all the difference in the world. 

The other meats I've tried aren't anything special but they're still good. Minus 1 star for that and for not taking cards. But if you stick with the carnitas you'll be happy.
author: Jake B.

description:
Favorite taqueria in SF! I almost always go with the super baby steak & prawn burrito-the prawns are big n juicy and the carne asada cooked & cut to perfection. Wash it down with a melon juice or any of their other aguas frescas.

They have plenty of meat options as well as tofu for you to eat in any form: burritos nachos, enchiladas, tacos, tamales, tostadas, chile relleno & lots more. I've also seen churros n other desserts and it seems like they're always adding new menu options. 

I love love love that they offer super babies for those who want all the flavors of a super in a smaller (but still very filling) size. Or just get the regular size n take leftovers! Cold burritos mmm...

This taqueria is pricier than others ($8 for a super, $6.50 for regular, $9 for my super baby steak & prawn) but still fairly inexpensive compared to other food options. They're CASH ONLY but citibank, b of a, & wells fargo are all right outside.
author: Siobhan T.

description:
Speedy burritos, but unfortunately my carnitas burrito had massive chunks of fat that make for a trepidatious lunch. 

Therefore, Gordo's wins.
author: Umilia M.

description:
So I am fortunate enough to come from a small farm town where Taqueria's are plentiful, so I'm always on the lookout for a good Taqueria.  

I ordered a super burrito but before I could order pork or chicken or shrimp, they threw some beef in there.  I was also getting a shrimp and steak super burrito with a spinach tortilla for my girlfriend's roommate, but they subsequently burned the tortilla THREE times in a row.  Poor service indeed.

The salsa was bland, the beef tasted like it was boiled not grilled, the guacamole was forgettable, the burrito was quite messy, and the price was a bit too high for the quality.  I'd take a Chipotle/dos coyotes burrito over this place (and I'm not a big fan of either of those places either).  The chips were also quite stale.  

Go to Tacos Los Altos in Bernal Heights.  I like that place much better (and I wrote a sterling review for it).
author: Vincent-Arthur B.

description: Quickly becoming one of my favorite burrito spots.  Always busy, but the line moves fast.  The food is always quality, many choices and combinations to satisfy most tastes. The green salsa is really tasty, I could drink it by the cupful!  You can even order a "baby" burrito (still quite large) if you don't want to spend the afternoon in a burrito coma.  Haven't tried the other locations, but the Glen Park restaurant is definitely worth a visit!
author: Erin C.

description: Terrible food . Ordered 3 burritos and two tamales. Burritos were packed with mushy unflavored rice . Meat did not taste fresh - what little meat that was in the burritos . The tamales were not terrible and the only thing we ended up eating. I would have gotten a better meal at Taco Bell! 30+ dollars thrown away. Will never patronize again
author: Rosemarie M.

description:
Stopped by for a bite to eat while waiting for the bus to take me up the hill. The super burrito is HUGE! Lots of delicious guacamole and the steak was nice and tender.

Line around 7pm was pretty long, but moved quickly enough. I think was in and out in 10 minutes. 

Cash only, but there's a Bank of America ATM a few stores over :)
author: Suejung S.

description: Don't fall for the name, the other locations are way more on top of their game than this one. Extremely inefficient and I've never received anything I've actually ordered. I am posting this review having left the restaurant with a line wrapped around the restaurant at a time when 5 of the 7 people working were looking at a burrito that was being made seemingly confused about who had ordered it. Just goto the pizza place next door.
author: Adam M.

description:
This place is great, authentic Mexican according to my Mexican friend and fraternity brother. He says authentic Mexican uses lots of seafood, so I ate two super burritos, one with shrimp and the other with salmon. The super burritos are actually quite big and each came with nachos- the reason I got two is that I eat like a wild animal and I probably have at least one tapeworm. The burritos are delicious alone, but if you are looking for good hot sauce or spicy salsa, you'd have to bring your own.

The bottom line: two thumbs way up from NOU fraternity and our Mexican brother, but no spicy options we think
author: Evan L.

description: Food is good! Service is ok. They are so unorganized. Everything steak and shrimp is tasty except the burrito because I hate that they have mixed veggies in their Spanish rice.
author: Y W.

description: Burritos are pretty good! This is the only Taqueria near Glen Park BART, just two crosswalks away. Only one stop South of 24th and Mission BART, but comparable to Mission taquerias. The line moves at a decent speed at peak meal-hours.
author: Pedro G.

description: Placed my order over the phone and they told me my order would be ready in ten minutes. When i arrived 13 minutes later, my order was not ready. They JUST started on it. I also asked for no rice on my burrito and when i dove in on my first bite o saw that THEY ADDED RICE!!! UGHHHHH. HOW HARD IS YOUR JOB?
author: Jessica P.

description: Hands down the best darn burrito in the entire Bay Area.  super tender pork meat and fresh sides.  My wife liked her child size burrito too for the lighter eater.  the chips were so so but the red and green salsas were very good.  I can't wait to try their nachos next time!!!  the big panda approves!
author: Steven L.

description:
After a pretty underwhelming meal from La Corneta recently, I feel like I have to knock down my review down a couple pegs.  I got my usual prawn burrito, with no special requests or anything.  The shrimp was undercooked and the burrito was rolled the wrong way, apparently (it's like I ate the ingredients in a sequence instead of mixed together) - it started out with a few bites of black beans and ended with a few bites of the undercooked shrimp.

I've been in the habit of going to the La Corneta in Burlingame for a couple years now... I think I'll just stick to that one for now, which I would still give the five stars I previously gave this location.  I'm giving it three stars because I assume they can still make a great burrito, but I guess I can't expect them to make a good burrito every time.
author: Ian M.

description:
LA CORNETA!!! The name makes sense after you eat here, because it's all you can do to not actually go buy a bugle and just stand out there on Diamond and alert people to THE BEST BURRITOS EVER. 

The first requirement for any sort of eatery is cleanliness. La Corneta is clean and bright and beautiful. The food prep area, the dining area, and the bathroom are all neat and clean. I'm immediately impressed by brilliant business owners who realize the need for customers, who are ordering food, for which they've just had to pay in cash, to wash their hands. I appreciate the clean sink and readily available soap and paper towels so much. 

Where the tacos and burritos are concerned... sure they've got other stuff, but I mean, if you're reading these reviews for nachos or sopas, idk buddy. The context I have most experience with involves team taco and team burrito. 

The tacos: they have the requisite double corn tortilla. I always get al pastor. The al pastor here doesn't have pineapple, but it's pretty good otherwise. It isn't that weird barbeque interpretation of al pastor, either. Just happily marinated pork. The sweet little ladies here always give me extra cilantro and lime without giving me dirty looks, which makes the entire taco experience all the lovelier. 

The burritos: they have all kinds of tortillas! White, wheat, red and green, they are gigantic and they warm them up before they start their burrito art. There is a line that moves along the counter as you're specifying your order, and it can get pretty packed in there, so just be ready to choose between beans and whether you want rice. Just get the rice. And black beans. They are so good about draining the beans and not putting dirty bean water on the burrito, I could kiss them from across the glass divider. By the time you get to the guacamole and salsa, they ask which kind of salsa you want. They have huge pans of glorious mild and spicy salsa, of which you have three potential encounters. In the burrito, with the chips, and then, because God smiles on La Corneta, they also have this perfect combination of tomatoes, onions and cilantro salsa in squeeze bottles on the tables with the squeeze top cut so that salsa comes out unabashedly. 

If you are getting a burrito, always get the super burrito. You'll be missing out on crucial mission burrito elements otherwise. I realize these are messier than regular burritos, but don't worry. I get a lot of flack for not eating burritos like a Californian, but I'm from New Jersey and we like to be clean. So once you have your little burrito baby, you have to unwrap the foil lengthwise and then carefully find the burrito seam and open that. Once you've opened the burrito, you can eat the inside neatly with a fork, plus you get the added bonus of being able to later rewrap the tortilla and eat a much neater version of the burrito after eating most of the filling. The thing is huge, though, so maybe not. The thing is delicious, though, so nevermind that it's huge, eat it anyway.

They also have aquas frescas, that sugary strawberry water of the gods. It is really sweet, but it's sort of hard to find, so it's totally worth getting here. 

Also, this might sound dorky and I'm not sure how important this is to other people, but they have a lot of napkins and the strong kind of plastic forks that don't break easily. Just in case you're a napkin freak like me.
author: Regina C.

description: The place is usually packed but worth the 10 min wait. Last time I was here mayor Ed Lee was there and he probably knows the best places in the city. I always get a carne asada burrito and free chips (great with their delicious salsa verde). I also like that this place has lingua which isnt offered at every place. Ill be coming back very soon for my weekly burrito fix.
author: Allen T.

description: My fave taqueria on this side of town. When I lived in Westwood Highlands I would come here at least twice a week after work. The line gets crazy long but it's worth it. Huge portions and inexpensive. Tonight after having dinner at the pizza place down the block I came here to get two burritos for later tonight when I'm hungry again, a super baby chicken and my favorite, a regular shrimp and carne asada in a spinach wrap.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Not much in ambience, so it is better for take-out, but the food is terrific.   I have the salmon burritos or the salmon tacos, and they are great.   At peak times, there is often a line, so it's best to prepare for the wait, but it's worth it.   I really like the choices they give you in terms of beans and hot sauces, so it is actually possible to have something that is not ultra spicy.  This is definitely not a chipotle type of restaurant.
author: Roger B.

description:
Chipotle meets authentic delicious food!! 

I could see if u don't speak Spanish that it "could" be hard to communicate but for the rest of us!  Bomb !!
author: Danny G.

description: Food is great and fresh, but customer service needs improvement- Some days if The ladies taking the orders are in a bad mode and take out on customers.
author: Fred R.

description: The food here is ok - pretty standard Mexican food that leans toward a slightly trendy rather than traditional direction. Although I find the quick/to-go options to be somewhat limited in Glen Park, I don't think I would go back as the seating and line are a bit of a nightmare. Most of the patrons had young children (infants-toddlers), and while they were generally well-behaved, I felt like the space just wasn't designed for this and the environment felt chaotic.
author: Lisa K.

description: I had the tostadas de ceviche less than two hours later I got sick, I believe I got food poisoning. I've been there a couple of times not impressed with how they make your taco or burrito, no gloves, going from one container to the next, not using a serving utensils at all.  After getting sick I will never go there again.
author: Theresa G.

description:
La Corneta is close enough to Daly City for SFSU students to enjoy great mexican food.

I love their quesadilla suiza with carnitas and their prawn quesadillas. My boyfriend is partial to their carne asada super burritos.

The service is okay. A girl did roll her eyes at me once when I asked for jalapenos in my burrito, but I can forgiveness this massive offense in customer service because the owner is just superb. I respect an successful owner who is not afraid to get his hands dirty.

The last time I was here, he delivered chips and salsa to me at my table and gave us extra guacamole and salsa in his newly pressed button up and slacks.

Respect. 

BTW, the guac here is so worth it. I could eat this guacamole with a spoon by itself.

Lines might look intimidating but they move fast. Really fast. Trust me. I hate queuing.
author: Trang H.

description: I'm not sure why this place gets good reviews. Either is because there are no other taquerias in Glen Park, or maybe people just don't know what Mexican food should taste like. I ordered two carne asada tacos with just onion and cilantro (the basic menu item that imo can say a lot about the quality of a taqueria). The tacos were so huge I couldn't hold them, the tortillas were soggy, the meat really wasn't good nor fresh nor grilled enough, and the cilantro was not fresh and there was too much of it. And it was the same ingredients that they put in the burritos of other people in the restaurant at the time so I can't see how the other items on the menu can be that good. Plenty of good taquerias in San Francisco, this is definitely not one of them.
author: Alice Y.

description:
One of the best taquerias in terms of flavor, options and service.  In addition to the usual fare, you get a choice of whole wheat or spinach tortillas for your burritos and tacos whether you like them soft or crispy.  The carnitas and carne asada are served in bountiful quantities with a tender, moist texture to go with your choice of black, whole or refried beans.  Don't forget to try their canteloupe agua frescas for a tasty, refreshing juice to complement the satisfying meal.  

Service is fast.  The ambiance and decor is simple and clean.  Parking is tough on the streets unless you're willing to walk around the corner.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This place is great when your looking for a place to enjoyed a wonderful meal with some friends. 

For the most part you receive your food in a timely manor. Keep in mind there can be a decent line (so you know people enjoy the quality of food). During my visit I tried the: Super Prawn with Shrimp, Beans, Rice, Meat, Cheese, Guacamole, Sour Cream, Lettuce, Tomato & Salsa ($8.95) and the Horchata (large 24oz - $2.50). Both were satisfying. I will definitely come back and try their other menu items.

A key piece of advice, this is a CASH ONLY place. So, don't forget to grab some cash before you head over (there's a Wells Fargo just across the street) or you'll be caught up in an interesting moment.
author: Kristina S.

description: Great place to grab tostadas! Im a fan of this particular la corneta because its close enough for me to drive on a late evening and pick up some dinner. Their carne asada is my favorite because it's not too greasy like other places. I didn't really like their refried beans the flavor  was kind of weird but their black beans are pretty good. If you don't want to wait in line you can always call ahead and order to pick up. Parking can be a little tough so get ready to go around a couple times and search for the right spot. Make sure to bring cash because they do not accept  cards.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I've been all over San Francisco in search of the best burrito.

La Corneta Taqueria in Glen Park is better than:
El Farolito
Pancho Villa
Papalote
El Burrito Express
La Corneta Taqueria in the Mission
Taqueria Vallarta (though this place is cheaper)

La Corneta Taqueria in Glen Park is better than EVERYWHERE. Except maybe El Metate.
author: Talia G.

description:
I still think La Corneta is the best taqueria in town but I know have further evidence to back it up!  My friends and I arranged a "burrito tasting" to test out the city's finest burritos for ourselves.  Each person brought one regular chicken burrito from a different taqueria  - there were 12 restaurants represented (including El Farolito, Papalote & Little Chihuahua).  One friend sat out and numbered the burritos so the tasting would be blind.  After trying each burrito, we rated them on a scale from 1 to 5.  La Corneta came out the clear winner with an average rating of 4.25 (the only burrito to have an average rating of over 4).

The moral of the story is: La Corneta is supreme!  And hosting a burrito tasting is a great way to spend an evening :)
author: Liz H.

description: Great, clean and consistent quality. My friends from out of town always want to lunch here specifically to have their super prawn taco-the best!
author: Kim O.

description:
This place is pretty good.

The portions are huge and you can't beat the price.  My bf had the burrito and I had the  chicken quesadilla.  
The chorizo burrito was one of the more tasty ones that I've had and the quesadilla's cheese was melted perfectly and was so much I could not finish it.

definitely will come back here. (both for under $15!)
author: Steph Q.

description:
good food! basically what you would expect from a taqueria. 

clean, friendly environment. 

yummy!
author: Jenny E.

description:
Things definitely got more pricy than usual. I live in the area. The menu is great. the quesadillas are always bomb, and the super burrito you can't go wrong. Carne asada extra spicy or el pastor meat..yum. I personally really like the carne asada and shrimp special cause its a crap load of food and the carne asada is cooked perfectly in large pieces (not the chopped kind that they put in the burrito). Horchata is grainier than most places, but i think thats how its supposed to be. anyways go with the dish i just told you, you'll love it. 

they also only take cash now i believe.. new policies.. ehh
author: Jason W.

description: I've been coming here for years. I tried almost everything on the menu. My only gripe is that they don't have a soda fountain or soda machine.  Most taquerias have them except this one. Quenching my thirst after eating ah gut bomb burrito which is calienate is a must and thats where a fountain is needed. Anyways try their El Pastor or Spicy chicken meats. My favorites
author: G-man B.

description:
It's hard to understand why most ratings are so high. Perhaps it's simply the best taqueria option in Glen Park.

My personal experience was a long noisy line topped with a generous helping of unfriendly service, a sprinkling of "got my order wrong", accompanied by some some flavorless carne asada.
author: Rebecca V.

description:
Admittedly, this is my first time eating Mexican food in California. (Yes, I know, horrifying.) And when I ordered it looked like a mess.

As it turned out, it's delicious. OMG. Glen Park rules, as always. My shirt ended up pretty screwed up though.
author: Zach V.

description: Chicken Mole is delicious, great casual menu but no salsa bar? Loses one star : (
author: Kenneth D.

description:
We came here last night after spinning class and this place is just AWESOME.  I mean really, for $17 you get a HEAPING super nachos and super burrito.  It's literally overflowing and oozing everywhere and it tastes even better than it looks!!  We literally had a meal for 3 people and everyone would have finished with the "OMG, I'M SO FULL" look in their face...haha

They have options for regular flour, corn or spinach tortilla with all of the normal toppings.  They cook everything FRESH and to order so you never have to worry about having old food sitting in the warmers.  Also, they have AMAZING homemade salsas with at least a handful of different types depending on if you are the mild to super spicy salsa lover.  

This is a great little addition to the Glen Park area I just hesitate to rave about this place TOO MUCH because it already has a line out the door and once you go you'll always want to go back!
author: Sandy L.

description:
This La Corneta  is a good example of quality and its relativity to distance.  One common known fact is that when you venture father away from the heart of the Mission District, the quality of taqueria food declines.  In the case of Glen Park's La Corneta, this holds true.

When ordering a burrito, regular or super, they provide twice the amount of beans and half the rice.  When I take the first bite, the food is digestible and holds some taste but I always have to force myself to finish.  By comparison, in a Mission District taqueria, they don't play proportion games with your orders.  They also don't hide condiments and extras like salsa behind the counter.   When food is prepared right like in the Mission, I've got to hold back from buying more!

As for quality in service, most Mission District taquerias are lined with servers idling to take and complete your order as soon as you speak.  At Glen Park's La Corneta, I've encountered some of the servers jumping to and from the assembly line to finish their jokes or conversations with one another, leaving me hanging as I wait for them.

In the end, they're not bad but undoubtedly need to be schooled on business practices.
author: Honest J.

description: This place always has some of the longest lines I have ever seen at a Taqueria whenever I go there.  It is mega-popular in the Glen Park hood.  Honestly, I don't know why La Corneta's burritos are so good.  Is it the ingredients, the seasoning, or what?  I have no idea, but these burritos taste amazing.
author: David M.

description:
This is a bias review because I love Mexican food, and La Corneta is right near Glen Park so its super convenient.  

CASH ONLY ESTABLISHMENT!

The Super burritos are awesome.  I usually get half carnitas half chorizo, and the mixture is AMAZING!  Chips are made there, and their salsas are really good (go for the spicy onion salsa dip).

Also tried the Flauta.  The dish was HUGE and came with an enchilada, fried stuff pepper, rice and beans and a salad.  Awesome!

I would recommend this place and would give it 4.5 stars only because its a tad bit more expensive than the taqueria by my house.
author: Tom L.

description:
Located 2 blocks from the Glen Park BART, La Corneta Taqueria offers a variety of burritos, tacos, quesadillas, nachos and other plates for purchase.  Food is sometimes a little pricey, but they have a great deal of selection in terms of meats, beans, and toppings & have tasty offerings.  Their shrimp burritos are the bomb!

They usually have a fairly long line, but it moves quickly on most occasions. Décor is typical taqueria drudgery, and I usually take my food to go and eat once home. 

Overall, good food + a welcome neighborhood food option
author: Kim R.

description: Amazing how they can fit so many ingredients in the wrapper without the tortilla breaking.
author: Beatrice L.

description: Hubby and I eat here literally every Saturday (I'm the mayor on Foursquare, thank you very much).  We've mixed it up a few times -- tried the tamales, ceviche, and even an empanada (and all were delicious!) but we always come back to the standard taco.  It's a classic and they do it right! I opt for the carne asada and hubby goes with 1 spicy chicken (which he RAVES to everyone he meets about) and 1 carnitas.  You MUST try this gem of a taqueria -- you won't be sorry.
author: Tay A.

description:
This is another one of those places that used to be good.  When they first opened, the employees were friendly, prices were decent and the owner would bring you samples of salsas he was creating.  Now, the lines are long, the employees rude because I refuse to speak the "other oppressor language" while ordering,  they short on salsa, chips,  ignore you when you are trying to order more food.    I used to get a super quesadilla and eat it for two meals for $8.00.  Now it's 10 and I guess if the rude workers would give me chips and salsa, maybe i wouldn't notice how small the portions got and how the quality of the food has good downhill.

FYI  Burritos are not Mexican food.  They were invented in San Francisco.  I don't eat something i can make in 15 minutes better at home.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
In 19 out of 20 visits you'll likely have to queue to place your order -- unless you show up long after the lunch rush and before dinner time. So folks must be coming from all over, because Glen Park isn't as densely populated as most SF neighborhoods.

Freshly grilled-to-order salmon tacos and burritos are a step above what's offered by most other taquerias in the same price range.

Tostadas de ceviche are a personal fave, and a good choice for healthy protein without much fat.

The staff here is efficient and accommodating to the customers' many unique orders, which is admirable considering how frequently they have to put up with jerky boys who didn't read the menu carefully and want to change their orders mid-way through the production line.
author: Francisco G.

description:
Super shrimp and steak quesadilla $10.  Super steak burrito $9.  24oz horchata $2.50. (CASH ONLY)

all the tables were filled, the line was long but went fast.  

Service was fast.

The food was soo good that we finished it all in one sitting.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Our favorite Taqueria. Very consistent and very good food.

For my money, you can't beat the super burrito with mole chicken. Taco dinner and tamales are also pretty damn good. 

I don't get the overpriced reviews, most of the dishes are $6 or $7.

Only downside is the line can get long, but what can you do, they're popular.
author: Chris O.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I work a block away. This is the cleanest Taqueria I have ever been to and the best food too. I love their menu. All their food is oh so good. My favorite is the #8 and their grill chicken Caesar salad. All the ladies are very nice and super friendly but only one lady can make my salad. If she's not there I just order something else. If you like Mexican food this is "THE BEST PLACE!" to get your fix. CLEAN, GREAT FOOD, GREAT SERVICE, AND YOU CAN SEE EVERYTHING THEIR MAKING RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU what more can you ask for?
author: Michele T.

description:
Absolutely alright. Despite a flawlessly constructed burrito, excellent heat and good guacamole, this taqueria didn't impress me. The tortilla was steamed (not grilled), the cheese was unmelted and my burrito included lettuce, an offense which automatically consigns this burrito to 3 star meh-ness. So much was good, yet so much more could have been better.

Salsa was very nice, however!
author: Casey U.

description: Still one of my favorite Burrito joints in the city! It is fun to watch them grill everything fresh, I love their fish burritos (fresh salmon grilled right for the order) and awesome churros, if you like it filled with custard. It is 2 min walking distance away from Glen Park BART station and be aware they only take cash. Love it!
author: Thomas W.

description: Maybe one of the best taquerias in San Francisco. Tons of options and very delicious!!
author: Gonzalo C.

description: OMFG have the Grilled Chicken Breast Enchiladas con Salsa Verde insanely good! Some of the most massive Burritos, and employees who are out of this world.
author: cereal y.

description:
Cheap lunch or dinner that tastes great!

For years I've dismissed this place as another Mexican restaurant in a city that's full of them. After hearing my brother rave about the burritos, I had to see what the hype was all about. Walking in, the decor was what really convinced me that this place was mediocre. The line, yep there's usually a line, goes by quickly and you better know what you want to order. The menu board is huge with options for burritos, tacos, quesadillas, and plates. The offer so many different kinds of meat. They also have other items like empanadas displayed on the counter.

Spinach tortilla super chicken burrito with everything and hot salsa is what I order. Loads of juicy chicken with a ton of fixings wrapped in a spinach tortilla which makes me feel better about myself after eating it. 

Super nachos are always good to share. Basically everything in a burrito substituting the tortilla for the chips and no rice. 

The quesadillas are no joke either. It's basically a flat burrito minus the beans and rice. 

DELICIOUS
author: Dennis L.

description: Best taqueria in the city. Fast service, fish and meat made to order, well priced, lots of seating, free chips, hot salsa. Cash only.
author: Anneka M.

description:
How many people does it take ring up a person at the register? One, right?! How many people do you need to make Nachos? One, right??!!

DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS OVER PRICED, OVER RATED TAQUERIA!!!

I am done with this place. Today I walked in to give this place the final chance and they lost. Lost a customer. But then again, with all the fortunates that live in GP, they  will keep going to this place thinking its great mexican food! - it's not!!!

Over priced to begin with, you can get a better WARM meal with ONE person making your food and ANOTHER ringing up. I walked out today after a long hesitation to try them one last time. I noticed someONE waiting in line as two ladies tended to someone paying. Hmmm, I would have thought they would have wanted to make dude burrito in front of me. No. One needed to bag while the other rang up. THEN, another few ladies came out from the kitchen, looked at me dead in the eye (when she could have been making food) and chatted with the ladies ringing up ONE person. Dude in front of me orders his food. The lady then turned to me and asked what I wanted. I stated to her in perfect spanish my nacho order. She looked puzzled. Then asked if it was to go? I said "yes". She then grab some chips in a box, put them on the counter, and then walked away to grab another order and left me hanging!!

I wasn't in a rush, but the disregard really put the icing on the cake for me with this place. The food is wayyyyyy over priced. I walked out one day with a burrito and beer at $15. That amount in the Mission and I could have had dinner AND extra for a brew or two. Mind you, I am born and raised in Glen Park so I ain't no snob and picking on the area. I have Glen Park tattoo'd on me so enough said with the hood. But the food is always served cold, they are always scattered behind the line (counter), and the prices for what you get are just no there for me. I've been there SEVERAL times and that have mixed up folks orders. It's the ONLY mexican food joint in the area so for me that translates into why it's always packed- not because the food it outstanding! IT SUCKS. 

Do me a favor and travel out of your element and into the Mission where you can find a better authetico mexicano meal...I think you may be happier.
author: Ana B.

description: The baby prawn burrito is my favorite. Recently, I tried the chicken corneta salad and enjoyed it as a lighter alternative.
author: Sasha B.

description: Had the super taco - it was delicious! The line was long but didn't take that long considering how good the food is. The nachos are fresh and the salsas are awesome.
author: Farin F.

description: Super steak and prawn burrito! You can not go wrong with this choice. Huge serving very delicious. Don't go around 6-8pm unless you don't mind waiting. It is definitely worth the wait. Bring cash, they don't except any other payment.
author: Anou S.

description:
I am giving this place 3 stars, based on the inconvenience you have to go through to get a burrito or taco.

First of all, the food is pretty good - but the lines are SO LONG and the place is always filled with families/people, so you have to take your food to go. I know that where there is a line, there is usually good food - but sometimes it's the reason I'll just keep on walking instead of stopping for food. 

(Note: I was in line one time, where the lady in front of me decided to call in her order while standing in line. Totally pissed me off because she sat snarkingly off to the side and got out of there earlier) 

Second, the cash only policy - they only tell you this at the register. So after you wait in the long line, order your food - you now have to scrape together the cash or find an ATM. Luckily there are three bank ATM's nearby.

Also, you have to inform them what type of salsa and how many you need. They offer them sparingly. That's why I love salsa bars, maybe I just want it really hot and spicy, maybe I just want to take the salsa home.
author: Rebekah T.

description: The food was good. I've been to the one in Burlingame several times and I love their burritos, so when in the city I stopped by this location. Sadly, the chicken super burrito I ordered gave me food poisoning. I had nothing else to eat that day so I know it was the burrito. My friend had a steak burrito and was fine so it must have been the chicken
author: Elizabeth M.

description: As a San Francisco native, I have had the chance to try the city's best taquerias.  Since I first tried La Corneta ten years ago, it has been one of my favorites.  Their prawn burrito is amazing and they consistently deliver great service.  Today I forgot that they only take cash, instead of sending me to the ATM the manager gave me the meal for free!
author: Caleb K.

description:
First time coming here and there was so many choices I didn't know what to choose! At the end I got a carne asada quesadilla and my bf got a chorizo super burrito. His burrito looked so freaking good, I bet it tasted even better, but unfortunately I didn't manage to get a bite before my bf inhaled the whole damn thing. ANYWAYS, my quesadillas was good, but wasn't mind blowing. It was huge though, may I add. Haha. Anyways, the meat was super tasty, cheese was very melty, wasn't as spicy as I hoped but I guess that's what tapatio is for! Although tasty, it didn't look as yummy because there was all this juice, everywhere. It made my quesadillas soggy on the bottom which I didn't like. But whatever, I'm not THAT picky, I ate the whole damn thing in the end anyways. Haha. 

Well next time I come here I'm definitely getting the tacos. I was so torn between the quesadillas and taco, so this place deserves another try.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I straight up don't understand the hype and good reviews. I've been here twice and everything I've tasted is WAY too salty. The beans, the rice, the cicken verde, the chicken mole, the carnitas...so so salty. The garlic shrimp isn't, but it's somehow sharp and crunchy....
I like the sevice and the "build you're own ___" aspect, and I wish I could give it a better review, but I'm gonna go drink a whole lot of water instead.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I am NOT a burrito fan. My husband recommended this place, his words exactly "Best burrito in SF." Instead of my safe cheese quesadilla, I order a burrito.. I don't remember the name.. it had cheese, rice, salsa.. meat.. beans. It was the best burrito I have ever had. The meat (pork) was moist and tasty, along with the refried beans and rice. 

When I came there was not much of wait... maybe 2 patrons in front of me. I definitely see myself coming here again soon!
author: Alice E.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! definitely my go-to for mexican food :) i have few reasons why i continue eating meat, and the super carne asada nachos at la corneta is one of them. i've never had anything that i didn't like here, but I just have a soft spot for those nachos. 

If you go during dinner time though, be prepared to wait in line. There have been some pretty slow days where it's taken me at least 30 minutes to get my food to go. Parking can also be a hassle, but definitely worth it. 

If you eat in, make sure to drown your food in the green salsa. If not, make sure to ask for some to go.
author: Micki C.

description:
The is just as good as any of the taquerias in the Mission.  Lines get pretty long and they do not take credit cards, but other than that you will not be disappointed.

We often get the Baby Burritos for the kids which are just the right size and I am partial to the garlic prawn plate.  I have never heard of anyone not liking what they have ordered so I think you can't miss.
author: Bruce R.

description:
Enchiladas and a mexican coke. At the end of a long day, I always love stopping by La Corneta if no one's up to cooking that night.

With generous portions and solid flavor, I can't really complain about much. I usually go for either pork enchiladas or the quesadilla. You can't go wrong with either one.

The line does tend to get incredibly long at the end of the day when people are looking for a bite to eat after getting off work, but the employee's move fast. 

It's cash only, but there's a B of A ATM next door if you ever forget while progressing towards the cash register.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
The food is fresh, the line moves fast and there's variety.

The ladies behind the counter are really nice and remember your face when you come back. 

Affordable and filling food!

Personal favorite: super baby burrito with steak and extra salsa.
author: Sian F.

description:
When I come out of glen park BART station, all I wanna do is have a big ol delicious burrito. You know what BART stands for? Burritos Are Really Tasty. hell yes! I am full and happy

p.s. This is not Kristine, but her ever-loving fiance Dennis (just to be clear)
author: Kristine K.

description: Great food, but there's usually a long line. I always got the super burrito -- huge and cheap, the best combination!
author: Nick Z.

description: One of my favorite burrito places to go. I usually order their prawn quesadilla or super quesadilla, there so good! The wrap is nice and crispy and they give you just the right amount of cheese and meat. I always have left over. Eating a little more than half would get me really full! Other than their quesadillas their burritos are good too. I ordered a super baby burrito with spinach wrap and surprisingly it was pretty big. The spinach wrap gave it an extra favorite and it tasted pretty good. Normally i don't like the smell of the regular flour wrap because it has this weird smell and taste to it. Last but not least, their ceviche are Yumm.... a little bit watery but still good.
author: Joy L.

description:
I LOVE La Corneta!

I always get the same thing - The Super Steak & Shrimp Burrito or Quesadilla on spinach tortilla. I have a really hard time steering away from my GO TO, its just too damn good! 

The steak is seasoned just right and perfectly cooked. It's juicy, tender and meshes so well with the plump and flavorful fresh shrimp. The tortilla is chewy and holds everything in so delicately! Then the combination with beans, crisp lettuce, cheese, sour cream and salsa is just TDF! (To Die For).

Super generous with the ingredients!

I've been to some of the other locations, this is the best one hands down. Very consistent here.

Service is great.

Prices are reasonable.
author: Natasha S.

description: I've been going to la Corneta probably at least once a week since I was 4 so I might be a bit biased but it's the best damn taqueria in the city. Prawns, chicken mole, green salsa chicken, and carne asada burritos are my favorites. Highly recommended!
author: Medina C.

description: This burrito joint is okay. It is a tad overrated and slightly more expensive compared to the taquerias in the mission. They are kinda trendy (like a chipotle) more than they are authentic, which makes it even more puzzling when they are only cash only ....
author: Dorian T.

description: I grew up going here when I went to middle school in Glen Park. The ladies working there have been there for years and are some of the sweetest people. Anytime you order they will pack your order with love. Love full of tortillas, beans, salsa, and all types of carne. I highly recommend their quesadilla suiza because I believe they make the best one in the city. BUT that's just ME, a Mexican that knows everything there is to know about good Mexican food. Pfft.
author: Gladys M.

description:
Was originally going to give it 3 stars but I had the runs as soon as I got home. The meat was already premade and cooked so that already brought the rating down to 3 stars. I usually like the meat made fresh on the spot but since I was already here, I wasn't going to leave now. The only good thing about this place is them putting lettuce in the burritos. I've always liked lettuce in my burritos because they gave it that crunch.  

Service was horrible! The lady that worked the register was extremely rude. I asked for salsa and the lady just tossed it onto my tray. They give you a bunch of chips but only 1 little container for salsa (I even had to ask for it). 

Overall, I probably wouldn't come here again.

***Parking***: Street only. It may be a bit tough to find parking since it is a busy street. 

CASH ONLY!
author: Johnny G.

description:
Pretty pricey! I used to love La Corneta but now I feel like their food is overpriced and mediocre. Honestly, it used to be better (and cheaper!). Also, they've become pretty skimpy on the chips and salsa. Whenever I order a bunch of items, they'd give me enough chips to feed only one person. You would think they'd understand that a big order = many people = a need for more chips. 

Super baby burrito is pretty big and costs $5.50, which is an acceptable price. BUT!! Beware of their specialty burritos, which cost about $8.95-9.95. I just don't think a burrito should cost that much..sadly, I ordered a beef/shrimp specialty burrito once because I thought it was a rice dish! My fault for not reading the menu closely... ;(.  I ate it, and it really wasn't anything to rave about. Not worth the money. I am sticking to the baby burritos.

If I was new to La Corneta, I would say that it's "good" but, unfortunately, I know that their food and service has gone downhill over the years to the "mediocre" level.
author: Sally Y.

description:
Both of my hosts at Air BnB were talking up this joint, and I hadn't actually had anything in Glen Park to eat except a muffin earlier in the morning so I figured after a day of bumming around the city, I would come back and try a burrito here instead of the Mission, where I can go later.  They didn't lie, it was a good burrito.  I like everything green so I had the Especial with pollo en salsa verde with black beans and rice with guac in a spinach tortilla and it was appropriately delicious.  The meat and veggies tasted fresh and all the flavors worked together for me.  After that horrible deformity of a burrito I had at the Shoreline amphitheater, this was much more satisfying.  
Pro: There's a lot on the menu.  Yes, it's all your typical Mexican fare but since there's a lot of that, you have lots of choices
Pro: It's probably the least expensive meal I've had since I've been back to the Bay Area. In a ratio of portion to price, it was a full meal for less than ten bucks. 
Pro: The place was clean. The bathroom was even cozy.
Con: Too long of a line.  Just like at Shoreline, I have to wait a year before I can order.  I wasn't even super hungry when I got in line but I was starving by the time I could order. You wouldn't think that a taqueria on a Sunday night would be so busy but that's how the locals roll I guess.
Con: They're cash only.  Is it some kind of conspiracy with Glen Park restaurants to not take cards? I'm beyond complaining that this is the 21st century, blah blah blah. It's pretty obvious that they make a ton of money and they pretty much aren't losing business because they don't take cards, and there's ATMs everywhere anyway.  If you're a local, you would have no issue with this but if you're from out of town, it's a pain in the ass, especially if you wait in line for a half hour and get your burrito made to order and then they tell you no acceptan las trajetas, but I did have cash on me anyway so no worries. Just know that before going. 

Overall, it's a good local spot and I don't even need to tell people who live in Glen Park to go there because evidentially they already do, but if you're visiting, it's pretty good. 

I
author: Alex H.

description:
Okey, here it comes... Something very unpleasant made me to creat an account and write this review and it is only up to you to decide whether it is reasonably or not. 

Now, before I start telling my story of what pissed off I would like to mention that I have previously enjoyed eating here regularly for the past 4 years. 

 It is 9:48AM and I walk into the taqueria. I am the only soul there besides workers. I stand there ready to order but everyone just looks at me with big eyes. I kept and kept asking if I could order but I was simply ignored. Finally someone in an extremely rude manner told me that they were closed for another 5 minutes... (they could have said that as soon as I walked in and when the business is closed the doors are closed as well).  

I leave and go to the place across the street to have a very delicious breakfast. And I am off to enjoy the rest of my day...
author: John S.

description: driving by San Fran on my road trip and decided to come here. Best decision I ever made. My vegetarian burrito was great, the salsa's were great. I wish this restaurant were in San Diego because it would definitely be my go to place. If I am ever in Northern California I will stop by here. I am craving that burrito as I speak! too bad I am hundreds of miles away.
author: C A.

description:
My best friend lives down the street and swears this is the best place in the city. I think he says this because he's convinced himself it is because it's close to his house. While I won't be a hater to his face, I will say....'meh!' It was ok, long line on a Sunday afternoon...which made me excited that it may be pretty awesome. I ordered the Super Burrito and the meat was ok, and the salsa was just ok. I'm not picky by any means, but I have had some bomb mexican food and this wasn't it.

My buddy always gets the tamale...maybe I'll try that next time. It is conveniently located right next door to GPS...the only bar in this neighborhood, so that is a perk. The people who work here are lovely and super nice.

Salsa and Steak can really make or break your Mexican restaurant. I would have them perfect these two things and this place could maybe be a fav of mine.
author: Tina C.

description:
Its safe to say I was pretty much raised on this food. Over the years, the taste/portions have remained consistent. Nice amounts, for good prices. I've noticed they added some new entrées to the menu, so it's nice to see them experimenting. If you're having trouble deciding what to order, go with your gut. You can't go wrong here as EVERYTHING is delicious and always FRESH! 

Definitely try the Strawberry Fresca if you like sweet drinks. The burritos/tacos/tamales are BOMB, but if you're looking for a plate, I enjoy their seafood options so go for "Fish Dinner" (Salmon) or the Shrimp Dinner.
author: Ashley N.

description:
I lived in Glen Park for about 10 years and every time I come back I am so pleased to see the success La Corneta is enjoying. I spent my formative years hunched over Carne Asada Baby Burritos here, sipping Snapple and hanging out after school.

In those days the place was about half the size it is now, they expanded a long time ago but that has not changed the quality of the food. Their trademark peas and carrots in the rice is still the same. The only difference to me now is that I get a super burrito instead of a baby and a Tecate instead of a Snapple.

If you're in the area, La Corneta is a must. Just avoid peak hours cuz the place really fills up.
author: Konstantin G.

description: Been going here since the 90's, before the expansion when they only seated 8 people max... If you dont know about it, then you late.. Everything here is good!!! Point black period... Its somewhat a lighter healthy taqueria..
author: Mono L.

description: Cheese in quesadilla wasn't melted, they forgot to add beans, guacamole was runny, and they put the wrong beans in my boyfriends burrito. Chipotle is better.
author: Kate C.

description: Their food is awesome. I admit that at times it can be a bit messy, but it's so freaking delicious. Their prices are reasonable, but unfortunately, they only accept cash, but they make up for it with the quality of their food. Any time that I'm looking for a quality burrito close to home, they are the go to place. The restaurant is often well filled with customers but not to the point that makes for inconvenient wait times. They are certainly a must try if you're looking for a great Mexican burrito at a decent price.
author: dAvid s.

description: Gainz, nothing but bombass gainz. You can get gainz here, gainz is sold here, good gainz. The end.
author: Jack Z.

description: Steak and prawn burrito. Do it. Do it now. Don't do the churros though. They aren't fresh. If you are eating there, make sure to try their green sauce. It's good stuff. If you are dropping by during the lunch and dinner hours, be prepared to wait in line. Cash only.
author: Pursarth T.

description: Surf and turf burrito (prawn and steak) was delish! Great neighborhood and always bumping with good traffic at supper time.
author: Stacy A.

description:
I like the option of the baby burrito when I'm not very hungry. Meat  is flavorful. Always a line but the workers keep things moving.
 I had them fill a big order for a party once and it was ready on time.  

My go to taqueria.
author: Armando L.

description:
I got into an argument with a friend about the guac here.  He said it has sour cream in it and I said of course it doesn't.  I ended up calling the restaurant and they said it does have dairy in it.  Weird!  

I agree with other reviewers that it's a bit pricier than other places.  It's totally decent, but nothing about it wows me like El Toro.  I prefer El Toro.
author: Julia D.

description:
This place can cater like Crazy! Had a business Christmas party last year, for about 500 people, they did an excellent job from start to finish. They have a small army that caters and cleans their own dishes. They are well organized and love to serve their delicious food, of which there was plenty. Enchiladas were amazing, burritos, desserts, just everything. I cannot think of a better Mexican Restaurant in San Francisco other than La Corneta. La Taquieria on mission definitely has competition and do not even mention Poncho Villa when comparing it to La Corneta. Love this place and what they do, excellent service, and great food. 

When going to the restaurant in the city, parking must be sought. I recommend this place to anyone who loves great Mexican food.
author: Joshua Y.

description:
A solid place for Mexican that satisfies once I figured out what to order and what to avoid. This place is pricey as compared with the more obscure places in the Mission, but it is so conveniently located right off of the Glen Park Bart Station.  

Cleanliness factor is relatively high and the crowd is very pleasant. No worries about veggie options and special orders- this place can definitely accommodate with in my experience, a 90% accuracy rate.

Must try the following:
-Carnitas in any variety of starch option (taco, burrito, quesadillas, etc.)
-Nachos, super or regular (tip: chips on the side definitely works!)
-Fish options
-Chile relleno!!
- Frescas (strawberry, pineapple, melon)
-Tres leche cake
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Combo 4 !!  Comes with steak, chicken & prawns ( I just got the meat cut up vs whole pieces). Enough food to feed tacos to family of four (2 adults & 2 kids) with drink  under 20$.  Wow!!    The only complaint I got is the lady that served me never smiled.  She had a mean poker face.  Guess it must be the line.  Line never ends 6pm-8pm  might wanna call it in ,  but you know how that goes.
author: Joe B.

description:
After a busy day of packing and moving, I was STAAAAARVING!  I headed to Glen Park with Julie F. to get some yummy burritos.  We've been getting burritos from here for a while now, and noticed the prices have gone up.  =(  With the economy in the crapper, everyone's got to try to make money somehow.  

I always get the Super Carne Asada burrito( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/uDNGBPuzNCbKxaDXLprzcw/l )...sorry for the fuzzy pic...must've been shaking from the hunger.  The guacamole and sour cream make it oh so good.  They put plenty of meat, so you definitely get stuffed.  Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs, and we also split a Quesadilla Suiza with Carne Asada( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/2sgTL5MHZn9bToDFu7N6Cw/l ).  This was my first time having any of their quesadillas, and it was delicious!  Lots of meat and cheeeeeese!  

If you happen to go during the lunch or dinner rush, you might be waiting in a pretty long line.  This place is always poppin'.  Parking can be a pain sometimes, so you might have to stalk people and follow them to their cars.
author: Patra I.

description:
So my sister-in-law told me about this place, but I never found the time to actually go there...until now. 

When we arrived, the line was super long! It curved around & the end of the line was near the register. I thought, "Must be good!" Haha. It wasn't a long wait at all.

I ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito = YUM! Can't go wrong with that.

We luckily found 2 tables to put together so we all could sit together. There's salsa bottles at the table. What a convenience!

Service was great. The owner (I think he was the owner) even came up to our table to check if we needed anything. Didn't expect that, but THANK YOU :)

Parking is a little tough in the area, but it's nothing to stress about.
author: Jessica A.

description: Yesterday, I found a large chicken bone in my burrito.  This is the final straw, there have been dangerous chicken bones in the burrito on several occasions and I will not risk it anymore.  My advice is to be very cautious when eating a chicken item here.
author: Jerry H.

description:
Super bueno Mex. Food!
I've never been dissapointed here(except for when I order nachos for some reason). Everything is awesome. Shrimp quesadila with veggies is where it's at. Also they make a real good chorizo burrito. Cheap too!
author: William K.

description: Loving Mexican food, I find that this place has one of the best burritos that I have ever tasted.
author: C B.

description: Best burritos in the city, they have healthy delicious choices and their food is NEVER greasy. I've been coming to this taqueria since I was a kid, so it's a staple for me.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
WHERE'S THE COMMON AREA COURESTY?

i decided to walk around Glen Park during lunchtime before I jumped on the Bart to the office. I passed La Corneta in search for "something good to eat for lunch" and saw bookoo people in line. Here? At Glen Park? How interesting. Hidden yummie spots, gotta love it. I thought to myself "it's got to be a good place to eat, but there's alot construction workers inside? haha". What really tempted me to come inside was seeing the portions of the people who were eating by the window.. huge burritos in your face screaming at you COME INSIDE, COME INSIDE. I eventually walked in and joined the line and ordered the Chicken Taco with a side of rice. Small order, just to try it out, trying not to waste money.. especially when our recession is in a crisis!

I recevied my Chicken Taco but no side of rice after mentioning it 3x. Uhm hello I know I'm not a quiet person? They have enough staff you'd think one of them would have heard me say "with a side order of rice". By the time I came to pay I still didn't receive rice and they gave me a bag of free tortilla chips and asked for what kind of salsa and i've mentioned "mild" 2x to not even get salsa with my chips. ANNOYING. Then to only see dirty available tables for seating. WTF? There's alot of workers standing around NOT doing their job. I decided to clean my own damn table and sit to enjoy my food. Common area? Courtesy? What the hell is going on?! I might as well have gone to Taco Bell.

 I did enjoy my taco for a very affordable price. As I ate my (soggy) taco with a fork, I skimmed the menu hung on the wall and said to myself "DAMN THIS PLACE IS PRETTY GOOD AND AFFORDABLE" but didn't know this place was ran by the hearing impaire.

1) Service - my experience; sucks
2) Food - delicious
3) Price - Affordable
4) Portions - filling

I will be sure to order "TO GO" with a shouting voice to make sure all my requested items will be included. 

until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: This is a nice choice when your too lazy to head down to the Mission. I like coming down here once in awhile but still go to Mission instead of here for their choices of meats. This place does do a good job in making a burrito and would rather eat here than the Burrito Express around the corner. Just the place get so busy lines form inside the taqueria.
author: M C.

description:
Love this place.  The food is good and worth staying in line for.  They're extremely busy at dinner time, so expect a line that goes around the place.  

The only issue I have is do not call in your order.  They will make hella mistakes every time.
author: Cindy L.

description: For the life of me, I've never understood the appeal of this place, other than location. But today took the cake. Long line, mushy burritos, bad service. My burrito had no chance for garnish. If you want a good burrito on this end, try La Laguna or way out on Mission St. This is a skipper.
author: Vincent R.

description: If I were bald, I would eat their Steak and Prawn Quesadilla every day instead of using Rogaine.
author: Todd W.

description:
I've been going here for a few years now, and have always thought it was a solid tacqueria. Over this period of time I've learned a couple of things and honed my routine to a keen razor edge. (Or perhaps "rut" is the proper term?) I would share with you these below:

1. If during a peak hour, call your order in. Upon arrival, stroll nonchalantly to the front of the long line and wait patiently for about 2 customers for the cashier to ring you up. It is important to effect nonchalance, but not an air of entitlement.)

2. Order the baby burrito. It's enough. If my wife and I are sharing the meal, we get the full size.

3. If you are getting takeaway, ask for their roasted salsa. mmmmmmm....

4. Give the steak and prawn burrito a try. 

So why finally do a review now? This past week I was in there and standing in line (broke rule #1 above!!!), with my 13 m/o daughter in my arms. I actually didn't mind because she was in a cuddly mood and was giving me a lot of wet, sloppy kisses which is always fun. 

Anyway, I was thinking that I ought to ask for a side of some beans or guacamole or something for her. Turning it over in my mind and finally near the register, I was about to ask when suddenly one of the girls behind the counter said "your daughter is beautiful" and handed me a rolled up corn tortilla with some rice and refried beans in it!

+2!!! one for the compliment and one for the stellar service!

I would have given them a 4 1/2 review anyway, but the experience above easily pushes them into 5 stars.

Their carnitas rocks too.
author: Peter T.

description: This is a standard fare burrito joint one block from BART. I've had better Mexican food for sure, but this spot is convenient. It's cash only though so be prepared.
author: Jason W.

description:
So I came with my husband two weeks ago because it was closer to our house. We usually go to the one on Mission (between 23rd & 24th) so we thought being La Corneta it would be exactly the same food. Boy was I wrong, yes it's the same menu but the quality is VERY different. We both had the Super Tostadas with pork carnitas and as soon as we bit the first piece of pork we knew something was wrong. First of all, the other Corneta doesnt put any fat or tendons or nerve endings in their carnitas this was one was full of fat (GROSS) and the food tasted funny like something was off. 

Long story short at the end of the night we both had food poisining and we couldnt stop vomiting for 2 days. I seriously dont ever want to come to this La Corneta ever again! 

The only reason I gave it 2 stars was the fast service for the busy crowd on a friday night. THATS IT!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!

I usually go for the super veggie, just cause, I don't know, it's yummy ?!  Either that or the super baby with carne asade.  Their burritos are super juicy so definitely a plus. Good portion sizing as well so be prepared for food coma, I always do. 

And if you haven't tried it yet,  give their spinach wrap a go. It's green, intriguing, I know.
author: Annie C.

description: The super chicken and prawn burrito was excellent...best surf n turf burrito I've had
author: Trev C.

description: I love this place! The food quality is always consistent, the service is good! They have a great variety for meat and veggie lovers, and there is always parking!! This is a miracle especially in our fair city. You don't have to go all the way to the mission to get great Mexican food!
author: Beatrice K.

description:
Ahh yes!

That's my usual mental outcry when I am behind the wheel heading to this wonderful burrito store! I don't care what anyone else says: this is the best I've tasted on a consistent basis. You hear that yelpers?! The best. I've been to other spots in the Bay that were tasty, BUT not consistently. I hate being a repeat customer somewhere that doesn't deliver after the first bite. What's better than knowing you'll be full and happy every time you drop in?...like I said the best. 

Tacos, burritos, quesadillas, combo plates...they're all a hit.  They've got plenty variety on tortillas, beans and meat- oh by the way ALL FRESH every day! I read someones review on here crying wah wah about the meat not being cooked right in front of them, yet they also complain about waiting in line? WTF do u want? They make their meat fresh every morning and cook a new batch once the first ones gone because they go through that much carne a day. Yeah, they got it like that. 
P.S. Any seafood WILL be cooked before your bug eyes. 

Chicken in spicy red salsa (pollo en salsa roja) grilled chicken (pollo asado), and grilled steak (carne asada) are the usual suspects for me and Mmm ay que rica are they yum yums on my tongue tongue! I'm yet to try out they carnitas but I'm sure that's crackin too! And the prawn(camaron) anything is delicioso!

Melon (cantaloupe) and strawberry drinks are miraculous to the last drop, and horchata is thirst quenching. Top that off with quick, friendly service and what do you get kids: 5 stars! Count 'em: 1,2,3,4,5. In the words of Flavor Flav: yeaaaahhhhh booooiiiiii, wooooooowww

Fair warning: cash only. B of A 15 ft away, wells Fargo across the street.
author: D V.

description: There are better taquerias in San Francisco, but this one is excellent. Everything is fresh. The flavors are good, albeit straight up the middle. The agua frescas are excellent. Good prices. Nice people. Cleaner than most taquerias, especially given the massive turnover. And convenient if you live in Glen Park.
author: Michael S.

description:
I must have really ordered wrong based on these other reviews. I came here with the wifey. She got the carnitas nachos, which were alright, but too much beans and not enough guac, my opinion. The problem though, is that I ordered a pollo en mole burrito. I was really excited that they had mole...I though. 

I am not sure who is smoking what, but this was one of the farthest things from mole I have ever tasted. I won't even say it was the worst version of mole I have ever had because it was not even a version of mole. It was just some shredded, chicken breast drowned in some flavorless, watery light brown sauce. I had pictured a very dark brown/black, rich, flavorful mole. I really don't know what this was supposed to be, but it was gross. Not only that, but it soaked through my tortilla instantly so that I was left with a soggy mess that I had to eat with knife and fork like a real gringo. 

I have been all over Mexico, have eaten Mexican food all over the U.S., and, more importantly, am Mexican-American, and I can not figure out what they served me. I strongly disagree with Talia G. that anything I tasted from here was better than Farolito, Vallarta, or even Pancho Villa for that matter. I would never dream of returning after this disappointing mess.
