author: Miguel V.

description: One of my favorite taquerias in SF! Fast service, tasty food, pretty clean restaurant. My go-to order is a Super Baby Carne Asada Burrito. I LOVE that they have a 'baby burrito' option. The regular burrito is actually  the size of a newborn human being, so having a smaller option is much appreciated. The ceviche (fish or shrimp) is also quite good and very affordable!
author: T N.

description:
Thumbs up for:
Consistently good food
Cheap food

Thumbs down for:
LOOONG lines! Every. Single. Freakin. Day.
CASH ONLY
Horrible parking situation
Hard to find a seat b/c it's so crowded
No salsa bar - you have to ask for it, and you need to be specific of which kind you want

I recommend calling ahead and getting your food to go. Don't forget to bring cash.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Great spot for Healthy Vegetarian Burritos.

I ordered the Super Chile Relleno Burrito on a Spinach Tortilla. Which included, a steamed spinach wrap/tortilla, with rice, black beans, chile relleno (a cheese stuffed chile which is not spicy and covered with a beaten egg mixture and cooked), lettuce, guacamole, sour cream, cheese, and a small amount of salsa. It was wonderful. I only ate half because I wanted to save some for dinner and with just half and a couple chips I am completely satisfied.

The best part is that they have different burrito options for instance they have the BABY BURRITO for those who want portion control, the REGULAR BURRITO in case your hungry and the SUPER BURRITO in case your starving or just want leftovers. 

A must try for any burrito lover. I can't wait to go back.
author: Norma Denisse S.

description:
Three little words is all you need to know:  Mango Agua Fresca.

So I see that prices have gone up a bit (super baby burrito= $5.50; super burrito=$7.75) but their burritos are awesome, as always.  

Cash only.
author: Joanne G.

description:
This La Corneta Taqueria located in Diamond Steet near the Glen Park BART station is one of our favorite taqueria in San Francisco. I have a strong affinity to this area because I use to go to school in Saint John Elementary, just a couple of blocks away from here, and I remember this neighborhood being run down, so I'm glad this area has improved throughout the years.

La Corneta is your typical Mexican eateries, but with the IT factor to it. They have one of the best Super Burrito and Super Prawn Quesadilla you'll ever find and their Quesadilla Suiza with Carne Asada is just downright NASTY (nasty all-caps is ghetto lingo for awesome). You can also get their combination plate, the Quesadilla Suiza, Prawns & Grilled Mushrooms for a very fair price. I love their supersize servings that come in a sombrero size plate. Complimentary chips and salsa with most meals and prices are great.

The only thing I'm not too keyed up about this particular La Corneta is that they do not take credit card. I'm a no cash carrying chap myself (because I believe that cash should stay in the bank or in my case, I just don't have any), but it just seems a little inconvenient. Parking is also a challenge so you have to stalk someone to get their parking.

Overall it's one of the best Mexican joints you'll find with a rock bottom price, but minus 2 stars for the parking and cash only policy.
author: Mel B.

description: La Corneta has gone straight downhill. I called and ordered 6 burritos to go ahead of time. They read the order back. I ended up getting 5 burritos and the order was all wrong: the super veggie with hot salsa was not hot at all and consisted of a glob of sour cream, a spoonful of beans, and the rest cheese and rice dripping with chicken fat. The other super veggie was just rice, beans, and cheese. The chicken mole was just super chicken. No mole. $40 of gross buritto. What a bummer. I won't be going back.
author: Tee B.

description:
I ordered a prawn burritto.  It was sooo good, I ate the whole thing.  I NEVER eat a whole burrito by myself. NEVER.

I think it might have MSG, cause I drank 3 bottles of water after.......
author: Angelica C.

description:
I don't know what the hype is about this place. It's an above average taqueria. The service and fresh ingredients are a plus, but don't really make it 

To justify my 3 stars instead of the expected 5, I gave this place 3 shots. I usually give places more than 1 shot before I judge unless it's extremely bad.

This place is always busy so expect to wait. Or just call in ahead of time. 

The burritos are fresh and not overly salty, but both time my burrito came apart when I unwrapped it home. So its like eating a meal on top of a tortilla. 

Final word: It is a good taqueria, but dont live up to the hype that it gets.
author: U L.

description:
There are always the lines no matter how early or how late I go here, but the staff works quickly so it's never a long wait.

I like that I am given a choice when it comes to the tortilla on my burrito orders because I really like the spinach tortilla.  The burritos are huge and overstuffed and they've really loaded up on the meats each time I have visited.  Great carne asada and pollo en salsa verde.  You also get your choice of beans and either a hot or mild salsa.  On occasion the meat is seasoned just a bit too salty for my taste, and in those instances I tend to break out the hot sauce to hide the saltiness.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I've ONLY been here because of fellow yelper Annie L. and her praises of this taqueria when i've always insisted of going elsewhere because of the lack of parking and such.

I've gotten their burritos, and the only thing making it last is their rice that has peas and carrots. what a genius idea!? its like fried rice in a burrito almost.
author: Kenny L.

description: Excellent food, service, and value. We fed a family of four for $28 in San Francisco!! Just remember, no credit cards.
author: Dev V.

description:
One of the best spots for burritos in the city. Best part is that there is always some parking spots in the parking lot around the corner. 

Love their super baby burritos cause the regulars are a bit much if you get a drink and some chips.
author: Derek N.

description: Great Mexican food and I lived in East LA. Huge portions. Love the steak n prawns burrito. But everything is fantastic here. Always a long line but worth it.
author: Phil N.

description: Adding a comment. This place is also fantastic for catering.  I introduced it to my company and now we've had it catered for company lunches many times.  Around $10 per head gets you an incredible spread of meat, tortillas, chips, and alllll the fillings.
author: Gina I.

description:
The BEST taqueria in the area! Well, the only taqueria. Beggars can't be choosers! A tiny bit more expensive than the average taqueria in the Mission, but overall, still worth it. What I like best about this place is that they also have prawns.

Steak and prawns burrito! JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
My buddy took me here for depression tacos last night. Meaning, I was crying and spilling the drama that is my life, and he suggested going out and getting tacos.

Well, it worked. The chicken taco was plain and surprisingly flavorful, filled with refried beans, grilled chicken and salsa. That paired with a plain cheese quesadilla caused all my tears to go away. A nice little place in  Glen Park for taqueria.
author: Jennifer B.

description: One of the best Taqueria around SF. The best thing is that it is super clean compared to many. I always go here when I am craving a super burrito. I usually get the carne asada/ lengua and it is the best. Add a melon drink and you are set!!!
author: JM S.

description: One of the best burritos in San Francisco.  Love the wheat tortillas.  The Carne Asada is great.  You also can't go wrong with almost anything they make.  They even have empanadas.  Lines are long so make sure you come before 5 pm during the weekday and you won't have a problem.
author: L V.

description:
I always feel silly when I come here because I always get the Super Baby burrito. As the name implies, 'Baby' = smaller than regular (maybe around 2/3 the size? but still bigger than La Taqueria's standard burrito), and 'Super' = the standard cheese, guac, and sour cream.

It's definitely enough to fill me up and I don't feel like I need to polish off a huge burrito to keep pace with my friends like I do at other joints. And if I can't finish the regular, who wants burrito leftovers?!? Yeah, I'm not the high volume food consumer I used to be, but I always leave satisfied.

The workers are always nice and smiling which is always a plus as well. I thought it was my long hair and winning smile, but they seem to do it for everyone. Oh well.
author: Andrew C.

description: When I heard that the line can wrap around the block for this place, I hoped we'd have enough time to eat. I was so happy we did! We had the mushroom quesadilla, carnitas burrito and a side of guacamole. Delicious doesn't even begin to describe this place!
author: Jenn G.

description:
I remember when La Corneta opened in Glen Park, and it was awesome.  The owner was really friendly and dedicated, service fast and efficient, and the food fresh and delicious.  The past few times I've been back to La Corneta I've found the food to be disappointing at best, but this last weekend was the last straw.  I was STARVING, and showed up at La Corneta to grab a veggie burrito.  And it was bad.

How do you fuck up a veggie burrito?

I tell you how:  you make it somehow, inexplicably, soggy.  A super vegetarian burrito at La Corneta contains beans, rice, salsa, guacamole, lettuce, sour cream, and cheese.  You get the exact same version at El Farolito, and yet that burrito is not soggy at all.  But this thing was WET.  In a way you do not want your burrito to be wet.  Like, wet on the outside, once I took off the foil.  And it pisses me off.  Not only is there an abundance of amazing, cheap, wonderful taquerias in San Francisco, there is also NO EXCUSE to fuck up a vegetarian burrito.  None.  I don't know if they need to start grilling their tortillas, or what, but I am sad to say that La Corneta will NOT be receiving my local business dollars any time soon.

I also noticed that the food station was a MESS.  Come on, La Corneta.  Pick up your damn game.
author: Alanna C.

description: One of the best taqueria's in the area!  Cash only but excellent food!! There are a couple of bank ATMs - one next door and one across the street . I've been there a few times - no complaints!! Definitely worth going to
author: Sniper D.

description: Pound for pound, best Taqueria in the Bay (or at least in SF). The price isn't the best. 8-10 bucks for your meal, but for the quantity, it can't be beat. Their Quesadillas are packed! Think of a deep dish pizza wrapped inside a tortilla and you've got a super quesadilla at La Corneta. The Nachos are good and they're not stingy like some other places. They actually make their chips and their salsa is great! Burritos are huge also! You can bet you'll have to wait in line here no matter what time of day you come, but it's sooooo worth it. Just be prepared to have some left over for a snack!
author: Aaron Y.

description: This place is good, don't get me wrong. It's not OMFG good, but good. I don't anticipate going back though because they are cash only. In this day and age, that just seems inconsiderate and greedy for a business, especially a burrito joint.
author: Azul C.

description: Muy deliciosa. I used to go here 3 times a week before I had a girlfriend and now I go once every couple of weeks. :) Favorite dish is simple: one regular taco with no tortilla, refried beans, chicken verde, topped with guacamole, cilantro and mild salsa. The only thing I'm not too keen on is their mild salsa - too many onions and tomatoes aren't really fresh. The line is always out the door because this is the only reasonably priced places to grab quick food that's not fast food around...oh and because the food is pretty great.
author: Carrie S.

description:
Good salsa. Nice marinated tofu. You can get a better burrito over in Excelsior (perhaps obvious?) but this place does okay if you're in Glen Park and hungry.

While it's nice they try at a "vegetarian" menu, minus stars for not understanding what vegetarian is. While the refried beans are made with olive oil (nice!) the rice is made with chicken broth.

If you are a strict vegan, you may also want to avoid the guacamole, as there was quite obvious cross contamination with the cheese and sour cream nearby.
author: Tamara F.

description: Ummm... I reviewed the wrong location, although I suppose that most of them are similar. I went to the one in the mission
author: Ronjini M.

description:
This place is the bomb dot com. I love this place. It is my go to burrito place. I don't think anything else can really compare.
When I first started coming here, I would get the super baby burrito with carne asada. It was pretty good. Sometimes, the carne asada would be a little dry but it would still be good because they would shove guac, cheese, lettuce, salsa, corn and all that other good stuff into there and it would just be amazing in your mouth.
Nowadays, I switch it up and get the super baby burrito with chicken in green sauce. I don't know what is in that green sauce but it makes that chicken super moist and super amazing. 
Paired with a plate of chips and salsa? Heaven. Especially after a long day and you just want to pig out.
Tips for kids with chinese parents who don't like trying new things: I took my dad, who doesn't like to get out of his comfort zone of chinese food. He was reluctant but I got him my go to chicken in green sauce super baby burrito and he loved it! So maybe your picky chinese parents will like it too!
author: Jessica H.

description:
i live 5 mins away so this is my go-to for mexican. 

the super fish really is the bomb, i have not tried anything else and i am satisfied. the nachos look good though

cons: no salsa bar and it's awkward to ask them for more than 2 salsas, when i really want 5

pros: everything else. the burrito is big, the salmon is really fresh, juicy, and tasty. the ingredients are good, the usual "super" ingredients

always a long line, but still fast, the staff is nice

a pretty good mexican place
author: Emily M.

description:
This review is only based on one bad order so I will probably give this place an update once I have the chance to come back. Two of my favorite things to eat are mushrooms and quesadillas. However, they do not taste too great when combined. The mushroom quesadilla just doesn't work on so many levels. The mushrooms don't really stick to the cheese so they all end up falling out. Then the quesadilla becomes soggy as it sits in a pool of mushroom and greasy oil juice. 

I should have just tried the super baby burrito. I saw that they slice their jalapenos fresh and also use fresh lime juice. The ingredients look very good unlike many other Mexican joints. Lesson learned for my next visit.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
I'm a little surprised to find that I've not reviewed La Corneta, because I've probably eaten here 100 times over the years. When we're feeling lazy and a little on the hungry side, "burrito" is the operative word in our house, and in our house burrito is synonymous with La Corneta. 

Expect to get in a line when you come here. Depending on the night, the line can be 5-20 people. No problem, it goes pretty quickly but you will almost surely have to wait. 

Service from the folks working behind the counter is casual and friendly. 

The food is good, reliable, solid.I like it that you can get a smaller "baby burrito," which is plenty of food for me. My favorite, salmon, is grilled fresh after you order. The carnitas and carne asado are pretty good, too. I love the ceviche tostadas - unusual for a San Francisco taqueria, and very tasty. Aguas frescas are nice too.

The price is right - a baby fish burrito and an agua for under $10. 

Quantity beats most of the local taquerias I've been to and it's better than any of the chains I've been to. I probably like the food at La Taqueria on Mission a little better, but the place is kind of a pain in the neck to deal with, the experience at La Corneta is a little nicer, and the choices are a lot more extensive.
author: David G.

description: I was in the area today and I was craving for a good burritos, as i don't eat them too often. Probably my 4th times here and always a good lunch weather you eat here or take it to-go. I order the Steak and Shrimp and add rice, black beans, cilantro, and mild salsa, I don't like too much stuff, just a simple one is best for me. Steak was juicy and moist as well as the shrimp, as they cooked them to order. The tortilla chips were a little disappointment because I like them on the thick and crunchy side. I would come back and try their other items like the fish tacos and combos. By the way, I was there at 1 pm with a very small line of 2-3 people, only 2/3 full on tables, plenty of parking on the street and had  good service...hummm maybe I got lucky today!!!!!
author: Wolfy W.

description:
I can't really discern Mexican food vs. authentic Mexican food.  However, this place rocks because the ingrediants are fresh and flavorful.  The spicy salsa are damn spicy!  The only thing missing is a good margarita.  =)  

The only downfall for LC are lack of parking space and the long lines at peaked times at the Diamond Heights shop.

UPDATE:  I just went to LCT this weekend with some friends. I really have no idea what has happened to this place.  The flavor is just not there anymore.  The salsa was bland and not so fresh.  The burritos seemed to have shrunk in size.   I understand why there was no longass line at noon on a weekend.  Very disappointing.
author: Kris H.

description:
I've gone to this place by happenstance over the years, mostly during my 4 years of "hard time" commuting to Silicon Valley.  La Corneta isn't just near BART, it's by 280 on-ramps as well.  I was never amazed enough by the place to even notice the food really.  Part of which was "commuter fog," since it was most frequently a choice after a hard day's work and drive.  Not that it was bad, which I would have noticed...and noted by never returning.  Still, seeing the great reviews here prompted me to want to pay more attention and really check it out.  

Got a grilled chicken burrito, special-style.  The chicken itself is excellent and that's a major upside.  But any place that won't melt the cheese can't make a great burrito.  No, it's not it a book somewhere.  But it's my f'n rule, and I'm posting it here for your consideration.  Add to that, weak rice, pretty good beans, slightly above average salsa, lame chips and brusque service by drones and I'll give you 3 stars.  The variety of menu options is good, the long line is bad.  I can't give 4 stars to a taqueria I wouldn't go out of my way for...ya dig?
author: Ted R.

description: This place gets convenience points as it is in my neighborhood.  Compared to some of the taquerias in the Mission, this place is missing something. What it is, I'm not sure, but I never leave feeling like "this is such an amazing restaurant." Perhaps it is the fact that they do not have a salsa bar? Call me picky but that is a big selling point in my eyes!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
love love LOVE this place!  one of my top 3 mexican restaurants in san francisco.  there are times when the line is a bit daunting, but the second you take a bite into your food, it is soooo worth it.  i get the baby super burrito with prawns and black beans.  i recommend one of the combos, too.  i like the one with prawns (is there a pattern here?), grilled mushrooms, and suiza.  it's a hefty meal, though, and can be shared with another person.

if you're in the glen park area, stop on by.  CASH ONLY!
author: Tina L.

description:
I have been eating here pretty regularly for the past few weeks, so it would suffice to say the food is good...but that was until I watched them make my grilled chicken salad!  

First, it's made differently each time...I'm never quite sure how big it will be or what ingredients will be used...and second, last night I discovered that they are handling all of the ingredients with bare hands...I don't know about you, but there is something about a woman with dirty fingernails digging in my lettuce that makes my skin crawl...As I watched this atrocity, she then drenched my salad in dressing...I usually get it on the side...I didn't think she was going to drown my salad...

When I told her that I wanted the dressing on the side, she let out this sigh and begrudgingly shoved the contents of the plate into the trash...like it took her an hour to put the thing together and I was imposing upon her...WTF guys? 

Is it too much to ask for them to wear some gloves while handling the food and to get a little friendly service?  

Anyway, the burritos are good...my boyfriend orders the especial with chicken all the time.  I will stick with my tostada (black beans, grilled chicken, salsa and guac...no rice!).  So much for salads at La Corneta...No glove...no love!!!  xoxoxoxoxo
author: Rebecca M.

description:
LOVE this place. They have the best tasting chicken burrito that I have ever had. I think it is the way that they grill the chicken that makes it different. To be honest I have no idea but it is GOOD!

With a few friends that live in Glen Park I find this place to be a great spot to catch up, laugh and get some good food in our bellies. I have not strayed away from anything else other than the chicken burrito. 

One other reviewer mentioned that parking was difficult and to be honest I have never had an issue. There is a small alley right around the corner that there is always spots in and if not I almost always find one on the street.
author: Ryan B.

description: The food at this place is good. I wouldn't say it's great since it's a little on the bland side, but they do offer spicy salsa. The reason I am giving this place one star is because of the level of customer service. This was my first time actually going in (my mom or one of my sisters usually does the pick up) and I have NEVER been treated or spoken too like that. I get it, its prime time for lunch but I let her know I was ordering three burritos. I had our order on my phone so I wouldn't get anything wrong. When I was ordering i looked down and read off my phone and she for some reason was offended? She wasn't listening and ended up making two super veggie burritos when I only needed one. Then when I tried to say something she told me that since I was on my phone she didn't understand me?? Instead of arguing with her and since there was a big line behind me I proceeded to the cashier where I explained the situation. I paid for what she made me just so I could get the hell out of there. I have worked in customer service for 5 years now and would never treat someone like that. Basically decent food but NEVER going back.
author: Iliana C.

description: Huge menu with some good (mostly) affordable items. I like how they actually know how to roll burritos. They have some really bomb tamales that are better than most places. Its a popular place with an intense line depending on the day, but its good because the high turnover ensures the freshness of their ingredients so thats cool. Overall, this is our favorite quick and easy place to go for good mexican food.
author: John T.

description:
Amended back up from 3 to 4 stars as of late 2011: they have gotten their groove back, and I patronize Corneta again. Review below is for entertainment only.

With a heavy heart, I can no longer fully endorse La Corneta in Glen Park. I used to love this place, but quality has dipped lately. It's not like I would never eat here again, but my last 2 or 3 steak burritos have been fatty and stringy. The last couple of grilled chicken burritos featured dried-out pollo. So I gave my go-to burrito joint five last chances, realized I was an abused husband, and left for good. At this point La Corneta for me would strictly be a shameful drunken booty call, but sitting here sober as I type, I am shaking my head 'no, never again'.
author: J C.

description:
This section of the city (Mission District) is not very touristy and is easy to get to on BART. The food and atmosphere was authentic Mexican food. 

I had the #3 CARNE ASADA & PRAWNS. It was way too much food but I was so elated at how good the food was I ate it all and set there in a beautifully delicious coma.

I highly sugest going here. If not for the food then for the section of the city.
author: Todd Q.

description:
It seems La Corneta just wants to get big and... and... well... Mediocre.

I've been going to this place before it became the monster it is today (when the donut shop was next door...).  The food used to be always hot, the queues weren't as long and the food was positively delicious.

As time has gone on, I now phone ahead my order (when there's no busy signal).  I'm told it'll be 10/15 minutes - I get there in the alotted amount of time... and I wait another 15/20 minutes while they make my order. 

And when I got home last night after waiting the additional 20 minutes with my phoned in order, my burrito was cold, tasteless and positively disappointing.  I also ordered the combination #3 plate which is supposed to have grilled flank steak... The guy running the grill put the steak on the flameless cook top - tasted like crap - I could have made it @ home.  

Watery salsa; thinned out guacamole; greasy/wet chips.
 


Definitely not the experience it used to be.
author: Right S.

description: Hands down my favorite taqueria. The food is always fresh and so tasty.My daughter loves their rice and beans. I'm in love with how I can walk right up and eat. I don't have to wait long unless their is a long line. Also there is a parking lot on the side street which makes is so convenient  to just park and eat.
author: Des A.

description: I've eaten here dozens of times,  the Shrimp Burrito is amazing. The nacho's are good and quesadilla's are Huge. If you're in Glen park I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: David L.

description:
This places makes it easy to stay on a diet. Yes, I did say "diet" for a Mexican joint. 

Order the mixed greens salad without dressing and add grilled chicken or shrimp. Fantastic salads with jicama, carrots, tomatoes, avocado, and more. Can't go wrong. This is a "special" item on the menu so ask for it. 

If you want to live it up, the seafood tacos and burritos are awesome. Try shrimp or salmon. Definitely beats a chicken or beef burrito any day!

Would give this place 5 stars, but the place is usually a bit busy in the prime dining hours and the tables aren't bussed as timely as they should be.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Came here on 3 separate occasions:

The first time I came here, I showed up somewhat late, around 9pm (they close at 10) and ordered a super burrito with al pastor but they didn't have any left, so I went with carne asada instead. The burrito is good, I don't know what else to say other than that I really wanted to try their al pastor.

Second time I came here, I came in the afternoon during lunch hour and I got the al pastor I wanted and I definitely prefer the al pastor over carne asada. It's a bit more fatty but that's to be expected but I don't regret it one bit. It was pretty packed though during lunch hour, I was a bit worried that I got the wrong order since they kind of line up the orders by the cashier but thankfully, I got my order.

Came back again for the third time and ordered a super quesadilla suiza with carne asada (I prefer carne asada over al pastor on my quesadilla). Unfortunately, I can say I've had better, it didn't feel like they put enough meat and cheese in it and that's really all a quesadilla is made of.

All in all, I would definitely come back for their burritos and maybe their plates.
author: Richard C.

description:
Great, consistent, fresh.

Lots of flavor in their shrimp, and the horchata must be home made. Probably my favorite Mexican place that I've been to so far in the Bay Area.
author: Barbie L.

description: SUPER STEAK AND SHRIMP QUESADILLA!!! so delicious, so much flavor, even my boyfriend who's not a fan of Mexican cuisine SUGGESTED going to this restaurant because their ingredients are so fresh. Took off a star because the tables and chairs felt pretty sticky and crusty but the price and food are superb.
author: Alice C.

description:
To everyone who says this is the best burrito place in the city: I second that emotion! I too have been going here for years, and at one point ate a burrito from here every other day. No other place comes close to the deliciousness that happens when their grilled chicken combines with their beans, cheese, and guac. I have even been known to freeze La Corneta burritos and bring them back to my current home in DC. They're that good. 
My go-to is grilled chicken burrito on wheat tortilla, super, with mild and hot salsa. An underappreciated gem is the fish (salmon) taco with black beans.
author: Belinda K.

description:
A great little burrito place 5 min away from my house. I enjoy going here and ordering a baby burrito as well as a nice aguas frescas which are house made. The Burrito is made pretty well, and they give you complimentary chips with it, which makes it that much better!

Overall it's a great burrito at a great price. The baby is plenty for most burrito eaters!
author: Raymond A.

description:
As I sunk my teeth into the oh-so-heavenly and perfectly-rolled Al Pastor burrito, my eyes welled with tears...
I set my burrito down.. laid my head on my friend's shoulder and literally hugged & rocked back n forth with her for a moment for bringing just such joy into my world. 

Then I went back to eating and I don't think I took any more breaks till that delicious, torpedo of tasty-filled ecstasy was safely sucked down my throat..into the depths of my intestinal walls and such. 

Seriously, it has come to this.. burritos bring me more joy than anything else in this world. If loving them is wrong, I don't wanna be right.

Great chips too..light, crispy and went well with their roasted salsa (ask for it!). 

I went on Thursday, it is now Sunday and I still can't get that burrito off my mind. 

I would like to let that burrito know, that if I could, I would eat him every single day. But, doing so would cause extreme health problems, so I cannot. But, I promise to live a healthier lifestyle just to be able to spend more moments like that again.
Oh this Valentines Day filled with sweet Al Pastory love, I'd like dedicate this song to La Corneta's burrito (no rice):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P8SPeR60lRI&feature=related

xoxo
Thinking of you.. always
T.A
author: T C.

description: Been going here for 16 years and it just keeps getting better.  Prices have inched up because they're not willing to compromise quality -- which is what makes it the long-line, well-worth-the-wait, amazing tenured and wonderful staff place that it is.  The guy that chops the meat has been there for over 15 years, and many of the wonderful women who so patiently wait for each person's customized order, have been there a decade or more.  That says just a little something.  Keep doing what you're doing.  Call in if you don't want to wait.
author: Susie S.

description: I love this place! That's why there's always a line out of the doors! So yummy! Fast service.. chips included.. Baby prawn burrito! My favorite taqueria in SF!!!
author: Nikki K.

description:
I was seriously craving some spicy food while en route to this location. My boyfriend and I had been wanting to explore Glen Park a bit and thought we would ride over to this hood on the trusty scooter for lunch at La Corneta Taqueria. The food here was pretty good. The restaurant atmosphere was very playful--meaning that we were surrounded by children under the age of 5 on all sides. I like kids a lot, there were just tons at this restaurant... one in particular really enjoyed my pink helmet (as did the homeless man outside). 

Back to the food: I liked my boy's burrito better than my super nachos. He ordered it with tofu, which was quite tasty. The tofu chunks could have been cut a bit smaller, but all other ingredients were yummy.  Neither menu selections disappointed me terribly or blew my socks off. It satisfied my craving for Mexican food and filled my belly to the brim for a good price. 

Would I go back... possibly. It is nothing to be super, duper excited about, but if I were in that area again, I might venture back.
author: Nichole P.

description:
La Corneta- flavor, flavor, flavor!  Clean, fresh food that you see made before your eyes!  
The establishment takes care to add quality ingredients into their food.  My family loves the Belly bomb burritos and especially the Mushroom Quesadilla.  
Carne Asada, has the right spices to stand on its own.
Al Pastor is moist and flavorful.
Fish and shrimp is cooked to order!
Mushroom Quesadilla seems to have a pound of mushrooms! 
One Burrito, One Quesadilla along with free chips more than fills three bellies!

Places like this reminds me I should have paid attention in my Espanol class!
author: Curtis L.

description: We no longer live in Glen Park, but this is still our go-to Taqueria whenever we're in the area. Fast service and kid-friendly.
author: Kir L.

description:
Their carne asada is the best! Lean and tender and moist. 

Unfortunately for La Corneta there are better burritos to be had. The super baby burrito I ordered was badly assembled. My first bite was all tortilla and sour cream ( yuck) and my last bite was all steak (YUM). Overall the burrito was too soggy for my taste. Too much sour cream and the tortilla's are steamed  and soft, when I prefer them warmed on the griddle instead.

Although my burrito was disappointing I'll be back to try more stuff with carne asada. I've had the super carne asada quesadilla at the burlingame location and it's perfection. 

3 stars for now- may go up if the tacos hit the spot :)
author: Valerie A.

description: The best place to get a burrito in Glen Park. I always get a spicy chicken baby burrito and it's always on point!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I have been going to La Corneta Taqueria by Glen Park for over 5 years

Pros

1. Fresh ingredients! You can taste the freshness!
2. Great selection!
3. Try the prawn and steak super burrito on a spinach wrap, with grilled mushrooms!
4. Try a prawn quesadilla!
5. The staff definitely handles the large crowds well

Cons

1. Portions are gradually declining
2. PARKING is always an issue
3. Pricey, if you get a super burrito with mushrooms and prawns you can look forward to paying over 10+ dollars.

Conclusion + Tips

Call and order your food in advance, you can skip through the line and just pay and go.

Great food, but expect to pay for it, if the portions will go back to what they used to be, they will earn a 5!
author: Chi T.

description: Solid meals from Corneta. Not a fan of their fish burrito (grilled salmon didn't seem that fresh), but their meats have been good. A carne asada taco is enough for any person. Convenient at the Glen Park Bart station, just have to watch out for the long lines. My suggestion is to call 10 minutes ahead to place an order to bypass the extended lines around rush hour.
author: Raymond H.

description:
The quesadilla de camaron super is possibly the best quesadilla I have had. The creaminess of the cheese, sour cream and green salsa is unique.

If you are hungry you will finish almost all of it. Otherwise you can share with your friend and with also the chips and salsa you will both be full, which is a very economical and GOOD meal. Especially when sharing a large horchata.
author: Hunni B.

description:
I used to come here all the time when I was younger. I went to elementary school nearby and this was always an option after-school or for dinner. What I love, besides the food, is that the staff always remembers you! Every once in awhile I will get one of the ladies to help me out with my order that I used to see all the time when I was younger. Pretty sure they recognize me too!

The food is delicious! I am a big fan of burritos and that is pretty much what I order any time I go here or to any other taqueria. I have also ordered their quesadillas which are equally as delicious as the burritos. I tend to order a super baby burrito with either carne asada, spicy chicken, or just keep it simple as a veggie burrito. You can't really go wrong with a burrito from here.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Okay I know this is a popular place that gets crowded, but that's mainly because it's the only taqueria in Glen Park and one of the ten restaurants in the neighborhood. The workers do not wear gloves while they make your food which should be prohibited, it's kinda gross. The line moves kinda slow at the register as well. I've been here a good amount of times. I ordered a carne asada burrito and the employees didn't really speak good English so you have to try to be more specific and sometimes they mess up your order. I'd suggest getting chicken because I think it tastes better than the beef in this location. The burrito cost $8.92 and it was pretty good. I'd wonder how fresh the ingredients are though because it made my stomach feel bad after. I chose to take it to go and I got home about 10-15 minutes after and found that my food was cold, I mean who has to reheat their food after buying it? Anyway the food was decent to pretty good, but the service makes you think the food could be dirty and not fresh.
author: Dan G.

description: In my opinion this restaurant has gone a little down hill since the early 2000's although maybe that's just my tastes changing. Even having said that, this is still a reliable taqueria that has good food. The salsas are relatively flavorful, but somewhat watery so you have to put quite a bit on. The chicken is the best meat option. While the steak is awesome when done well, sometimes it can be overdone and is quite chewy. Burritos here are good and not as greasy as other places like El Farolito. The quesadillas are also very good, but pretty greasy. This is also a little nicer inside than most taquerias in SF.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
This place is almost always busy and so either expect to wait in line (which usually moves pretty quickly) or come after normal lunch times or before/after normal dinner times.

I am always torn between getting a burrito or their super nachos.  The super nachos are piled high with meat, beans, rice, cheese, lettuce,  guacamole, sour cream and salsa.  They melt the cheese over the meat and beans, so it holds it together nicely.  The key is to mix everything up so that you can get it all on each chip.  The nachos are so big that my boyfriend and I usually just split them and are completely stuffed afterwards.  I can't order nachos anywhere else because I know that they won't compare to La Corneta's

Their burritos are super delicious too.  I can only ever eat a baby burrito.  I really love their steak and prawn burrito.  They cook the prawns fresh for your burrito so you know that they haven't been sitting around getting dried out.  The carne asada is perfectly tender, tasty and never chewy.

All of their food looks really good, but I think that I'll be sticking with their nachos and burritos.
author: Lindsey S.

description: If La Corneta and Pancho Villa were in a gun fight I believe Corneta would win. That being said they are my number 1 and 2 taco joints in SF. I have been coming here for close to 15 years.I really like the super prawn steak quesadilla l. The super baby burritos are great for lunch. Food quality is great and fresh and made right in front of you. Staff are super friendly, super busy and super efficient. Close to bart and not to bad to find parking most times. Don't forget to leave the staff a tip they deserve it !!!
author: she o.

description:
The food here is pretty good, I have only had their burritos though. Their salsa and guac are really good.

The downside is that they get hella busy during peak hours...if you can, I suggest a phone in order to bypass the ridiculously long line that snakes through the restaurant. Also, several times when they are that busy, I have been given the wrong order. I can't tell you how disappointed I get when I bite into my dinner and get a mouthful of sour cream...ew!
author: Kelly N.

description: I was in the neighborhood and popped in for a (carne asada super) burrito. I was in a hurry which proved to a problem in the end. There wasn't many customers, but only one register which bottlenecked the purchasing process. To top it off it is CASH only with no visible signs communicating this hindrance. After waiting in line for over 10 minutes, I was forced to leave without my food to obtain cash, paid fines for withdrawal at local bank and came back to get in line once more. Food was fine, but experience was not great.
author: Lindsay G.

description: Fresh, fast and tastey! What else could you ask for? (oh yeah, great customer service as well. Long lines but they move fast!
author: Robert C.

description: The best Mexican food in the Bay Area. I went to college in Tucson and studied burritos more than the books I should of been reading. Do your self a favor and get the shrimp and steak option on anything you order! I stop here before Giants games all the time.
author: Alex K.

description: I fell in love with this place while living in LA. I was attempting a long distance relationship with Sweet Pierre, who introduced me to this place on one of my bi-weekly visits. It's been a decade since that first visit, and while Pierre and I didn't last, my love for San Francisco as well as the food and staff did! I now live a block away. Everything is good, but the chorizo quesadilla specifically makes me squeeze my thighs together.
author: Troy S.

description:
i really loved it at first. But lately their carne asada doesn't have that much taste as it used to.
if you have more than four orders, do it one by one, regardless if they want to write it down to make it easier on them. Just say no. Pretty expensive too.
Overall, i prefer going here than any other taquerias in SF.
author: Jay M.

description:
La Corneta Taqueria is a high 3-star, low 4-star in my book. Maybe this has to do with it being yet another restaurant in SF that is CASH ONLY without conspicuously posting signs about it! 

Mini-rant: Why are so many places in SF cash only? I'm from Chicago and, until I moved here, I had NEVER seen so many larger-type establishments that didn't take credit cards! Man up, San Francisco, and take my plastic! 

I mozied on in for lunch today and it must have been "bring your baby to a Mexican restaurant" day, as there for at least 6 strollers in this not-so-big establishment. 

Assorted babies aside, the food was quite good and quite cheap. I had the super burrito with tofu, which was much better than expected (and only $7). The rice at La Corneta really makes a difference, as it's buttery and savory. 

On the lower end of the scale were the super nachos. Not a ton of cheese, the chicken wasn't exactly shredded (kind of chunky) and the portion size was ho-hum. Glad that I'm the one who ordered the burrito! 

The crowds here are a little bit intimidating, but I think I'll head back in the future.
author: Tom A.

description: My cousins took me to this great find for food and drinks.  They have the best horchata ever!   Wow!  I used their restroom and it was very clean and clean smelling! I was very impressed!  The food is all fresh and reasonably priced. I recommend coming here, but there is no parking so take Bart!
author: Louise T.

description: Food is just ok.  Tortilla of the burrito was still a little cold.
author: Jonh S.

description:
My go-to place for burritos, quesadillas etc.
Literally JUST reheated half a Super Burrito w/Chorizo left over from last Sunday and it tastes just as good as it did when it was made.

Almost always busy, so the food is super fresh. And it's 

I just get sad when they run out of their yummy al pastor.

And even tho we've been going for a few years, we just realized that phoning in our order is way quicker, duh.
author: Stella D.

description: Every time I come here, I order the same thing : Super baby burrito with carne asada, no beans & the melon drink.. lol. The line is usually short when I get there but gets pretty long after a while. I'm satisfied after my meal, so 4 stars for them :) I've probably been here at least 10 times since I got pregnant .. haha.
author: Sara L.

description:
If you have read my previous reviews, you know that I love Mexican food, and I have been on the hunt for years for the perfect burrito. A friend from work recommended La Corneta, and since we were in the area, we had to try it out. 

There was a long line when we got there, so I was happy to see that. The place basically runs like an assembly line, choose what you want and your food moves down the line with ingredients being added. There is a huge amount of meats to choose from; I got the spicy chicken while the wife tried the chicken chili verde. The spicy chicken was like a stewed chicken with a small amount of spice to it, in hindsight I should have gotten the grilled chicken. 

I like the idea that they warm your tortilla real fast, so you get a tortilla that is nice and warm and ready to eat. The burrito was massive, and if you don't like huge burritos you can choose a baby burrito and normal one. The one thing I noticed was that while the burrito tasted good, not one ingredient stood out. They all kind of ran together and held the same texture. In a way it feels like if one ingredient was taken out, I wouldn't have noticed. 

Not sure how the rest of the food is, but the burrito was ok. Not sure if i will go back, since it is out of the way anyway.
author: Josh G.

description: Great little place. Order along the counter Mexican food, good prices, lots of options. I like that their vegetarian burrito has lots of veggies in it compared to some places that just take out the meat. I'm not sure what all deliciousness was in there, but there were peas. Yum.
author: Meryl S.

description:
My friend got food catered at her house for a party. They arrived to drop off and set up the buffet platters. They even gave a few cans of (I don't know what they're called) gels that you light up and stick under the buffet dishes. 

Food was good. The only thing that needed improvement (IMHO) was that the guacamole was too watery. It needed avacado chunks in it. It was too "watery" for my taste. 

Also the carne asada was dry and chewy. 


Other than that, food was good.

I love the option of the super BABY burrito, grilled chicken, with black beans on a spinach tortilla. I love the super quesadilla. I love love loves the super nachos. 

This place has so many memories for me.  I even remember the old style, the renovation, and new layout.  

I wish it would accept VISA or Mastercard. I hate paying the $2.00 fee at the BofA atm right next door just for my $5 + burrito.
author: Val B.

description:
I'm a regular at this place, and I like it because it is different than most taquerias.  It's hard to say exactly why, but their food just seems to taste fresher than other taquerias.

They have more veggie options than most places.  And they're good.  The Super Veggie Taco in particular - it is delicious, comes with copious amounts of their delicious guac, and is a whole lot of food for the $3 pricetag!  AND it comes with chips!  Great quality budget meal!
author: Raman S.

description: i came here a few times for clean quick consistent Mexican food near the freeway.  It is similar to Chipotle but local.
author: Byron L.

description:
Of course I came in with expectations of this little place by the Glen Park station, since La Corneta would represent Nor Cal Mexican food to me (a SoCal native).  Did not disappoint!  My super baby burrito was pretty tasty, I liked all the fresh flavors.  Chips should've come with some salsa, but I asked and got some.  The ceviche tostada was alright, lots of seafood and very fresh.  My friend's Prawn Burrito was awesome.  I love how much seafood they give you!

Horchata was the best I've ever had.  This is NOT small praise.  I highly highly recommend it.  

We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was still busy at 2 pm!    Worth the wait  though!  And cheap!
author: Yen D.

description:
By far some of the best Mexican food I've had in SF!
Their burritos and quesadillas are huge and could easily become two meals. 
My favorite burrito is the Prawn Super Burrito. Typical restaurants often hold back when you order seafood, but here, you'll find a large prawn in every single bite of the burrito!
The Carne Asada Quesadilla is also a hit. The tortilla is toasted to a perfect crisp, and the steak is perfectly tender. 
It often gets really busy here during lunch and early evening, so plan on waiting. La Corneta might be a buck or two more than most taquerias, but it's well worth it!
author: Evar S.

description:
I do not understand what everyone else is talking about.

I didn't find anything spectacular about this place whatsoever.  The decor is nicer and the overall environment definitely cleaner than most other taquerias you can find on mission but that's pretty much where the positives end.  I came at 2 in the afternoon on a saturday and low and behold, there was a line.  I don't mind waiting as long as it's worth the wait but that was not the case.  I tried their super carne asada burrito and their super nachos.  Their carne asada has zero flavor and some pieces were a bit chewy actually.  The cheese was glooped  up in this one area and so I ended up with a bigass bite of cheese.  Nachos were equally lacking in flavor.  Their rice is funky cuz I've never seen a taqueria have peas and carrots in their rice.  Everything was just so forgettable.  And not to mention, overpriced.  

You know, I'm usually very excited to finish my half burrito (because I can only finish half in one sitting) but I just found myself looking at the burrito sadly thinking, "You could've been so great.  What happened?"
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Being a part-time vegetarian, I decided to let loose and run wild on the night I visited La Corneta.  I stole a bite of my boyfriend's steak quesadilla. One bite turned into 4 or 7, but who can deny juicy cow smothered in an oozing heap of cheese.  I'd say my experience here did not leave me wanting more, nor was I running for the door. The food was average, but I do see myself giving this place another chance, especially because prices are reasonable. 

Until then, I will continue my search for Mexican food that I want to make love to.
author: Jaime L.

description: I this had been the best mex place sooooooo far, and I'm from LA
author: Ivan M.

description: Awesome people and great food!  They rock.  They are in my contacts list so that I can order ahead when I roll back into town.  Super veggie burrito with hot salsa, please!
author: Larry W.

description:
I've been to so many Mexican food places it's not even funny. When I went to San Francisco twice I probably have ate food there at least 4 times. The burritos are huge and I barely finished mine several times.

The next time I return to San Francisco for sure I'm going to stop by there before I leave.
author: Diego O.

description:
More like 4.5

Been going here for like my whole life. It's the crackspot maaaan. It's honestly all about the super baby prawn burrito! They cook the shrimp to perfection and their ingredients are fresh are delicious! I just wish they put more cheese and made it nice and gooey...but still SO good! 

The casadillas are good too! I thought the mushroom/vegetarian casadilla would be extremely lame of me to order but WOW! It's SO good! The mushrooms are good well and it's so good. 

I never usually hafta wait in line because I guess I go at really absurd times, but apparently at the prime hours (lunch,dinner peak times) the lines ridiculous and apparently their assembly line isn't crackin'. But their shrimp burritos are!
author: Eryn K.

description:
My favorite Mexican place!

The meats, beans and other fillings are tasty, and the portions are large enough to fill  me up and give good value.  

The salsa, both picante and fresca, are only okay but aren't really needed.

Lines can be very long at meal times, but they work quickly behind the counter.

The nachos are oh-so-bad for you, but so memorable.

The chicken mole is divine!
author: Timothy T.

description:
Whenever I'm given the opportunity to have an extended lunch from work, I love to travel outside of the China Basin area since 1) it's a great opportunity to explore what SF has got to offer and 2) I can count on one hand the restaurants I'd fork over my hard earned money to feed my hungry stomach.

After deciding on heading to glen park and explore what the area has to offer, I was  instantly engulfed in the smell of carne asada.  I am a firm believer of following your nose and my stomach agreed.  

The line moves fairly quickly.  I ordered the super baby burrito with al pastor and refried beans.  I was a little hesitant to eat a burrito for lunch since I'm real sensitive to food coma, but this place totally surprised me.  Instead of the heavy burrito I'm used to eating in the bay area, everything was real light! It totally reminded me of the food in the outskirts of Puerto Vallarta where all of the food is not drowned in grease and doesn't make you feel like you instantly gained 10 pounds.  Instead, it feels like you can do 20 jumping jacks afterwards and still feel like you can walk on your toes.

I think it's the only Mexican joint on the block, but still good.
author: Lucy W.

description: The food was good and the service was good. But the super tacos in my oppinion weren't worth 4.50 each sorry! And I took it to go got no forks or napkins ugh wish I would've checked. Had to eat like a pig at twin peaks but it was alright I guess. Lesson learned DO NOT TAKE THE FOOD TO GO IN A RUSH. And if your not willing to pay for food overpriced go to El farolito. I'm just saying though!
author: Marvin C.

description:
So my buddy says this is the best burrito in SF. I live a few blocks from Papalote so those were big words. So I order up the super fish burrito (salmon) and they pull out this fresh salmon steak and throw it on the grill. I had to wait a good 10 minutes for the burrito but boy was it worth it! When they call it "super" they actually mean "ridiculously huge". I watched them prepare it and she could barely roll it up. The only thing holding that burrito together was the foil it was wrapped in. If you're like me and you like everything fresh then get the fish burrito because it's not sitting in a big vat from when it was all cooked in the morning. Sure it takes a little longer to cook but it tastes so fresh. 

Prices are about right and they have all the various Mexican beers to choose from - Tecate, Pacifico, Corona, Modelo, etc... (something Papalote lacks). The only thing I had to take away the one star from is they only accept cash, no cards. C'mon people. It's 2010. Start taking cards because I never carry around cash.
author: David C.

description: Hands down the worst tacos I've ever had. I never leave a plate half uneaten, but these were miserable.
author: Bernie S.

description:
Best taqueria in the city.  Quality ingredients make a quality burrito, and all of their ingredients at La Corneta are super fresh and tasty.  But most importantly: their meats are by far the best.  The chorizo, al pastor, and carnitas are all really amazing.  Usually I can't chose just one and end up getting a baby burrito plus a taco (or two) on the side.

At less than 7 bucks for a super baby, its also a pretty good value as well.  Only downsides are that is is cash only, sometimes there is a long line (it moves fast), and it is too far away.

Be careful, this is a review of the Glen Park La Corneta, the one in the Mission is not quite as good.
author: Lenza M.

description: Good food I like the vegitarian and vegan option -with the tofu marinated in red sauce. It's delicious. Parking is free Go down the side alley.you can call in to order unless you want to wait in a crazy long line that wraps twice inside the place.
author: Leah M.

description:
i saw lines here of anglos and amigos/amigas inside la corneta taqueria  so i got curious and got in here. the burritos seem pricey ($7) but i saw they were pretty huge. they also had many kinds of salads, tacos, quesadillas,  tortas and all kinds of combos (chile relleno, enchilada, burritos, taco, etc.)

the right wall has the menu on it and the left wall has an handdrawing of the mexican sun and a female manual laborer.

sampling:
-garlic shrimps(camarones al mojo de ajo-9.95) seem a bargain and it was! 8ish grilled fried large sized shrimp in garlic, very tasty
-black beans: had choice of pinto, so i went black. beans started clumping together later. since the beans couldn't be gay, i figure it must be the lard used in cooking.
-refried beans,  ok small amount
-salad with salsa, a large slice of tomato,  nice touch
-some flour tortilla which they forgot to give me.
-lots of heavy duty chips and nicely spicy sauce (from under counter); always nice.
-strawberry fresca (24 oz-2.50) very tasty, very sweet, tasted like honey or some other sweetener present, saw strawberry seeds.

frijoles refritos:
-line moved fast.  
-inrestaurant seating of about 50, almost all taken, fast turnover.
-should be 5 stars for the food and the great value. deduction for use of lard and forgetting my tortilla. (they never made an effort to return it to me)
-metered parking or free a block away.
-few restaurants open at lunch in this area.
-surprisingly, almost all workers here mid aged, few youngsters(janitor, busperson, dishwasher)
-definitely repeatable for good value, service questionable.
-be prepared to make choices of type of beans, type of tortilla, hot or spicy sauce, chips or no, type of meat. 
-open kitchen, all meats in plain view, all cooking in plain view.
-sit at the window, see the hotties walking their dogs.
author: Victor G.

description: Love the fish burrito. Otherwise a good option for a non-mission burrito.
author: Trini L.

description:
This is the place that secured my undying love for the burrito.  Being from Boston, I had eaten good burritos before, but not truly great ones.  A few years ago I lived near this location and ate a half a dozen meals a week here.

My favorite was always the shrimp burrito (they call them prawns) - they would grill the shrimp right there in front of you while they constructed the rest of the burrito.  Not only do the offer guacamole, but you can also have fresh avocado slices added to your burrito - few places do this, and more should offer it.

I must say I've never been big on loose peas, whether they wind up in soups, Chinese fried rice or in this case, in Corneta's Spanish rice.  I won't penalize them for the peas because everything else is so great. 

You Californians don't know how good you have it.
author: David V.

description:
My 3rd favorite burrito place in SF behind El Farolito and Gordo, but is just so far away for me (across the street from Glen Park BART). The quality of the food is excellent and this La Corneta actually has room to sit down with your friends, unlike their other locations. My favorite is the Spicy Chicken, but it's really not that spicy.

I'm usually their during non-peak hours but still notice that the line gets long quickly. The problem here, unlike Gordo or El Farolito, which also have long lines, is that the staff here doesn't seem to move it along very quickly. Basic principles of queueing theory that I learned in my Operations Management class, but that are easily observable through experience of working in a restaurant, are not followed.

Still worth 4 stars for the taste though.
author: David M.

description:
Currently my favorite taqueria in the city. I usually get a customized Super Quesadilla (on wheat, no cheese, no sour cream and add onion and cilantro). The quesadilla is served with a delicious salad and is (I like to think) relatively healthy. 

The funny thing is, I saw someone else eating the quesadilla and said to myself "That looks very good, I want whatever he's having". That experience has repeated on subsequent trips with at least half a dozen people eyeing my plate and some asking me what I was eating (twice today). 
Make sure you get the pickled onion with your food, it is delicious. 
Recommended.
author: ubaid d.

description: Maybe they have off and on days or we got there early so the good stuff was still out, but our carnitas were awesome and not super fatty like some other reviewers experienced.  Nice location in the neighborhood and a good selection of beers to wash your food down.
author: Adam H.

description: Great food, good price.  Only bad thing about this place is they don't take cards.
author: Sammy A.

description: This is probably the best taqueria I've experienced in SF.  Their vegetarian burrito and aguas frescas are actually fresh and delicious.  If you're in the area it's a must visit.  I'll be going again!
author: Madeleine M.

description: Thank you Joel! The Glen Park location has some of the sweetest staff and stellar service too. I had a little issue and not only was I amazed at the promptness of the response but I was also offered another chance to try the food again - and yes, I am so in love with the vegetarian tostada. Living as a vegetarian is not easy...especially when you grew up on McD's chicken nuggets - thanks mom and dad lol. Seriously, I love how fast the service is and when I was accidently charged more - Joel made sure that the situation was fixed. Yes, you need to bring cash and no, this ain't no taco bell. La Corneta is much MUCH better and totally worth your money. The free chips and salsa that come on the side...I never say no to that! It makes a great mid-day snack. Thank you La Corneta for being there every night after a long day at school. It's my midnight snack...ssshhh don't tell my diet that
author: Rachel A.

description:
I notice everyone loves this place.... still.

I have been stopping here a few times a month for the last nine years and i am disappointed in the quantity. 

I started with baby burritos but was forced to switch to reg. burritos a few years ago when they stopped putting a decent amount of beans in my veggie baby burrito. Then last night, my reg. burrito was made up of mainly rice and to boot, the cost has gone up not just once in the past year, but a few times. 

Recession, more rice, less beans + higher prices = maybe having to find a new favorite taqueria. Any suggestions?
author: Laura M.

description:
Been going here since my elementary school days. I remember when it was just a small "closet" sized place next door....and I have been getting dam near the same thing whenever I go. 

Super chicken and prawn burrito.
author: Paulo L.

description: Love love love this place. I have yet to find another taqueria that tops them and I've tried other places around the area from San Francisco to San Bruno. The super nachos and super burritos are what I usually get because they are so f-ing amazing. The line can get really long depending on the time of day you go, but it goes by quick because the workers know their stuff and work fast. I've been there so much that a couple friendly faces always recognize me. I recommend this place to everyone.
author: Monica M.

description: Went here with our son, it's one of his fave places and now it's on our fave list too. We all had burritos, veggie for me and chicken for the guys. Really good. Even though there was a line, we got through quickly because they had enough staff to handle the crowd, I appreciate that. It's assembly line style so you watch them do everything  and it moves you right along. All the ladies were nice and we loved our burritos. Of course, parking can be an issue, but that's a given. My husband has the gift of always finding a spot, so we don't worry. Just go.
author: Kathleen C.

description: I come here a lot! This place has the cheapest veggie burritos I've found in the city so far ($3.74 - most places I have to pay $6 or more), and they're so yummy! This place is really popular, and sometimes the line can be really, really long, but the ladies who work here are really efficient, so I've never had to wait for more than 10 minutes from entering the premises to having the burrito in my hand. I'm knocking off one star because they use peas with the rice (I hate peas!), but for the price and overall quality of the food, I'll gladly be that awkward girl who picks out peas while eating.
author: Vilde E.

description:
There's a reason why there is ALWAYS a long line here...

This place really has their caca together!


consistently very good food!

Succulent meats (never dry), spiced just right, perfectly salted, fair portions, and the clerks here actually LISTEN to special requests, and with a smile!  A rarity!

My personal favs:  the tamale platter, and the carnitas burrito  (awesome!)

A MUST if you are in the area, and don't want to spend your entire paycheck across the street at Canyon Market or at L'Petit Laurant, both are too expensive.

The owner is also a very nice guy, always smiling, always acknowledges you, and the service is efficient.
author: Ted K.

description: A bit more expensive than other locations in the Mission, but hey its probably cause its located in Glen Park. Love that they have seafood options that are prepared when ordered.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I felt good about this place until my lat visit. And then I felt great!!! 

I have ordered a lot of different things here but I think I have finally found the holy grail....the pork tamale and fish taco combo!! (my own made up combo)

I fell in love with the taco because they put a huge filet of fresh salmon on the grill and then slap it in between 2 hot corn tortillas topped with pico de gallo. The serving of fish is very generous and cooked well. If your EXTRA hungry make it a super taco and add black beans, rice, guac, and sour creams. Its almost like a taco salad because it fills up an entire plate and could easily be eaten on its own.

I got a tamale on the side to be adventurous and was so pleased to find it wet, which means it was slathered in a tomoato-ey cheesey peppery sauce that was just like my grandma makes!!  Then its stuffed with salty  juicy pork. The masa was firm and moist and packed full of tasty lard. 

It was so satisfying I felt inclined to tip the homeless guy at the door just for picking such a good place to panhandle.
author: M K.

description: Only place I go for a burrito. Super baby with everything! It always hits the spot (only draw back is depending on who's making it they could be a but more generous with the guacamole and sour cream). Don't like nachos but they put it back on my map with the super nachos. Grub! Just a tad on the pricey side. But you get what you pay for.
author: Jason T.

description: I was thinking that Mission is the only place to eat best tacos, but this place can easilly beat many other mexican restaurants. It is surprisingly crowded for such a calm neighbourhood.  Tacos and quesadillas are cheap and above average.
author: Ozgur G.

description:
Great little Taqueria very close to the Glen Park BART station.  Their burritos are reasonably priced and are huge, you also can get chips and salsa with them as well.  The salsa was fresh and delicious!

The only downside I would say is that this place can get super busy during lunch time.  Other than that, well worth visiting.
author: Dylan H.

description: I come here about once a week to get my super chicken and prawn burrito. It can get very packed here later in the afternoon. There are meters for parking around the area. Parking is not too bad. Sometimes I call in to place an order ahead so I don't have to wait in line if it's packed. They take cash only. There is a Bank of America next door and Wells Fargo across the street. Food is great. Chips are light and crispy and free with order. So good. One of my favorite taqueria.
author: Susan M.

description:
Fantastic food. 
Chicken quesadilla, shrimp or chicken burrito, enchiladas all top notch.
Always long lines (good sign re: food), but it moves fast (note: cash only).
We've probably been there a 100 times...neighborhood gem in Glen Park.
author: Gurpreet D.

description: My FAVORITE taqueria in the city - now that I'm older and visiting Taquerias sober and during normal dinner hours.  It may not be as authentic - what with the spinach tortilla options - but you can't go wrong with a Super Burrito with Carne Asada + Shrimp. Ah-mazeballs.  The green (spicier) salsa that they provide on the tables in squeeze bottles is the best part - make that meal as spicy as you want it.  There's usually a line, and I've stood in it when it went out the door, but it goes pretty fast.  Plus you'll need the time to check out the extensive menu, and decide what you want to order.  Parking can be a little difficult, but it's not as impossible as other San Francisco neighborhoods.
author: Tabitha I.

description:
Really big portions. One burrito is largely enough for two people. It weighs a ton in your stomach... Too much rice and beans according to me. The ingredient are low quality.

The caesar salad was just ok, chicken being quite greasy. It's cheap so don't expect too much. I felt quite bad after.

Excellent rate cal/price.
author: Aude B.

description: I like how their line is set up, taking your order at the end, and choosing the ingredients till you get to the other end and pay. They should do this at all taquerias!
author: mathew r.

description:
Definitely my favorite place for a burrito in the city.   The prawn baby burrito is an absolute favorite.  The green and red salsas on the tables make it even better.

I trek all the way over to Glen Park cause this is the best Mexican in the city.  Better than anywhere in the Mission.

Would give it 5 stars if there was more seating and it the lines weren't so long.  This is a popular place.
author: Andy H.

description: It's a decent taqueria. It's close to my house so I mostly end up here out of convenience.
author: M R.

description:
So satisfying. Burritos are a bit on the pricier side (around $7 for the regular) but this is THE only place I am totally happy to pay that much for. I favor a carne asada or carnitas burrito on principle, and the steak here is so delicious. Plus very good and even distribution throughout the burrito -- not too much rice and beans, I hate when taquerias go skimpy on the meats! Great salsa, too, nice and chunky pico de gallo.

They have a great selection of other Mexican dishes. I should get to trying them, but their burritos are so damn tasty.

And the complimentary chips are always nice, light, and crispy with just enough oil. YUM. Ask for extra complimentary pico de gallo, it's the bomb.

Tip: It can get pretty crowded at prime eating times and the weekend -- can be hard to find a seat.
author: Kris Q.

description:
Great place! They have a live band even for lunch, a sunroof, murals all over the walls... 

Amazing Super Prawn burrito. Best burrito I've ever had in SF. The prawns were perfectly cooked, tender and juicy. I'm not a big mexican foodie but I crave this...

very extensive menu. Tacos are small portions so it's good for a quick bite.

They make their own chips and salsa which they're really not stingy about giving out.
author: Scarlet S.

description: Food is not how I remember it. Still good, but not great. And the place is VERY dirty. And the bathroom looks like an area that should be quarantined!
author: Yodel A.

description:
Price - 1.5 $ (around 9-12 dollars per person depending on what you order)
Service - good, but had to yell for the waitress to hear
Taste - missing something, maybe their salsa needs to kick it up a notch (with tobasco maybe?)... definitely not BAM worthy

On the plus note, everything here appears to be very fresh and some what more healthy than your average taqueria. Seems like most folks order their food to go.
author: Ming S.

description:
One star for the bright yellow on the walls....no more stars for many reasons...
1). I think food handlers should wear gloves when they prepare your food. 
the girl preparing the nachos was not wearing gloves, and was arranging the chips on my plate like it was a frkn floral arrangement...she also touched the cheese, the cilantro and the dirty towel with the same hands.....
2). They only accept cash....(touch food, touch dirty rag, touch cash, no gloves, repeat) 
3). The Food wasn't that great. The tables were dirty.

Go to Taqueria Guadalajara instead!
author: Lady L.

description:
The Absolute BEST taqueria in town, hands down! They are quick, friendly and the flavors are to die for. Speaking for a vegetarian their tofu is delicious and my top pick for burrito innards. Perfectly flavored, not too spicy (like the Corneta on Mission) and far from bland. For what they provide I think the price is acceptable. 
You can't find too many taquerias in town where you can stand in line, tell them exactly how you want your food and watch them do it right there in front of you. No mistakes, practically no waiting an voila you're eating in no time. 
WARNING: it is a very popular place, so the lines can get long during peak lunch and dinner hours, but then lines move very fast.

They work very hard here and people can be down right mean when they are hungry. I say, if you enjoy the food: TIP them, they'll appreciate it!
author: Vanessa A.

description:
Love this place ! Remember CASH only.
Super tostada salad in good.
author: derek l.

description:
I used to live around the corner and would stop in a couple times a week. Now I live 600+ miles away and don't feel complete unless I stop at La Corneta for a Spicy Chicken Super Baby Burrito! 

 As stated below, there is always a line (which moves pretty quick). So, if you are in a rush don't go at lunch or dinner time!
author: Patrick b.

description: My favorite Mexican place in SF.  The food is fresh, delicious, and so reasonably priced I can hardly believe it.  My favorite menu item is the steak and prawn burrito, but everything I've tried has been delicious (and I've tried nearly everything).  What makes this place extra special is the spicy marinated onion (Cebolla Roja) - spicy, and addictive.  Just be careful of the habanero peppers.
author: Carol Y.

description:
My friends and I were craving for some burritos today! A friend recommend this place so we gave it a try. 

I wasnt that hungry in the first place, but once we stepped inside La Corneta Taqueria, their BIG menus caught soooo much of my attention. I was so tempting to try so many of them!!! You can even check it out here on their website, tempting isnt it??? http://www.lacorneta.com/MenuPage.aspx

Not like any other little burrito shop or taco truck where you have only a little amount of choice to choose from; At here, they have a great variety of burritos ( meats, seafood, or vegetarian) nicely separately into diff. categories. 

If you wanna try a little of EVERYTHING, try combination! I got Combo # 4--CARNE ASADA, POLLO & PRAWNS served with rice, beans, salad, and Tortillas! It was a BIG plate which you can share with one more person! (it comes along with Nachos too! Great deal isnt it?? for $12.55) the grilled steak and chicken were great (not rough)!! And prawns were oh-my-god DELICIOUS!!!! Grilled mushroom was so fresh and nicely-done too! I love LOVE love this plate!!!!! 


Both of my friend got themselves different burritos, too bad I dont remember the names of them, but they were really good too!!! I tried both of them! around $8 each! Also served with Nachos! =)


I will def. come back to this place! I just gotta try MOREEEEE food!!!


P.S. people there are pretty nice. Service is fast even though there was a long line today =) An ideal place to hang out and have good food!
author: Kal S.

description:
Was in the area to try Gialina but after a rude regular basically pushed his way through to put his name down regardless to others waiting in line and the hostess has her nerve to tell me we arrived at the same time when I waited 5 minutes already - they don't deserve my $.

La Corneta was just a few store front down and it looked promising.  There were plenty eating and another line waiting to order.  We ordered a regular taco with carnitas ($3.25?) with your choice of beans (pinto, black or refried) and salsa (regular or spicy).  The tortilla was loaded with refried beans, chunks of carnitas and a heapful of spicy salsa.  It was plenty to fill us up along w/ the complimentary chips and salsa.  The spicy salsa is terrific with lots of chopped up jalepeno that gives it a nice kick.

Love that there were bottles of green and red sauces on the tables so I can load up every bite with more flavor. 

The horchata is very tasty (small is $1.25?), great flavor of cinnamon and just the right amount of sweetness.
author: Gloria H.

description: If you're looking for a beef and prawns burrito and not minding pay over $9 for it you should try this spot. The lines here a really long most of the time. The menu is pretty extensive. I am more bias towards the simplicity of what El Farolito offers. Also, I am not really used to having lettuce inside my burrito or using those bottles that you use to dye hair as your way to get salsa to your chips. If I'm in the mood to splurge ill come here but when i start eating my mind starts thinking of that I could've gone to El Farolito plays with me head. lol
author: Jeff C.

description: Heck ya!  This place is da Bomb, we ordered a steak and mushroom quesadilla and the steak and prawns super nachos and boy were they good.  They do not skimp on anything here, loved the heaping mountain of pico de gallo and guacamole.  The carne asada is awesome as are the prawns.  Portions are huge and absolutely loved the fresh sauces on the table.  The menu is extensive so we will definitely be back to try other items.
author: La C.

description: This has always been my favorite place for burritos but tonight when I walked in I passed someone eating a chicken tostada salad in a tortilla bowl.  I ordered mine with  grilled chicken but the guy behind me ordered one with chicken mole and that looked amazing too. Well now La Corneta is my favorite place for a Chicken Tostada Salad. More food then 1 person can eat and when they said it came with guacamole and sour cream they were not kidding. Im so full but I am already looking forward to eating the leftovers tomorrow night. Maybe I'll eat it with the chips they give you with all the takeout orders. Would recommend this to anyone! I
author: mary s.

description: This is my favorite Mission taqueria that's not in a truck. The stationary location lends the restaurant plenty of space to sit down and enjoy the band that sometimes frequents La Corneta on the weekend. The burritos are amazing.
author: Eddie H.

description:
Ohh mannnnnnnnnn,  I go to this place for one reason and one reason only, and thats for the prawn burrito.  I love that burrito so much, i have never ordered anything else in fear of not liking it and wishing i got the prawn burrito.
