These guys use actual prawns, not some small fake shrimp that comes out of a can or something, these prawns are deviened, and grilled right after you order it.  The burritos are just amazing.

Its located right next to glen park bart station so i always just take bart.  There are so many restaurants near by that look good, but again, too scared to try it because of regret.  this place is always packed, oh yeah, get the spinach tortilla.  they got wheat, but again too scared to mix it up.  Hit it hard my friends.
author: JD B.

description:
The refried beans have lard in them (I asked) and I am pretty sure they use MSG because I am always dehydrated after my meal. Who still does that? It makes me disappointed in La Corneta. I had a nightmare of an experience at the Mission Street location involving other peoples barf (see Yelp review) and now associate trauma with La Corneta.

Sorry.
author: Shannon Z.

description: Hey La Corneta!!! you outdone yourselves again.  I had to come back to Yelp and update this to a 5 star review.  Roasted Pork Super Burrito was the bomb.   Usually, I can only eat 1/2 of your super burritos in one sitting.  This one was so delicious, I could not stop shoving it in my face.  O, the Horror, when I got up.  I felt so fat.  Tried walking it off but all the blood was rushing to my stomach to digest all that wonderful burrito.  Rolled over to take a nap at 7pm and didn't wake up until 7am to go to work the next day.  I felt so refreshed today.  Thank you La Corneta.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Their SUPER STEAK & PRAWN is the best.

Menu is tasty and reasonably priced overall.

Parking is not too bad in that neighborhood.
author: Francis M.

description:
Since the day this place opened it has been flooded with people.  People just love La Corneta.  Lines snake around the table as peoples mouths salivate at those who have already gotten their orders and are happily eating their burritos and enchiladas.

Despite often having to wait in line, it moves fairly fast.  I'm a huge fan of the Chile Relleno super burrito.  Then again, I love anything deep fried and put that in a burrito and you got fat girl on a rampage status.  The carnitas is extremely moist and succulent.  The super tacos are very filling.  Hell, even the super baby burritos are filling.  They are constantly putting out fresh ingredients, not refilling existing old containers.  And the horchata is off the hook.  

Can I just say that the owner is ballin!  His house is like something transplanted with perfect precision from Cuba. It's so cute!  I'm not a stalker or anything if that is what you are thinking and I know that comment totally wasn't needed.  Now I need to clarify that I live down the street and I see him coming and going when I walk my brat of a dog.  *Shakes head* I'm still not a stalker.  Most importantly many workers have been here for years so one would assume that they are treated well.
author: Justine D.

description: An excellent Taqueria. Best churros in the city.
author: willy j.

description:
I don't get it.

I wanted to love it.  

Gristly carne asada; runny refried beans, lack of attention to detail when I was placing my order so I had to repeat and repeat and repeat to get NO rice, and a really long line.  Do these people like to eat fat?

I don't.
author: Goddess B.

description:
I loves a good burrito.  I'm not even going to complain that my super burrito costs seven dollars.  It makes me full and happy face. 

Extra props to the lovely patrons for letting the old lady with the cane skip the long line.  Glen Park is so nice.
author: Poppy C.

description:
This place is excellent. My friend from work loves this place so we decided to come here during a lazy Friday. 

La Corneta is really clean compared to some of the dives over in the mission. When I first walked in I thought  of oh great, my friend took me to a baja fresh/chipotle type of place. But I was wrong with my quick assumption .

My Order
Super Al Pastor Burrito - The burrito had a great over all flavor thanks to the guac and rice. The al pastor was ok but kind of got lost with the rest of the flavors. Also their rice has pees and carrots in it. Terrible, I hate pees and carrots. It reminded me a little of fried rice.
Carnitas Taco - Little expensive but the carnitas was delicious. 
Agua Fresca - Sweet and refreshing. Agua fresca has to to be 3 parts sugar, 2 parts water and 1 part  fruit.

My Friends Order
Carne Asada and Camarones Combo Plate - Probably the best carne asada I have ever had. It was nice and flavorful and tender.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Who would've thought that one of my favorite Mexican food places would be in the Glen Park area? 

I appreciate any taqueria that makes its own tortilla chips rather than take the easy route of buying those life-sized tortilla chips bags from Costco. The chips come out warm because they're made on site and one of the joys of life should be warm and crispy tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole. Scratch that. I can one up that by recommending the super nachos because that combines the warm chips with guacamole, cheese, sour cream, and meat. The amount of training you'll have to do to clear your arteries is well worth it.

Everything I've had at this taqueria has been good. The salsa and guacamole are always freshly made. I want to try the ceviche so will set that as a goal, right up there with job promotion. The line does get long but it moves at a decent pace. Parking is all metered though so err on the side of caution and overfeed the meter if you see the long somewhat long. This place doesn't accept credit cards but there's a Bank of American ATM at the Eggettes two stores away if you find yourself short on cash but not willing to work off the debt.
author: Gwen L.

description:
When baja fresh meets roberto's, hilberto's, alberto's and makes babies.. 

huge portions, fresh food.

being from so.cal, especially right next to the border, i've come to know and love my down and dirty, hole in the wall, leaving my intestinal tract greasy, mexican food.

but what can i say? the salmon tacos are killer! the burritos are pretty good. the salsa is fresh, and all made right in front of your face!

don't get intimidated by the long lines, the wait isn't as long as you would think, and totally worth it.
author: kat c.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Mexican food and am glad that we came here for a quick bite to eat! I wasn't very hungry and opted for the Super Baby Burrito. It was stuffed with everything and ended up to be pretty big. In fact, I've eaten at places where the normal burritos are much smaller. 

Each bite was delicious and scrumptious and my favorite part of the burrito ( the bottom) was just as good. My friend got the steak quesadilla and I had some of it, also very good :). 

We dined out, so didn't get a chance to eat in the facility. Seemed kinda crowded and busy. Good for take-out, but not for dining in.
author: Da M.

description:
I liked this place but it really didn't set itself apart in terms of quality.  I guess with so many good places it just falls into the "good" category. But it garners 4 stars for portion size and value.

And when talking portions, it's big portions. I mean really big. So big that I felt like a pig. I almost slipped into a food coma. When I barely managed to move I thought I might have gained 3 pounds.

Aside from the typical taqueria grub I found the mango juice to be quite tasty.  The service was fast and I found the place to be pretty clean. At most taquerias kicking some spanish to the servers usually garners some extra love but not at this place. Too bad. 

If you're lookin' to fill your belly on nickels and dimes this place can't be beat.
author: Roger H.

description:
First off, I've eaten here probably 60-70 times, so I feel well-qualified to write this review. 

La Corneta deserves the highest rating on Yelp, first and foremost, for the freshness of its food. The great value (read, size) of the portions and efficiency of the staff lock down the 5 stars even further. Having eaten every vegetarian option at La Corneta, I can say they serve the best fast veggie mexican food I've had in SF. Burritos, tacos, chile rellenos, quesadillas, and nachos are all great.

The rice and beans (black, refried, or pinto) are consistently cooked and flavored. The black beans are vegetarian, as are the refried beans, I believe, though 
I'm not certain. The burritos are large, I often share one and am fully satisfied. And, every one of the staff has expert skill in making each item.

Tips:

Make any dish "super" with guacamole, lettuce, and sour cream for added greatness.

Don't sleep on the tomatillo salsa either in your burrito/taco or on the table in one of the two squeeze bottles of salsa. (The other red salsa is also delicious.)

Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages are served as well.
author: Neil T.

description:
Don't be intimidated by the line, its not bad at all!!!!!! and besides we both know you don't got anywhere to go, so go ahead and stand in line it runs fast anyways

This place is one of my favorite places to go get mexican! huge burritos overstuffed tacos delicious horchata and everything is fresh cuz they constantly have to make new stuff on account of everyone ordering it up.

I've had pretty much everything on the menu and I've got to say if you're hungry go for the combination plate #4, It's got enough meat and side stuff to create a full sized burrito as a side dish! " 'scuse me sir, would you like a side burrito to go with that pile of meat??" indeed that is what you get.

and lets say you don't wanna be a douche and take up space at the counter on account of them making your fresh to death food. go ahead, take a load off and find a table, they'll bring it to ya!

this place is gooooooooddddddd!
author: Calvinn W.

description:
This is the best burrito store in san francisco two hands down. actually i can only speak of their steak and shrimp burrito. never tried anything else.

I know I've eaten at maybe 50 burrito shops in sf and this is the best place!
author: Miguel T.

description:
Yum, La Corneta!  This is my favorite mexican restaurant in the city.  Not too greasy, fairly inexpenive, and lots of options to choose from.  Their Carne Asada and Al Pastor are great on a burrito or nachos.  Their garlic shrimp dish is also quite tasty (although a little more expensive).  They also have black beans, which is a plus, and their chips are fresh and crisp without being too salty.

Highly recommend this place.
author: Chad H.

description:
I Love this taqueria! They have shrimp, fish, black beans, tortas and green salsa as menu choices which are rare at other taquerias. They have lines because they are that good! Chips are homemade and tasty even the next day. I ate there on a Tuesday at 4:30, no lines and lots of seating.
Oh yea, I usually don't even like taquerias, they are the furthest thing from my mind, but this place is that tasty and has a clean environment!
author: Full T.

description: Even tho this place is in yuppy town (Glen Park), they actually make some of the best burritos, quesadillas, tacos, nachos, and horchata I have ever tasted!  I have been coming here since high school (over 10 years ago) and it has always been great.  The Mission location is good, but I prefer this one. Kudos to making a super "baby" burrito for those who don't want to feel guilty after eating a big meal.  Love this place!
author: Jeff M.

description:
UPDATE, i feel complied to write this after what I ate the other day..

THE BEST FREAKEN SALMON BURRITO I'VE EVER LAID HANDS ON

if you come by here, and not a fan of Mexican food, get the SEAFOOD BURRITO; it takes longer to make, cause they throw that salmon onto the grill for you, which is really really worth the extra few minutes wait as oppose to how quickjly they'll make a regular burrito (the assembly line acts fast!) but anyways, I'm going to give this place another five stars, for it being absolutely banging.. although it's pretty much cancer to my wallet... can they stop being so damn expensive??!? :[
author: Stanley C.

description: Very good Authentic Mexican Food which serves mostly non-mexican clients.  The restaurant is always very clean and well ordered, and the staff very courteous and nice.  It is a pleasure to go there.  Parking and traffic can be a pain, but the food is well worth it!
author: Marc P.

description: I used to eat here all the time when i lived in the neighborhood. For being like the only Taqueria in Glen Park its pretty tasty.
author: Isabel L.

description:
Don't it always seem to be that you don't know what you got till it's gone???  I didn't quite appreciate the taquerias in San Francisco until I left and moved to a town that considers California Tortilla the height of taqueria cuisine.  

La Corneta makes amazing burritos, tacos, and more--if you like seafood, try the salmon taco or the baby prawn burrito.   The meat is always tender and tasty, the tortillas warm, and the fillings fresh and abundant.  The chips here, which come with every order, are hot, crispy and fresh. For something healthier, you can order hot grilled vegetables and chicken.

So why not five stars?  I don't have a problem with taquerias being cash only. However, I do have a problem with the fact that I have gotten incorrect change here on multiple occasions and they can be incredibly slow in ringing up customers, causing a very big pileup behind the cash register during busy times.
author: Bear S.

description:
Dear burrito gods,

 I come to you today with my friend in my thoughts. He said to me:

"I can't eat cow tongue! I don't want my food to taste me back!"

 I am sure you gods agree that this is blasphemy! If he only knew how good cow tongue tastes, he wouldn't care if it tasted him back!! Lengua (aka cow tongue) is my all time fav thing to get in my burritos and I mourn for my friend who refuses to try it. 

 Despite my friend's unwillingness to try lengua, I also come before you gods today to thank you. Of all the cow tongue burritos I've had (even at the famed taco trucks here in the city), you burrito gods have introduced me to La Corneta Taqueria's lengua burrito, the best lengua burrito I've had. Medium sized pieces (not too big, not too small), perfect texture (soft and tender), in a light, tasty tomato-y broth, gift wrapped with all the goodies in an amazing aluminum foil present from you, the burrito gods.

So I thank you burrito gods.


Sincerely grateful,
Christine


P.S. Dear burrito gods, please tell La Corneta Taqueria to accept credit cards. Thank you.
author: Christine L.

description: This is by far the best place for Burritos.. I've been coming here for over 5years and the food is still great! I always get the spicy prawn burrito on spinach tortilla.! It is off the hook!! The spicy prawn quesadillas are also delish! They don't get 5 stars because 3-5 times they get my order wrong, specially if you call it in. They also have a location on 22nd and Mission but that place is no where near as good. Not only is the food different but the service isent so good... For some good Mexican food La Corneta is your place! (try the one on Diamond st if possible)
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Friend yappin' about his trip to the Philippines last night at La Corneta:

Friend: Yeah! You can get jack and cokes for 50 cents
Me: (Hmmmm Steak and Prawn Quesadilla)
Friend: The water in Boracay is clearer than the water in Hawaii!
Me: (Wow I can't believe I didn't have to choose seafood or meat over each other....I can have both at the same time!!)
Friend: My son was able to swim everyday!
Me: (*Slllurrrp* damn this Horchata has the perfect thickness, should have gotten a large)
Friend: You can throw a party there for 50 people for 60 bucks!!
Me: (Steak and prawn burrito, steak and prawn nachos, hmmm what else can you put steak and prawns on??)
Friend: I was on a scooter and I hit the wall!
Me: (Hmmm steak and prawn quesadilla, this is helllaa good...)
Me: (Steak... prawns... steak... prawns... steak AND prawns...)
Me: (Damn)

I am tempted to give this place 5 stars but since I've only had two things here and I've only been here once, so I will hold off! Until my next visit to La Corneta, I'm gonna be salivating in my dreams about steak and prawns!!
author: Faffy L.

description:
Amazing, super nice (at least the employees who have been there for the longest).


I love the Super Shrimp anything. There are so many options in regard to the menu. The only downside is that their chips always fall apart, but hey they are free. 

I wish I remember the name of the cashier-she sometimes makes burritos too. She was amazing they always earn their price and tip =)


Thanks
author: Lisa M.

description:
3 words: Super Prawn Taco.
You will die and go to shrimp, beans, guac, rice, salsa, and tortilla heaven. Then ressurect yourself and do it again.
author: Melissa P.

description:
I really wanted this to be my new favorite taqueria outside the Mission, and honestly, it's not bad at all.  The super baby prawn is pretty darn good and the carne asada is very tasty.  However, a couple things keep this place at the 3 star level for me:

1.  You have to specifically ask for salsa if you order to-go, which means I always forget and get home to dry chips.  Do they honestly think that by default their customers don't want salsa with their to-go order??
2.  The lines are long.  Don't come here in a hurry around dinner time.
3.  The consistency is not great - I have had fantastic burritos here and I have had a soggy mess.  It may depend on who makes the burrito, they have a large staff that seems to vary a lot over time.

I'll probably keep going back because it's in the neighborhood, but I'll probably venture out a little more often too in hopes of finding something better to satisfy my burrito cravings.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Three words merit my five stars:  
Carnitas Burrito Especial.  

Don't miss it!  

Deliciouso!
author: Bevy M.

description:
People flock to this place like they're selling flour tortillas with the face of Jesus on them.  I did once get a tortilla chip that looked like Vincent Price, and it screamed when I ate it.  I almost felt guilty about eating the rest.  Almost.

In any case, you probably don't need me to tell you that any restaurant with a line long enough to snake past the door most nights has to be pretty decent.
author: Jess T.

description: I visited this place on Saturday afternoon so they were busy. As a vegetarian, this place has good options..however today, it was not good. It was my turn to order so I ordered the vegetarian burrito. I was diasspointed that every item on the steam table had ingredients mixed in from the items next to it. The workers work too fast and so sloppy that there was a little meat in the rice, some rice in the beans, the guacamole had sour cream. Being that I was a vegan, I could not order anythink because of the "cross-contamination". I know that they were busy and it is hard to avoid a piece of something here or there to fall into the next food tray however when there are tons of food mixed together, it makes it impossible for people like me to order. I should have taken a pic however I don't have a smart phone (yeah, I know I'm cheap). I was not able to order anything that day so I was dissapointed!
author: Jerome H.

description:
Every time I go here, it reminds me of a Mexican novela because the older lady (looks like the owner) behind the counter is pretty hot.

This is how it loosely plays out:
Me: Nina traviesa. Te estas portando bien? Si no voy a tener que poner sobre mi radilla y latigar te con amor to cochino?

(You naughty,naughty little girl. Are you behaving? If not, I'll have to put you on my knee and whip you)


Her: Mujer, confesa que te ago falta. Que mi calor, pasion y essencia te dejan llanmando mi nombre en la soledad de las noches

(Admit that you miss me. That my heat, passion and essence leave you calling my name in the stillness of night)  

Me: Es me o esta caliente

(Is it me or is it hot in here?)

Her: Tus burrito es greso en mis manos

(Your burrito is thick in my hands)

Me: Pare! Pare! Pare! Cuanto es?

(Stop! Stop! Stop! How much?)

Her: Es gratis

(It is free)

Well that's not really what happens. That's the kinda crap I think about while waiting in that long a$$ line for a super fish or carne asada  burrito. So my advise? Call ahead. Otherwise, the  burritos are still worth the wait.
author: RJ A.

description:
Yelpers sound the trumpets because LA CORNETA is...by far the best taqueria that makes my list!!!  This taqueria has been one of my long time favorites.  When you walk in there is a beautiful eye catching mural on the wall and where it is located is a perfect spot--the heart of "downtown" Glen Park!  When I'm craving for a salmon quesadilla I come here.  I add mushrooms with it and pour the salsa verde (or is it verde salsa?) with each bite that I take. MmmMmmm...soooo good!  I've also a couple times had a prawn baby burrito and that was just as good.  I love how the seafood is always fresh.  I will try the ceviche the next time I pop back in here!

The only cons I would say is that 1. they only take cash--but because I bank with BofA there is an ATM a few steps away.  2. If you go at the wrong time which usually is right after work hours you will catch a long line but I think they do their best at trying to move the line up as fast as possible.

OOOO..I forgot!  To drink try a 1/2 Horchata & 1/2 Strawberry Aguas Frescas.
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
A solidly good burrito. I wouldn't rate it above Pancho Villa but it's dang close.

The 3 C's and a D
Close (to me), Convenient and Clean with a Damn' fine burrito will probably have me going back there the next time I need a burrito fix but don't feel like messing taking the longer trek through the Mission. 

Ole!
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Why is my super quesadilla soggy? The server just handed it to me! Boo. I ended up picking out bits of carne asada and eating them with chips and beans I stole from my boyfriend. Mmm, beans. I just love beans. 

Did you know that beans are high in oligosaccharides? According to wikipedia, "these oligosaccharides pass through the upper intestine largely unchanged, and when these reach the lower intestine, bacteria feed on them, producing copious amounts of flatus." Flatus! I'm guessing that is just a nicer way of saying FARTS.
author: Nathalie L.

description:
La Corneta Taqueria serves great Mexican food in Glen Park.  I give this place 5 stars even though the line out the door that is 15 people deep is insane.  I tolerate the wait each time I eat here.

I've had the Super Fish Taco and the Super Steak Tostada w/ black beans.  The Super Fish Taco was served with salmon, lettuce, tomato, cheese, guacamole and beans.  When I get a fish taco, I prefer a red snapper taco but salmon is a good fish choice as well.    With everything fresh, you cannot go wrong.  The Super Steak Tostada comes with steak, lettuce, tomato, cheese, guacamole and beans.  Of course the tostada comes in an edible shell which is devoured.  My salsa choice is the salsa verde for the delayed heat taste in your mouth.

I have been told by friends that the line can come and go in waves.  It seems like every time there is a BART train rolling through Glen Park Station, the line mentioned above will occur.  Might be good info for you "trainspotters" out there.  I will keep coming back to this place -- gracias La Corneta Taqueria.
author: Janet H.

description:
Even if La Corneta wasn't my neighborhood taqueria, I'd still go out of my way to eat there (or, more accurately, get take-out from there -- and I always call ahead to avoid the heinous lines).

They offer lots of options, including several varieties each of tortilla, beans, meat, and salsa, and everything I've had has been good. My personal favorite burrito combination involves grilled chicken, black beans, cheese, and guacamole, but I also know the spicy chicken, chicken mole, and shrimp are good.

Service is friendly and efficient, the restaurant is clean -- it's all good. Yum.
author: Tara M.

description:
A few things I like about La Corneta:

1) It's open late
2) The food is stellar
3) It's convenient

The main thing I do not enjoy:

1) I'm always reminded of the Led Zeppelin song 'Communication Breakdown' whenever I attempt to order.

But please do eat here, the menu is vast.  The chile rellenos are AMAZING.  As they ladled it on my plate my eyes bulged with lust at it's ripe, green skin, the batter bursting out of every orifice.  The guac is divine, and holy shit, the MELON AGUA FRESCA!  It brought me to my knees.
author: Lily E.

description: This is one of my favorite taquieria's in the city. I always get a super baby burrito or their super crispy tacos! Their super nachos and quesadillas are good too, but if you get those i suggest eating it there than taking it to go, as it can get soggy from the greasy goodness!
author: Jess N.

description:
Freakin' awesome burritos. The best I've had in the city. Their spicy chicken is SO DAMN GOOD, as is their shrimp. I haven't tried anything else from here, but I know their food is very popular.

At peak times, be prepared to wait in a long line that may twist around the not-so-big place, but it's definitely worth it.

Side note/another plus: my last time eating here, I hadn't been in a while, and I forgot they didn't accept credit card/debit. My total was $11.75, and I had 9 bucks cash. The woman took the 9 dollars without any hassle, even though I was short, which was SO sweet. Thank you to that kind woman, and I will give it back to you next time I'm there! That kind of hospitality is much appreciated. :)

HIGHLY recommended!!!
author: Tiffany R.

description: delicious, quick, and you can customize anything on the menu! despite the fact that we had a huge line behind us, they listened to each of our custom orders (replace beef with fish, different kinds of tortillas, etc.), and made sure our order was cooked to perfection! amazing, authentic, and very friendly.
author: Brook D.

description: This place opened when I grew up around here in Diamond Heights area, about 10-15 years ago, they were less known then and have revamped the place, but the food is still great, the burritos are tasty and juicy and the meat is never full of fat or old like some other taquerias.  You can get spicier salsa or whatever, they have alot of menu items not just just burritos either.There are new yuppiesh wrap choices too, which have come with the popularity, which are also fine. If you are near, on your way to bart or something, or just in the neighborhood this is a place you should try. Be aware, there is a line at meal times esp. that bart traffic, so don't expect to necessarily eat your food nice and relaxed, you're gonna need to table swoop.
author: Lily G.

description:
I've been going here since for probably 10 years at this point, before that worthless expansion, and go back every time that I'm in SF.  

This is the preeminent SF burrito spot.  

Frankly no where else in the city even comes close. To those that swear by la taqueria, I say to you this: don't try to argue that by not putting rice in a burrito, you are making it better.  it doesn't.  I like my burritos big, bulky, and chalk full of flavor, and to not have rice is a travesty in my book. 

This place has two things that you should get: the super burrito with either carne asada, grilled chicken, or carnitas.  Alternatively, the super nachos.  I dare anyone to try and finish those nachos all by themselves.  

The "super" in the super burrito/nacho entails all the accoutrements that make the burrito tasty -- guac, sour cream, lettuce, pico de gallo, etc. Thus, it's a necessity.  

I suppose the thing I like most about these burritos is that they aren't dry.  I comparison to let's say, chipotle, there is a certain moistness to la corneta's burritos that is almost indescribable, but can be imagined when you think about how fresh guac, sour cream, pico de gallo, lettuce and juicy meat would come together.  

Call in your order to go right to the front of the line and pay.  If you call even 10 minutes before you arrive, then your burrito will be ready.

Parking can be bad...best shot is to go to that parking lot close by.  And this location is better than the one in the mission, for whatever reason.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Awesome!

Im from southern California and i find that unless you want to go to the mission district, there isnt very many good mexican food places in the SF area.  But i have to say that this place is definitely worth it.

First the few negatives...
The place is cash only so that is a big bummer.  Second, the place is pretty small and gets packed pretty fast, so don't count on getting a seat in this place, your better off planning for takeout.  Plus, make sure that when you order, you follow your order all the way to the register! A few times ive been there your food tends to get in the shuffle and a misunderstanding occurs and you get something wrong with your order.  In my experience it isnt anything serious, once or twice i got a different kind of salsa then i asked for, but other then that nothing major.

Ok to the good things...
Ive already said, the food here is tremendously good!  They have a big selection of food to choose from that are all reasonably priced.  The biggest bonus of this place is the fresh ingredients.  I love their salsa among other things, because of its fresh taste.  As i mentioned earlier, the place gets pretty packed so thats a negative, but there are usually enough people working behind the counter that the line moves very quickly.  Sometimes too quickly, make sure u know what u want! :-P  You also know its a good place to eat when u have a variety of different kinds of people eating there.  From families to police officers, to business people, to even yuppies, this place has a little something for everyone.

Make sure to check it out sometime! :-D
author: Mark R.

description: I love this place. The best Mexican food in San Francisco as far as I'm concerned.
author: Won't B.

description: Came here expecting to leave happy. However, I only left feeling neutral. I ordered a Super Steak on a spinach tortilla, the portion was what it should be. The burrito was semi juicy, unlike El Farlito. However, I did like their rice, since it consisted of peas & carrots. Price was fair, only going back if I'm ever nearby.
author: Alex T.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with La Corneta.

Love cause it's walking/stumbling from my house.
Hate when the line is 20 people deep.
Love when guapo gets good flirty service.
Hate the inconsistency of the food
Love when the fish burrito incites sheer panic and clears out my bowels 30 minutes after consuming.
Hate when the fish burrito incites sheer panic and clears out my bowels 30 minutes after consuming.

(_|_)
   *
  *
   *
 \.,./

(ok I totally stole that from Suzy C)

I do want to try the beef tongue cause it's supposed to be good.

Lastly I do have to mention my horror story of why this place will never get more stars

One time I ordered 2 tacos and ate them there. After a few bites I bit (lightly) on something really really hard and immediately stopped chewing (thank god.)  Pulled it out of my mouth and was shocked to find a STAPLE!  not a paper staple but an little industrial food packaging staple.

I took it up to the counter and they quickly tried to whisk it away, I was like "lady - this was in my mouth!"  and she was trying to be like "oh really sorry, no comprende" cause she realized probably even more than I did at the moment that this could be a "I could sue you and put you out of business" situation.

But no physical damage was done, and I'm too nice a guy.  But I'm still a bit traumatized when i eat there. :-(
author: christoph s.

description:
Dear La Corneta,

My last taste of San Francisco, oh how I love you and your super baby burrito al pastor. I was sad when my friend informed me it wouldn't really be possible to have my birthday party consist of "Show up at La Corneta and take over a few tables."  Please, please send a delegation up to Seattle. I beg you.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I for the life of me cant finish a whole burrito. I cant even do damage to a regular burrito. So I was delighted when I spotted the 'baby burrito' at La Corneta. 

Tonight I opted for the super steak & prawn quesadilla (I guess a mini version of surf & turf). Big spinach, yes spinach, tortilla with chunks of carne asada, huge prawns and gooey cheese topped with mild salsa...oh baby! My other half had the super steak that was bursting with chicken and all the other usual ingredients a burrito is suppose have. Plus he managed to polish off an order of crarne asada nachos ( I hate guys for their fast metabolism). The downside is that yet once again the mango juice had pieces of the fruit flesh in there (you know that stuff that get stuck in between your teeth when you eat mango). I keep hoping that they'd make a batch without that and yes I have said something to them. 

During lunch it's busy with the line out the door (where the heck do these people come from Glrn Park is not that busy, is it?) The service is cool, hey they make my order right every time.
author: Lola L.

description:
Simply the BEST!
The food is very fresh & they have great prawns. 
Yes, there is often a line, but patience is a virtue and good things come to those who wait. Beautiful mural paintings as well.
It's hard to eat at other taqueria's after you have had La Corneta.
author: Catherine D.

description: They screwed me in the worst way possible and that is when I asked for carne asada but they put carnitas instead. Of course, I didn't realize until I was almost done with it.  "It should have been done right the first", I begrudgingly complained to my husband. "You have to forgive them, they have a very complicated job", he replied.
author: J C.

description:
After a two month absence, I return to La Corneta to discover the prices have gone up a dollar, at least for the baby super burritos. Unfortunately, while prices have risen, the quality of food has declined. My burrito was incredibly bland and mysteriously cold for some reason even though I consumed it immediately after its preparation. 

Our relationship has withered and I feel as if I barely know you anymore LaCorneta, mi corazon. Sadly, I think it's time that we went our separate ways. La Corneta, I bid you adieu.

(However, I have to give praise for the carrots and peas in the rice... carrots and peas!!!!)
author: Annie L.

description:
After the burrito I had yesterday, I was compelled to write a few words.  Maybe I'm just unlucky, but I've had a few crappy burritos at this place.  I don't order anything complicated, just carne asada with black or refried beans.  Regular stuff, ya know?  Yesterday's was super greasy, with flavorless beans, plus I bit into something HARD, which always makes me lose my appetite.  Previous bad burritos have had great surpluses of rice, with little in the way of sauciness or flavor.  Tell you the truth, I don't really recall having a GOOD burrito here.  Maybe some "OK" slabs, but nothing to write home about.  

The service is just fine, but yeah, the lines are ridiculous at certain times of the day.  I think you Glen Parkers are just high on having your own taqueria and are willing to give it a break.   

Check out their location on Mission St..  It's a lot better.
author: Chris K.

description:
It just goes to show, an establishment with a long line spiraling through the restaurant at 2pm in the afternoon on a Saturday has got to be great.  Don't be discouraged as the line moves pretty quick.  I love that I can get beef tongue in what ever form i want; burrito, tacos, nacho, or any dish where you can choose a meat.  Should you order the Super Burrito, it comes out "GINORMOUS".  After eating half, you can siesta and come back to eat the other half. Their ingredients are fresh and expansive seafood choices like; salmon, prawns, and ceviche.  

You get numerous alternatives when it comes to:
     garlicky or spicy chicken
     regular or crisp tacos
     baby, regular, especial, super baby, or super burrito
     Vegetarian burrito, vegetarian taco, vegetarian quesadilla, vegetarian nachos

Check out their specials.  Today there was ceviche tostada.  
Other things to try:  Aqua Frescas and desserts
Wine and beer is served at this location.  
You always get a side of chips with your eat in or to go order.
author: Nanette L.

description:
UPDATE: You can read my original review below, but my lunch experience today was a disappointment and has caused me to reduce my rating of this place from 4 stars down to 3.

First, a modest lunch for two (a burrito and drink each) cost $27!  For a taqueria, that seems a bit outlandish, no?!  And the food wasn't even that good today! :(

- We ordered steak and prawn burritos, and they were pretty damn bland.  The steak seems completely unseasoned, and the server was pretty stingy with the guac and sour cream.

- The chips were stale.  Yuck!

Maybe I was just less picky years ago, but wow, I have no doubt that any burrito-seeking folks can do better than this place nowadays.  What a shame!

*  *  *

This is one of the places I go to with a bit of reluctance rather than an "Oh boy, can't wait to go!" kinda feeling.

I'll start off with the annoying stuff:

- It's cramped.

- Tortillas are steamed, not grilled.  After trying grilled tortillas elsewhere, going back to steamed makes me a bit grumpy :(

- They nickel and dime you.  50 cents extra to have some beans in my quesadilla?  Come on.  I'm already paying $9+ for the damn steak-and-prawn quesadilla!

- Prices have been edging up pretty strongly over the last two years.  A fancy burrito and an horchata'll easily cost you over $12 :(.

But the good stuff that keeps me coming back:

- I've never had such an amazingly good prawn or steak-and-prawn burrito/quesadilla/etc.  Come to think of it, I've never seen another taqueria that offers juicy garlicky prawns (and I don't mean the little tiny crappola fishyfishy shrimps, either!).

- Parking usually isn't too bad.

- The salsa and chips are actually darn tasty.  I mean, come on, what's with so many other taquerias around here having chips that taste like compressed stale sawdust?  Or chips that've CLEARLY been taken out of a bag that was shipped from several states away... last week?

- The super burritos will easily last you two meals.

- The horchatas are yummy, with tasty bits of fruit that actually taste like fruit :)

- The tortas are also super-tasty!  Try an untraditional one with chicken mole.  Or bbq pork!

*  *  *

So, in the end, I still come here at least twice a month on weekends to grab a two-meal dealie.  And besides the good taste, I figure this stuff is also reasonably nutritious (especially when I ask for a whole-wheat tortilla)... beans, guac, prawns, salsa... all healthy stuff in moderation!
author: Adam L.

description:
Burrito Heaven!!

I always order the super baby burrito and they never disappoint.  Burritos are wet and juicy and whether it be veggie style or stuffed with bbq pork...it is super good.   I recommend the Glen Park location rather than the one on 24th and mission.  I have always had a pleasant experience there and they have never messed up my order at Glen Park.  On the Mission one however, each time I went, I was either never given chips or they give me the evil eye for asking for and extra salse.


A must try!!!
author: Bernice C.

description:
I try* to eat here once a week - it's just that good. 

*my dining companions want variety...hey, the menu has lots of variety!
author: O O.

description: Mushrooms... what goes good with mushrooms?  Pizza?  Pasta?  Sauteed with steak/prime rib?  Cream soup?  It's ALL good to me, as long as it is cooked well.  While in the neighborhood, I thought a Super Prawn & Mushroom Quesadilla (hold the sour cream, with mild salsa) would make a nice filling lunch.  When my order arrived and I bit into the first taste of the perfectly cooked mushrooms, there was a deafening silence.  There's something about biting into cooked fresh mushrooms and getting that crunch without being raw.  In this case, they sautee the mushroom slices with sliced pieces of prawns and add them to a toasted tortilla filled with melted gooey cheese, guacamole, lettuce, and mild salsa.  Cut into two large pieces, you can eat this with your hands, but I recommend using a fork and knife for the final bites as the quesadilla becomes soggy as you eat it.  At $10.95 ($9.45 for Super Prawn add $1.50 for mushrooms), it may be a little pricey for lunch, but the yumminess is WELL worth it.  I do not recommend doing take out with this as the mushrooms make for a soggy tortilla as it steams in its container on the way home.  The only downside was that the prawns were a bit on the dry side.  Solid, solid four stars!
author: Mike C.

description:
After six years in Phoenix, I feel like I'm allowed to be a little picky about my Mexican food. I've tried several little Taqueria's while living in San Francisco and most disappoint. However, I just love La Corneta! It's one of the few things I miss about living in Glen Park. 

The Carne Asada & Shrimp Dinner is very good. The shrimp is juicy and well seasoned. The steak is a little tough but very flavorful and it comes with rice, beans and tortillas. It's really a ridiculous amount of food and I had left overs for the next day. 

The burritos are also very good. Previous reviews are correct - get the small burrito unless you are very hungry. My favorite is the verde chicken. 

The flan is also very good! Not as creamy as I'm used to but very good. 

Prices are very affordable and portions are generous. Just beware, they only take cash.
author: Marissa P.

description:
The City can easily spoil you with the plethora of delicious taquerias, but this is one of my faves. My typical order is a super burrito with lengua (the adventerous side of me haha), whole beans, everything but lettuce. Maybe agua fresca if it's watermelon or cantaloupe. And MMMMM is it tasty.  The lengua is tender and the burrito nice and juicy. If I'm being a complete pig, I'll eat the whole thing, but it easily can become two meals. 
Parking can become somewhat of an issue during the lunch rush so give yourself enough time to park and stand in line.
author: Rayna L.

description:
I tried their combo that included a flauta, chile relleno, and enchilada.  The chicken was well-seasoned while the chile relleno tasted very fresh and homemade. I also tried their prawns. They are sliced in half and buttered- also seasoned very well. On another visit, I was very impressed by how fresh the shell of the super tostada tasted. The texture was just right- crisp and lightly fried.  La Corneta Taqueria is one of the best  Mexican-American places in the City. 

Pros
- authentic
- meats are well-seasoned
- high quality

Con
- takes cash only
author: Angus H.

description:
I'm just another in the long line of people raving about this place (and standing in its long line waiting for the yummy food).  Not only are their burritos good but so are their tacos!  One taco is HUGE.  I usually get a single super veggie taco with black beans - with some extra tortillas on the side.  The tacos are piled so high with tasty fixin's that I can make several "mini" tacos with my extra tortillas.  A great Saturday lunch when you're running errands and a great dinner anytime when you're too lazy or tired to cook. 

Despite what everyone says about the line - it's not that bad.  It moves fast, the place is clean and friendly, and the line is filled with families and friends.   And the food is worth it: fresh, flavorful, and filling.
author: Susannah M.

description:
Don't worry about the lines.  That is a good sign, and many of the customers have it to go, but at peak times finding a table is difficult.  I like the quesidilla suiza with hot salsa.  Good chips that are never stale, possible to high turnover.  Good burritos that are not overfilled with rice and beans.  The salsa, either hot or mild tastes very fresh.  I like to stop by after my daily BART ride if I don't feel like cooking that night.   Table space has increased tremendously since taking over the donut shop next door years ago.

I've been back a few times, but it appears that my orginal 5 star rating was based on me being very hungry that day.  Three stars is more like it.
author: Michael M.

description: Love the super tacos and the super burritos. Great quality ingredients and huge size. Highly recommended. Nor for romantic dinner though, but great to grab a quick bite or take away.
author: Tamas K.

description:
The food is fresh and made to order.  

The burritos are big, filling and tasty.  The quesadillas are cheesy with a the tortilla perfectly crisped and their nachos are stuck under the broiler to melt the cheese instead of being stuck in the microwave.

The prices are slightly higher than some of your mission street taquerias, but so totally worth it.  

The only bad thing I will say is that they don't have pina agua fresca everyday. If they made it everyday or at least whenever I'm there, they would totally deserve the five stars!!

 Other than that this is the place to go for your taqueria cravings.
author: Bella P.

description:
Not much to add to the 300+ reviews already here.  There's a reason why the line is always long and people still flock here.

Had a carnitas quesadila suiza the other day , and I'm adding that to my (long) list of favorites here
author: John R.

description: Oh I am so bummed. I recently wrote a long-overdue review of Corneta and that reminded me that I should go and eat there again. Had a terrible meal. Guacamole quality has gone downhill, chips have changed, prawns were a little fishy...:(
author: Marina N.

description: Will not be back!!!  I get a regular chicken burrito that is always 7 dollars . Tonight however that same burrito was $8.63.  When I questioned they said i got extra chicken . REALLY?  You will loose all your customers when you start doing this.  This place is scratched off my list..  Your to busy for your own good..
author: Jack O.

description:
I eat here at least once a week. Like everyone else I have had many good meals and a few awful ones. Recently, I've seen children walking across the bar and wondered whether it's OK to store shredded cheese in plastic garbage bags. Which they tend to do. I've chomped down on a chicken bone several times, which has driven me to the prawn burrito almost exclusively. But this stuff comes with taqueria territory, I know. And La Corneta is overall FAR better than anything you're going to get in the rest of the city, including some of the Mission's most celebrated (and overrated) names.

I forgive the jaw pain from that chicken bone, though. The one thing that kills me is that the staff insists on trying to put MILD salsa instead of HOT on my order, despite my loud insistence to the contrary. Literally, half the time I catch them about to dump that watery tomato dice onto my otherwise perfectly crafted burrito only for me to yell SPICY! HOT! HOT! I swear. I mean, I know I'm extremely white, but I'm a Texan by birth and I demand serrano peppers in my pico de gallo.

HOT SALSA DO YOU HEAR ME?

Jesus.
author: Christopher N.

description: We used La Corneta to cater my son's birthday party.  I felt like I was calling on short notice (about one week out) and they were able to fill the fairly large order.  When the Glen Park location realized they couldn't deliver on time for the party, the man took the rest of my order and then coordinated with the MIssion Street location.  They delivered to a playground, on time, and there was way more than enough food.  It was really tasty too- everyone kept asking where I ordered from.
author: Ellie F.

description:
Big airy, bright and clean  this place looks practically suburban despite the giant virgin of Guadeloupe mural.  It's the kind of place that my waspy grandmother wouldn't be concerned about eating at the tables.  Despite all that the burritos are delish,

The wrap was quality ensuring that every bite had a good mix of meat, beans, salsa, rice, sour cream and guacamole and that it kept it's form to the very end.  The chile was well seasoned, but not particularly spicy and neither was the salsa, but I'll bet a better order could have solved that.  I read some complaints about having a hard time getting salsa when ordering to-go, but that was no problem for me.  I got just what I ordered with my chips.  I'm going for the burritos, but the tamales, chiles and chorros looked good too.
author: Thomas T.

description:
Muy bueno!!  Great authentic Mexican food.  My favorite is the Super Fish Taco.  Nothing like grilled Salmon with their delicious salsa.  Another one of my favorites is their Steak and Shrimp burrito of their popular 
Baby Shrimp burrito.
One thing to keep in mind.  They move at lightening speed and especially when busy and the possibility of a slight language barrier, I strongly suggest you make sure you are clear in ordering and check your order after it's bagged.  I sometimes get a super burrito instead of regular.  I have also found my order to be lacking when checking the items in the bag.  Other than that, all is good!
author: Diane V.

description:
I'll make this quick: not the best mexican food.  I've had better burritos, and I've had better salsa.  But fantastic meats.  Chili Verde Chicken, delicious.  Definitely some of the best meat I have had from a taqueria.

And  line out the door for dinner is completely worth the wait.  Great food demands patience.
author: Aaron L.

description:
As I browsed through reviews for places to eat in Glen Park, this restaurant came across with a lot of 4-5 stars.  I was thinking let's give this place a try.  Right when you enter this place, I would imagine grills/stoves heated with food, but it wasn't.  I waited at the front so that I can pick the meats, beans, salsa, etc.  I had to walk all the way up to the register, the guy there was busy counting money, looked at us, and went back to counting money.  It wasn't until I had to flag one of the cooks who then flagged a lady to take our order.  

I ordered a baby burrito.  I'm use to the taquerias in the Mission with freshly cooked/heated items, flames everywhere, the good ol grill smoke filled atmosphere. The burrito wrap was not heated on the grill, the carnitas was already in one of those steam/warm bins, the salsa tasted bland.  The lady preparing the burrito didn't even stuff it, you know the type of burrito that is fully stuffed, instead my baby burrito was filled with air.  Extra salsa? You would need to ask for it.  I was also about to order an Orchata, but it wasn't even kept in the refrigerator, left out in the open for who knows how long.  Finally we went back to the register and the guy says CASH ONLY...wtf.

The only plus star is the interior design of this place. Wait, I take that star back because the tables were not clean and there were leftover food and drinks from previous customers.  My word of advise, stick to the Mission.  "Eek! Methinks not." -it's more like: Noo! MEKNOWS NOT!!!
author: Elliot Y.

description: Strawberry agua fresca way too sweet.  Almost undrinkable.  They got my order wrong.  Super baby burrito had very little cheese and guacamole.  Could not find the sour cream.  I may as well have gotten the regular.  Don't think I'll come back here again.
author: Jennifer L.

description: If i'm not at El Farolito... I usually go here!!! Started going here since they were offering Tilapia for a while. Super Burrito with Tilapia? and it was bomb! It's just few steps way, right off the Glen Park Bart Station. So lines can sometimes get long during rush hour.
author: Shane M.

description:
I love this place, I love the prices, and judging by the lines, a lot of others do, too.

It's local for me, so I've been coming here for years. It's funny, though. I never get a smile or a hello. But I've learned that putting together a taco dinner is more an art than a science. Sometimes you get cheese, sometimes you don't. Sometimes the beans go here, sometimes they go there. Sometimes half of your meal is rice, sometimes it's half lettuce. So I've learned to keep an eye on the preparer to be sure they make it the way I want.

A little trick--call in your order ahead of time so you don't have to stand in the line, which can be pretty long during the dinner rush (20" or more). The only drawback is that you may not, for example, get cheese with your taco dinner.
author: E B.

description:
Food: 5/5
My boyfriend and I drove all the way there from the middle Richmond because I craved Fish tacos. Then I saw that a fish taco is $6 (what the HELL? At a taqueria??) and decided on the super chile relleno burrito instead, and finished about 1/3 of it. But it was SO GOOD. Boyfriend had super beef, and said it was one of the best in SF. But I can tell he misses the far superior San Diego burritos. 

Service: 2/5

Maybe it was because it was 15 minutes before closing time, but the employees there were quite inhospitable. Borderline rude. 

Price: 2/5 
It's still a taqueria, you have to go through line and you aren't served. The prices are kindof silly. And why does it take like 11 people in the kitchen, when only three or four can fit in the burrito making line? Gee, wonder why the prices are so high. 

So it averages out to 3/5. The food was good, but not worth the price or the rudeness.
author: Hale B.

description:
La Corneta is good, but not great. If you want a sizeable meal at a good price, this is a good place. It's definitely built for capacity, though.

It seems like La Corneta's mission is to get as many people through the line as fast as possible. That's good for efficiency if you pass it on the way home, but it's not really a place to aim for.

The prices are good, and the food is adequate.
author: Sekhar S.

description:
While you have potential to be better, you just don't care about me. And that's why you get only 3 stars.

First, what is the point of asking me what kind of beans I'd like when you don't care. "Can I have refried beans?" I ask politely. You spoon a big (and soggy) spoon of black beans on my burrito.

Apparently my question was answered...no I can not have refried beans.

And then when my soda top pops off and sprays all over the bag, you simply remove the soda and leave the spill. Though you did replace the soda. I suppose that was nice...since I didn't do anything really.

This place is pretty standard. Nothing special, cheap price. It's like so many other burrito places I've visited in this city. But definitely low on the totem pole for service.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Living just 6 blocks away, and often needing to use the Glen Park BART station, I've found that this is BY FAR my favorite Taqueria in the city. The service is quick, the food tastes great, there is more to the menu than burritos and tacos. Absolutely recommend it.
author: Charles P.

description:
I came to this Corneta before the one on Mission, and love it very much.  Here I usually order a baby burrito with a spinach tortilla, either carne asada or pollo asado, depending on the mood.  This location is much smaller, with the line of eager (and hungry) customers winding in and around the tables.  For that reason, if I eat in, I'm always sure to grab a window seat so as not to be disturbed while I have intimate quiet time with my burrito.

Also, the staffers here are just plain sweet.  !Estas muchachas si saben!
author: Randy F.

description:
LOVE IT!  I'm sorry, but this place wins.  I don't care what all the other people say... this is my favorite taqueria/burrito shop.  Grilled Salmon in their fish dishes says it all, but I'm really in love with their salsa and extensive menu. Plus who can complain about a vegetarian burrito that is like $2.75 or something crazy like that.  

Welcome to Yummy!
author: shannon m.

description:
Next time you are on BART, get off at the Glen Park stop and walk across the street to La Corneta. Stop in for a strawberry agua fresca; it's addictive as hell & not watery like some other taqueria's drinks. Or stop in for a baby burrito if you aren't famished. Or if you are famished, stop in for one of their combo plates- that bad boy is loaded with everything Mexican you've always wanted to eat. Even vegetarians should stop by and try a chile relleno baby burrito. 

Or take a shrimp and steak burrito to go and don't forget to ask for extra pico de gallo (fresh salsa) because it is so tomatoey and so perfect on their crispy chips. 

Didja order? Didja get in that long ass line that moves pretty quickly, order from the nice Mexican ladies, repeat your order twice and are now clutching their famous white plastic bag? Good, now get back on BART and watch everyone else drool while you devour some of the most delicious Mexican food in the city.
author: Fancypants X.

description: I'm going to put myself out there and say that this is one of my favorite burritos in the City. Better than El Castillito, La Taqueria, Gordo, El Farolito, Cancun, Pancho Villa, and whichever other ones I've been to. Why? It's not like it's a lot better, but it has all the elements I'm looking for: good ratio of beans/rice to meat, tightly wrapped, so it's not really messy, tasty meat options, and bonus on the 'prawn' burrito. Also had their chicken quesadilla, which was stuffed with grilled chicken and melted cheese goodness. Quick service, excellent agua fresca, but maybe a couple bucks more expensive than some of the other places out there.
author: Saunders C.

description:
Fresh, quick, basic Mexican food PLUS the option of made-to-order fish or shrimp dishes.  

You get to look over the quality ingredients as you move down the efficient line.  Everything was normal until I had to wait at the end. Why? Because they were grilling the shrimp I just ordered. Nice!

The seating is clean, but without atmosphere and no lingering is encouraged.
author: Galen W.

description:
The La Corneta in the Mission is one of my favorites, so I figured I'd give this one a shot and brave the 20 minute lines. Was glad to see them charbroil their own meats.

As for the burriro I got - the tortilla tore a bit, which was kind of a pain, but I guess I should be happy that they overstuffed it. On the other had, there was so much rice and beans, it was hard to taste anything else. The spicy pico de gallo got overwhelmed, and the hot sauce they give you on the tables wasn't really very spicy.

The whole burrito ended up being kind of bland. Now I understand that this could be a result of rush hour, but still, I was pretty disappointed. I'll likely come back and give them another try as I'm in the neighborhood, but I won't be in a hurry.
author: Owen R.

description:
Went here because I was dragged and had no other choice. Believe me, I love mexican food and could probably eat burritios four times a day, but I was in a total chinese food mood, bitter that I wasn't going to get my kung pow and greasy eggplant in me that night.
 
I'll admit, my mind was pretty much instantly changed when I walked into this place. Its the kind of taqueria where you walk the assembly line of meats, toppings, and salsas, choosing what you want as you walk towards the back of the restaurant. Their meat selection is pretty standard along with their salsa selection...I went with carnitas nachos since that's how i gauge my Mexican restaurants and believe me, it did not disappoint! I got them to go since Mexican restaurants typically pack more nachos into a to-go box than on a plate. I swear, when they were making my nachos, i didnt think the box was going to be able to close...they packed in so much meat, guac, tomatoes, lettuce...it was a thing of beauty. 

My friends got burritos and I got more nachos than one should eat by themself....everyone was happy. I would go again

Pluses - good carnitas, wide selection of fresh stuff, affordable, generous portions
Minuses - Its in Glen Park (but theres another location on 23rd and mission)
author: Nate F.

description:
This place is awesome! It's tasty, cheap, fast, and a huge menu. My favorite? The baby burritos, the perfect amount of food AND you get guacamole, sour cream and all that yummy not-good-for-you-stuff. Other things I enjoy : Aguas Frescas (fresh juices) (try getting half horchata half strawberry!), Churros, chile rellenos and the veggie burrtio. 

The only downfall? Almost always a long line. But it is worth the wait.

Oh wait, one more downfall....I live way to close to this place and La Corneta beats cooking anyday!
author: Molly W.

description:
This is our go-to Mexican joint simple because it is close by. Typically we order the super burrito but on the last visit we discovered the mini super burrito which is the perfect size (meaning I can eat the entire burrito in one sitting). The new favorite is the mini super with shrimp.

Tip #1:  
Be aware that unless you request otherwise they but lettuce in their burritos. This is just strange to me. By the time the wrap it up the lettuce is all wilted and slimy...simply request NO LETTUCE PLEASE and they are happy to oblige.  

Tip #2: 
This place can get very busy.  So, call your order in ahead of time. In 10-15 minutes waltz in to the front of the line and pick up order.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: There seems to always be a line here during lunchtime. I finally decided to try it out after a bank errand. I ordered the two enchilada plate, and for the first time I saw these put together in front of me and then the dish going into the oven. It's good but I can't rank it compared to other similar places. Funny they give you tortilla chips but without salsa, and instead there are two bottles (a red and green one) at the tables that can be squeezed out. I don't often go to taquerias but that's what I normally order when I do go. The yellow decor is a bit bright but at least it makes the place look clean.
author: H K.

description: The shrimp burritos are my favorite. I worked around the corner for 5 years and had lunch here like twice a week. I love their green salsa. We used them for catering as well so if you liked their food and want to have it at your next luncheon I strongly recommend it. Hassle free and delicious. Another good recommendation would be the spicy shrimp plate served with beans, rice and salad. Super good!!
author: Margarita M.

description: Pretty solid burrito place. Lots of options.
author: Tiff W.

description:
Solid.

+Fast service
-Long lines during lunch, of course.
author: JC R.

description: The best burritos, the freshest ingredients, and the friendliest service in the city. We've been going there for over 10 years and the quality has been equally high every time. And the price is amazing.
author: CJ R.

description: Not the best taqueria, but not the worst either. But the nice thing is it does offer fish tacos and burritos. The shrimp quesadilla is pretty decent here though. It seems as if they skimp a little on the meat/seafood portions. Drive a few extra miles and go to the Mission.
author: Minh V.

description:
Awesome awesome awesome!

This taqueria hits the spot when you need a good burrito (or prawn quesadilla, or super nachos...etc) Always good, always fast.

The fact that it's so close to home makes me happy every time!
author: Steve H.

description:
Excellent food!  

Burritos, tacos, you name it.  This place is worthy of a trip via Bart.  It is about a block from the Glen Park Bart station.

Sometimes the line gets a bit obnoxious, but this is a great place to eat.  Calling ahead for some take out is a good strategy as well.
author: Nelson W.

description:
I love La Corneta. I think they definately make the best HORCHATA. Sweet and non-grainy.  The prices are good, its bright and clean. I like the super taco - really filling. 

The only reason they get 4 is they long line - but hey at least we know the ingredients are flowing-through fresh.  I hate thinking people sitting right next to the line are staring at my butt. Chances are if I'm going for something heavy I'm already bloated.

Okay, Okay I also don't like peas and carrots in my rice.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
Holy Crap this place makes huge plates. Food's good and plentiful, but not all that inspired. Great place down the hill from my house now, and doubly awesome is that it's near the BART station. It's next to a bar that you can bring the food into. Beer + Food = Del.icio.us

check. it. out.  (if you're in Glen Park)
author: Tyler W.

description:
I've been going here since they opened....years and years and years ago....when they were a much smaller establishment. I grew up on these tasty little burritos. Lets just put it this way...If tomorrow was my last day on earth....i'd eat here for lunch!

my mouth waters and my stomach churns, just thinking about the fresh spicy pico de gallo and warm, perfectly salted, ,light, crispy, homemade tortilla chips....damn it! too bad i live 500 miles away now!

Everything is super dooper fresh and made right before your eyes...ohh and all the options, to make it just the way you like, i love options! Mild or Hot Pico de gallo, jalapenos and carrots, spanish rice,  black beans, refried beans, pinto beans, lettuce, cheese, sour cream, guacamole. what more could ask for in a taqueria? 
 I pray for the day that they open one up in san diego and show these socaliens what real mexican food is all about!
author: Natalia J.

description: I ordered delivery for 20+ people and the food was hot and on time. They also give you a lot for the cost... It's tasty and I would definately recommend!
author: Devin K.

description:
I love how I don't feel like I'm going to keel over and die after I eat here even though I am thoroughly, thoroughly content when I leave. 

Super baby burrito with their complimentary chips and salsa = the perfect amount of food for me.  

But I decided to get something new this time: fish (grilled salmon) tacos.  Damn that was good!  I was afraid the salmon was going to be fried and really heavy, but they surprised me by grilling it to order.

I love that they put peas and carrots in their rice!  It's just so much healthier than all the other Taquerias I've been to because they put a lot of fresh lettuce and salsa in their burritos.  

Damn, I'm craving some RIGHT NOW!  I MUST HAVE!  Next time, I'm going for the Fish Super Baby Burrito.  oh baby.... OH BABY...
author: Anna T.

description: Food is decent but overpriced.   Service is horrible.  The lady who bags the chips and women at the cashier needs to take a class on customer service.  I have been there multiple times to see if maybe they were just having a bad day.  Nope. They are like that ALL THE TIME.  I will never come back and I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Ren C.

description:
Farolito and Cancun this place certainly isn't. It's far too bright and clean to be a 'reputable' taqueria. However, they DO accept credit cards, which is a big plus in my book, especially when I'm feeling too lazy to head to the ATM before lunch. 

I think I might just be too biased to really give La Corneta a fair review, in reality, everything I've gotten here has been really good. Their shrimp burrito is excellent and their chicken burritos are perfectly spiced. Also, you have the option of getting a 'baby' burrito which means you won't slip into a food coma at 2pm after having one for lunch at noon.

I guess I just don't trust a taqueria that's well-lit and clean!
author: Craig E.

description:
Definitely not the best Mexican food at all. La Corneta can't hold a candle to some of the great places in the Mission. However, my Super Taco was fulfilling and loaded with my favorite ingredients so I can't complain much. My bf's Steak Tacos were quite yummy too. 

We happened to come right when school got out around 3pm. I felt like I was in a high school cafeteria. It was way too rowdy and noisy.....good thing we picked up our food and left!
author: Anne E.

description:
This joint is across from the BART station for an easy in and out burrito fix. Parking is not easy but with a few circles around, something does open up if you wish to drive. 

Some good bars nearby in the hood. 

The shrimp dishes are great at La Corneta as are the spicy chicken and carne asada fillin's. 

Vegetarians are not disappointed. 

Great mexican dishes a la San Francisco. Clean and family friendly - which means they have beer and other kids around.
author: James T.

description:
SO Fresh and So Clean

I started going to this Taqueria when they 1st opened they were much smaller and they ended up expanding by getting adjoining storefront. The food is Fresh and the Place is clean.

I love the Carne Asada and Prawn Burrito
It's a little high priced compared to some other Taquerias but it's always worth it.

I think it's the best place to eat in Glen Park..Check out there mission st location as well
author: Kim R.

description: Top 5 taquerias in SF! Clean, always good, crowded, prices are fair and they have limited seating. Lots of menu options and they have fast cooks! also, theyre cash only.
author: Cee B.

description: This is a solid place with pretty good carnitas and a decent sized portions.  However, I suspect my burrito was only that big because half of it was sour cream. Grody. The workers could step it up a little bit and I'd give them four stars. I know I can't always expect the best service from a burrito joint, but anyone could tell they didn't really give a shit about us. Four of us order, they only give salsa to one of us though we all have chips.  That's just...wrong.  I guess I could have used my bare chips to scoop all the excess sour cream out of my burrito. Hmph.
author: Skye L.

description: I love La Corneta!! This is one of my favorite places to get mexican food! I have been going here since I was  a little girl. I love getting super baby burritos or super nachos! The food is always fresh and made quickly. Also, their housemade horchata is a MUST!!
author: Thea M.

description:
This is my favorite Mexican Restaurant outside of the Misison District.  The food here is the bomb, portions are large, and good prices.  I always feel very satisfied after a regular burrito with carne asada, refried beans, rice, and spicy salsa.  And I always add an extra of guacamole.  Mmm mmm....I'm drooling just thinkin about it.

The only downside to coming here at peak hours is that the lines wrap around all the way back to the cashier and you might have to wait for a table.
author: Steve D.

description:
I'm Mexican. And I have eaten a lot of burritos. Here, and SoCal.

And this one is the best one I have ever had, hands down. Don't go all the way to the Mish! It's right by the Glen Park Bart station! The salsa is divine, which never happens, and holier than holy, it is actually clean.

The only thing I don't like is that it's cash only. Not like that's uncommon in this city though.  Oh, SF, you silly cash-only bastard.
author: Shannon V.

description:
Our favorite taqueria. Actually, the Mission location is, but this one's closer to us. 

The food here is really good. The taco dinner is our favorite. A bargain for the taco, rice and beans. Enough food to fill you up, and not leave you feeling paralyzed-by-fullness like the huge burritos do. 

The baby burritos are another good deal. They're not too small, especially at the Mission location. I'll never order a regular burrito there again. Although, I do order the Baby Super Burrito. 

Good commuter tip: call ahead and place your order. Get there, pass the line, and go straight to the register and pickup your food.
author: kristen b.

description:
Went here to get my taco fix at 6PM and there was a really long line.  I was expecting this from all the 5 star reviews.    Got a Carne Asada taco and a Carne Asada burrito.  I love me some Carne Asada.  

The taco was Huge.. But the problem was reached when I had to use a fork for my taco.  And that's not too good.  The tortilla was falling apart, but the portions were big.  So that's why I gave it 4 stars.  

The Burrito was great.  Good size and packed full of yummy goodness.  One of the better burritos that I have had in my era.   If you like your food spicy, you have to try their Hot salsa.  Very good and packed a good punch.   

Will come back again to try something else and probably to try eating it there to see if there is a difference compared to bringing it back to my place.  I'm sure that it was part of the reason for my disintegrating taco.
author: Herb C.

description:
Burritos can be ordered in regular and small sizes, when you don't feel like downing the equivalent of two meals in one sitting. They've got lots of options to choose from in terms of the tortilla (whole wheat, spinach, flour, corn) and beans (black, refried, whole). Plus a wide selection of fillings: Tofu, Salmon, Shrimp, and your garden variety of meats. It's true, the line's always long, but I suggest you call your order in before you get there and pick up your food at the front of the line. Don't forget to leave a tip.

P.S.
The super prawns burrito is a must. Besides being filled with a load of shrimp and sauteed onions, this burrito is set apart by it's tasty brown sauce.

Also good is the Fish (Salmon) Burrito. These two take an extra 5 minutes to prepare, so be ready to wait or phone ahead.
author: David G.

description:
I lived in San Diego for 5 years and the Mexican at La Corneta even puts lots of the burrito places there to shame!  

During rush hours, be prepared to wait in a line, but, unlike other taquerias in the city, it is clean, decorated, has cool murals to check out while you are waiting, and up-beat.  

I love their Baby Vegi Burrito Super Style.  It has everything in it that its big brother does, but doesn't leave me in a food coma after finishing.  

You will have your option of three kinds of beans, lots of different meats (I don't eat much meat) that all look totally safe and tasty, and all sorts of fresh toppings.  There are multiple different kinds of tortillas; spinach, sun dried tom, whole wheat, etc.  Everything is beyond fresh, if nothing else, becuase it is so durn busy!

There isn't much good food around this area of the city, but I could eat at La Corneta 5 nights a week and be quite a happy camper.  Their portions are large, and prices fair.  But best of all, it is all cooked in front of you so you don't have to be wondering what happened to your Mex food before it made it into your hands. 

Happy Eating!
author: Julie H.

description:
First time I drove by this place, there was a line out the door and down the block and I thought , "Hey, they must be giving away burritos!". Unfortunately, no free burritos--La Corneta is just that good that the place gets packed. Burritos, tacos, quesadillas are all huge and well-priced. The "baby" burritos are the best deal--and there's nothing "baby" about 'em. The fish burritos here feature salmon and are wonderful. Even better is the fish tostada! 

And don't wait in line--call ahead, order your Super Baby Fish Burrito and skip right up front to the register.
author: Wendy G.

description:
i absolutely love this burrito place! its always my first choice for mexican food. BUT (oh no) the lines get really really long especially whenever I feel like eating there.  One time the line was so long that me and my boyfriend just drove all the way to mission (i think its called la taqueria... pretty good)

my usual orders are the super baby chicken burrito and i also get the super crispy taco from time to time..

i took off one star because one time me and my friends ordered to go from here and everyone but me got a BAD case of diarrhea.. we think it was from the sour cream because my order didnt have any.. haha i lucked out
author: JUDY L.

description:
Coming up on an appointment in Glen Park, I needed a quick place to grab a bite for lunch.  Knowing nothing about La Corneta, I stopped in to check it out.  Now I am damned glad that I stumbled on it.  I do believe that this is my new favorite SF Mexican destination.  The fresh salmon burrito (grilled, not fried!) was excellent, abundant, and reasonably priced (about $7) and the carnitas taco was delicious.  The generosity of the portions combined with the free chips led me to realize that the $2 taco would have been enough - but I'm glad that I got to try both.

It's hard to find Mexican restaurants with fresh fish tacos or burritos - all too often it's fried fish that's offered...my trips to Glen Park are now definitely going to be split evenly between the fabulous Gialina pizzeria  (gourmet pizza with truffle cheese? oh yeah) and La Corneta...both extraordinary compared to all of their SF and Bay Area peers.
author: Josh M.

description:
When I'm in the area (which is often) this is my "go to". Its consistently tasty, super fresh ingredients, friendly staff, and great prices! 

Avoid the dinner rush that starts promptly at 7pm. If unavoidable, they take phone orders, that way you just walk in, pay, and walk out. 

The aqua frescas taste like you stuck a straw straight into (insert fruit of choice - mine would be canteloupe). Plus the staff always remembers a regular, and they hook you up too. I still owe them two bucks becasue I was short last time....but they didn't mind! They just said, "bring it next time"!
author: Crystal A.

description:
La Corneta builds one of the best burritos in the city.  It can be tough to find a really great burrito spot in the city within walking distance if you're not a fixie-riding hipster living at 20th an Valencia.  For those of us near Glen Park, La Corneta fills that niche.  

The super burrito really IS super: super big, super tasty, and, unfortunately, super expensive.  While you're almost guaranteed to have to unbutton your jeans/loosen your belt after eating here, you're going to have to lighten your wallet considerably first.  

Keep in mind, however, what you're paying for.  The ingredients are fresh, the meat NEVER dry, and the rice better than most.

The atmosphere is a definite plus.  While some may prefer the dingy/grungy taqueria that hasn't seen a health inspection in my lifetime ("It's more authentic," you claim...) La Corneta is, by comparison, a class act, and I like that.

Five stars for great food in a convenient location with great service and atmosphere. Subtract one star for cost.
author: Zachary S.

description:
This is a little more expensive than your typical Mission taqueria, which surprises me since they have a location in the Mission. 

They don't have the fastest service.  In fact I showed up yesterday, I was the only customer, and it took two minutes for an employee to notice me.

That said, it's very good.  My boyfriend has gotten nachos there several times (carne asada & carnitas) and loves them.  I like their burritos.  But yesterday, I decided to switch it up and I got a super baby burrito.  This has all the fixings (sour cream, salsa, guacamole, etc.) but in a smaller size.  It was only $4.50.  And it was more than enough to kill my hunger.  I will stop being a fat American and no longer order the regular size burrito...at least, as long as I have my baby burrito option.
author: Dwigt S.

description:
