Tip: Order a Super Taco!  It's like $3.50 and can be a meal in itself.  Sure, you can't pick it up and have to eat it like a salad, but it's good budget eats.

Alternately, if there are three of you, get the Super Nachos.  As long as you are all under 200 lbs and not starving, it should be enough to feed all of you.  They really pile it on, yo.
author: Jared M.

description:
Dang where have I been? This place is so good! I never noticed it existed until I saw it on yelp and decided to check it out.

I'm at Glen Park Bart Station all the time, and sadly, i've only seen Viking's Submarines as a cheap, decent, and closest place to get a meal-to-go. After  ordering a delicious super baby burrito one afternoon around 2PM at La Corneta, i am really looking forward to coming here again. 

Once I walked in, the place was busy and packed! Every table was occupied, so that's a good sign right? Definitely! They know how to quickly move and make fresh and awesome burritos. Next time, i'd like to try something other than a burrito. :)
author: Bets Y.

description: It's an above average SAN FRANCISCO burrito.  That alone deserves 4 stars because the burritos here are so fine and deliciously tasty.  In comparison to other SF spots though, it's a whole lot better than many of the average Mission spots like Cancun, and is maybe even a top 5 contender for best burrito in the city.  I give it 5 stars though because unlike a lot of the burrito leaders, this place actually has delicious chips to compliment your burrito, instead of those awful corn/cardboard hybrid bagged chips that aren't even as good as Tostitos which are served at many places.
author: Greg J.

description: I Love this place! Good place for your Tacos, Burritos and any Mexican food you're craving. A little pricey but it has a great selection on whatever you like on your food, there's free chips and salsa for every "sit in" dining. A little bit crowded when it gets busy and boy,does it go really busy! The only thing i don't like about this place is that the proprietors do not accept plastics (Credit Cards/Debit Cards) to which it's really a major drag. Other than this, everything is good!
author: Joel A.

description: Very good place to go if you live near by. Yes there is always a line but it  moves rather quickly too. Prices are decent but the parking is somewhat of a pain. Other than that, come by and stuff your face with a chicken burrito!
author: Spooky B.

description: I'm taking off one star from my previous review.  It probably depends on which person makes your food but the last couple times I've gone my food has been a little short of my expectations.  For example, a taco was made so poorly that I actually had to take it home and use my own tortillas to re-make it.  I think it's a good idea to stick to the burritos because the tacos are pretty poorly prepared.
author: Amber R.

description: Prawwwnnnnn burrrittto!!! Mmmmmmmm.... And don't forget some hot chips and guac on the side. Delic.
author: Colleen M.

description:
It's a shame I live so far away from here, otherwise I'd make sure this place stays in business.  Although, it doesn't seem to need any help from me.  I somehow managed to get in here before a line started forming outside the door and down the street.

I ordered a carne asada super baby burrito and it was delicious! Generous portion for even a baby burrito (I wonder what the regular burrito looks like!) Cute little place, will definitely come back again.  It's walking distance from the glen park bart station :)
author: MissJennifer L.

description: LOOOOOVE this place!!! I've been going here since the mid 90's (back when it was half the size!) no other Taqueria can compare! (at least not without charging waaaaay too much) their rice is awesome, and incomparable, it is the essential staple to any burrito or plate, which the other ingredients gather around in awe! oh... if i could have one now, and every night, i would be oh so happy...
author: Caitlin S.

description: We used to head over to the Mission to get amazing and excellent authentic Mexican burritos.  We no longer travel to the Mission because La Corneta brings all of that to Glen Park and is one of the best burrito places in San Francisco. When they first opened, they were a little whole in the wall but their fan base grew very rapidly. Everything is prepared fresh daily and made to order. The staff is friendly and the price is incredible for those on tight budgets. The prawn burrito is one of the best with fresh, sweet prawns. I'm scoping out other types including the Chicken Mole.  Be prepared for the lines out the door - it's worth the wait!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Every good San Franciscan has their favorite Taqueria. IMHO, you can tell the locals from the posers based on whether their favorite is in the 16th/mission area or not (posers only know about taquerias in the mission if you ask me.)

I've been eating at La Corneta since I was a 14 year old vegetarian. And my order (super baby vegetarian burrito) hasn't changed much, even though I'm not a vegetarian anymore. (Now I add sliced avocado, but that's the only change.)

Things I love about La Corneta:

1. Baby burritos! They are the answer to the "burrito belly" effect that happens every time I get a burrito somewhere else. I have no self-control when it comes to eating burritos. None. I can't  stop myself from finishing them because the tastiest bites are always at the end. But finishing other burritos just makes me feel sick. Too much food! I'm sleepy! My tummy hurts! Baby burritos are the answer. I can finish my burrito and not feel too badly (the secret is the smaller tortilla size, and the smaller portions of the fillings). 

2. Sliced avocado! Glorious addition, and only a little bit more $. Be sure to wait until after they've put the guac in to ask for it, that way you get double avocado love!

3. The mural. 

However, the ladies that work there are sometimes surly, and often don't listen. You have to watch them making your burrito so you don't end up with the wrong stuff in it (or no sour cream when you wanted it, or no guac, or whatever). Just watch them and you'll be fine.

Also, the line is often ridiculous, and many of the people don't THINK about what they want while they're waiting for 10 minutes to order (personal peeve). Nothing La Corneta can do about that. but SERIOUSLY people. Think while you're in line, and save us all some time! (That should be a rhyme!) 

Oh, and they're cash only. Always a little bit lame when places are cash only, I think.

But still, my all time favorite SF burrito.
author: Marissa K.

description:
This is for the Diamond location only...

This is really one of the most overlooked and underrated burrito places in the city. Rating your favorite burrito place is so subjective an exercise it's akin to rating your favorite musician or movie, but if you like a good taqueria experience, this place is worth a look. 

Mole chicken, prawns, huge quesadillas, great crispy tacos...they cover the standard offerings extremely well and then add some cool stuff on top. Cool baby burritos (yes, there's a super) for those that don't want to eat something the size of their forearm.

Definitely call in your order, because the lines there are often mad foolish. That's the only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars...
author: Jay N.

description:
The first one is the one you remember the most fondly, right?

This is the site of my first "real" burrito: which is to say, the first burrito I had west of the Mississippi, the first burrito I had that was not originally frozen, the first burrito I ever saw that was as big as my head and much more tasty.

This is the place where I take my ignorant east coast friends for a burrito when they come to visit - if only to hear them rant and rave about it for the rest of their visit.  "It was so good," they say.  "It was so big," they say.  "It was only five dollah," they hollah.  

I've had other burritos at other places that are probably better, but you know, for me, this is the place I like to go for my super burrito; line or no line - I can get a burrito and take it next door (to the GPS) and eat it with a beer, no problem.  

Plus, it's clean; the people behind the counter hustle, it's cheap, there's easy parking nearby, it's consistent, and it's as big as my head.  Those other places?  You don't always get those things at the corner taqueria, but you get them here.

All hail La Corneta!  Or as we say: MUY ES GRANDE!
author: Jacob R.

description:
Very solid burrito.
There platters are good, but maybe not quite great.

Good is a good thing mind you!!!!
author: JR H.

description:
Good food. Fair prices and healthy if you order right.

Gets really busy during peak hours so a phone order is highly recommended.

I recommend the Chicken Mole burrito!
author: Eugene L.

description:
Mileu:
Ghetto fast food with ghetto neighborhood.  Will only go if it is work week.  

Service:
Nice people.   Gave me extra chips.  Will be back

Food:
EXCELLENT.  I used to go down to TJ with my parents and ate at this one tiny restaurant that had the BEST tacos in the world.  This totally made me reminisce about it.  OMG, it was so good.  I will be back.  Look for the only asian guy among the latino crowd with 10 tacos all by myself.  So damn good, and hella cheap.
author: M L.

description:
Wow,first thing I was amazed at was the menu selection.

Menu options are quite good.I can't decide each time.Parking can be a little tough and this place can get a little busy.

If you are on Bart it is easier to walk to and order vs driving +parking.If you live up the street/neighborhtood  that is a plus.Parking will not be a factor to you.


Quite good.
author: Dani D.

description:
WWW.BOMB.COM 

That's what this place should be called. 
It's gets 1 star off for the massive selection, and the crap enchiladas. 

I wish they only offered half the stuff because I always feel like an idiot standing in line wondering what to order. And all the other 100 people standing behind me pushing me forward don't make my decision any easier. Either do the pushy ladies serving the food. 

But, that's neither here nor there. 
I have been here enough times to really start to get the whole ordering process down. AND If you stick around through this review, I will give you the secret to the best damn thing you could EVER order from this place (not on the menu). SO, are you ready???
I'm going to tell you about a few of the things I really like from this place in no set order. Then I'll whip out the big gun. 

Here we go:

Super Steak and Shrimp ANYTHING- seriously, anything, especially since they grill the shrimp with clarified butter. mmmmm! 
but the SS&S taco salad is really good (feeds 2). The SS&S quesadilla and the SS&S burrito is great.

The Tacos Plate (Krispy)- Carnitas, the way to go. make sure to get sour cream and guac. 2 tacos, piled high with fixin's, beans and rice. make sure to get a fork

Tacos al Pastor (soft)- juicy and delicious. 

Chile Relleno- Great appetizer (do you need an appetizer for Mexican?)

Alright, here it is, my gift to you. The Chilenitas Burrito. I stole the idea for this burrito from one of my favorite spots in Ventura "Johnny's". 
Here's to you Johnny:

ChilenitasBurrito:
Chile Relleno with two scoops of the red sauce that they use for the Relleno (NOT THE SALSA)
Carnitas
Rice

That's it. Don't add anything, and definitely don't take anything out. This seems like a pretty simple burrito, but that's what makes it so genius. Try it. Love it. Spread the word. 

Audi 5000
author: Lawrence A.

description:
Ah La Corneta how I miss you.  You make me salivate and my stomach growl when I think of devouring your succulent selections.  Well, I can't have you anymore, but I still dream of you.

Best shrimp Burritos in the Bay.  Best, Best, Best.  Yes even better than Taco Bell!  How can you beat chihuahua poop filled tortilla's, you ask?  Well somehow La Corneta has managed.

I will have you again someday, you just wait and see.
author: Rob B.

description:
We tend to head down here more during the school year to grab some quick take out.  The food is good, but I was disappointed last time I order my regular fish taco.  In the past they threw it on the grill when you place the order, this last time, they had pre-grilled the salmon and tossed it on the grill to warm up, but it was ice cold in the middle.

The burriots and other items are not as good as Pancho Villa Taqueria, but that's a bit far to drive when I have to rush to get my kids fed at 7:30 at night.
author: Twist' D.

description:
Cheap, quick and delicious!  Those are the three adjectives that come to mind when i think of La Corneta.  I'm SO glad that I live within walking distance of this place!

My favorites:

Mushroom Quesidilla - I would recommend not taking this out and eating it there, otherwise, by the time you take it home, it might be soggy.  And plus, if you eat it there, you get unlimited salsa that's on the table!  I can't get enough of their salsa!

Super Baby Chicken Mole Burrito - Ok, you don't have to get a super, but I want all the fixings and can't finish a regular sized burrito.  Heck, I even have a hard time finishing the Super Baby!  Their chicken mole is tasty!  I normally don't enjoy white meat, but the white meat in this mole is juicy and flavorful.  Tack on some sour cream and quacamole and I'm all set!  

BEWARE - You will experience food coma after eating their burritos.  I've almost always taken a nap after having a meal here.

TIP - The line gets pretty long on the weekends and during rush hour on weekdays.  Call in your order ahead of time and walk straight to the front to pick it up.  It'll save you about 10 - 15 minutes.
author: Dorothy T.

description:
Best spicy chicken burritos and spicy chicken tostada's EVER!!!!!!

Hate the long lines and looking for parking but food is spectacular!!!!!!!! Need I say more?????
author: V M.

description:
Have been coming here for about (has it really been?) 10 years now and the food is fabulous!

The super baby burrito are just enough; shrimp or carnitas or al pastor (like adobo) are the best! Their super tacos are awesome too! 

They also sell tres leches cake (yum) and cream/custard filled churros (can it get any better than that?)!

The line can be long at times, but it moves along quickly and is worth the wait.
author: Kelly R.

description:
La Corneta is my local neighborhood taqueria.  They will always hold a special place in my heart for introducing me to, my now favorite burrito - the Chile Relleno Burrito.  I will never forget that special moment when I noticed it on the menu, when I coyly ordered it, not knowing what would come of it.  I remember my first bite of warm cheese, hot chile and pillow-like rice and breading.  And now, I'm addicted.  Its literally the only burrito I order anywhere, and when it isn't available I tend to pout.  

La Corneta's Chile Relleno Burrito sets my benchmark for all chile relleno burritos.  Namely falling into three categories:  Ingredients, Density, Composition.  The ingredients are most important as a C.R.B can only be as good as it's Chile Relleno is.  Also, the quality of the beans and the rice is equally important as they add or subtract a lot of flavor.  The density of any burrito is calculated based on the air to stuffing ration inside the burrito.  A properly dense burrito should be able to be rolled tightly with a nice blend of rice, beans and chile relleno in every bite.  Lastly, the composition of a burrito is based on all things involved other than tortilla, rice, beans and chile relleno.  This includes anything from smothering the burrito to adding sour cream and guacamole.  

The IDC Breakdown:
Ingredients: 9  Their ingredients are incredibly tasty and their chile relleno is subtle, hot but not too hot, cheesy but not too cheesy.  Their rice is light and the beans are thick without being greasy.  

Density: 9  Their burritos are tightly rolled and double wrapped with aluminum foil.  After the initial bites you can clearly see the equal distribution of the rice, beans and chile.  

Composition: 9  At La Corneta you can opt to order your Chile Relleno Burrito with or without Cheese, Guacamole, Lettuce, Tomato, Sour Cream, & Salsa.  If you want it with, order your burrito "Super," if you want it without order your burrito "Regular."  I especially like that La Corneta trims the stem from the relleno before heating it up, and heats the relleno in a light tomato broth.  

All in all, La Corneta is my favorite place to go for a chile relleno burrito - though I often wish it was less popular.  Those lines can get crazy!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
The situation: I was hungry and had just gotten off BART at Glen Park, and was feeling like having some Mexican food.  The solution: La Corneta Taqueria.

I went with the a selection from the "specials" column of the menu - two chicken tamales with rice and beans.  Here's how I break it down:
tamales - i really liked 'em.  best part of the mea.
rice: okay
beans: okay
They cover the tamales in cheese.  Maybe not the most healthy, but I can deal.

Their cleaning guy was a bit obtrustive to the dining experience...to the point that if CYE's Larry David were eating there, he'd have taken issue. But yes, the place is fairly clean, though I did have to wade through a couple dirty utensils before finding a suitable fork.  That brings me to a couple reasons I had to lower this place's rating: plastic utensils and they only take cash.   It's 2008, get with it.

I'd go here again for convenience, but I think there are better taquerias in SF.
author: Charles R.

description:
biggest taco ive ever gotten in san francisco .. and ive been around ... but not the best tasting ... though not bad at all ... 
really fresh ingredients too !!
author: Micah W.

description:
Grilled salmon tacos!!!  Delicious and fresh!  Everything is great here... seriously, everything.  Ceviche, too!  

I keep hoping and praying that La Corneta will open a location in Oakland's Grand Lake neighborhood, or central Alameda (new retail space going in at Buena Vista and Sherman [hint hint]).  Current Mexican offerings in both of those locations leave much to be desired.

Love you, La Corneta!
author: C P.

description:
This is my kind of Taqueria. Even for a vegetarian, the possibilities are endless when you can choose the type of beans, type of salsa and type of tortilla!

I am withholding a fifth star because the burrito didn't completely knock my socks off. However, when taken together with the tasty one dollar churro and EXCELLENT Strawberry Fresca, this place makes for a pretty satisfying meal.
author: matt k.

description: I ate here with my friend and found it to be a pretty decent taqueria. Its one of those clean, fresh, taquerias that you would find in a nicer neighborhood so dont expect it to be one of those hole in the wall locations. When i went there, the spot was pretty empty and that just how i like it! I ordered the steak and prawns burrito because it was recommended by my friend. The burrito was actually very good, tasted fresh. I didnt like the wild rice combination they put, something about peas and carrots in a burrito is just weird to me. Also there wasnt enough flavor in the prawns to justify it costing over 10 bucks. Also the portion isn't as generous as other places. That coupled with crappy parking in that neighborhood (not entirely their fault but it should be noted) i'll give this spot just an ok.
author: Julio S.

description: Fresh, tasty, reasonably priced, great downtown Glen Park location, owner is a really nice guy, staff has been there for years and are really nice.  What else can you ask for?
author: M N.

description: I think I just found my new favorite taqueria.  The people working there are friendly and the food is tasty!  I had a crispy puerco con chile taco and a prawn taco.  The prawns were simple, but YUMMY.  The prawns were fresh and perfectly grilled with that slightly smokey flavor I love.  Highly recommended...
author: Kevin M.

description:
Looking for a taqueria that doesn't disappoint?  La Corneta is the one!  I love going here with my family, since they are the ones that introduced me to it.  From time to time, our Sunday lunches have consisted of their menu!  It's in the heart of Glen Park, and when I mean heart, I mean heart.  It's close to a bus stop and the BART station.  So there's a lot of car AND people traffic.  There are many other stores around there such a Whole Foods and other restaurants like Tyger's.

This is probably the only taqueria in the city I will go to by myself and not forced by people.  I love it here.  The menu is awesome and the selection to add in plentiful.  The way their wrap your burrito too is SUPERB.  Not no envelope wrapped Taco Bell crap, no sir.  Tight and packed for your enjoyment.  The only bad I would say is that they don't accept card, even though there are several banks near by; the line can get pretty long and it's pretty small inside; and the parking can get irritating.

Love this place though, either way.  (:
author: Xandra Marie G.

description:
All of the hype about Cancun in the Mission has drawn attention away from this lil jem.  Located in the "downtown" area of Glen Park this place is uber popular and makes a wonderful burrito.  

Be it Chicken, Carnitas, Carne Asada or Shrimp its all bueno. 

Thumbs UP:  Great food - period.
Thumbs DOWN:  Its in Glen Park and the line is always 20 + deep
author: Jeff C.

description:
Love this place!  It's the only taqueria that I'll order steak at.

My fave: the baby fish burrito-- with salmon!
author: SaraMitra P.

description:
Ok, I'm a San Francisco native.  Born and Bred.  I've been working my way through neighborhoods one apartment at a time.  The Richmond, The Fillmore, The Castro, Ingleside, Noe Valley, Glen Park, Cow Hollow ... you get the picture.  And being a native San Francisco I have trolled my fair share of Mexican resturants, Taqueria's mostly.  I am of the opinion that La Corneta on Diamond street could, quite possibly, be the best Taqueria in S.F.  I know that's a risky proposition and maybe I should qualify this by saying the best one "I" have been to.  But  I gotta tell you, it's pretty damn good and it's INCREDIBLY reasonably priced.  My personal suggestion is to have the super taco.  For under $5 my wife and I have been known to share one happily.

Now, don't expect anything cutting edge or fancy.  It's just a taqueria.  A clean, well run and consistantly great taqueria.  No mango salsa.  No Chilean Sea Bass.  But good food everytime.  Check it out.
author: Torbin B.

description:
UPDATE!!!!!!

Okay, so I thought I loved this place.  I don't know WHAT HAPPENED.  Seriously, where's the need for all this lettuce.  And sour cream.  Blech.  I'm taking this down to three stars that Burrito was so bad.

The chips are hella good! And they give you as much as you want, for free (I'm looking at you Farolito!!)  

I just love hanging out in this place while I'm eating.  You don't feel oppressed by the smallness/bleakness of the environment and the chairs are super comfy.  
 
Everyone's a winner!
author: Bill P.

description:
I've tried the burritos, the quesadillas, and tacos.  They are all on hit.  This is my 2nd favorite burrito place in SF (after La Taqueria).

Whether you go to the one on Mission or the Diamond St. location, you will not be let down.  At both places the lines can be long but it is worth the wait.  The free chips are excellent, not too oily at all.

Plus they have a wide variety of items.  I've been a bunch of times and still have yet to try all the appealing items.
author: Pete M.

description: Hands down La Corneta has some of the best Mexican food in the city. I have never been disappointed here and I always go home with leftovers. It's perfect after a wintery walk at Funston or a late-late night. Very fresh, very tasty, and very good prices.
author: Bridget W.

description:
Great lengua (beef tongue).  I checked this place out with a friend recently.  I had two tacos, one carne asada and the other lengua.  I was very surprised with the lengua...very tender and a light tomato sauce.  The tacos are so filled with meat that you can't pick them up.  Next time I'll just have a lengua plate with rice and beans.  Very tasty aguas frescas...I had the melon.  

They are busy around lunch time and parking can be a little difficult.  The place is also very clean.  I'll have to check-out the Burlingame location soon.
author: Alberto S.

description:
i give this 4 stars only because the "super tacos" i order are ALWAYS bomb, but you MUST talk them through everything you want ... and Yes ... they did raise the prices and that sucks because the food isnt worth the price, i bet they just have to pay the new minimum wage for The City.

The food is good and the parking lot around the corner is free (the gravel lot)

if you show up during "prime" food hours, you will wait a little bit because the line gets beefy...

if you want simple items with little changes...phone the order in....also they dont take CREDIT/DEBIT ... but major atms are all over the area....
author: Marcus B.

description:
When I first moved the city two years ago my aunt took me here.  I ordered my usual two carne asada tacos.  Normally it all tastes the same to me, but I've been thinking about those two tacos ever since.  It tasted so fresh and was so filling I kept vowing to come back.  But I forgot where it was and what it was called.

Today as I was driving to the dentist I found it again.  After my appointment, (sore gums and all) I found my way back.  Yahooo!!!!!  I ordered the super prawn tostada for take out.  It made the trip back to Daly city with and held up pretty well.  The prawns are so tender and cooked perfectly.  The tostada wasn't soggy even after my trip home.  Hmm, can't wait to go back now that I know where it is!
author: Sonic D.

description: Great food here. I've been coming here for years and they've been consistently delicious. But do yourself a favor and try to avoid the commuter rush in the evenings, the line gets pretty long.
author: Ian C.

description: Couldn't bring myself to order anything here last night. Bf had a mushroom quesadilla swimming in grease and some kind of pork and bean thing on a tortilla. Lets just say  almost 24th hours later, he is  still sick. Won't be back ever
author: Colette C.

description: Yes...... he is going to say it..... the best taqueria in San Francisco.
author: Mike J.

description:
I didn't even at La Corneta and it was the greatest dining experience I've ever witnessed.

I sat across from a raging lunatic that devoured a carne asada and shrimp plate while everyone around him thought nothing of it. Little did they know that they were in the presence of Ike Turner reincarnate. La Corneta gets five stars for feeding wild beasts and keeping their alter egos from manifesting itself into a hulk more incredible than Mr. Turner himself.


PS. Just a tip for La Corneta... warm up those damn burritos after you put all the slop in them. I hate cold cheese...
author: Gordo M.

description: We've lived in GP and frequented this place for many years.  We call this the yuppie/GenX burrito joint.  La Corneta is consistantly good.  But there are better in our City.  My issue is with the hustle and buslte behind the counter which all to often leads to screwed up orders.  If you have a single order, you are fairly safe.  Our issue is:  seems no matter if we call in or place our family order at the counter, at least one burrito, taco, etc will be screwed up.  A one time occurance I/we could accept.  But this is an ongoing issue.  Language is not the issue as my Son and I both speak and often order in spanish.  So when we are hungry for burritos and don't feel like driving and searching for parking in the Mission, we usually agree to "play russian roulette" at La Corneta.  Last night we waited in line, tried to watch our order and yet ... this happened Again!  Hence this review.
author: Gerry M.

description: Two tacos.  Both way too big.  You could look at this positively and say that you get a lot of meat for your money, but the liquid soaked through so fast and they were so unwieldy that they fell apart and I had to use a fork.  And the meat was blah.  So no great shakes, get on BART down to the Mission or just walk under the freeway and you can find better food.
author: Spike S.

description:
I went here last week with my boyfriend to grab some dinner. My boyfriend got the shrimp & steak burrito, and let me tell you... they DO NOT play when it comes to the meat! They gave huge portions of meat and steak.

I got the fish taco (salmon), and the fish was very tender and tasty. I have been here a few times before, and will continue to come back.
author: Maria C.

description:
Ok people, yes this is a good burrito place but don't tell me you haven't notice that the service is lacking. They are cheap with their chips and salsa which irriates me since it's not like their making money from it. I order 4 burritos and will get 2 salsa's when I asked for at least 4 and barely get chips for everyone. I have to go back and ask again which is annoying and they look at you with that face.

Plus, why aren't they wearing gloves and hairnets?

I live in the area and the last thing I want to deal with after waiting in line for a long-time is someone who won't give up the chips and salsa!  What's up with that!
author: Daxia L.

description:
No other taqueria can compare to La Corneta. I could just be biased because I grew up eating there back when it was less than half the size that it is now. People rave about La Taqueria and other places, so I've gone and tried the food there, but my heart still belongs to La Corneta.

The lines are usually pretty long, but it goes by pretty quickly, and the food is definitely worth the wait : )
I recommend getting the super nachos or a super prawn quesadilla, but you can never go wrong with a burrito of your choice.
author: Katrina C.

description:
One of, if not, my favorite Mexican joints in th city. 

I make a point of eating here when im back in SF 

the food is Killer and you will not regret standing in line ( which happens sometimes )
author: Moises M.

description:
This was the first Taqueria I tried when I moved to SF 7 years ago and ever since then I've praised the place. All my friends who've I've brought here who claim they already go to the best Taqueria change their mind after trying this place.

If you're getting a burrito I recommend trying the spinach wrap and if you just wanna eat cheap but get FULL I recommend the Taco Dinner but if you really want to splurge that $10 go with the steak & prawns!!!!
author: Keith A.

description:
Can I just say that every time I eat at another taqueria, I am disappointed because of La Corneta?  This was my very first none Tex-Mex exposure to Mexican food and I fell in love.  Everyone else pales in comparison.  

You don't know how happy I was to see Al Pastor on the menu.  And it's not a pathetic Al Pastor.  It's hardcore, greasy, red Al Pastor!

Their orchata (sic?) rocks too.  

There's a line during mealtimes so patience is a virtue, but it gives you time to debate about what you want to eat.
author: Lynn L.

description:
Like other people have stated, I would come here even if it was out of the way.  The super fish quesadilla is dynamite and the grill man is superior.  Prior to coming here, I had tried numerous taquerias and Mexican restaurants in the city and I have always been let down.  That is, until I stumbled upon La Corneta.

Up until that point, I had stopped eating Mexican food altogether because I just didn't dig it anymore.  A friend of mine that went to school on the East Coast was back in SF for the summer and was over-axious about his newfound interest in working out.  So our tradition three times a week would be for us to go to La Corneta, therefore revitalizing my interest in Mexican food.  He would have tacos, and I would have the super fish quesadilla (made with large salmon fillets and an abundance of guacamole), and we would go to the gym afterwards.  Granted, I've packed on some muscles since then, not to mention good memories and a newfound respect for a damn good taqueria.
author: Brandon C.

description:
Don't let the line scare ya... it's one of the better burrito joints in The City.

Oh, wait a minute... NO, DON'T COME, THE LINE IS TOO LONG!!!

I'm kidding.  It may look horrific, but line goes fast.  The real problem is that the place is too small for the amount of customers they have, but I'm not going to hold that against them 'cause I always get take-out.  The line is what the line is, and won't change unless they open a second counter or start making crap food.

It's cash only, but the line would be a lot slower if people were allowed to pay with their credit cards.  If they were hurtin' for biz, then then they'd probably get a CC machine and let those bastards cut into their profits; these people don't need to do that because their food is good.  Besides, there's B of A and a Wells machine within baby-crawling distance, and they'll hold your food until you get back.  They know you'll be back for it, because it's damn good!

I haven't had it yet, but the steak dinner looks awesome.  That's an item that should be eaten there, and I don't often have the opportunity to stay.  The steak dinner is definitely on my to-do list, though.

Places this popular usually develop an attitude.  Not here.  I'm not saying every order goes through without a hitch, but there's a lot of communication required in making your burritos just right; a noisy environment and language differences don't help, but these people handle it as graciously as you could possibly imagine.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Boys and girls, I'm going to relate a painful truth. When you see something akin to these words "I can't BELIEVE people like X location. Y and Z are SOOOOO much better. [Insert veiled Ad hominem toward now ostracized positive commenter]", what you are reading is a common practice among us primates that scientists call cock flailing. Cock flailing is bullshit posturing, ego masturbation, and nothing more. Cock flailing should be ignored. Always. But it should especially be ignored when it involves San Francisco burritos, and especially when I do it.

That being said, is La Corneta the house of Chicomecoatl made flesh and distributing burritos in Glenn Park? No. This is a well above average carbo bomb manufacturing facility with good ingredients, good staff, and a good location. Period. It may not satisfy any of your hipster needs to be ironic and awesome, Beck probably won't play an unannounced acoustic set there, Gary Danko won't be examining the flavor characteristics of a gut buster there, but you will get a tasty, filling burrito at a decent price.
author: Aaron C.

description:
The food is always fresh and good!
The chips are great!

The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars (mind you this is all compared to other Taquerias and not to Michel Mina's latest!) is the service if you walk in during a busy time is very, very slow!

HINT:  I always phone ahead (even if I just drive up from outside) to beat the lines!     I don't have the patience to wait 10 minutes just to order!
author: Michael M.

description:
I finally made it into La Corneta the other day.  I'm not that into waiting in long lines, but I got lucky and hit it before the dinner rush.

The carnitas tacos and agua de fresa were amazing.  By the time I left the line was wrapped around and out the door.  

In terms of GF eating my meal went over fine.  But I could see contamination being a bit of an issue here since it looked like the wheat and corn tortillas could be warmed in the same warmers.  Be sure to be very specific about any modifications you need.
author: L C.

description:
My favorite taqueria in the city!

If you're going for a burrito, I'd recommend the "super baby burrito". There is nothing baby-like about it. It's still massively huge but saves a good chunk of change when compared to the super burrito. The super quesedilla is quite good as well- perfectly grilled and sloppy as hell.
author: Adam P.

description:
sooooooo worth the line!  

Top 5 Burritos that I have ever had

Plus they have 2 great squeeze bottles of sauce on every table!
author: Gina K.

description:
La Corenta is ok...

I used to like it a lot more before I had La Taqueria and the Los Compadres taco truck. The burritos are really good but the carrots and peas in the rice really kill it for me. Can't really get over it.

Love that they give you chips with your burrito though.

All in all... just OK.

That said, I end up eating here rather often because it's on my way home from the bart station.
author: Ryan U.

description:
despite the difficulty finding parking at times, this place is worth it!
the baby size is perfect for those who can't eat a lot while the regular size is good for two meals.
the spicy chicken burritos and fish burritos are delicious!  the tostadas are pretty decent-sized.  
the strawberry aguas are very good!  churros are pretty yummy also.  
you can't go wrong with anything here.  though the lines can get long (between 5-7pm), it can move quickly.
author: Serena L.

description: It's a taqueria.  So imagine busy and crowded with patrons scrambling to get a table before even placing an order.  Food here is decent but the meats are a bit fatty and not the choice cuts that you can get else where.  It's a good place to grab a bite for lunch because it's fast, but you'll probably have to eat it curbside.
author: MTBer I.

description: One of, if not the, best burrito joints in SF. I get the super steak and shrimp burrito, the most expensive one btw, but worth every penny. Don't forget the horchata!
author: mateo r.

description: Being that I was born and raised in San Francisco, I think everyone has their favorite taqueria. If you live in San Francisco, you can have a rotation of different taquerias everyday or even more, literally. Hahah. But this is my #1 burrito spot. I love their burritos and nachos, and the portions are big! I think they own more than one taqueria in SF 'cause I've been to the one in Cesar Chavez, which is as good as this place but I like this place better 'cause it's literally a 2-minute drive from my house. Lol. The only thing I don't like is that this place always has a line that reaches the door, which is a good thing for them but I can get impatient when being in line for too long. It gets super packed around 5pm when people start to get off work and come here to grab a quick to-go dinner. I think this is the only taqueria in the Glen Park neighborhood too, and it's convenient 'cause there's tons of public transportation nearby and BART is close by too. I think this is the only taqueria spot my mom goes to, too. She's the person who introduced my siblings and I to this spot 'cause whenever I'd go with my dad to pick my mom up from the Bart station when she'd get off work, we'd get some burritos on the way home.. and this was since I was in elementary or middle school, so it's been a long time.
author: Jessica R.

description:
The baby burritos are pretty filling as is.  The carne asada is moist and flavorful.  The al pastor was dry.  

Service was subpar and this was before the dinner rush.  It seriously felt like we were speaking different languages.  I had repeated twice what I wanted in my tacos and still had to be asked what kind of meat I wanted.  Maybe their format is different.  Maybe I'm supposed to tell them the meat after I tell them what beans I wanted and if I wanted a burrito or taco or torta, etc.....  I was annoyed.

Lastly, because we had our orders to go, I thought they would naturally provide a couple of the to go salsas but sadly it wasn't included.  What kind of service is that?  It's not put out for us to package our own salsa, so it's either ask for some, they provide, or I steal the squeeze bottles from the tables.  As a to go order, they should have asked or just tossed some in.  I felt we were blown off because we didn't look like regulars or we looked like newbies ordering.  The sketchy guy in front of us ordering just a bag a chips for $1 got better service as did the other sketchy guy who was just sitting at a table waiting for his order (the lady personally served him a bag of chips) while I stood by the register for more than 1 minute wondering why my order wasn't being rang up yet. 

TWO THUMBS DOWN FOR THEIR EFFICIENCY AND SUBPAR SERVICE.

I'll stick to Cancun and El Toyanese
author: David C.

description: I live near this place so I frequent it a lot.  The atmosphere for eat-in is uninspiring, so I usually get take out.  The service is fast, and even when the line is at its longest, you'll be out of there in 15 minutes with take-out.  The quality of the ingredients is good and the best bargain on the menu is the Baby and Super Baby burritos.  Their al pastor is good but not the absolute best I've had.  Still, never had a bad meal from here, and very reasonably priced.
author: A.J. F.

description:
ive been going here since oct 09 and i haven't stopped.  i used to eat cereal for dinner and find other low-cost meals but i'm sticking to la corneta.  they make their food fast and there are no surprises since everything they make is uniform.  

i have gotten to the point where the people working there know what i'm going to order and have it ready when they see me in line.  i dont know if thats good or bad.  but the food is consistently delicious.
author: John A.

description: I have to say that almost everytime I go there the burritos are just ok. Usually the tortilla is so wet and soggy from the beans and meat. Also there carnitas are way undercooked, and no one wants undercooked pork. Also- Cash Only which is always a pain.
author: Colin H.

description: Try the chicken salad - a really refreshing break from burrito after burrito.  And the dinner plates with enchaladas or chile relenos are muy bueno, too.
author: Gary F.

description:
Good solid Mexican food.  The shrimp and carne asada burritos are tops.  Also, the holy grail of good Mexican:  They have EXCELLENT chips. and salsa.

Tip for newbies:  Call once you get there is the line is too long, order some food for pick up and grab a beer at  Redrock or the dive next door.  One beer later, you will have you food faster then if you waited in line.  Trust me.  I have them at speed dial #5.
author: Tony A.

description:
The "Best Burrito" debate is too much of a religious war in this town to really weigh in on,  but La Corneta can hold its head up high.  When I used to live around the corner I hit this place up twice a week at least.

Good quality, effecient, friendly.  Can't ask for much more.  As others have said, call ahead and skip the line.  Those in line will bore holes in the back of your skull with their stares,  but screw 'em.
author: Ian M.

description:
I've been to La Corneta dozens of time, as a close friend of mine lives in Glen Park and we'd regularly grab chow there as a precursor to a night of debauchery or Smash Bros.

It's definitely good - a little bit pricey, and I don't like how there are peas and carrots in the rice.  Definitely a taqueria done Glen Park-style, clean, cute, efficient and a very pleasant place to be, even when there are snaking lines.  I just like my Mexican food a little greasier, a little grimier.  

If you're getting off at Glen Park BART and are craving something filling and substantial, you can't really go wrong with LC.
author: Keane N.

description:
Shrimp burritos, mmm mmm gooooooooooooood!

When I use to live back East and came home, before heading back out I'd stop here to get some grub for the plane and more.  I'd get burritos for my friends and they'd look forward for the hand delivered treats!

I've been going here since it started.  The people are nice, service is great, and good people watching at the Glen Park location.

Sad to say, the Burlingame Avenue location isn't the best...  Doesn't have the same SF feel but still good eats.
author: Mayah C.

description: Try the super burrito with an Agua De Melon. 4 adults and a baby for $50 (tip included). A whole lot cheaper than La Taqueria.
author: Joseph A.

description: This is currently my favorite taqueria anywhere, hence 5 stars.  It's a California style taqueria, so don't be disappointed if it's not what you got in Guadalajara.  I grew up in San Diego, and have lived in California for more than 30 years.  I have eaten a lot of mexican fast food.  This is a very, very good place.  My favorites are the Carne Asada Dinner Special (plate), the garlic prawn special (plate), the prawn burrito ("regular", refried beans, spicy salsa), and mushroom quesadilla.  Pretty much everything here is very good.   They assemble it they way you ask for it.  I would be very careful not to get a super burrito - way too much on it.  And lettuce never belongs on a burrito, i just don't get that.  Lucky I don't have to get it that way.   The point is, you can order food you don't like.  But if you ask for what you like (and you know what you like) you shouldn't be disappointed.
author: Eric S.

description: Yum, yum yum, yum yum!  Everything is authentic and good here.  Burritos are awesome, prawn quesadilla is out of this world.  Long line all the time, order for take out!
author: Rose D.

description: Unbelievable value. I had a regular chicken burrito that was big enough to feed a family of three. The burrito came with chips, and I bought a canned drink...all for $8. Will be back often
author: Kurt H.

description: The only thing I see going for this place is that it is the only Taqueria in Glen Park. I'm 0 for 2 here. I've tried the super taco and the super quesadilla. Both were mostly a mound of slop on a plate. Maybe I'll try something simple next time, but then that's it.
author: Bib G.

description: When this Taqueria came along the food quality was very good, better than most Taquerias in the bay area.Now it has become a dump the Carne Asada meat has a lot of fat i guess they don't cut the fat off the meat anymore to make it look like there is a lot of meat in your burrito.The tiny girl that looks like Rigoberta Menchu who runs the cash register is sometimes rude when you ask her for salsa for the little bit of chips she puts inside your bag.One time she put 6 chips in my bag, so i ask for more and she wanted to charge me extra.When the owner is there she acts much nicer.I will not be going back anymore unless the quality of the meat improves.
author: A R.

description:
I'm a big fan of Coroneta's tacos.  They're cheap and stacked high.  Stick with the carnitas or steak though.  The chicken is sometimes a little grisly.

All in all a well run operation, especially considering the extremely high volume of patrons they get around lunch and dinner times.  

The staff might do a better job of being friendly and offering a smile now and then.  I've been going there on an almost daily basis for the past few weeks and have yet to receive a hello, how are you of recognition...
author: Adam C.

description:
Aside from being crowded almost all the time, this is my favorite place to get quick Mexican food to bring home. I always like to get off at Glen Park Bart station on my way home from downtown or the Mission to grab food here, then get back on Bart to go to Balboa Bart station. and yes, I don't get Mexican food from the Mission even when I'm there , instead I go here. Plus it's only like a block from Glen ark station. It's been getting ridiculously popular over the years, and there's always lines that go around the place in there, if you had gone there like 7 or so years ago, there would not have been so many people.

 And what ever happened to the homeless man who used to sit in front asking for money with a dog, I remember everyone always gave him their chips from this place but I don't think he ever wanted those. But this place is so good I always run into people I know.
author: Adrian L.

description:
It's alright.

If it were anywhere else in the country you'd think it was the greatest Mexican food ever, but it's not anywhere else in the country, it's in San Francisco, and just a short drive from the Mission. And by the time you've waited in line, you could have driven to the Mission and got better food. But if you're walking home from Glen Park BART, then your choices are pretty limited, hence the line. I know I'd miss it if I had to move to Iowa.
author: bristol b.

description:
This place passes the test that my cousin taught me when looking for great new places to eat: the "Is-there-always-a-line?" rule. And to answer the question, yes, there is always a line. Always. 

The food is great, reasonably priced, and in a great neighborhood, right off the Glen Park BART station exit. Check it out if you have the chance.
author: Adam H.

description:
La Corneta is an old favorite of mine. 

Their Carne Asada burritos were simply to die for. Slightly charred on the outside yet juicy in the middle steak, fresh mildly hot salsa, excellent refriend and black beans, zesty guacamole, spinach, corn or flour tortilla, and flavorful rice. 

Tortilla chips are always fresh and the salsa was made daily. 

It used to be a small restaurant with barely any seating, lines were out the door and it was always busy. 

Few years later last Sunday I went there again. It's now a double wide restaurant, with more but still limited seating. The lines are still out the door and the burrito is just as good though a little on the dry side. The tortilla chips are still fresh but the salsa is on the tables in those squeezable ketchup bottles, a little disappointing really. 

The service is perfectly acceptable. If your eating there and your order takes a while, they will bring it to you. 

All the burritos clock in at under 7 bucks and about 7 inches long and around 2 1/2 to 4 inches in diameter depending on whether you get regular or super burritos. The chicken is just as good as the steak but I've never had the fish so I can't say. 

Parking is a pain in the ass, though you may get lucky on one of the side streets. This is a cash only place but there is a BofA ATM just a couple doors down to quickly remedy this.  

This is still one of my favorite places in SF for burritos.
author: David F.

description:
Whenever I go to La Corneta, I know I'm going to get a great burrito.  There isn't anything special about their preparations or decor, but service is quick and there is good quality control.  Parking can get a little rough and they close at 10.  Food is always good.  Can't go wrong with La Corneta.

Super Steak Burrito w/ hot salsa and complimentary chips - 6.75+tax
author: Matt A.

description: You can't go wrong ordering from here.  I always order the super carne asada burrito, without the lettuce, and it is delicious!  I order for pick-up and it's ready in 10 minutes.  The only down side is they do rush you when you order, even on the phone, which can cause confusion at times.   Just make sure you repeat your order a couple of times.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: As a new resident to the San Francisco area I was lucky to stumble across this fantastic hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. Before you walk in, make sure you know what you want to order and be efficient when telling it to your "burrito maker" . If you make one mistake while ordering you will be given the cold shoulder and the next person in line will be called. Great place and reasonably priced, a locals favorite. Make sure to pay La Corneta a visit if you are in the Glen Park neighborhood.
author: Steven F.

description: La Corneta (Glen Park) is the most delicious taqueria in SF!!! The food tastes so much more fresh than other taquerias.  I recommend the Super Veggie Burrito, Salmon tacos, or the Vegetarian tostada.  Enjoy!
author: Tara R.

description: I am seriously disappointed. I love this place. The food is great and the salsa is the best of all the La Cornetas. I went there on Sunday as they were opening and got some stuff to go but when I paid and asked for some extra green salsa (they give it in small plastic containers) she told me I could only have one per item. YOU HAVE TO BE KIDDING ME! I could have stayed there and eaten there (although I ordered food for someone else too) and had all the green salsa I wanted from the squeeze bottles they put on the table. I called to find out if this is the "NEW" policy and they put me on indefinite hold. The people at the Burlingame La Corneta are so nice and friendly, I will have to ask them to figure out how to make the same salsa and not go back to the Glen Park location!!! I guess they have enough business in Glen Park they don't have to worry about being nice!
author: Cynthia N.

description: Best taqueria in SF! Well maybe not for parking, but hey its SF! Everyone lines up to get food in there and the prices are so reasonable! Well worth the money!  I'm a vegetarian and the options are great!  I love the tostadas and the veggie burritos!
author: R C.

description:
La Corneta...always there...waiting, taunting, beckoning for me to come inside after a long BART commute. If at all possible, call in your order. It make that delicious burrito, or most of their other delicious foods, taste that much better knowing that you can walk past all the suckers in their loooooong lines. 

Oh, and I think what makes their burritos different is that they have peas and carrots in their rice. Niiice.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
For some reason I don't like mexican food IN mexico, but in California I crave it like pookie  in New Jack City craves crack rock.  And in S.F. there's no better place to assuage that addiction than La Corneta in Glenn Park...and I don't know why half of San Francisco doesn't know where this neighborhood is.  It rules!  There are at least 3 top notch restaurants in this area as well as a friggin' bart stop - you can't miss.

So get on bart, go to Glen Park, and get a friggin' super keserdilla with steak and prawns and YOU can be a fein too!
author: John H.

description:
I absolutley love this taqueria.  I order the Super prawn tostada and they grill the prawns right in front of you..they also have kick ass burritos with awesome meats (I like the spicy Chicken) and that green avo spicy salsa is on every table so you can pour as much on your lunch/dinner as you wish...(I am obsessed with that damn green hot sauce.)  I prefer this location to the mission one...just take bart to Glen Park and its acrossed the street...I dare say this is my #1 taqueria in SF and that is a firm #1 sorry El Faralito....I still have love for you but La Corneta takes the cake...BY A LONG SHOT!!  
I Love you La Corneta, I would marry you if I could....MWAH!
Air kisses
author: Michele K.

description: The best burrito outside of the mission and my go to place! Wow the super burritos are SUPER and you get full fast. The ingridents are fresh and the spicy chicken is my favorite with their spicy salsa.  Its easy to get stuff to go and they make it super fast. I love the different salsas they have and its great to eat inside cause you can look at the area from the window.
author: Nadia N.

description: I had the super fish burrito.  While this place is better than many other "Mexican" food spots in SF it was just okay.  Will come again if I cannot find anything better.
author: Hello T.

description: Great burritos everything fresh quality food one of the best taquerias in SAN FRAN!!!!!!!
author: rene w.

description: Only a few blocks from  my house La Corneta is a  Glen Park gem. The food is always fresh the people who work there are nice and they do Prawn tacos, quesadillas, and burritos better than I have had anywhere. very inexpensve and even with a crowd line moves fast.
author: William S.

description:
i hate to say this, being a richmond district girl....but i think this place is better than gordo's (don't judge me! don't hate me!), at least as far as taste is concerned.  being a huge starch fan, i think the rice at la corneta kicks the rice of any other taqueria here in the city...there's also a HUGE choice of different things to order, and quite simply, everything i've ever had here is effing delicious.  not to mention i like when taquerias give you free chips and salsa...and gordo's doesn't. (i'm sorry, gordo's!  i really do love you!).  even if there's a line, it goes very quickly because there's so many people behind the counter working.

minus a star cuz i ordered a churro for dessert and it was stale, chewy, and gross.
author: asia c.

description: Been going here every Sunday afternoon since it opened.  Best Super Chicken and Fish Burritos on this or any other planet I've been to!  Been reading some of the reviews down below!  For those of you who don't like place PLEASE STAY AWAY!!!  It'll make my line that much shorter!  I'm from East L.A. and it sure as heck wasn't that great for Mexican food!  So there!
author: Charlie A.

description: Been there several times and they've always provided great food! Prices are good and the staff is polite too. One thing for improvement; the place is real noisy, so I always feel like I have to yell at the person helping me.
author: Linda S.

description: Great Mexican food and good portions every time I come here it is usually crowded just wish parking was a bit easier.
author: Jen B.

description: I like coming to this place for lunch.  The food is good, service is fast and the place is bright and fairly clean.  There is a lot of choices of meats, but I usually get the Carnitas tacos or a Carne Asada burrito.  It's flavorful and prices are reasonable.  If I can't make it down to La Taqueria in the Mission, this is the place I go.
author: Paul K.

description:
This is hands down one of my favorite burrito places in SF, and I have been to damn near all of them. I usually go for the super burrito with Prawns and Carne Asada on a wheat tortilla. Yes, the prawns are going to be a bit expensive, but they make the BEST prawns in a burrito you will ever have, literally cooked to order right in front of you. 

   Also, for the Nacho lover, they make the BEST nachos that I have ever had, they have the chips already in a container ready for toppings, and they are VERY generous with their portion sizes... you will not be able to finish it alone, and make sure to get extra chips to scoop the toppings off when you first begin eating, as there is NO way that you will be able to get to the chips without scooping off a good portion of the top layer. 

   A little tip, this place gets VERY busy, especially around dinner time, so do yourself a favor and call in early, you can place an order even for one burrito, and they will usually have it done in 20-30 mins, so you can just walk right up to the front and pick up your food. This will save you half a hour... literally.
author: Cole M.

description: I never thought Mexican food could be bland until I came here. They know how to do it so well. I have given them chance after chance but no improvement. I will give 2 stars for the variety of choices that they succeed in making bland and the great staff.
author: Marguerite E.

description: This place is a total joke. The service is awful, takes 40 minutes to get a burrito on a good day. Staff moves like snails. Plus, they expedite phone in orders, line never moves. To boot, the food is white people bland luke warm mex. Only reason they get any kind of kudos is because of their location and no other mex place in the hood. Total joke.
author: Robert P.

description: Cash only. The super vegetarian burrito was divine.
author: Jamie E.

description: Muy delicioso!  Came in for a quick bite to take back to our table at Glen Park Station and was definitely impressed.  I decided to get just one chicken taco, but made it a super, and it was the biggest taco I've ever seen!  It was more like a burrito bowl with corn tortillas.  The pico de gallo was great and the salsa roja was refreshingly spicy.  I want to go back to try the carnitas and carne asada because everything looked amazing.
author: Laura B.

description: Went with 3 stars, but in actuality more like 2.5 in my mind. Just ok to me, not a fan of the peas and carrots in the rice, and in my opinion the meat and chicken taste pretty bland. If I'm hungry and in the area I will occasionally stop in though
author: Nick R.

description: Yummy, fast, cheap! Carrying out here is fun for us because it's not far from our neighborhood. Great authentic Mexican!
author: Nicole L.

description: As with other fans- this place is worthy of a visit from other neighborhoods. The line moves quickly and no matter what you choose, whether it's a combo plate or wrap or torta or tostada...you will be very satisfied. I'm a super big fan of their chicken mole. So, it's very hard for me to stray. But as noted by others, fish and shrimp are freshly grilled for your order. They also do a brisk take-out.
author: Jonathan G.

description: For the most part I love my local taqueria, I've been going there since they first opened. The menu is great and the food is always fresh. The down side is waiting in line, and arriving home with someone else's order.  And they frequently forget the salsa, so be sure to remind them.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: As I sit here and write this review, I am seriously having a craving for one of their burritos.  Aside from burritos, they have a very extensive menu of different kinds of Mexican food. Ingredients are fresh, and the taste is very authentic.  Aside from the standard pinto and black beans, they also have refried beans (my personal favorite), which can be a little hard to find.  It's about a block away from the Glen Park BART station, so it seems to attract a lot of traffic.  Very cheap food, very good, and definitely fills you up.  You can get your fix to go or "for here," with seating inside the restaurant.  It is cash only.  I cannot wait to hit this place up next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Alberto C.

description: Mediocre food. I got a carne asada burrito and it was pretty bland, also the meat was not cooked enough, but the salsa was extremely flavorful!
author: Adriana R.

description:
La Corneta used to be good to me.  But after a few times of bad experiences, especially yesterdays, I will no longer eat here.  I order a salmon dinner plate.  The salmon was pretty good. The rice AND beans were way tooooo salty.  And this isn't the first time.  The food, at least at this location, has been pretty salty.  So I rather go somewhere else where the food is more consistent. 

1 star for the friendly cashier
1 star for the actual salmon

No stars for:
- the over-salted rice and beans
-the forgetful girl that made my order, she has screwed up my order everytime she has helped me in the past
-not taking credit cards...cash only!
author: OLGA M.

description: The mission is KNOWN for the hole in the wall taqueria and yes most of them dont seeeeem clean but im sure they are fine- well for the most part ha- anyway la corneta is the nicer of them and i think if you have out of towners that dont get the small hole in the wall idea then yes take them there- otherwise it was good but not fabuulous like i would say la taqueria is!
author: Lisa Z.

description: Good fresh Mexican food. I always order the spicy shrimp with mushrooms. I've been coming here for years. I love this place.
author: Moises M.

description: They charge extra for taco sauce to go, when you can use a whole bottle on the table if you eat in the restaurant. They last charged me $.90 for extra iceberg lettuce on 3 tacos and this is the first time they skimped on lettuce. Next time I will gladly pay extra for whatever and skip on the tip...
author: C H.

description:
I have no idea what the hell is wrong with the people who wait in long lines for this place. I've gone multiple times thinking "Hey! Maybe there is something wrong with me, maybe I just had a bad experience! Maybe this, maybe that!" 

And every time I've gone back, I've been grossly disappointed. Keyword in that last sentence is "grossly", because thats how this place makes me feel. 

Peas in the burritos. Seriously. Its in their cheap disgusting rice and this of course mixed in with their terribad way of putting together a burrito results in a mushy disgusting carne crap burrito that is just nasty gross oil at the end of it (if you can get that far). I don't like wasting food, but I've thrown out half a burrito now, twice. There are so many better burrito places in the city, I have no idea why anyone would come here for one.

Oh and while I'm at it, half the time when you're sitting down in their ultra-busy restaurant, tables are rarely cleaned. I ended up having to do their fucking job for them just to have a place to sit down.

As a plus for this place, the chips served with the burrito were edible.
author: Chris B.

description: After being introduced to La Corneta by a friend, I've been an occasional customer for almost a year. With reasonable prices and super fresh ingredients, La Corneta will be sure to give your taste buds a real treat. The super burrito is about as big as a new born baby and the chips are crispy, made fresh. Be sure to try a cup of horchata, best around.
author: Brad M.

description: Good food. Uncomplicated Mexican. Great aguas frescas.
author: Matt H.

description: Me likey! While visiting friends in Glen Park they took me to La Corneta Taqueria. The lines can be long but they tend to move pretty quickly. I ordered the carne asada super burrito. Yum yum. Complimentary chips and salsa make this place A-ok.
author: Lovely In L.

description: They seem to have gotten skimpy with the guacamole over the years, but this place is still pretty damn GOOD. I usually order a super burrito with chicken. They also make great homemade aquas frescas. I highly recommend the canteloupe one. Their style is quite different from El Farolito (which is quite amazing in its own right). The ingredients do seem fresher. and FREE WARM TORTILLA CHIPS!
author: Will T.

description: My first time here.  Long lines the entire time my boyfriend Jeff and I were there.  With his ravenous appetite, he ordered the carne asada tacos and carnitas quesadilla.  Both very generously sized meat portions.  I had the fish quesadilla (salmon).  Salmon was in large cubed chunks and very tender.   Delicious.  I often pick up Jeff at the BART station across the street and now will make it a point to stop when the mood strikes.
author: Lani C.

description: My roommate tipped me off to this place, so we swung by on the way before picking up our CSA box. The tacos were fantastic, and I appreciated the variety of items you could customize. I ordered a shrimp and a spicy chicken, both with corn tortilla and avocado, and enjoyed every bite. Salsas were also decent, and made destroying the bag of chips far too easy!
author: Jaclyn C.

description: wow. I can't believe anyone who lives in SF would give this place more than 2 stars.  The food here is just plain bad.  Go to the Mission, or even the castro or Noe for much better food.
author: D. F.

description: Tender but flavorless carnitas (lots of fat pieces) and carne asada.The super wasn't so super since they skimped on the guac and sour cream.  The chips were under hot lamps and not very fresh...also, she gave me like 8 chips total.  Really? Skimping on chips?  May be I'm just spoiled by all the good Mexican food in LA.
author: b t.

description: I love the fish tacos (salmon), shrimp and steak quesadillas, and any of the burritos! They have a wonderful selection of things to eat including veggie options.  Great flavor in anything you order. The line might be out the door but it moves fast. Cash only.
author: Eric H.

description:
When I still ate meat, my favorite was their prawn burrito with chicken added. I've been to all three their locations, Burlingame, Glen Park, and the Mission.

Nowadays, I like their super vegetarian burrito. My sister and I would eat here after dance class. One time, we didn't have our wallets and didn't have enough cash. Worried, they were nice and let us pay "next time" and we left happy and surprised with their generosity...until the guy came running after us! Scared, we turned around to find out we had forgot our complimentary chips!
author: tofulicious y.

description: Great burrito.  Nicely flavored.  I had the steak.  The tortilla was crispy and I didn't have to wait at all.  Everything looked fresh and tasted as such.  Proportion wise, I nearly couldn't finish it but then again I always leave a small portion which makes me feel guilty.
author: David L.

description: Ay ay ay! Delicious.....Love the carne asada taco. The 2 salsas in squeeze bottles on every table are superb. Talk about value . One taco will fill you up for hours. Budget dining at it's finest.
author: Bleep S.

description: We used La Corneta to cater a small reception.  Great food, reasonably priced.    I highly recommend them for any party that wants delicious food and good service.
author: Carl K.

description: I've always had a soft spot for this lovely Mexican establishment. Maybe it's the peas in the delicious rice, maybe it's the ridiculously cheap price I pay for a veggie burrito ($3.85!), maybe it's how quick you can get in and out of this place. The chips are definitely an added bonus. If you can manage to avoid the lines out the door, this place is worth the hike to Glen Park.
author: Julie D.

description:
Giving it 4 stars because they have a friggin' large choice of grinds (that means "food") , they bust out the burritos like machines, and you gut will feel good and full when you are done.

Not neccessarily the absolute, over-the-top best ever kinda' food....just good and solid when you need it.
author: Jason L.

description: Super fresh? Check. Flavorful? Check. Ridiculously cheap? Check. Genuinely friendly employees? Check. Fast service even when the line is outside the door? Check. it doesn't get better than La Corneta Taqueria in Glen Park. This has been a staple for me for the past five years. All of their food is exquisite and I dare you to try and find a better burrito. Go super baby veggie!!
author: M. D.

description: Burrito anyone? Yes please! I usually come here and order the super carne asada burrito with black beans spicy and no lettuce. Its pretty standard here - wait in line - order - walk down line while watching them make your burrito - pay at the register. They give you chips and salsa with your burrito and its a cash only place. I have never been disappointed with their burritos. I've tried the quesadilla suiza and that was awesome too.
author: Julie F.

description: Oh man, when I lived two doors from this place you find me in this joint when my wife was not around. I give them 4.5 stars for service and taste. Check this place out before the 4-5pm rush because you not be dissatisfied. Their beans and rice are on point and the chicken is the best! The portions are hefty and the salsa is good. For the average Joe you will fall in love.
author: J B.

description: I really wanted to love this place because my husband and his buddies had been raving about it. After a night out, we headed here for lunch and I sampled the nachos and a chicken taco. I started eating the nachos first, which were overall okay. The taco, however, made me feel queasy. Could it have been my hangover? Sure. Will I go back? Yes. It is always jamming with people so it definitely deserves another shot.
author: Shannon C.

description: Got the super burrito with chicken. Nothing was special about it. A little over $8 after taxes. Came here only since it was convenient and there are few places to eat in Glen Park at this price range. Definitely have had better at a number of places in the Mission.
author: Iván J.

description: As Victor G. mentioned, this place attracts everybody! A block away from the BART station, so it gets crowded during lunch time. The place has a good amount of clean seating, which is always a plus! Had the super taco with carne asada and dang, they piled it high! First of all, the carne asada was chunky and had a nice smokey flavor that was quite enjoyable! Their selection is great! I'll be back for more!!
author: Vanessa W.

description: My favorite Mexican place in town.  The mission location occasionally has live music and more seating.  They are so busy the food is always fresh.  I like the way they flavor and prepare their sauces, guacamole, rice, salmon, and tofu.  They usually have lots of staff so long lines move quickly.
author: Saul M.

description: Best damn burritos ever. End of story. Cash only, you can also call in for pick up. DE-LICIOUS.
author: Catherine K.

description: Ayeyeeyeeyeeyeeyee!!!! This place is da bomb.  Steak and Shrimp Quesadilla w/ mild salsa and a Large Strawberry Sangria.  Trust me--It's pretty darn bueno.  The line is always out the door during lunchtime and even during dinner. But they are pretty efficient so the wait isn't too bad. And It's probably the cleanest taqueria I've been to too. Did I say it was pretty darn bueno?  You bet I did.
author: Ed C.

description: I love the quesadillas here *heavily drooling* because it tastes really fresh and I like many of the other items on their menu as well as their great prices. They serve the food fast and they're really friendly.  The place can get really crowded during lunch time so I think it's best to go during some off hours.
author: Deborah W.

description: I was introduced to this place by the same friend who introduced me to Golden Era Restaurant.  She knows a lot of good places.  Before I turned vegetarian--I woud love getting anything with shrimp here.  It was just sooo good and seasoned right.  Now that I'm vegetarian, everything is still delicious minus the meat!  However, I bought my boyfriend a Super Chicken burrito and he said he didn't like it because the chicken tasted burned :(  Two things: They only accept cash which can be annoying when you have none on you--luckily there is a BOA around the corner...And...I wish the staff could be a little bit more friendly--you know, smile a little more? Otherwise, great place! Yummy food! I want a burrito right now.
author: Mel P.

description: Grabbed a bite here with some friends before they had to go watch a movie. I watched them make one of their orders, which was two super carne asada tacos. You could barely even see the tortilla because of the huge mound of filling that was put on top of it. I decided to get just one because I didn't think I'd be able to finish two. If I had gotten two, I probably would have to take the second one home. I couldn't even fold it up, so I attacked it with a knife and fork. Never ever ate a taco like that until now. If it weren't for my allergies acting up, I would've enjoyed the moment a little bit more. I'll make sure to try their burrito next time.
author: Rhia R.

description: I have only ever had one thing here, the prawn super burrito. It is just awesome. The first time I had one it was an epiphany. Whenever I am in the neighborhood, this is where I want to eat. From time to time, I get that prawn super burrito jones and other places can satisfy it temporarily, but I need to come here to get it fixed. It is an extremely popular place and so the line gets started early and can disrupt your dining experience if you are trying to eat there. They only take cash and occasionally the burrito is poorly wrapped, especially when they are really jammed. But these little annoyances do not really distract from the quality.
author: Alex C.

description: Definitely my favorite place to get Mexican food! I love their super burritos, especially their carne asada burrito and their prawn burrito. (Sometimes I like to get half in one, deeeelish!) They use some really big and juicy prawns that are cooked right (because I've had some horrible prawn burritos where the prawns were too fishy and small and seemed boiled.) They also have great quesadillas and the restaurant itself is pretty presentable. I took off one star because I hate waiting in their long lines, parking is tricky and I don't really appreciate how the rice they use has little peas and carrots mixed in it.
author: Ally C.

description: I usually order a super steak burrito or the combo plate and I think I'll stick to those items from now on as the last visit I changed my order to a fish taco...going on my 3rd day of recovery from a bout of food poisoning. I will most likely go back as this is one of our regular places for a great burrito but not for awhile.
author: John K.

description: So, everyone loves this place.  Fellow yelpers, my ex boyfriend and everyone who lives in Glen Park.  And I mean everyone!  The line is insane but the burritos...not quite worth it in my opinion. Constantly  I am tricked into going by some friend who is DIEING for a La Corneta burrito.  I get excited and think that all this time I have been incorrect and I am just ordering the wrong thing.  Maybe its my 10 years of vegetarianism that refuses to get a burrito with meat.  Supreme veggie burritos with black beans are great though, right?  Right? But alas, I am disappointed but my friends are ecstatic.  Whats wrong with me?
author: Stacy R.

description: You would think the La Corneta in the Mission would be the original, but no, it all started from this far more modest location in Glen Park, which, while lacking the cool skylight, is my favorite because it's tucked away from the Mission madness.  Their food is very Cal-Mex (lots of sour cream and guac), but soooo delicious.  The quesadillas here basically redefine what a quesadilla is.  And they have a lot of styles of meat too choose from, all equally delicious and unique.
author: Wes M.

description: I found a new burrito back up in the Glen Park district.  They serve up healthy sized burritos and dishes that tastes damn good.  Salsa is the traditional fresh variety and you can choose the different tortillas to fit your needs.  You won't be disappointed with their pollo, carne asada, shrimp, carnitas, etc.  U shaped lines form in side their restaurant during peak times and parking can be difficult.  La Corneta also does a burrito bar to go for your parties at home, you pay about $7 per a person and they do up a trays for your guest to build their own creations.  They provide the beans, salsa, sour cream, rice, etc.
author: Jason A.

description:
Being that this is my very first Yelp review, I had to write about my favorite taqueria in San Francisco.  I have been coming to La Corneta for nine years now.  One might think a burrito is a burrito is a burrito...NOT!  I lived in San Diego during my college years expecting to find better, if not, same quality tasting burrito.  I was sadly disappointed.  So much so, that whenever family members or friends from SF would visit me, I requested they bring me a burrito from La Corneta.  La Corneta's prices are reasonable and the portions will keep you full.  I can appreciate the cleanliness of a good taqueria joint as well.  The only bad thing I have to say about this place is that when phoning in an order to-go, at times, it can take just as long to wait in line.  Can't blame them though since La Corneta is always jam packed and the line always wraps around.  It is definitely worth the wait!

Here is my usual order:
- super steak and prawn burrito on spinach tortilla
- tostadas de ceviche
- strawberry fresca
author: jeanious a.
