description: good taqueria, kind of reminds me of La Taqeria on 25th n mission.  gotta get the carne asada y prawns combo. tastey and filling. many locatons 2 in SF, and 2 down the penisula.
author: dee s.

description: A quaint clean place for some Mexican Comfort Food down at the Mission. They have the best Carne Asada Plate & Burritos in town. So if you want to  give in to a guilty-high carb-dinner... head down to La Corneta & you wont be disappointed!
author: Jays D.

description: Mexican food is pretty low on my list of favorite cuisines... and in fact I usually try to avoid it when possible. Yet lunch at La Corneta was reaaally good. The place is really a fast food restaurant, but their menu is still really extensive: burritos, tacos, enchiladas, regular entrees and all the variations thereof. I went for the super burrito with chicken (that involves your choice of beans, rice, guacamole, sour cream, cheese, salsa, and comes with free chips), and it was delicious. Kudos for proving to me that Mexican food can still be delicious at times.
author: David S.

description: I love this place!  They are generous with the all toppings and meat--it justifies the prices.  I saw  the server switch  to new gloves when whe touched the plastic wrap thingy.  The roasted salsa is really good!  I have been here three times and even when the line is long it moves pretty fast.  They make their only fresh chips.  The only reason not 5 stars is that it is (like so MUCH of the fast food in SF)--a little heavy on the salt).
author: Jorah N.

description:
mhhmmmm.

they have good prawn nachos!!
author: Jul C.

description:
I went to this location for the first time last night even though I've been to the one on mission a plethora of times.  This spot offers the same great food, just a little closer to my house.  I recommend any of the seafood (prawns or lobster are the best) options.  The burrito is great, especially given the choice of Black Beans over refried.  
Last night I took Mat K. for his first time.  He was skeptical going to Glen Park for a burrito, but reluctantly gave in.  As we were unwrapping our burrito's, he was telling me how Nor Cal burrito's don't stand up to So Cal ones.  Right after he took his first bite, with a look of shock on his face he says, "Wow, this is the best burrito I've had since moving up here."  He states that he could find a better one down south (freaking transplants), but I think after this burrito he's going to have his work cut out for him.  He was also worried when we walked in and there was no salsa bar.  But the two salsas on the tables are wonderful.  I like the green better, yet I can't seem to aim the noosle to lather my burrito without getting it all over my hand too.
Everything on the menu is delicious.  Everybody I've taken here has ordered different things and they've all loved it.  The service is quick and friendly.  For anything Mexican that's going to be delicious, look no further.  BTW, it's very gringo friendly with mild salsas available.
author: Dustin S.

description: YUM!  Super tasty, super convenient.  They have chicken mole and chile relleno burritos, both of which I LOVE.  I only am leaving a star off because they don't take credit card, which is annoying.
author: Caleb R.

description: The best chicken quesadilla in The City - and the rest of the menu is damn good too. The lines can be a pain, but they move folks along quickly. Fresh, clean and good grub - I don't need anything more from a Taquera.
author: Shawn C.

description:
Had a business lunch here today.  It was the day Mexico defeated France in the World Cup.  Crazy fun both inside the restaurant and on Mission.  

Food was very good.  Meat in the tacos was juicy.  Cheese and lettuce were fresh, beans were good, and soft taco shell was moist.  

Restaurant was clean.  

Definitely will go back.
author: Karen B.

description: I took away a star just because when they remodeled the place they didn't  accommodate the line that sometimes awkwardly winds around the tables in the dining area.  Other than this oversight, the food is great!  I usually get the super tostada with chicken or if I'm feeling vegetarian I get a burrito with spicy tofu.  If I know it is going to be busy I call in my order so when I get there I can go straight to the register.  This strategy is also good if you need to order takeout for several people.
author: Julie D.

description: Have to say, their shrimp is awesome...grilled and slightly carmelized...yum!  They don't get a full five stars from me though due to the number of times that my order has been screwed up, even when I am standing right there, telling them three times, and because they don't take credit cards.  That's awfully inconvenient if you are ordering for a group of people.  I also agree with the comments about their being frugal with the salsa on to go orders.   Also, don't come here expecting to find a place to sit and eat.
author: Julie T.

description: I know I just wrote a review about how I am picky about Mexican food and whine whine whine.  This place has a relatively small veg menu, and I just got the rice and bean burrito with tofu, but it was pretty food and had that flavor thing i hear about.  The crowd was kinda the pre/post bar type but the food is better than that.  Definitely would go back if it weren't in the sticks.
author: Nessie V.

description: It's typically like all the other taqueria's out there, so I can't say too much about it. But it's close by to where I stay at, their food is decent, though not mouth-watering. The best thing about it though is that when you order nachos, they give you a TON of it. It's insane and that's why I like it here.
author: Thea G.

description:
THEY HAVE CLEANED UP THEIR ACT AND ARE BACK TO BEING DELICIOUS!!!!!!



OMG THIS PLACE HAS ROACHES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I grew up in glen park, so of course I knew about this place, and how wonderful they were, but I believe they  are under new management, because the burritos just have not been as heavenly for the past couple of years. And then I walked into order  around mid November, and noticed a huge brown bug crawling along the metal counter top. I wasn't for sure if it was, what I thought it was. So I brought my BF inside to confirm, and sure enough another popped up and it was true! This place was magnificent, but be aware it DOES HAVE ROACHES! If you don't believe me, step inside and watch the counter top for a minute or two and you will see one, maybe two! lol gross
author: Doms W.

description: Decent burritos if you don't have time to go to the Mission. The Quesadilla Suizza is pretty good. Lines every day they are open, but they move fast.
author: Arlene C.

description: Ok being an SF native I know my mexican food.  And La Corneta happens to be my favorite.  This is your one stop shop for Mexican Food.  I have never had a bad item from this place.  I am constantly exploring the menu and have not been disapointed.
author: Jimmy V.

description:
I used to like these people but not anymore. Over the years since I first started going to this place its food has been declining. We've gotten everything from food that was cold, to food that looked and tasted like it had been sitting in those basins all day.

Tonight I went with family to La Corneta because my father really wanted a baby burrito and proceeded to be completely ignored by the staff. I would have understood if it had been busy or if they were short a number of people but there was one other group of two people in line and six people behind the counter all of whom were doing something else. They looked directly at us several times and both me and my father tried to politely get their attention but they continued to ignore us. Its not the first time of course but my father wanted to give them a second chance but they will not get a third. Needless to say we decided to take our business elsewhere.
author: Jessica B.

description: I love this place.  The steak and prawn burrito is fantastic.  The salmon is delectable.  The carnitas are yum.  I have no complaints on anything I've ever tried here. There is usually always a line, so I recommend going to the bar next door, order a cocktail, call in your order and pick it up after you've guzzled down your liquor of choice.
author: Christina S.

description: hands down best mexican food in the city! :) yum!
author: shawna d.

description: Super nachos are super hot-cho!  But beware the ridiculously long line.  It's always long.
author: Richard E.

description: Lines are long.....but the wait is OK because this place serves one of the best Damn Super Prawn Burritos I have ever had in MY LIFE!
author: Victoria S.

description: best in the city.  I love the places in the mission as well, but across the street from the glen park BART station, you can get your eat on at this taqueria.  Some of the burritos and plates are a little bit pricier than your average place, but its well worth it.  My favorite burrito is the steak and shrimp combo.  I also recommend the nachos which are humongous.  And if you somehow saved room for dessert, try the churros - regular and filled.  In the evenings they are quite busy, so if you're not eating in, call ahead to save time.
author: Kenton W.

description: I don't know what kind of baby can eat their baby burrito but I liked it!  Was stuffed.  The place is always busy and food seems always fresh.  Good deal for a good, filling meal.
author: Kevin M.

description: This place has my all time favorite burrito, spicy shrimp....I remember when they opened and were so small you could hardly wait in line....they got so busy they expanded next door and now there is still a line out the door no matter what time you go. That being said, the wait is worth it...this place in Glen Park is best in SF for burritos to go and you can sit, but it is limited. I definitely recommend the spicy shrimp....They do have another location now in the Mission, but I haven't tried it...I used to think Pancho Via and El Torro in the Mission were best, but La Corneta beats them hands down and is much cleaner and safer...
author: Jennifer S.

description: La Corneta... How many times are you guys going to mess up my order?! Seriously?! I would say every other order is either incomplete or absolutely wrong.  I asked for a bean burrito with only cheese and sour cream, you gave me a carne asada super burrito with everything except cheese and sour cream.  You forgot my chips and salsa, even though I asked twice.  You forgot my iced tea, even though I paid for them already, and then you tried to charge me again when I asked for the iced tea.  I've talked with the owner several times about this issue, and he has assured me that he will get to the bottom of it. I believe that he does, because things will be better for a week or two, then back to the old ways. I have this love-hate relationship with you because I think your food is delicious (when you get it right) and is the only reason i am generously giving you two stars. Otherwise, i'd rather go to the other food places.
author: Theo C.

description: I love going to restaurants where you just eat, talk, and laugh, however loud you want. La Corneta is just that place. W/in a block of the Glen Park BART stop, you will first notice thats its got a high vaulted ceiling, which makes the place really inviting, especially if you go during a sunny day and a breeze comes in, its just a nice place to eat. I ordered the Super Nachos w/ chicken for $8 with a horchata, and by the time I was done, I was DONE. Everything tasted really natural, and the chicken was cooked just right, no burns marks... I've never had "natural" tasting nachos since I'm so used to eating nachos from places like Rubios or Chevys, and obviously they are heavily flavored with salt and the like to cater to Americanized tastes. When we left, I noticed a bubble tea joint next door, and being the fanatic that I am, I held back since I had one earlier. I was so happy to know that these two places are right next door to each other. Another yelping to come...
author: Thomas L.

description: Knowing that there might be a long line at this place from other yelpers I decided to call ahead on a Friday evening with an order for the "infamous" steak and prawn quesadilla.  I was a little disappointed when I arrived that there wasn't a line at 8pm.  Went over to the counter and asked for my order,which they do not know about.  Well, it's ok since there is no one there so I repeated my order and got my Q. The Q was cut in 2 giant halves, one of which I gave to my companion.  I bit into the Q and it was blisteringly hot, but delicious.  Good size chunks of cut up prawns and steak filled my mouth with gooey goodness.  The outer skin of the Q is kind of pancake like with a crunch.  This is one of the best Q I have ever had.  The yelpers were right on, in fact as we were munching down our dinner a long line began to form.  I counted 18 people in line at one point.  I guess the moral of the story is that you might want to call ahead with an order just to hedge for the line.  The Quesadilla here is seriously delicious, you got to try it.
author: Jim J.

description: Delicious burritos! I work around the area and I eat here at least once a week.
author: Cristian G.

description: Maybe this place is overcrowded: I don't know. I went at 3pm on a weekday. What I do know is that I had an amazing carnitas burrito. The pork was very well done, falling apart like good carnitas should. A-and the cilantro sauce on the table? Crikey! Not since the infamous Orange Sauce at La Victoria in San Jose have I been so in love with a squeeze bottle burrito condiment. I slathered my burrito in the stuff.
author: Darius K.

description: The super chile relleno burrito with refried beans was fine: a bit mushy, and not as spicy as I like (I'd asked for it spicy), but it was still flavorful and huge.  Convenient location near Glen Park BART.
author: angela n.

description: Not sure if mission district taqueria fans would care to venture here just to eat, but definitely stop if in this hood for the prawn burrito.  The butter flavor really come's through.
author: greg e.

description: I don't know what it is about this place, it's just so delicious that I forget I'm on a diet once I walk through the door.  The food is not expensive but should be because it tastes like magic!!!  Bad news is that I'd eat here even if I just ingested a whole kitchen full of food and a candy bar for dessert.  This place is freaking yummy and I do my patented 'Happy Dance' every time I eat there.
author: Duckie A.

description: Everybody in SF has their favorite tacqueira and this is mine. Oh sure, you can go to El Toro (my old favorite) or uh, jeez, I can't even remember the name of my other old favorite. But La Corneta has the best baby shrimp burritos in town. And you know you can call ahead and order so you don't have to wait in that massive line.
author: Jenni O.

description: This is one good burrito, people. Worth the wait and the drive/muni over if you got that craving for the Silver Bullet.  It's a hidden destination for those that know and I know that someone's gonna hate us for letting the secret out, but I can't stop singing the praises of La Corneta! Has a sister restaurant in the Mission as well.
author: Charlene L.

description: I love Corneta.  So does everyone else.  Unless you arrive when they first open, prepare to wait in a very long line.  The lunch rush lasts until the dinner rush begins but if you go you'll be happy you waited.  The menu is HUGE which often makes me nervous, but I've never had a bad/mediocre meal here.  The service is always friendly and efficient.  I love the fact that they have super baby burritos with all the good stuff like cheese, sour cream and guacamole in a more managable size at a more reasonable price.  Anything I order usually includes their "spicy chicken" which really is spicy but they have TONS of diferent meat options including seafood.  It's a good thing I don't live closer to any of the locations of this place because I'd probably weigh 500 pounds.
author: M M.

description: If it weren't for La Corneta, my nephews might have starved.  My sister and bro-in-law barely cook - does zapping chicken nuggets count? - so both boys have been raised on this taqueria's guacamole goodness.  Clean, fresh, a wide array of choices, it never fails to satisfy.  I can expect to eat here on every SF visit, and I don't mind a bit.  I tried the el pastor this time - not too impressive, but everything else has been.  Especially the five-year-old's quesadilla smile.
author: Amy L.

description: I don't know where I had the idea that the only good food came from the Mission. I was proved wrong when my friend took me here. The menu had a good variety the agua fresca was bangin and the prices are really good. To make the night even more betterer I found parking right away in front.
author: Alia D.

description: I tried the steak and shrimp burrito.  YUM.  Surf and turf in a tidy little package.  Too bad the staff is a bit unorganized.
author: Nikki c.

description: The only place I go to for burritos!  They never disappoint me.  Only downside is the long line but definitely worth the wait!
author: amber c.

description: one of the best burritos I have ever had.  The place gets really crowded so be prepared to wait in line
author: Somala A.

description: I always order the chile relleno burrito. It's very delicious! It's so huge that before I even start eating I automatically cut it in half and wrap half to take home. The one on Mission is good too but it's a bit on the salty side.
author: E. M.

description: The food here is not only good but Great I love the steak and shrimp burrito also they have great veggie dishes.
author: Dee Z.

description: It's so nice to have an authentic Mexican restaurant in our new neighborhood. Went there today for the first time and the food was great, the service was professional and friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. We'll be going back to sample other items on the menu.
author: Denise A.

description: Went here because of all the rave reviews... However, I was a bit disappointed. The Sangria tasted like it had been sitting out in the heat and was about a week old, it was terrible. I got a Shrimp burrito and it was pretty good, nothing spectacular. I did enjoy the atmosphere in there, it was bright and lively and they had a Mariachi!
author: Mariana P.

description:
I love their Super Baby Steak & Prawns burrito! Don't let the "baby" trick you coz with everything they put in, it's as big as their regular burritos. 

I also like their quesadillas. YUM. I recently tried the chicken asada plate and the chicken was so tender & flavorful - I would definitely recommend this if you want the whole meal - served with rice, beans & guacamole. YUM. 

Definitely a must-try. I've also tried their spot in Burlingame... good - but not as good as this one. :)
author: Linda I.

description: Ordered the carne asada especial burrito...THE ABSOLUTE BEST STEAK BURRITO I'VE EVER HAD!!  I will be back
author: J D.

description: Yummy burrito joint, doesn't blow your socks off, but really really good.  Everything is really fresh and there is a good selection of salsas and condiments.  Added bonus is that it is clean and is decently priced.  I go to Glen Park to get my haircut, and I haven't once left without getting a burrito from La Corneta.
author: Jennie J.

description: Said a la Homer Simpson:  Mmmmmm, burrito.  The long line at this place is well deserved.  The food is mucho tasty and the salsas on the table alone are worth the wait.
author: Helen C.

description: La Corneta rocks.  Their salsa verde is the best in town.  Enormous tacos filled with high quality ingredients at a great price.  for indulgence have one of the quesadillas.  Packed with meat and gooey cheese and all the rest of the fixin's.  This is no "appetizer".  Great shrimp too.  I'm usually a burrito eater, but this place converted me to tacos.  Also their chips are always hot and fresh.  What's up with Cancun's chips that come out of a box?  They can't touch Corneta!  PS.  Call your order in and mosey up straight to the cashier.  Only way to do it here.
author: Aaron N.

description: Definitely my favorite taqueria in the city - I always complicate things with special requests and I don't know how they get it right every time, but they do.  The food is delicious and even when the line is out the door it moves fast.  It's the best!
author: Rebecca K.

description: My criteria for a good burrito is as follows:  a toasted rather than steamed tortilla, tightly packed interior, real avocados or, in the alternative, fresh guacamole, whole beans (never refried, yech), and a good balance of wet and dry.  No soupy burritos, no falling-apart burritos, no roasted bell peppers and sun dried tomatoes and all that faux gourmet hi-tech burrito stuff.  For me, Taqueria Cancun is the gold standard (since Talk of the Town in Oakland closed some years ago).  This place comes in pretty close, except that they steam their tortillas and they don't use chunks of avocado (they use guacamole instead).  However, unlike Cancun, they offer a salmon burrito which is surprisingly well-balanced and tasty.  I was impressed overall, it's worth a visit.
author: Samantha R.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  They served food up right!  Their steak and prawn quesadilla is to die for.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Melanie B.

description: Decent burritos in a clean and bright restaurant. Service is a bit inconsistent, but what can you complain about when it's so cheap! I got the baby burrito and some chips. The salsa fresca is good! The burrito itself lacked some kick, but was filling, cheap, and not too greasy. I don't think there was anything outstanding about it, but it was a good quick stop before going to a show.
author: Joy C.

description: Really great chips and really great salsa, and they hooked my taco up with mad guac and sour cream, but apparantly a veggie taco means a rice and beans taco? I asked for a veggie super taco with no beans and it was basically a rice taco with the super taco toppings (you know, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, guac). I thought i saw a piece cubed carrot or bell pepper or two, but it seemed like that might've just been some pickled-stuff super taco topping? who knows. For a truly awesome veggie super taco experience, try Pancho Villa on 16th instead (i know, i know, a whole 6 blocks away, but it's worth it).
author: Ashley M.

description: Hey! Hey! Hey! This place is awesome. The burritos are very, very, delicious. Flavorful and yummy and good and crave-able. The dinner plates are really good also. I get the tofu dinner - it's a really good vegetarian dish for those who don't [but also those who do] eat meat. We always take the burritos to-go because the lines in the room get so long they begin to weave in-between tables causing some claustrophobia. A great place overall though, I love it :D
author: Nick B.

description: This place is almost always packed to the gills, with an impossibly long  line snaking its way into oblivion.   All the Glen Park moms in yoga pants with your out of control children who irritatingly mispronounce everything on the menu: get the hell out of my way woman, you're just wasting space, and my time, and lord knows by the time you're done ordering your single shrimp (its camerones biotch) taco with 'no oil' and no rice the goddamn chips will be cold.  Damn you!
author: Emily X.

description: La Corneta is one of my favorite mexican restaurant.  My family and I have been coming here for 10+ years.  I usually get a burrito and it's great.  The friendly service and clean place is a plus as well.
author: Stacey L.

description: I officially just found my new standby mexican joint. I stopped in there after I got off BART because I was feeling pretty faint (maybe because I hadn't eaten all day?!) to get something to eat before heading home. I grabbed a pollo burrito especial (meat & beans of your choice, rice, salsa, and cheese). I was way too hungry for this baby burrito business, but maybe next time. I'm excited about it because I consider myself to be a burrito connoisseur, and I'm in LOVE with the burrito I had. I can't wait to bring my boyfriend with me and try some other things on the menu. Fast, affordable, efficient, clean, fresh, and delicious. You won't leave unsatisfied.
author: Betsy W.

description: I will always love this place - even if I don't live anywhere near it anymore. When I do have a hankering, I'll drive up to their new location in Burlingame. My meal of choice - steak and shrimp anything! Usually the baby burritos but the other night I tried their super quesadilla and I ate the WHOLE thing (and these suckers are BIG). Wash it down with some Negra Modelo and you're good to go!
author: Melani A.

description:
love love love love living two blocks from here.

always call ahead, much less stressful, and walking past the line that doubles on itself (twice) to the cash register is priceless.

also, their chorizo is exceptional
author: Brooke B.

description: Tasty Meats. huge burritos.  Good portable inexpensive  lunch.  I like the mission location better for atmosphere, but this works on the go.
author: Maya C.

description: The food here is ok, but they charge too much!!!!!! I feel like burrito is just rice and beans!!!!! Taquerias in the mission district will give you food that is just as good, but way cheaper.
author: Gabriel T.

description:
my friend and i decided to go there late last night.  the parking is way too hard to find but it's worth it.  the food and the service is very good.  we got super nacho with grilled pork (wanted carne asada but they were all out) and super burrito with spicy chicken (wanted carne asada).  whenever i come to san fran to visit (come once a year) i always stop by here at least once during my trip.  it's cheap and consistant.  

my super nacho was very good....she really piles things up for u.  but after awhile it gets so soggy that u need a fork (next time i will skip the black beans b/c the juice i think that makes it soggy) the grilled pork was good and i really enjoyed it.  the super burrito with spicy chicken...it wasn't as good as if it had been with carne asada (that's what i usually get).  i couldn't taste spicyness of the chicken.  it was just ok.  

overall, the place is very good...we just went there too late to get carne asada and it's our fault for being lazy.... i will continue to come here whenever i visit san francisco.
author: donald c.

description: bomb.com!!! not only is the foo great so is the customer service. the ladies there are very kind to the children as well as the customers. my fav, is the super nachos and the green chicken burrito. definitely my favorite taqueria
author: A C.

description: After moving to the East Bay I realized how much I took for granted the lovely and familiar places I was surrounded by living in Daly City and SF. It's taking a while to find great Mexican restaurants close to home and my hubby and I always end up coming back to this place. We've fallen in love with their burritos and there's nothing's that's come close to replacing them. The service is always decent, the area is conveniently close to Bart, the prices are reasonable, the food is fresh. What more to ask for?!?!
author: Elle E.

description:
When I'm not feeling up to an al pastor burrito supremo from El Farolito down the street, I mosey on into La Corneta and revel in my options.  So many avenues to happiness on their menu, it's unreal.

Friendly, efficient service, a lovely dining space that's a real departure from most Mission taquerias, and a wide range of options make La Corneta one of my true faves.
author: Alice T.

description: Great food sevice ok. Don't call to order your food because they will say HOLD and will not pick it up.
author: Jay S.

description:
Everytime I leave this place I don't ever feel preggers, even though I just had a baby.. a super baby.. BURRITO!  
Honestly, it's not like i'm on a diet or anything, because let's be serious those never work.. but I am a girl who is somewhat health/body conscious.  Typically at other Taqueria's I am "forced" to order a regular super burrito.  Thus I feel inclined eating the whole thing because 1. I don't like to waste food 2. cold day old burritos don't taste quite as good nor do they look appealing 3. I like to eat.  But here at La Corneta they have these smaller baby burritos that are just the right size! My pants aren't too tight after consumption and I am safisfied :)  
The super baby burritos are about 4-5 dollars and come with a side of salsa and chips.  I personally like getting a carnitas super baby with refried beans.  The refried beans here are good, never too watery and quite tasty. The rice is a little different in that it has peas and carrots in it, but I'd like to think that at least I'm eating some more vegetables.
All in all if your in the mood for a burrito but not so much the guilt trip, La Corneta is the right fit :)
author: gee t.

description: Amazing value. I can get a beans and rice taco with avocado slices for $2! They pile so much on that with chips I am more than satisfied. Other favorites are the mole, chorizo, and the ceviche. I live just over the hill so I call ahead and go straight to the front of the line!
author: Vanessa L.

description: ok, this place definitely deserves 4-stars for the their food but they don't get that extra star because you gotta get there before 10pm on a friday night! damnit, com'on now... that's just being unreasonable when you know that fools like to get drunk and eat mexican food! Anyways, this is how good the place has been for me. I wasn't able to get there in time tonight but all I kept thinking about was how good a burrito from La Corneta would've been. damnit!
author: James C.

description: I like this place., even though when I order to-go they always mess up my order. Excellent, Carne Asada and Prawns done to perfection on the grill. I cannot stand the fact that they do not use gloves, and use their hands to scoop the salad and then touch all of the utensils at the same time to scoop other food items, I was disgusted.
author: Dee D.

description: Maybe its just because this place holds good memories for me, but the food here is SO GOOD! The line is always out the door, but it moves quick and is totally worth the wait. Anything and everything is good. Its always a problem finding not only parking, but a place to sit because its always so packed. Delicious!
author: Mary B.

description:
i came here a while ago
it wasn't bad at all, we got nachos which were delish
the steak was very flavorful and tender 
which is very important.
so if your in the neighborhood and 
feel like mexican, why not come here!
author: Isabella T.

description: #1 taqueria in the world. Nothing compares to this establishment of the gods. The Super Nachos will fill you for the next two days. Always fresh, never hurting except for the pains of pure enjoyment after a satisfied meal. I love La Corneta. I've been goin there for for almost a decade since they were only half the restaurant they are today.
author: Chris L.

description: Yummy burritos... LONG lines.... Difficult parking.... I like the tongue especial burrito. My family like the beef... but our first choice is still La Taqueria.
author: jane f.

description: Right smack in the middle of Glen Park, just one hill over from where I grew up. This place is awesome, and the line is long during din din time so be patient. The super nachos plate & the shrimp plato is excellent and so are the main dishes. My friend Rich turned me on to this place when it opened and I've been hooked ever since. The people that work there work fast and your food comes fairly quick. There's never anywhere to sit so be prepared to take out your order. Visit this place and you won't be disappointed because if the lines are that long, it must be raging..!!!
author: Sven S.

description: My fave Mexican place as far as San Francisco goes.  Definitely big if yer into seafood and Mexican.   Very clean, but not as big as the Mission & 23rd location (which can seat 30+).  Parking is kinda difficult at times, but the food is excellent.  My pick is the prawn burritos with any meat or the mushroom  quesadilla .
author: Richie W.

description:
I eat here at La Corneta once a week, which I wouldn't do if it sucked. But you gotta take the bad with the good.

Good: 
* The food: Burritos are solid -- not as great as some of the best in the Mission, but better than 95% of the others you'll get in the USA. The meats are generally superior -- carnitas, pollo rojo, mole, pollo verde, shrimp, all fresh and tasty. The quesadillas are absolute monsters, scrumptious, greasy monsters.
* Portions/Value: Most of the platters go for $8-$9, and you get a LOT of food.  If you order an enchiladas or meat platter, it comes with a giant portion of your entree, a lot of beans, and maybe a pound of rice. Plus guac. Plus a salad. Plus extra tortillas. And chips, if you want 'em. You will not leave hungry or broke, and like I said, the food quality is generally excellent.
* Take-out. You can call in your order ahead of time and skip the unbelievably long line (see below).
* Service: One time I was dissatisfied with the meat-to-fat ratio with my carnitas. I took it back, they fixed it, no hassles. These people are very nice.

Bad:
* This is the only taqueria in the neighborhood, and people come from all over Glen Park, Miraloma, Sunnyside, and the surrounding hoods. Corneta is a mob scene for lunch or dinner every day of the year. The line literally goes out the door, and while Corneta seems adequately staffed, it doesn't seem to process the throughput of some of the stars of the Mission. So if you come during peak hours (11:30am-2pm, 6-8pm), expect to wait in line for a while.
* Because it's so busy, seating is at a premium. I don't know how about 1/2 the reviewers could possibly rate this place as "good for groups," because it's hard enough to get a table for 3 or 4 in there. But again, this is testament to the quality and value of this place.
* Cash only. B of A, Wells, and Citi have ATMs within a block, but bring your greenbacks.
author: Eric M.

description: My boyfriend is a fan of their burritos so I tagged along one night and tried the tacos. Now I have him meeting me there after work. YUM
author: Angela K.

description: It's good but maybe not as fabulous as most people say. But then again, Mexican food has never been on the top of my preference list. It's still a decent, quick, and cheap bite.
author: Emma T.

description: Ground Zero for cheap, tasty, hearty, fresh Mexican food. The staff is friendly and the only downer is when they have to use pale, out-of-season tomatoes in the winter to make their salsa.
author: Beth W.

description:
I come to La Corneta when I'm craving for mexican food.  It's also the closest and the best mexican restaurant in my neighborhood.  Everytime I go, there's always a long line.  Day or night.  Their ingredients are fresh and well seasoned.  

Their nachos are HUGE!
author: Katniss B.

description: My favorite neighborhood taqueria. This place is a religious experience, and everyone in Glen Park/Excelsior knows it. There is *ALWAYS* a line out the door, so that should tell you something! The ingredients are fresh, and the aguas frescas & horchata are to die for. The wait in line is long, but worth it. If you're a meat lover, get what I always get: the steak & prawn super burrito on a spinach tortilla. But everything in there is good, so you can't go wrong. If this place goes out of business, I'm walking to the Golden Gate Bridge to jump!
author: Maurice R.

description: my favorite taqueria. PERIOD. super baby bedgie (veggie) with a large horchata.  oh mercy mercy me.  LA 'rittos cant even touch la corneta.  its clean in there, its fast, and most importantly its tasty.
author: Karina U.

description: Definitely one of my favorite spots.  You don't have to go to mission to get good Mexican food!
author: Mila M.

description: The number of people in line (on a daily basis) says it all.  Only rivaled by pancho villa on 16th and mission.
author: J G.

description: Regular-sized fish taco is salmon, grilled right then, and only $4. Yum! And churros for $1 are a great take-away treat.
author: Tim E.

description: Their enchilladas are to die for (not literally) Staff is super curteous, especially to my 2 year old, while waiting in line (if you come here regularly you know the line can get long) one of the ladies always makes my son a bean/cheese taco. I've also notcied the gentlemen in front of the place that holds the door open for customers & asks for change. While it bother me to see people go hungry it puts me more at ease that La Corneta gives him meals. This place rocks! If you're in the neighborhood gotta try it.
author: Marley T.

description: This is my neighborhood burrito spot and there is *always* a huge line...but it's because the food is sooooo good.  The hot salsa is great, hotter some days than others, with great little bits of fresh jalapeno.  My minor complaint is silly, but worth mentioning...they put peas in the rice.  They're few and far between, hardly a deal breaker, but EW, I hate peas.  So, be warned.  The burritos are huge, order the baby size and you'll still be plenty full.
author: Emily T.

description:
I used to think this was a great taqueria, back when I moved to SF years ago.  I recently moved to the neighborhood and was happy to be close enough to get burritos here regularly.  I have been disappointed each time thus will not likely return.  

I usually order a super baby.  Used to be, this was a great burrito, just a bit smaller than a regular.  The past two times I went, it was like eating rice and tortilla, with a touch of sour cream.  They go REALLY light on the chicken and other fillings.  Yes, it's a baby but I am still paying 6-7 bucks and a tortilla filled with rice is not worth that price.  Too bad, I do like the salsas there.
author: Kim S.

description: Good grill-y taste, but a bit plain as others have said. I like that they have a large menu and how clean  they keep it. Baby burritos are plenty big enough for me.
author: haley d.

description: I really wanted crispy Taco's last night, so we stopped off at La Corneta in Glenn Park on the way home from surfing. They were out of crispy shells so Amy got me soft tacos for $2.10 each. I was so bummed out that they were not crispy, then when I opened the box it was a tortilla on the bottom and just all the ingredients piled on top. There was too much stuff to wrap up and eat. I was so bummed out. But I was hungry so I jabbed a fork into it and was so happy as soon as the juices hit my mouth. It was awesome. I only had to eat one of the Tacos because there was so much meat in it, and I enjoyed every bite. I love this place now! Dinner for $2.10 AND it's great?!?!
author: Pele N.

description: Better than some of the greasy joints in the mission (personal taste - i'm more of a "dry" burrito guy), but doesn't cross the line to divine. Just good, dependable mexican food. If you're getting a fish dish to go it's best to call in your order else face a 15 minute wait for cooking.
author: hunter w.

description:
best carnitas to ever hit my mouth
best salsa verde to ever hit my mouth
lines too long on weekend evenings! call your order in then zip to the front and pick it up.
author: Angie M.

description: Every time I join the giant line of hungry, post-work neighborhood folks at La Corneta, I wonder if it's worth it... But when I get home with my amazing, $3 super baby vegetarian burrito with half an avocado on it, I remember why I bothered.  This place is great, cheap, and definitely worth the wait.  So is the one in the Mission--both are total SF gems.
author: Caroline G.

description:
This has always been my favorite place for a Burrito since the days when they were only half the shop size they are now.  The best thing about them:

1. Fresh everything (meat, shrimp cooked to order, sides)
2. Good Service
3. Condiments on the table are always stocked (at least when I'm there)
4. The rice isn't dry like at other places
5. The meat isn't dry like at other places
6. It's clean

And the best part, is they're down the street from me!

They ARE busy, with a line wait of 5-15 minutes, but it's not that bad for the great food you're getting.

TIP: Call in ahead for your order.  If you're driving, park in the 'alley' or at the bus stop and run in to pick up.
author: james c.

description: Ok, so I haven't been here since 1997, but back then it was good for basic burritos. I doubt its changed much.
author: Tom S.

description: 'Hi. I would like to get the super veggie burrito with black beans. Make it spicy and with everything.' The burrito is huge for the price, under $5 for the super veggie and chips. If I'm not that hungry, I get the super baby burrito with chicken and everything. Sooo goood!
author: Phillip T.

description: I recommend calling it in ahead of time.  Sometimes even then you need to dial a few times to get through, but its always worth it.  I could live off of the Super Spicy Prawn Quesadilla (even better if you add black beans!)...but no matter what you get, I think you'll like it.  Warning: they don't mess around with their hot salsa.  Its fire.  I would love something in between the mild and the hot, but not enough to deduct a star.
author: Colette G.

description: There is a reason people drive here from Oakland. Shux, I feel like flying to La Corneta from Boston. The flavor of the rice (yes, peas and carrots are yummy in there) and the grilled meats in your toasty and juicy burrito is potent. Your life will change after you eat here. For the better.
author: mickey l.

description: It's like, ok.  It's better then any Mexican food place located at the intersection of Market and Church but still just, eh.  Every "Mexican" place in Northern Cal just seems the same to me. The three stars are for the churros.  I do love me some churro.
author: Katie H.

description:
mmm.  yum!

i had an enormous quesadilla last night at la corneta.  my two favorite salvadorenas treated me to dinner, claiming that my gringa self hadnt truly ever had real mexican food.  this was the first stop of many on our upcoming taqueria tour.   

15 hours later, im still full.  my carne asada quesadilla was enormous and deliciosa.  i ate it all, plus chips.   la corneta itself is super clean, cheap and fast, despite the long line.  

im sticking to three stars because it was good, my quesadilla wasnt the most amazing of my life.  plus it wasnt hot - i like my melted cheese hot!   but...i would def go back :)
author: Kristin K.

description: This place is a winner...everything is great!! I love thier crispy tacos or tostada, or quesadilla...some of the best in the city!  You wont be disappointed...
author: Steph S.

description: I had the carnitas burrito and it was really yummy.  The service was really fast and the place was really clean.  Very reasonable prices will go back
author: julie c.

description: SUCH GOOD MEXICAN FOOD! I love everything that I have eaten here, and being a college student: the fact that it is affordable is a total turn on. All of the lady's that work here are really nice, although it may be because I am a familiar face. Whatever you order, I am sure you will be satisfied and FULL. If only they took credit cards.....at least there are B of A and Wells Fargo ATM's within half a block of the joint...
author: Derek H.

description: This one gets the same grade as the Mission location.  I've only eaten the tacos at this one - no burritos, no specials - but based on the tacos it seems to be just as good.  The asada and prawns are delicious, and they have always been generous with the portions.  The prawns are what draw me in: plump, flavorful, and put on the tortilla still hot from the grill.  So good.
author: Jon C.

description: One of our favorites in the hood. My honey likes the super veggie burrito and I'm a fan of the ceviche followed up with a carne asada taco. Just right for a cozy dinner in!
author: Aislinn S.

description: La Corneta is a good option for mexican food. The salmon quesadilla is very good, and if you are up early you might be able to try their salpicon de marisco/ ceviche, which is pretty good. If you are hungry you can go for one of the plates like carne asada with rice and salad, enough energy to build a cathedral or hybernate like a bear for months... The thing I like the most about this place is that they do not raise their price crazy after they become known and that the quality of the food is consistant. Keep up the good work
author: Candido B.

description: Good taqueria food and friendly service. The burritos are large and agreeably messy, and the tortas are done right. Have an agua fresca instead of a soda, and view the long line as an opportunity to mull over your selections. Don't worry about it too much, though--this isn't Mexican haute cuisine, it's really yummy street food. Oh, and go for the spicy salsa.
author: Alberto Y.

description: La Corneta is delicious! Not only is the food incredible, but the price is right!! The line is long at any time of the day (a sure sign of superb cuisine), but the wait is generally short and the food is well worth the wait! I recommend the super fish burrito (made with fresh salmon) or the super prawn and steak quesadilla!
author: Erin R.

description: All I'm going to say is "Super Baby Burrito" all the burrito goodness without those last 2 inches that go straight to fat. My favorite bite before hopping on Bart.
author: Kirtley W.

description:
I've been going to La Corneta darn near since it opened. I live in Glen Park but even if I didn't I'd probably be here standing in line with all these fools from other neighborhoods and towns who come all the way to enjoy  delicious tacos, burritos, quesadillas, etc.

It's funny, whenever I go ANYWHERE in the West, I always try to track down the best taqueria in town. Some have come pretty close to beating La Corneta (especially Santana's in San Diego or some mariscos joint in downtown Riverside) but for the most part the improbably located taqueria in Glen Park (aka SoNoe or I'm Living in Glen Park because I can't Afford the Marina) takes the cake, err the churros. Pretty much everything here is boss. Try the shrimp quesadillas if you really want to know what living is or the pollo asado burrito. When I was younger I used to get the super burrito. Now that I'm getting older, I find that one lousy (actually it's not lousy) taco is more than enough food. Wash it down with a Negro Modelo or their delicious cinamonny horchata, and you are in hog heaven. Another plus: real goddamn guacamole; not that crappy watered down stuff they use at "can"cun (why do hipsters like that place so much?)

I agree with some of the other reviewers that a grilled tortilla, a la El Farolito, is pretty hard to beat, but imagine how crazy the helix-style lines here would be if they tried that. By the way, El Farolito is my other favorite taqueria in San Francisco.

Finally, some serious respeto to the burrito wrappers at LC. I can't believe what an elaborate ballet needs to happen to get everyone through that line. It's long but it usually goes pretty fast unless you get one of those micromanagers who is ordering for an entire family and has to specify the exact bean count for each freakin' burrito!
author: Christopher V.

description: So tasty.  It's not the best mexican food I've ever had, but it's great for a casual taqueria.  Getting anything "Super" means you have to eat it with a fork and knife, period.
author: David T.

description: Awesome mexican food. The chile relleno burrito with refried beans is my favorite indulgence. That and a beer and I am set.
author: Bethany G.

description: A  SUPER FISH ANYTHING WILL INCLUDE A NICE SIZED PIECE OF SALMON....most mexican grub spots in the city i've been to use cod instead of salmon.
author: dion l.

description: With the wonderful array of Mexican food in the Mission, this place is a cut above the rest.  With three tortilla options, you could at least feel a bit better about opting for a whole wheat or spinach tortilla even if whats inside is going to cost you major treadmill damage. My favorite dish.....Super Prawn Quesadilla!  But its definitely a plate to share, the portions here are huge.
author: kari s.

description: This place is soo good! It is worth the wait. I love the grilled fish burritos. Everything is super fresh and made to order.
author: sarah k.

description:
La Corneta is really close to my place so I get burritos there a lot and I like them alright. I would've given them 3 stars, but I had to take one off for declines over the past year or so. About one in 4 times, they get my order wrong. Food quality varies --sometimes very tasty, sometimes kinda blah - and not just tacos & burritos, but guacamole and salsas too. Also, more often than not, the chips are greasy - really really really greasy. But the place is clean, the mood is festive and they have a big menu. And I dig the watermelon agua fresca.

Tip for takeout orders -- call it in! Then you don't have to stand in that long line. Go right up to the register.
author: Lisa M.

description: Yummy treats for the right price. I would suggest their carne asada nachos. They are delicious, but you will never go wrong with one of their tasty burittos. Check em out!
author: John R.

description: I love La Corneta, the super BABY burrito is the perfect sized portion for me, and is totally yummy.  I am a big fan!!
author: Julia B.

description: favorite burrito place in the city (el faralito in the mission is a veryyy close second)! i've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience or bad meal. they don't take credit cards, but the food is worth going to the bank to make sure i have cash. my only complaint is that they aren't open later - if it's after 10 and i absolutely need a burrito, i'll go into the mission.
author: ashley d.

description: This is one of the places where my dad takes me for dinner whenever it's just the two of us. Every time we go there, there's usually a line but it's never ridiculously long. I usually order the super prawn burrito because I like shrimp in basically anything while he orders a combination plate. We like to sit at the bar near the window and just watch people walk by while enjoying our meal. The burrito is very filling and all the ingredients in the burrito aren't too loaded. I like the coolness that the guacamole and sour cream brings to the overall flavor of the burrito. I never eat the chips that come with my burrito because I give it to homeless dude who I always see in front of the restaurant. Even though this isn't the best burrito I've ever had, I like the experience of coming here with my dad and just eating burritos. Parking isn't really a problem, but that's just based on my experiences.  This place is right across the street from the Glen Park BART station so it's an accessible place to get your Mexican food.
author: Lauren L.

description: I don't think I've ever been here when there wasn't a looong line. Is it worth it? Absolutely.  Note that you can call in your order and pick it up thereby bypassing the looong line.
author: Fred C.

description:
For God's sake, can't you people find somewhere else to eat?

La Corneta has many a tasty snack on offer.  Tons of options that you won't always find, like multiple tortilla flavors (spinach, whole wheat) and a ton of different toppings for your taco/burrito.  They have a stewed tofu which will make you forget it's tofu, and I've enjoyed every meat there, and have tried most of them over the past few years.  Carne asada is great, and the chicken mole is a real treat.  

They're really flexible too, and generally handle every request (no cheese, lettuce and guacamole only, whatever) just fine.  They're among the hardest working people I've ever seen in a restaurant, and they are always at least pleasant no matter how hot it is in there or how busy they are.  They process a ton of people through there (surely these people don't all live in Glen Park, and know there's another location on 24th St.?) and do it quickly.  They seem equally happy if you order in Spanish or English, another nice part about the place.

Few stay to eat, but the surroundings are pleasant enough.  They sampled many tile colors from Home Depot but arranged them pleasingly, and there's a nice paint job as well.  It's pretty clean and surprisingly welcoming for what is, essentially, a taqueria.

Finally, if you are considering coming here for the first time, be prepared to stand in one of the longer lines you will find in an eating venue in SF.  It's kind of reminiscent of one of those falafel stands on MacDougal St. in Manhattan, where the line is out the door.  Except here the line stays inside.  Anyway, I guess burritos are our special answer to the middle eastern food we generally lack here.

They are really prompt and accurate with phone-in/take-out orders, and sometimes ludicrously fast.  I once called in a dinner for 6 visiting relatives and by the time I had gotten in the car and started to drive the 5 minutes up the hill to get it they were calling to ask where I was!  

Also, you might be lulled by the location or the surroundings into thinking that this place takes anything except dollars.  There's an ATM up the street, but avoid embarrassment and come with cash.  A bit more than the average taqueria, but cheap enough.
author: Spaulding A.

description:
I'm guessing this is a new one. Have loved this place from the day I first stepped into the Glen Park store. The Mission Street taqueria is just as delicious, but bigger, more seating, and faster. I'm looking forward to this new location since it is closer. I'm hoping it isn't just a rumor since there doesn't seem to an address listed.
Great Pollo Asado (good char, yet moist) and best pinto beans anywhere. Squeeze bottles of salsa on the tables for seasoning to your own taste (plus squeeze bottles don't have people dipping their chips, or spoons into them..that just puts me off my food). Oh, and as you might have gathered from that last comment I like clean places, and this is one spankin' clean joint.
Upadate
Okay there was some glitch when I wrote this. There are only the 2. Both fabulous ( and I use the f-word very infrequently) . I prefer the Mission St. one only because it is highly efficient, and much larger, should you choose to sit and eat.  I also think that the "system" is better there. They ask up front about your choice of beans, and salsa so hearing impaired (who isn't in a taqueria with live music?) folk like me can request what they want without  mulitple ?que? ?que? ?que?...is there a way to invert the ?
author: James T.

description:
The food here is consistently good.  The ingredients are always fresh and the trays never look like the stuff has been sitting around for days.  I really like the steak and the big chunks of pork.  The pinto beans are great too.  I moved away to Seattle for 2 years and this place is one of the reasons I moved back.  Definitely a die hard customer.

The only bad part is the lines suck.  The backup is all at the register.  It's not rocket science to put in the second register. PLEASSSSSSSSSSSSSE!!
author: Marlin P.

description: Tasty salmon tacos,  delicious melon agua fresca.  Great inepensive meal.
author: Charlotte M.

description: I started eating at La Corneta about 2-3 years ago. For a while I loved the place, but my last few visits have been marked by higher prices and food that just doesn't taste as good as it used to. I love the restaurant, but lately my experiences have not been as good as before.
author: Kyle S.

description:
YUM! My favorite place for burritos - I'd drive across town just for their super baby burrito. My favorite burrito is their fish (salmon - probably farmed at that price, but I'm willing to make an exception) burrito - no wait, make that the carnitas... or the pollo en salsa roja (spicy chicken), no make that the pollo en salsa verde.... 

Did I tell you I love this place? Their mushroom quesadilla is also delicious - oozing with melted cheese and garlicky freshly grilled mushrooms. I always have the large mango agua fresca to drink - refreshing, you can taste the fruit and not overly sweet.
author: Dara Z.

description: The only bad thing about this place: more people are finding out about how much they ROCK! My husband and I have La Corneta on the speed dial because the chicken burrito is fresh and their salsa is fresh. The people that work there are really nice and not bothered by you. I like to buy a little extra hot salsa and make eggs on Sunday mornings. MMMMM!!
author: Aaron L.

description: I remember when Corneta was next door and about the size of a closet....then they remodeled and made the place bigger. A good thing they didn't change how they made their great burritos and quesadillas. Since I was 14yrs old (28 now) I grew up always telling the "older looking blond lady always behind the register"......"Super Chicken and Prawn Burrito w/ xtra picante"....not on the menu...but they will take care of you like that. Lines...not a problem, worth the wait. Prices, worth every reasonable penny. Service, even after work just before dinner time (5-6pm) they make sure everyone is treated fairly and 99% of the time...even though they just group everyone's food by the register...all you have to do is tell them once what you ordered and wallah. Love you Corneta.....
author: Paulo L.

description: This place is good but often the wait is long although it goes by quickly.  I really enjoy the prawn burrito here.  The ingredients are very fresh and the prawns are generous.  I also like the option to order either a small "baby" or a regular burrito (not regular vs super) just different in size not ingredients.  I won't lie and say that i ever do order the "baby" but it is good to know that if i really wanted to implement a diet a meal here wouldn't have to be overkill.  Something about the food at this taqueria also has a bit of a healthier taste.  I don't leave with the heavy "brick in the stomach" feeling that I often experience after eating at other taquerias.
author: Brenna C.

description: just went to get a chorizo super burrito and paid about $8 and it was huge and juicy! just how i like them. and the chips and salsa are really good. i totally recommend it! go if you're ever in the GP!
author: jason xavier c.

description: The pig is one mighty fine beast. Just thinking about the cornucopia of goodies it can be turned into makes me salivate like crazy, and has the wife reaching for a bib. Throw in a 3 hour mountain bike ride and I turn into a lard-guided, pig-seeking missile. Fortunately it is downhill to La Corneta where I can satisfy the carnitas craving with a super quesadilla. It's huge, the carnitas is tender but not too greasy or salty, and has plenty of cheese and salsa. Even my ravenous burrito-prophet companions stare at it with unbridled envy. Sure the wait can be long, but the food has always made up for it.
author: Johan G.

description: Everyone raves about this place, so I decided to try it.  Big plates of food. Above average.  Lots of things to choose from on the menu. The lines were ridiculously long for a Sunday evening, but I guess it was worth the twenty minute wait. The staff is your typical mexican restaurant staff. Not really wanting to have any other sort of contact with you once your order has been placed. Although these chicks seemed to have fallen into well filled with wet n wild makeup. All's well though, the food rocks!!
author: LISA G.

description: Always have had the best taco's here.  And their choices in agua frescas are excellent.  friendly, fast, and clean...
author: Claire U.

description: the shizzle my nizzle. This place is friggin awesome. super carne asada quesadilla is like no other quesadilla in the planet. trust me. the spicy prawn plate is also phenomenal
author: Anthony P.

description: I am pretty vanilla when it comes to Mexican food - I usually get a BRC or some variation of it. That being said La Corneta makes a mean ass super veggie burrito. if you want good cheap food in Glen Park then it is the only place to go. The chile relleno burrito is a monster with the works and i highly recommend it. the place is smallish especially when the line  gets long but hey, it a taqueria. They only take cash, just like EVERY OTHER PLACE IN GLEN PARK . It's not a problem if you bank with B of A, Citi or Wells Fargo - which I DO NOT.
author: chris b.

description: Pretty much the best place for a cheap, quick, and convenient burrito.  I usually get nachos and a strawberry agua there after school and share them with some friends.  The lines can get ridiculously long but they move fast.  The owners must be millionaires, simply based on how long the lines are.  But don't be intimidated; it's usually worth it.  Good for take-out, pick-up, or eat-in.
author: Nicola H.

description: Taste okay. Nothing stands out from any other taqueria.  Food is pre-made like in a cafeteria, they assemble everything when you ask what you want, so everything has been sitting there. When you ask for chips and salsa, they put it on the side of the burrito. So you'll have to wipe down the burrito before you touch it because the salsa has leaked under the burrito. Service is a bit slow, there were four employees, one worked the register, one made the food, the other two were standing there talking to the others. Hence why most people will say there's a line. Only one person making the food. They have hot sauce on the tables for you to add more heat, but the hot sauce was very mild, the green sauce tasted like toothpaste as I quote my friend, bland and minty. The Biggest problem with this place is that they don't take credit/debit. This place is CASH only. Bought 2 burritos, and the bill was literally $17 for 2 burritos. Most people will say papalote is expensive, well compared to this place, papalote is a bargain. La Corneta makes me want to trade my burrito for the ones at Chipotle, yes Chiptole, high school kids making burritos at a franchise owned by mcdonalds.
author: Robin L.

description:
Fucking scrumptious.  

Beware:  The orange-reddish chunky salsa in the squirt bottle has the tendency to get clogged, build up pressure, and conveniently relieve itself onto your sleeve.  There's a fine art to avoiding post-mature salsa ejaculation here.
author: John D.

description:
no one can argue that this taqueria is in a very cute neighborhood but i can and will argue that this is NOT the best mexican joint around nor does it even match up to some of the crappier places i've been to.

i got a baby prawn burrito with all the fixings and black beans. service was quick. we got our chips and salsa and set down to eat. i unwrapped my burrito within seconds of bringing it back to my table but it was too late. the burrito was soggy already! i had to wrap a couple of napkins around the burrito to keep the juices from running down my hand. then i started working on the chips. oily, but what do you expect right? the salsa was fresh enough but as i was scooping up some salsa with my second chip, i noticed something unusual. something redder than the tomatoes they used to make the salsa. it was a lady bug. i dead lady bug. ugh. i brought the salsa back up to the counter for an exchange. i handed it over to one of the ladies working there and told her my problem, she looked at me like i was crazy then reluctantly gave me a new thing of salsa.

oh yeah, and lettuce in the burrito. sorry just not my thing. i forced myself to finish the burrito because there was no way for me to salvage it and bring it home anyway. but the next time anyone suggest we go to la corneta, i'll say "pass."
author: Mei N.

description:
I only buy from two taquerias and this is mos def my first choice. Food here is excellent and you cannot go wrong with anything you buy. Make sure you bring cash because that is all they accept. Also, the lines get a bit long especially around noon and around 3 when high school students are out. 

I LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Lofa H.

description: LAME! They are so stingy with their salsas if you order out. It's like pulling teeth to get salsas to go. They also have one of the rudest staffs in town. They've gotten my order wrong so many times, but they just scoff at me and laugh. Go to Menudo. That place rules.
author: Heather M.

description: Why are there still huge lines here? The prices have increased, the quality and quantity of the food have dropped, the atmosphere and service are... meh... and there are frozen carrot cubes in the rice.  I  think  I'll take my business to another burrito place in Glen Park..
author: Linda F.

description: This place is a pretty good taqueria.  I swing by for a baby burrito every so often for just six bucks.  Whole wheat tortillas and black beans are a big plus.  Their carne asada and pollo asado are pretty good, especially when it's fresh.  I'm a fan.
author: Alan C.

description: So glad I recently discovered this place which is only a 5 minute drive from my home!  Every time, the food is consistent, humongous portions, tasty and fresh!  Relatively fast as well, as long as the line is not out the door.  On a weekday, there's less of a wait but I guess it depends on how early/late you arrive during meal times.  Love the combos and even their wheat tortillas are amazingly chewy and savory!  The very sweet and refreshing strawberry agua fresca probably has too many calories, as do all the entrees there, I'm guessing.  But who cares when it's this good?  I stuff my face every time I go.  They even have a chocolate/flan layer hybrid cake for dessert!  Just wish they would drizzle a bit more caramel sauce on it!  But all in all, my favorite go-to place for Mexican now !  No need to trek over to the Misson...woohoo!
author: Doris C.

description: I loved this place and have been going since it opened many years ago.  However lately the food hasn't been that great and the girls that work there are so busy talking to each other and fixing their hair it has really grossed me out.  They are rude and biotches.  They also have gotten really cheap with the quacamole and you can barely taste it in the burrito.  I hope to run into the owner so I can let him know how disappointed I've been lately.  I always get the super burrito pork (chile verde).
author: P S.

description: baby super burrito prawn or carne asada.  one of the best taquerias in SF.
author: Patricia P.

description: One of the best mexican joints around sf! I ordered the carne asada super baby burrito + Strawberry fresca - the burrito was so much that I couldnt even finish it and the fresca was perfect. I just wish that they had x-large cups
author: Fat L.

description: Let me start out by saying that if this place was in any other neighborhood I would give it 3 stars.  It is our neighborhood taqueria and it is really just ok.  I mostly get the meetless burritos which I would say are very average in taste.  The salsa sucks, so now I get my burrito without any and they are much better.
author: Jessica E.

description: i can't honestly say it's the best burrito I've had but it may be one of them. I've tried many of their burritos and haven't been disappointed. The peas and carrots in the rice threw me off at first but I kinda like it. I'd recommend the steak and prawn burrito - carne asada y camarones (which can be pricey) or the chicken in green sauce - pollo verde (which can be a little messy) both very good. The lines can be long but move quick. Make sure you have cash because last time I checked they don't accept credit cards. Parking can be an issue but if you're in the area I say it'll satisfy your craving. There are two other shops, one in the Mission and another in Burlingame. All three consistently the same.
author: Lee O.

description: I have been coming here ever since they opened.  The food is always good and thats why they have remained open for so long.  If you go after work expect a long line. You will get large portions for your money and really good food.
author: Melissa M.

description: Absolutely nothing special about this place at all.  In fact, one of my least favorite taquerias in SF.  The carne asada is fatty and greasy compared to other places, the portions are small for the money, and the guacamole is often heavily watered down with sour cream (which i find utterly unforgivable).  The lines you find at this place are also ridiculous, and are not a sign of good food, but rather the fact that glen park lacks sufficient places to grab a quick lunch/dinner.
author: john s.

description: La Corneta, how I miss thee. It used to take so much willpower to walk past everyday on my way home from the Bart station to not stop in for dinner but now that temptation is gone since I no longer live in SF. If I was on a desert island I'd want La Corneta burritos as my one food. I loved the assembly line method of being able to pick and choose the ingredients in my burrito. If anyone knows of someplace similar in LA, I would be forever grateful for a recommendation.
author: Carina K.

description: Best combination of excellent quality and price in the Bay Area. Maximum value. La Corneta rocks!
author: Mike D.

description: Sorry, La Corneta.  I have been to this place many times over the last 7 years.  This past Sunday May 30, the service was terrible.  The staff seemed upset that there was a line of people ready to order before they officially opened, even though the doors were wide open.  When they started taking the orders they seemed upset at anyone (including children) who were not ready with the orders.  I even heard a rude comments from a female servers (who apparently didn't think I could understand what they were saying).  The food was ok, but I will not go back to this location, unless they servers are re-trained.  (By the way, the other La Corneta in the Mission is still one of my favorite places to eat Mexican food.)
author: Ana V.

description:
so irritated that im writing while i eat. she asks me "what kind of meat?" i say "carne asada". she asks me "hot or mild?" i say "hot".

tell me why im eating a chicken burrito with no hot sauce whatsoever. pissed. and sad =(
author: A. Z.

description: i went into la corneta with a hangover and meager expectations:  the combination provided for a surprisingly delightful experience.  the burrito was a bit undersized compared to what i was used to seeing in the mission and also a bit pricey.  however, the green chicken it was comprised of was saving grace.  perfect flavor, texture and spice.  very very well done.  definitely worth a shot.
author: Ryan H.

description: This place was very busy, so much so that it took awhile to get thru the line at lunch.  I took my fish burrito togo, but it was just OK for waiting that long!!!  I was expecting  something better than the taco trucks, but it wasn't even close.  Nice restaurant though, lots of employees to handle the rush.  Salsa was ok, just n ot what I expected after that long line!!!
author: nicki s.

description: good stuff.  Super baby buritto ,black beans, spicy chicken. Spicy salsa extra chips please! This place is great but its always crowded. so i get my buritto here then I walk to Eggettes down the street for my EGG PUFF and OREO Shake with tapioca. oh that place got some jail bait workers. ok just kidding.. no police please.
author: derrick d.

description:
SO AWESOME.

but i have to say that their prices have definitely risen in the last few years.. yayaya, i know inflation, but still 8 dollars for a burrito???  This is still one of my fav's and probably my first choice when i get a craving...but i have to say, since you got your sister resaurant on Mission.. you're just not the same...
author: Caitlin S.

description: This place does not accept debit cards!!! Are you kidding me??!! Really??!!  I can't believe there's businesses out there that still do that!! That's so ghetto!! I bought a burrito the other day only to get to the register and have the lady tell me that they only took cash! I had to run outside to the B of A ATM. Businesses like this upset me because they prefer to save themselves a few bucks by not accepting debit cards than to ensure people's business and pay the debit card fee!! The burrito was bleh! Nothing worth writing home about. I don't think I'll ever go back.
author: Enrique C.

description: Great burritos.  One of my favorite burrito places in the city.  Prices are reasonable.  The lines tend to be a little long around dinner time, so be prepared to wait.
author: Nick H.

description: I'm telling you, no other taqueria in this fine city can touch La Corneta. Get the Super Baby Burrito, or a regular Super/Especial if your pants are loose on ya. You can't go wrong with the meat: carne asada, grilled chicken, carnitas and salmon are all tender and flavorful (the lengua too!), if the oh-so-perfect saucy varieties (al pastor or chicken mole anyone?) don't tempt you away. The staff are lightning fast, friendly for the 4 seconds you actually talk to them, and you have to fight them tooth & nail if you don't want a heaping bag of fresh tortilla chips with your to-go order. Can you tell I eat here a LOT?
author: Cynthia S.

description: Last night we ordered up some quesadillas, nachos, and other various snacks while drinking heavily next door at Glen Park Station Bar.  The quesadillas must have been laced with crack because I could not get enough of this food into my mouth while making tasty delicious moans of happiness.  Yes, I was drunk.  True, crack is whack.  No, I did not "revisit" my dining choice later in the night when the world began to spin.  So you can point fingers and say "no no no, his vote doesn't count because he had 8 Jameson on the rocks," but here I am Yelping about it first thing (3:30pm) the next day...I remember it.  I don't remember getting home people.  I don't remember the cab ride, the stumbling through my house at 2:00am, the conversations at the end...nada.  Quesadilla?  Remember it.  Loved it.  So I will go to La Corneta sober one day and try it all again, but for now it will live on in infamy in my hungover head as I stumble through this day searching for something equally tasty to satiate my whiskey belly.
author: Ryan G.

description:
this is my go-to burrito joint.  i eat burritos at least a few times a month- and have for over 20 years.  because i usually order the same thing each time, my review may only prove helpful for those of you who enjoy chicken or beef burritos.  the staff is always friendly, the food is always fresh and delicious, and the portion sizes are a great value.  

the only improvements i could imagine might be that i'd never have to wait in a huge line and that i could charge the meal (cash only!).  but then the place would be perfect- and that's not realistic.
author: Jay J.

description: Yum. Good food at a good price. Their nachos are ah-mazing.
author: Massie B.

description: no serious complaints, but more of a question i've always pondered after eating there. why peas and carrots in the rice? its mexican food not puerto rican arroz con grandules folks!
author: Niki M.

description: A little less greasy than your regular Mexican taqueria and a hell of lot cleaner...that alone sells it for me!  Line is a bit too long and I almost got taken out when I cut in line (hey, my friend was saving my place while I parked the car!).  The prices were a tad too high, but I was happy with my super carne asada quesadilla.  I usually like less or no sour cream though.  They do add tons of carne asada which is a plus, being the meat lover that I am!  The chips and guacamole were ok and the salsa was more pico de gallo and less spicy (and I got the hot!) then I like.  My friend ordered the steak & prawn burrito and actually forgot there were prawns in his burrito until he bit into a something chewy.  I have to say that I did enjoy this place, but it's just your average taqueria.  After visiting those wonderful tiny drive-thru stands in San Diego and LA that charge a fraction of the price for the same quantity/quality, I was not that impressed.  Don't get me wrong I will definitely be back, but that could be due to the fact that it's right down the street.  I bet this place would taste great after a night of partying!  Mmmm, quesadillas!  Too bad it's not open that late.
author: Kimberly C.

description: OMFGBBQ! I used to live in the city in Twin Peaks and went here 3-4 times a week. No Joke. I wish there were more stars to give to this place. Good god this is the best burrito I have ever fucking had! Im so pissed I live so far away and whenever im coming through the city and theyre open I definitely make a point to stop in. Its is always packed and theres a reason for it. The best time to go is around 4pm. Not quite lunchtime not quite dinner time. Fuck all the haters....trust me...best burrito by far in the whole Bay!
author: Chris G.

description: so ive driven by this place several times already & I shit u not....the line extends out the corner....wanted to c what all the hype was about...first off is its location...saves a drive to the mission...then this hot spot serves prawns with its burritos...steak/prawns burritos~im all over it~pricing is not an issue since they have the option of "baby burritos" on the menu...the only buzz kill is that its not open late late....its closes round 10ish booooooooo
author: elmer d.

description: the line is usually out the door, which makes sense considering the location- but not the food.  the food is bland.  filling and hearty- sure.  but bland.
author: Samantha W.

description: La Corneta is a homey and neat place to get a burrito or enchilada. Located in the charming Glen Park neighborhood, within walking distance from the BART station, La Corneta is close to home, a favorite of mine and a nice alternative to making a trek to the Mission! A platter is enough to feed two..... either that or always ask for a takehome box. Even with the Baby Super burritos, I have to split them. They put shredded lettuce in the burritos so if you are anti-lettuce when it comes to burritos, then tell the girl behind the counter to nix it. It's not that it tastes bad right there when you bite into it. But try nuking the other half of that leftover lettuce-laden sucker for lunch the next day and I swear that if you listen closely enough, you'll hear a collective *sigh* and ay caramba from all of the disapproving Mexicans as they shake their heads at the idea of putting lettuce inside burritos.
author: Patricia M.

description: this one of the best places to eat in the city. its good priced. in a good locale and parking isn't so bad around there either.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: i love this place, it's fast place and have great tacos, steaks & shrimps!!! been eating at this place for over 3yrs now, it is always pack tho so i usually place my order on d phone & just pick it up...
author: Jo Z.

description: Service is extremely snobby and slow. Food portions are so small you can't really call it a meal. The Mission restaurant is much better and the service is 100x friendlier and quicker. It also helps that the restaurnt is much bigger and more seating capacity.
author: Jenny A.
