description: Fantastic. The food never disappoints. Everything is fresh and they make everything in front of you. When it gets busy, the line is out the door! Best taqueria I've ever been to!
author: Brian W.

description: The beef at this place is kinda hard to ignore. Even at 7:30 in the morning. When on my way to BART, I walk through the vented grill smoke settling heavily over this particular block in my neighborhood. Do you know what it is like going to work with visions of tasty marinated skirt steak dancing in your head? It ain't easy. what are they marinating this meat in? Forget about focusing on work. La Corneta's delish grilled steak burritos are the bomb. Nope, it's not that gross grey meat-like matter you find in some taquerias. They're grilling this steak fresh all day long, tossing fresh slabs of bright red marinated beef onto the grill, flipping it a few times and then chopping it into perfectly browned strips seasoned with just the right amount of salt, pepper and cumin (?) on a dark wood chopping clock. Skip the rice, beans, lettuce and cheese and keep it simple. Load it up with chopped white onions, cilantro and a squeeze of lime. It's a purists' beef burrito.
author: Alexander G.

description: the food here is fresher and more varied than at a standard mission taqueria.  i don't want to get in to the controvercy of the Best Burrito in San Francisco, but damn (!), this is a good burrito.  my favorite is a vegetarian with mushrooms and everything else under the sun.  amazing guacamole.
author: emmie k.

description: hands down best Mexican food in the city. get a chicken burrito. you won't be hungry afterwards and you'll love it. holla at your boy
author: Mike L.

description: got a super burrito pollo here yesterday. it was great! chips are awesome and so is the hot salsa!  very close to glen park BART
author: Mary C.

description: every day was taco before my office relocated from glen park to gringo-landia (downtown).  i'd recommend anything 'al pastor' or with puerco con chile verde.  ordering here is an art and be ever vigilant as they prepare your food.  listening is not one of their strong points, even if you speak perfect spanish.  try to avoid the lunchtime crowds.  i only wish they offered fish tacos of the fried variety, as i'm not a salmon fan.  5 well deserved stars and finish up with an alfajor or 2.
author: beltrand a.

description: Chicken burrito with salsa, lettuce, cheese, rice, and black beans on a spinach tortilla please! There was a time in my life where I had a  "burrito body" as a result of daily burritos from La Corneta. It's right down the street from my place in Glen Park and I'm addicted! I need burritos anonymous from this place! I painfully gave it 4 stars because it's usually packed with customers and so has no place to sit. Not to worry dear burrito lovers you'll eat this burrito (or taco, etc) so fast there will be no reason to sit! The line goes really fast and if you keep your eye on the person making your burrito (they mess up sometimes) you will never be disappointed!
author: Alexis G.

description: I can't add too much to what's already been said, but this place has become one of my recent faves.  Really good food, stays open fairly late, a very nice staff of over 8 people working very hard to service the fast-moving but ever-present line.  Cafe-style ordering: you stand in line, choose, order, pay, and then bus your tray to an open table with hard wooden chairs, or take it to go.  I've ordered the fish burrito both times I was there, and was amazed to see them take a large strip of fresh salmon out of the 'fridge, lay it on the grill, and cook it to order as you watch.  The aluminum-bound burrito comes out hot, flavorful, and filling .... all for a very reasonable $8.  No, not the cheapest food out there --- but trust me, you don't want to eat the cheapest food you can find (there's got to be a better way to save money).  The unisex bathroom is kind of dicey, and the homeless guy who owns the sidewalk out in front is kind of friendly and not too pushy, as 'house' homeless folk go, and if you're driving, parking isn't too bad, either.  Great for a quick, tasty, inexpensive-ish dinner!
author: Richard A.

description: i often come more than once a week. I cant say enough! the line is often so long its annoying, but once you get your food its ALWAY worth the wait!! the burritos are to die for, the super tacos are amazing and they have free chips and salsa and cheap beer.  La corneta is some of the best mexican food i've had in city, not greasy or questionable, but cheap and always delicious!
author: Genevieve H.

description: Ah Yes...La Corneta.  I had been hearing good things about this place and was itchin' to try it.  Went there on a before class lunch mission last week and, like Yelp promised, there was a LONG line.  My friend and I decide to stick it out and are pleasantly surprised.  The line moves FAST.  Before we know it we are sitting down and tucking into our meals.  I got the Carnitas Super Burrito, she got a massive plate of shrimp, steak, and chicken (with all the fixins...seriously, I don't know how she eats like this, she's got a great body and IS NOT bulimic...I digress).  The Carnitas Super Burrito.  Do not let the size fool you...it looks small, but that's because it is very tightly wrapped!!  Ok, maybe it's a little small, but I'm comparing with El Farolito and their super burritos are freakin' huge.  Corneta has a fine burrito and they have black beans (which is a plus).  Taste-wise, it compares favorably to Farolito and Castellito, but it is a little smaller.  I would give 3.5 stars, but I give an extra 1/2 star for the fact that a long line moved very fast.
author: Garrett C.

description: So cheap. so good.. so fast. eat the salsa verde. order the "off the menu" Baby Very Veggi Burrito for $3.99 -- you simply can not find better taqueria value in the world, anywhere. (if, of course, you are a vegetarian).. park in the dirt lot around the alleyway next to La Corneta (just off Diamond)..
author: David F.

description: Love this place!  The salmon (in anything) is fried up fresh and super-tasty.  I've had much worse at fancy places for many times the price.
author: Peter L.

description: I could probably eat here four times a week!!  The super baby burrito is delicious and cheap - $4!!!  The lines can be long, but it's worth the wait.
author: noone n.

description: Excellent and  very consistent.   When ordering items from the grill the cook always takes care to make sure your food is cooked to perfection. My only complaint is the phone orders at times seem to take priority  over the customers standing in line.
author: Kevin C.

description: My fav taqueria. I keep coming back even though I live farther away than I did when they first opened. When it first opened, the owner was around a lot and would pass out free drinks in the evenings. The business took off and now it's just a jammed packed factory line of orders. I still am loyal as I love the food. Chips & salsa included, the green salsa is my fav. Keep coming back for the prawns, in a burrito, taco, quesadilla, whatever.
author: Ste B.

description: This place is really awesome! I loved coming here after a long BART ride back home and just wanted to get some food and crash at home, this place never disappoints!
author: Daniel H.

description: Their super shrimp and steak quesadilla is awesome.  Though the lines are long, they generally are pretty quick.
author: Jen K.

description: I eat here WAY too much.  Of course, it's only two blocks from my house and it's cheap, it's good, and I can get two meals out of a super burrito.  I mean, c'mon -- a pretty good ceviche tostada with chips and salsa on the side for $2.75?  That's a seafood meal for less than three bucks including tax!  Wow.  They don't skimp on the shrimp or the salmon for the super burritos, and the chorizo is great!  They have a nice, large taco salad, and good quesadillas.  Some of the other meats are just OK -- the pastor for example isn't nearly as tasty as at other places.  The chips and salsa are fairly average, but when I add the red and green sauces from the tables it comes out pretty good.  And there's one lady in there who's apparently really unhappy with her job and/or life, but the rest are pretty friendly, and they tolerate gringos speaking Spanish just fine.  It isn't fine dining, but for what it is, it rocks!
author: Bill P.

description: Outstanding. Fresh and cooked perfectly. The best "gringo" mexican food I've ever had.
author: Becky S.

description: They have pretty good carne asada but does lack a little on the cheese like some of the good burritos I've had in the mission.
author: Justagentlemen U.

description: this place is amazing.  I visit at least once a week.  the food is extraordinarily fresh, and they are generous with their portions.  everything is delicious.  the steak and prawn quesadilla is out of this world1
author: Roxy Y.

description: if your thinking of this place go there already.  agua fresca and food are to die for!  words cant explain or i can stress how great the food and speedy service is.  nothing but good experience.  im an ex genentecher....and i brought a group of VP's here and they became loyal customers and they are from the tri-valley!  go there now!  ditto to what everyone wrote!
author: Raul M.

description: Finally A Taqueria that serves up FAT BABY burritos. When I'm in this hood, and i got 6 bucks, i head over here to eat,. This place is good when there are no cops in line, yeah for some reason cops come up in here way to often, I doubt they sell donuts there, shheesh...
author: Sleep E.

description: When I moved to GP a couple of years ago I was ECSTATIC to have a taqueria in my neighbourhood. Unfortunately the enthusiasm ended at the threshold. Sadly, I've experienced poor service, a cold burrito, and poor pricing--twice. I've eaten a lot of burritos in my life and this place just doesn't compare to many places here in SF. Despite better seating, being closer to home, and slightly cheaper prices--I'd still bypass this place and take BART to the Mission for my burrito fix. The salsa is watered-down, the Hot Sauce is anything but hot and the staff can't be bothered. My guess is if there was an alternative place, any place for that matter, to get a burrito in Monterey Heights/Sunnyside/Glen Park--this place would have a serious run for their money. Save yourself the time and go two BART stops up towards the Mission and find yourself a really good meal that won't leave you wishing you'd not given $8 away.
author: Christian D.

description: We went to this place today and there is a homeless guy standing outside begging and then he comes in and demands that the people behind the counter warm up his food that someone bought for him that he had outside somewhere. He hands it to the idiots behind the counter and they carry it over the open containers of food to the microwave that they also heat the food to be served in. This was one of the most unsanitary moves I have seen. To top that off they let this guy actively pan handle inside the store stopping each person in line trying to buy food . Sorry but this needs to be reported to the health department too. Who knows what kind of disease this guy had. I mean he really looked bad and it was like the staff behind the counter were scared to tell him he needs to leave. I really liked the food and the location until I saw this, I will never eat there again and I suggest you seriously consider finding another place if they continue to mingle homeless meals with the meals that they serve paying customers.
author: blue S.

description: I wonder how long before everyone recognizes that although the food is pretty good here, La Corneta does not believe in the customer. Here are some exercises to try: 1) order something your way, 2) check your bill for extras you didn't request. Wanna add lettuce? At La Corneta it's 50¢, every other Mexican place in the universe it's free. As for authentic, no where in Mexico do they put beans in the tacos--that's maybe a burro or burrito on that side of the border. One time I thought I'd make life simple and order the chile relleno solo off the menu. I got to the cashier and found they added cheese and cream without asking and charged me for the disservice. I complained (not rudely or anything) and the girl literally threw my refund (short of tax) at me. She vocalized "Next time...[as though I should order differently]. How shall I order? I'd like a word with the owner because the employees neither speak English or Customer Service. Head to the Mission for good Mexican without the hassle and ill feelings.
author: Eric M.

description: i've eaten here a few times and am always disappointed.  definitely worth it to go over the hill to the mission for a better burrito. sorry la corneta, tough competition.
author: lily k.

description: I am a fan of this place! Good, quick Mexican food that is cheap in price without being cheap in quality. There are often long lines, but they get through the crowd quickly. Their menu is extensive and you are sure to find something for everyone.
author: Rachelle P.

description: The best part about living in Glen Park is the access to the Bart.  The second best part is living near la Corneta.
author: Andrew G.

description: OK let me just start by saying this place is......AWESOME, GREAT, FANTASTIC, STELLAR OK I think you get the point. I have been eating at this place since I was like 8 years old (give or take a few years) I treat myself to this place whenever I can. EVERYONE I take here absolutely loves it. This is real authentic Mexican food I am so spoiled by this place that when I go somewhere else I am never really satisfied.
author: Johnell H.

description: The best taqueria in town with a great selection of seafood options. I particularly like that they use salmon in their fish menu items. My  favorites include: Super baby fish burrito and the fish dinner.  The long wait is the only down side.
author: Marina D.

description: Food's great. The place is clean. Can't beat the location. It just gets REALLY crowded at predictable and not-so-predictable times. Insider tip: call ahead for a take-out order so you can skip the line.
author: Irina D.

description: Currently my favorite Mexican food in the whole world. Never, EVER been disappointed. They grill to perfection. I don't expect fancy service for these prices which, admittedly, are on the slightly high side. But I always get some kind of smile and never any attitude. Actually, I called in an order once ahead of time and they hadn't prepared it by the time I got there, so I guess they're not perfect. That was two years ago. Now, 30 "burritos especiales" later, I'm still going back. I get the burrito, chips, and a simple corn quesadilla for less than $10 and it packs plenty of flavor zing... and is almost enough to feed two, actually. They give roasted jalapenos, lime, and salsa free of charge to boot. Just be sure to ask. I see some people have complained that the lines are long, but, HELLO, the lines are long for a reason. Remember the "Soup Nazi" episode of Seinfeld?! I suggest avoiding lunch and dinner rush hours if you don't have more than 10-15 mins.
author: L I.

description: I have eaten at La Corneta in Glen Park for many years. I have been there when it is busy and slow. Tonight, I came in with my husband and daughter for dinner. I sat at a table while they waited to order. They waited, and waited, and waited. There was at this time nobody in line but my husband. Finally my husband requested that someone come and take his order. They looked at him briefly, but no one said anything to him and ignored him. My daughter shouted "Hey! We need service over here!" and was ignored. They waited for ten minutes without anyone saying "I will be right with you" or "Sorry to keep you waiting, be right there." It was not busy and at that time there was no one behind us in line. Finally, he did something he never does, he got angry and left. I went up to the servers and asked why they did not serve my husband, or at least acknowledge him. Looking at him without comment is not an acknowledgment. At first they stared at me blankly, they when I asked what was wrong with them that they could not apologize to my husband, they apologized to me instead! Management needs to work on a customer service standard. They should acknowledge or greet people when they come in, even at closing time, which this was not, it was 9pm.
author: Lisa B.

description: good food. decent prices. green stuff sometimes soggy.
author: RODGER B.

description: Ok yelpers, I'm Latina, I'm picky and tough to please so I have gone to this taqueria 3 times because I wanted to give them a chance and I've read other yelp reviews. This last Friday was my last time.  The food LOOKS great and the portions are generous BUT the flavor just isn't there.  It needs "something" I just can't put put my finger on it.  I ordered the Carne Asada Super Nachos. Again, it looked spectacular and appetizing BUT the meat was like shoe leather and they were cut in big chunks so I had to use a knife to cut them into bite size pieces. The beans have no flavor; the green and red "chile" that they have on the tables again it looked good but it had no flavor.  My hubby ordered the ceviche tostada and he said it was good but he got sick in the middle of the night. No more La Corneta for us. Sorry La Corneta I gave you 3 chances but you just don't cut it for these two picky Latinos.
author: M R.
